title: ICF Completes Acquisition of Creative Systems and Consulting
summary: ICF (NASDAQ: ICFI) has announced the completion of its acquisition of Creative Systems and Consulting, a leading provider of IT modernization and digital transformation solutions for U.S. federal agencies. Creative, founded in 2010, brings expertise in Salesforce, Microsoft, and ServiceNow platforms, which complements ICF's existing capabilities. This acquisition aims to enhance ICF's digital transformation services for its federal government clients.

title: Octo Acquires Digital Transformation Leader B3 Group
summary: Octo, a federal IT modernization provider, has acquired B3 Group, Inc., a digital transformation company specializing in low-code/no-code platforms and cloud engineering. This acquisition expands Octo's reach into the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs (VA), bolstering its position in the federal health market and enhancing its ability to provide advanced IT modernization services across various federal agencies. The integration of B3's expertise and programs, including the Digital Transformation Center (DTC) contract, will strengthen Octo's oLabs environment and offer improved digital solutions to federal customers.

title: Miro Raises $400M in Series C Funding Round to Accelerate Innovation Through Visual Collaboration in the New Hybrid Workplace
summary: Miro, an online platform for visual collaboration, has closed a $400M Series C funding round, bringing its total funding to $476M and valuing the company at $17.5B. This investment will fuel product development and global expansion as Miro aims to further support organizations in unlocking creativity and strengthening collaboration in the new hybrid workplace. The company has seen significant growth since its Series B round in April 2020, increasing its user base to 30M and working with 99% of Fortune 100 companies.

title: Deloitte Trains More Than 1,000 College Students Through its Salesforce Bootcamp, Delivering on Ongoing Commitment to Expanding Talent in Salesforce Ecosystem
summary: Deloitte announced it has trained over 1,000 college students through its Salesforce Bootcamps via the Deloitte Digital Salesforce Academy (DDSA). This program aims to bridge the gap between college students seeking business and technology careers and the demand for Salesforce-skilled talent. The bootcamps offer foundational Salesforce training, career exploration, and preparation for certifications, helping students secure roles within the growing Salesforce ecosystem and Deloitte.

title: ServiceNow vs Salesforce: Which Is Best for You?
summary: This article compares ServiceNow and Salesforce, two leading enterprise software solutions, detailing their core functionalities, target users, and market positions. Salesforce excels in customer relationship management (CRM), sales, and marketing, providing a 360-degree view of the customer. ServiceNow specializes in IT service management (ITSM) and workflow automation across IT, employee, and customer operations. While they have areas of overlap, they primarily serve distinct purposes and can even be deployed together for comprehensive enterprise management.

title: Oracle Corp. stock rises Monday, outperforms market
summary: Oracle Corp. (ORCL) stock increased by 2.02% to $89.28 on Monday, outperforming the broader market downturn where the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average fell. This marks the stock's second consecutive day of gains, although it remains $17.06 short of its 52-week high. Oracle's performance was mixed compared to competitors like Microsoft, Adobe, and Salesforce.com, and trading volume exceeded its 50-day average.

title: GyanSys Acquires Leading Vancouver-Based Salesforce Partner Groundswell Cloud Solutions
summary: GyanSys Inc. has acquired Groundswell Cloud Solutions, a Vancouver-based Salesforce partner, to enhance its Salesforce advisory and implementation services. This acquisition boosts GyanSys' Salesforce practice to over 250 professionals with significant certifications and project experience, expanding its presence in the U.S. and Canada and strengthening its partnership with Salesforce.

title: NVIDIA Named America’s Best Place to Work on Latest Glassdoor List
summary: NVIDIA has been ranked as America's best place to work on Glassdoor’s 14th annual Best Places to Work list for large U.S. companies in 2022. The ranking is based on anonymous employee feedback, with 95% of NVIDIA employees recommending the company and 98% approving of CEO Jensen Huang. This recognition highlights NVIDIA's commitment to employee satisfaction amid evolving workplace expectations.

title: Datto Hires Splunk, Qlik Veteran Brooke Cunningham as CMO -
summary: Datto has appointed Brooke Cunningham, a veteran from Splunk and Qlik, as its new Chief Marketing Officer. This strategic hire aligns with Datto's ongoing expansion beyond its traditional storage offerings into cloud-based software and security solutions for Managed Service Providers (MSPs). Cunningham's experience in scaling businesses and nurturing partner ecosystems, particularly in the security technology sector, is expected to support Datto's accelerated growth and its commitment to the MSP community.

title: ServiceNow crowned Glassdoor’s best place to work in UK
summary: Software company ServiceNow has been named the UK's best place to work in 2022 by Glassdoor, based on positive anonymous employee feedback regarding its culture, opportunities, and training. Technology companies dominated the list, with seven in the top ten, reflecting a shift in employee expectations post-pandemic. Glassdoor's 2022 methodology also included employers' diversity and inclusion ratings for the first time.

title: PayPal Deepens Relationship with Salesforce to Help Global Merchants Optimize their Ecommerce Experience
summary: PayPal is expanding its relationship with Salesforce, enabling global merchants to integrate PayPal's checkout options directly into their e-commerce experiences. This expanded integration will provide access to Venmo, PayPal Credit, and PayPal’s Buy Now, Pay Later products, building on existing access to PayPal and Braintree through the Salesforce AppExchange. The partnership aims to help merchants increase conversion rates, foster repeat shoppers, and broaden their customer base by offering diverse payment methods.

title: How Marc Benioff is transforming Time magazine
summary: Marc Benioff's acquisition of Time magazine, initially seen as a vanity purchase, is proving transformative, with the company projecting 30% revenue growth to over $200 million, largely driven by a new studios unit. Benioff has restructured Time around a product-centric ethos, similar to Salesforce, and aims for profitability and to become the world's "number one media brand." He views business as a catalyst for change, evidenced by Time's upcoming sustainability initiative.

title: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink says stakeholder capitalism is not 'woke'
summary: Larry Fink, CEO of BlackRock, defended stakeholder capitalism against criticism, asserting it is not "woke" but rather a strategy for generating profit. In his annual letter to CEOs, Fink emphasized that focusing on sustainability is a capitalist and fiduciary responsibility, not a political or ideological agenda. He also clarified that BlackRock's approach doesn't involve divestment from fossil fuels, despite pressure from environmental groups, and noted the firm's engagement in China as a significant opportunity.

title: Accenture named a Leader in Worldwide Salesforce Implementation Services
summary: Accenture has been recognized as a Leader in the IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Salesforce Implementation Services 2021 Vendor Assessment for the fifth consecutive time. The report highlights Accenture's differentiation in its current offerings and future growth strategy, attributing its success to its industry knowledge, technical expertise, and ability to help clients achieve desired business outcomes in an increasingly complex Salesforce ecosystem. With over 34,000 Salesforce-skilled people and 40,000+ certifications, Accenture continues to drive innovation for its clients on the Salesforce platform.

title: Systems Integrator GyanSys Acquires Salesforce Partner Groundswell Cloud Solutions -
summary: GyanSys, an Indiana-based systems integrator, has acquired Groundswell Cloud Solutions, a Salesforce and Mulesoft cloud consulting partner. This acquisition significantly enhances GyanSys' Salesforce consulting capabilities, adding over 250 Salesforce professionals and expanding its geographical reach across the US and Canada. The deal is part of a trend of M&A activities in the Salesforce cloud consulting partner ecosystem.

title: How to Invest in the Top 100 U.S. ESG Companies
summary: The article discusses the 2022 list of top 100 U.S. ESG companies compiled by Just Capital, highlighting major movements like Alphabet's rise and Meta's fall. It explains the methodology behind the rankings, which prioritize issues important to Americans, and introduces the Goldman Sachs JUST U.S. Large Cap Equity ETF (JUST) as a way to invest in companies demonstrating "just business behavior."

title: AST Announces Strategic Investment by Recognize
summary: AST Corporation, a cloud and digital transformation solutions provider, has received a strategic growth investment from Recognize, a technology services-focused investment platform. This partnership will allow AST to accelerate innovation, enhance global delivery, and expand its solution offerings. Charles Phillips, Recognize co-founder and former president of Oracle, will join AST's Board of Directors as Chairman.

title: Valet Living Chooses Cadalys Service Management to Deliver Enhanced Employee Support Experience
summary: Valet Living has selected Cadalys Service Management to enhance employee support for its 900+ associates, enabling seamless technology and tool support regardless of work location. This strategic decision aims to improve visibility into internal service journeys, streamline IT-related requests, and provide a scalable, unified IT Service Management (ITSM) solution on the Salesforce platform. The goal is to optimize employee experiences, drive productivity, and support Valet Living's continued business growth.

title: Biden Gets CEO Support for Economic Agenda
summary: President Joe Biden met with CEOs from major companies like General Motors, Ford, and Microsoft to garner support for his economic agenda, which includes nearly $2 trillion in spending and tax increases focusing on climate, manufacturing, and child care. Despite the Senate stalling the "Build Back Better" plan, these business leaders, including Cummins CEO Tom Linebarger and GM CEO Mary Barra, expressed support for aspects like child care subsidies and increased semiconductor production. The White House is now exploring which components of the plan can secure the necessary votes in Congress.

title: 7 Pardot Training Videos to Help Improve Your Marketing Automation Skills
summary: This article compiles a list of seven top-rated Salesforce Pardot training videos and tutorials available on YouTube. These resources are aimed at helping beginners and those evaluating new solutions to understand Pardot's marketing automation capabilities, integration with Salesforce CRM, lead management tools, and other features like B2B analytics and email marketing. The videos cover various aspects of Pardot, from campaign setup and forms to onboarding, scoring, and grading.

title: Adobe Inc. stock underperforms Thursday when compared to competitors
summary: Adobe Inc. (ADBE) stock declined by 1.55% on Thursday, closing at $493.05, amid a general downturn in the stock market where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average also fell. This marks its third consecutive day of losses, leaving the stock $206.49 below its 52-week high. While Adobe underperformed some rivals like Microsoft Corp. and Salesforce.com Inc., it still fared better than SAP SE ADR.

title: How Salesforce is creating a more diverse, inclusive culture
summary: Salesforce is actively addressing the tech sector's lack of diversity by implementing various initiatives and setting ambitious representation targets. Led by Chief Equality Officer Lori Castillo Martinez, the company is using a data-driven approach, employee feedback, and new programs to build a more diverse and inclusive workforce. Their strategies focus on accelerating representation, improving employee experience, designing intentional systems, leading with a global mindset, and engaging stakeholders.

title: Oculus VisionTech Announces Forget-Me-Yes on Salesforce AppExchange, the World's Leading Enterprise Cloud Marketplace
summary: Oculus VisionTech Inc. (TSXV: OVT) has launched Forget-Me-Yes® (FMY) on the Salesforce AppExchange, offering customers an automated solution for DSAR deletion-request compliance across various global data privacy regulations like GDPR, LGPD, and CCPA. FMY is a cloud-native SaaS platform designed to protect data subjects, collectors, and stewards. This integration aims to simplify data privacy compliance for businesses worldwide and capitalize on market growth opportunities.

title: Accenture Talent Hub for Salesforce Launches in Albany, New York
summary: Accenture has opened a Talent Hub for Salesforce in Albany, New York, aiming to create 100 new Salesforce-skilled cloud jobs in 2022. This initiative, part of the Salesforce Talent Alliance, focuses on recruiting, training, and skilling individuals in Salesforce technology to meet the growing market demand. The hub will offer internships and apprenticeships, supporting diversity and inclusion while addressing the need for digital and cloud capabilities in the region.

title: Updated: Penrod breaks from bootstrapping to raise $8 million, plans over 50% growth this year
summary: Milwaukee-based software consulting firm Penrod Inc. has successfully raised $8 million in funding, breaking from its previous bootstrapping strategy. The investment comes from Salesforce Ventures and a Milwaukee family office. The company, founded in 2011, plans for over 50% growth this year following this significant capital infusion.

title: 10 immutable laws of security administration redux
summary: This article revisits Scott Culp's "10 Immutable Laws of Security Administration" 20 years after their initial publication. The author, Brett James, analyzes each law to assess its continued relevance in today's cybersecurity landscape. He concludes that most of the laws remain highly applicable, with some requiring updated technological contexts, and highlights the ongoing importance of vigilance, good administration, and risk management in security.

title: JobTread Software Releases State of the Art Budgeting Solution that is a Game Changer for Construction Businesses
summary: JobTread Software has released significant updates to its estimating and budgeting solutions, aiming to revolutionize how construction businesses manage their finances and projects. The platform, launched in January 2021, focuses on a "budget-first" approach, enabling contractors to accurately budget, price, and schedule jobs, ultimately increasing profitability. With customizable tools and integration with QuickBooks, JobTread helps streamline operations from sales to project completion for over 250 businesses, with plans to support over 1,000 by year-end.

title: Event-led Engagement Platform, Airmeet, Raises $35M USD Series B From Prosus Ventures, Sistema, Sequoia Capital India, RingCentral Ventures, and Others
summary: Airmeet, an event-led engagement platform, announced it has raised $35M USD in Series B funding from new investors including Prosus Ventures, Sistema Asia Fund, and RingCentral Ventures, alongside existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Accel India. The company has experienced significant growth, scaling its recurring revenue 24X since its Series A investment and enabling 150 million minutes of video streaming in 2021. The funds will be used to expand its global footprint, invest in R&D, and scale its go-to-market functions, with a focus on strategic activities to increase brand visibility in the international market.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | Forget the Office—Salesforce Is Making a Wellness Retreat for Workers
summary: Salesforce is introducing a wellness retreat for its employees to reinvigorate corporate culture and enthusiasm after nearly two years of remote work. The company signed a multiyear agreement for a 75-acre retreat in Scotts Valley, Calif., which will serve as an employee work-and-wellness center for its nearly 70,000 staff members. This initiative reflects the company's approach to incorporating the outdoors into its corporate culture in the work-from-home era.

title: Salesforce unveils 'Trailblazer Ranch' to reconnect remote employees
summary: Salesforce has launched 'Trailblazer Ranch,' a 75-acre retreat in Scotts Valley, California, to help remote employees reconnect and focus on well-being after two years of remote work. The company plans to bring 10,000 employees to the ranch by the end of the year for onboarding, training, and team-building activities, which will typically last about two nights. This initiative supports Salesforce's long-term hybrid work model where most of its 70,000 employees will work in the office one to three days per week.

title: Cisco Has Discussed Deal for Software Company Splunk (Published 2022)
summary: Cisco Systems has held discussions with the software company Splunk about a potential acquisition, though no deal is currently solid. If talks resume, Cisco could acquire Splunk for over $20 billion, significantly higher than Splunk's current market capitalization of around $18 billion. This potential acquisition aligns with Cisco's strategy of growth through mergers and acquisitions, particularly in the security sector.

title: What is ServiceNow Impact? An app to keep digital transformations on track
summary: ServiceNow has introduced "Impact," a new app designed to help customers maximize the value derived from their ServiceNow subscriptions and bridge the "value gap" in digital transformation investments. Available in four tiers, including a free "Base" level and three paid tiers offering increasing levels of support and features, Impact aims to encourage broader consumption of ServiceNow's products by providing tools for measuring progress, personalized training, and developer support. While presented as a product rather than a service, customer renewal of Impact will depend on its ability to deliver expected value.

title: Pegasystems’ stock falls as it misses earnings and revenue targets
summary: Pegasystems Inc. reported a net loss of $37.2 million in the fourth quarter and missed Wall Street's earnings and revenue expectations, causing its stock to fall. Despite the Q4 miss, the company's full-year 2021 results were more encouraging, with revenue up 19% to $1.21 billion. Pegasystems is optimistic about future growth driven by demand for digital transformation projects and provided fiscal 2022 guidance.

title: GyanSys Announces Salesforce-SAP Connector on Salesforce
summary: GyanSys Inc. announced the launch of its Salesforce-SAP Connector on Salesforce AppExchange. This new application enables dynamic, out-of-the-box integration between Salesforce cloud solutions and SAP S/4HANA or SAP ECC systems for both master and transactional data. The connector offers an easy-to-use, configurable solution with over 100 pre-built APIs to accelerate customer ROI and address complex data challenges for enterprise users.

title: Actual, which renders company ESG data in a SimCity-like platform, raises $5M seed
summary: Actual, a San Francisco-based startup, has secured $5 million in seed funding for its SimCity-like platform that visualizes and helps manage Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) data for companies. Founded by alums from LinkedIn and Airbus, the platform aims to assist businesses in modeling and executing their ESG plans to meet regulations and investor expectations. Actual's "model first" approach allows companies to use existing data, even low-resolution, to forecast future scenarios and transformations.

title: Salesforce consultancy Thunder rolls out new brand
summary: Thunder Inc., a San Francisco-based Salesforce consulting firm, has rebranded with a new purple color scheme, a bolder logo, and the tagline "As easy as boom." This rebrand aims to differentiate Thunder in the saturated Salesforce ecosystem and reflects their confidence in delivering client solutions. The firm, founded by Carter Wigell and backed by a growth capital investment, focuses on implementing Salesforce solutions for various companies.

title: Salesforce ties executive compensation to ESG goals
summary: Salesforce announced that a portion of executive variable pay for those at the executive vice president level and above will be tied to ESG measures, starting this fiscal year. These measures will focus on increasing representation for diverse employees and reducing air travel emissions, as well as increasing spend with suppliers signed onto Salesforce's Sustainability Exhibit. This move reflects a growing trend among major companies to link executive compensation to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) and sustainability goals.

title: Salesforce employees revolt over NFT moves
summary: Hundreds of Salesforce employees have revolted against the company's planned move into the NFT market, citing environmental and economic concerns. An open letter signed by over 400 workers addresses cofounder Marc Benioff and co-CEO Bret Taylor, raising issues about the high carbon footprint of blockchain technology and the speculative nature of NFTs. This internal backlash comes shortly after Salesforce highlighted its sustainability efforts, creating a perceived conflict between its stated values and its explorations in the NFT space.

title: Roofing firm takes on economic ‘double whammy’ with ideas
summary: Beldon Roofing CEO Brad Beldon discusses the "perfect storm" of challenges facing the construction industry, including a severe labor shortage and broken global supply chains leading to inflated prices and lack of transparency. In response, Beldon's company has launched Ozbee Team Software, a construction software platform built on Salesforce, to help companies manage operations more efficiently. Beldon also advocates for expanding the H-2B temporary worker program to address labor deficits and suggests societal changes to encourage younger generations to enter trades.

title: Salesforce, Elanco Animal Health, Pepsi Co, and 150+ Major U.S. Companies Oppose Anti-Transgender Legislation
summary: Over 150 major U.S. companies, including Salesforce, Elanco Animal Health, and Pepsi Co, have publicly opposed anti-LGBTQ+ legislation, particularly bills targeting transgender youth. These businesses, representing nearly 25,000 employees in Indiana alone, argue that discriminatory laws negatively impact recruitment, retention, tourism, and overall business operations and financial performance. They call on public leaders to abandon efforts to enact discriminatory legislation to ensure a strong business climate and fairness for all Americans.

title: Snowflake and Databricks back $222M round for dbt Labs at $4.2B valuation
summary: dbt Labs, a fast-growing data management startup, has secured $222 million in funding, valuing the company at $4.2 billion. Notable investors in this round include Snowflake, Databricks, Alphabet’s GV fund, and Salesforce. The company plans to use the capital to hire 300 new employees over the next year and expand its offering as a popular data transformation tool used by over 25,000 data scientists and 9,000 companies.

title: CRM giant Salesforce acquiring B.C.’s Traction on Demand
summary: Salesforce.com Inc. is acquiring B.C.-based software firm Traction on Demand, which specializes in implementing marketing strategies using Salesforce's CRM services. The Burnaby-based company employs about 500 workers across British Columbia, and its founder had previously resisted selling the company. This acquisition follows Salesforce's recent spree of purchases, including Mobify and Slack Technologies Inc.

title: How CFOs can supercharge their organization’s sales forecasting
summary: CFOs face a significant challenge in accurately forecasting sales, as traditional methods are often manual, time-consuming, and prone to becoming outdated quickly. The article introduces the "virtual sales forecast" (VSF) as a modern solution that leverages analytical tools, data connections, and automation to provide more accurate, granular, and frequently updated sales projections. By implementing a VSF, organizations can empower various departments with real-time insights, leading to better strategic planning and operational efficiency.

title: Adobe named a Leader for fifth consecutive year in 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Digital Experience Platforms
summary: Adobe has been recognized as a Leader for the fifth consecutive year in the 2022 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Digital Experience Platforms, positioned highest and furthest to the right for both Ability to Execute and Completeness of Vision. The company highlights its market-leading technology in integrated insights, AI/ML (Adobe Sensei), content management, scale and breadth (handling 21.5 trillion segment evaluations daily), real-time personalization, and the foundational Adobe Experience Platform. Adobe emphasizes its commitment to helping businesses deliver personalized customer experiences at scale, highlighting trust, data privacy, and efficient workflow management with Adobe Workfront as critical components for success.

title: Rimini Street Appoints Marketing Veteran Jeff Spicer as Chief Marketing Officer
summary: Rimini Street, Inc. has announced the appointment of Jeff Spicer as its new executive vice president and chief marketing officer. Spicer, a seasoned technology marketing veteran with over twenty years of experience at companies like Oracle, IBM, and VMWare, will be responsible for leading Rimini Street's global marketing strategy, brand management, and demand generation. His appointment aims to support the company's growth initiatives and goal of reaching $1 billion in annual revenue by 2026.

title: Salesforce Is Holding Employee ‘Listening Sessions' Amid NFT Blowback
summary: Salesforce is conducting "listening sessions" with employees who are concerned about the company's reported plans to launch a cloud-based service for non-fungible tokens (NFTs). Employees are reportedly worried that the NFT initiative contradicts Salesforce’s commitment to sustainability. Chief Revenue Officer Gavin Patterson confirmed that these sessions aim to understand employee reservations.

title: Leveraging Technology to Improve The Lives of P&G Consumers
summary: P&G utilizes advanced data-processing technologies like machine learning and artificial intelligence to enhance its products, understand consumer behavior, and streamline operations. This technology-driven approach, which began over five years ago, impacts everything from product development and quality control to personalized consumer communication and supply chain logistics. P&G's strategy focuses on connecting data, facilitating data scientists' work, and developing talent to continuously improve products and consumer experiences.

title: Salesforce Says The ‘Future Of Work Is Here’ And Offers A ‘Success-From-Anywhere’ Approach, While Still Emphasizing The Need For Connection
summary: Salesforce is promoting a "success-from-anywhere" approach, offering employees flexibility in where and how they work, while still valuing in-person connections. The company is evolving its office spaces into destinations for collaboration and social interaction, alongside initiatives like Trailblazer Ranch to foster employee bonding and well-being. This strategy aims to blend remote work flexibility with the benefits of physical interaction and community.

title: Inside Salesforce’s strategy for employee engagement
summary: Salesforce is adapting its employee engagement strategy to post-pandemic realities, focusing on balancing "both the head and the heart" through a formula of "culture plus technology plus data equals engagement." The company leverages technology like a yearlong marketing cloud journey for new hires and a Concierge tool, alongside human touches, to keep its 75,000 employees connected and engaged. This approach prioritizes core values, trusted relationships, and freeing up time for human connection through automation.

title: Trailblazer Ranch at 1440
summary: Salesforce is partnering with 1440 Multiversity in Scotts Valley to launch "Trailblazer Ranch at 1440," an initiative aimed at bringing employees together for connection, onboarding, and training after two years of remote work. This collaboration will also involve a research study on post-pandemic corporate culture and employee well-being, expected to create 100 new jobs and boost the local economy. The city of Scotts Valley celebrates this partnership, highlighting Salesforce's philanthropic model and commitment to sustainability.

title: What’s Changed: 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Digital Experience Platforms
summary: This article summarizes the key takeaways from Gartner's 2022 Magic Quadrant for Digital Experience Platforms (DXP), detailing the evolution of DXPs and their core capabilities. It provides an overview of the criteria for vendors to qualify for the report and categorizes prominent DXP providers into Leaders, Challengers, Niche Players, and Visionaries, highlighting their strengths and specialties.

title: Salesforce and Sprout Social partner to manage full social media presence
summary: Sprout Social and Salesforce have announced a global partnership to integrate Sprout's social media management suite with Salesforce's CRM solutions. This collaboration aims to provide Salesforce customers with a comprehensive platform for managing their social media presence, including engagement, publishing, analytics, and customer care. The partnership seeks to create a unified view of the customer by integrating Sprout with Salesforce Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, and Slack, enabling businesses to better connect with audiences and operationalize social media at scale.

title: Everest Group Recognizes Accenture as a Leader in Platform IT, Salesforce and Duck Creek Services in Insurance
summary: Accenture has been recognized as a Leader in three new reports by Everest Group for its platform IT, Salesforce, and Duck Creek services in the insurance industry. The analyst firm highlighted Accenture's strong capabilities and market impact, emphasizing its well-balanced services portfolio and diverse partnerships that help insurers with modernization journeys. Accenture's resource quality, effective management of large-scale implementations, and robust change management capabilities were also noted by clients.

title: Forrester predicts RPA software market growth will begin to flatten next year
summary: Forrester Research predicts that the Robotic Process Automation (RPA) software market will reach $6.5 billion by 2025. However, the report also suggests that growth rates will begin to flatten as early as next year, as companies shift towards more AI-fueled automation solutions. While the software market's growth may slow, the services component related to RPA is expected to grow more robustly, potentially reaching $16 billion by 2025.

title: Traction on Demand’s Greg Malpass on the Salesforce offer he couldn’t refuse
summary: Greg Malpass, founder and CEO of Traction on Demand, sold his company to Salesforce after 15 years, despite previously resisting acquisition offers. The deal, which has an undisclosed sale price but is expected to generate US$75 million in revenue for Salesforce in 2023, was an "incredible opportunity" that Malpass felt accountable to his employees to pursue. Traction on Demand, a Salesforce partner with 1,500 global employees, will become part of Salesforce Professional Services, with Malpass focused on a smooth integration before exploring his next steps within the larger company.

title: Announcing Winners of the 2022 Workday Partner Innovation Awards
summary: Workday has announced the winners of its second annual Partner Innovation Awards, recognizing services and software partners for their outstanding contributions. These awards highlight specialized solutions that help Workday customers navigate a changing world, extending key Workday solutions across various industries. The winning innovations span financial services, healthcare, retail, technology, and more, demonstrating a commitment to customer success and technological advancement within the Workday ecosystem.

title: Building a Future-Ready Workforce
summary: This article discusses the evolution of organizational change management from traditional, mechanistic approaches to more agile, integrated, and digitally-driven methods. It emphasizes the critical need for organizations to cultivate a "future-ready workforce" through continuous recalibration to adapt to rapid technological advancements and market shifts. The author outlines three fundamental components for building such a workforce: identifying technological drivers, predicting adoption rates, and understanding market forces, which inform strategic changes in organizational design, skills, learning, culture, and employee experience.

title: Report: F1 set for ‘US$30m-a-year’ Salesforce sponsorship
summary: Formula One is reportedly close to finalizing a five-year sponsorship deal with cloud-based CRM specialist Salesforce, valued at approximately US$30 million annually. This agreement would place Salesforce in F1's global sponsorship tier, alongside major brands like Aramco and Rolex. The news follows F1's recent financial success and its termination of broadcast contracts in Russia due to the ongoing conflict in Ukraine.

title: Embracing Automation Technologies: 5 Tips for Modernizing Mortgage Origination
summary: The article discusses the challenges faced by the mortgage origination industry, including cyclical market conditions, market disruption from fintechs, and shifting consumer expectations. It presents five tips for modernizing mortgage origination through automation: making automation a standard practice, being innovative without being disruptive, eliminating manual document processing, making the process painless and personalized, and enhancing a buyer's bargaining power. The authors advocate for an automation-first approach to reduce costs, increase speed to close, and improve customer experience.

title: SaaS customer relationship management (CRM) Market size to grow by USD 44.17 billion | Retail end-users to exhibit maximum demand | Technavio
summary: The SaaS Customer Relationship Management (CRM) market is projected to grow by USD 44.17 billion between 2020 and 2025, exhibiting a CAGR of 14%. Retail end-users are expected to drive the highest demand, significantly contributing to market growth due to the expansion of retail and e-commerce. North America is anticipated to dominate the market geographically, accounting for 52% of the global market expansion, primarily driven by the increasing adoption of cloud-based offerings and the need for customer information analysis.

title: Great Expectations: Making Hybrid Work Work
summary: This article discusses the evolving landscape of hybrid work, highlighting how employee expectations have changed significantly since the pandemic, prioritizing health, well-being, and flexibility. Based on a Microsoft Work Trend Index study of 31,000 people, it outlines five key trends for leaders, emphasizing the need to empower managers, rethink the office's role, rebuild social capital in a digital-first world, and establish sustainable flexible work practices to avoid digital exhaustion. The study reveals that employees are actively reshaping their work lives, making flexibility and wellbeing non-negotiable for future success.

title: After Abandoned Merger, Zoom And Five9 Make Investment Into AI Company Cresta
summary: Following the failed merger attempt between Zoom and Five9, both companies, along with Genesys, have invested in AI startup Cresta. Cresta, led by CEO Zayd Enam, secured $80 million in a Series C funding round led by Tiger Global, valuing the company at $1.6 billion. The company develops AI-powered software to assist customer service agents and salespeople, with revenue tripling in 2021.

title: Citigroup's Jane Fraser is latest female CEO to take on abortion access
summary: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser is among a small but growing number of female executives, including Shar Dubey of Match Group and Whitney Wolfe Herd of Bumble, who are publicly committing to cover travel costs for employees needing to access reproductive health care in other states. This decision by Fraser is particularly significant given the typically more conservative finance industry and Citigroup's substantial number of employees in states with strict abortion laws. While male CEOs have offered other forms of support, female leaders are at the forefront of providing assistance for abortion-related travel.

title: Texas Lawmaker Warns Citigroup Against Paying for Out-of-State Abortions (Published 2022)
summary: A Texas legislator warned Citigroup that he would introduce a bill to prevent the bank from underwriting municipal bonds in the state unless it rescinded its policy covering travel expenses for employees seeking abortions out-of-state. State Representative Briscoe Cain sent a cease-and-desist letter to Citigroup’s CEO, calling the policy a "misuse of shareholder money" and vowing to propose legislation that would ban local governments from doing business with companies offering such benefits. This follows Citigroup's announcement to provide travel benefits in response to changes in reproductive health care laws, particularly after Texas enacted a restrictive abortion law.

title: Google’s revamped Contact Center AI Platform provides tighter integration with CRMs
summary: Google Cloud has updated its Contact Center AI Platform to offer a comprehensive, out-of-the-box solution with tighter integration with popular CRM software. This aims to provide businesses with cloud scalability, unified data across sales, marketing, and support, and more personalized customer experiences. The platform also expands its partnership with Salesforce.com Inc. to integrate with Service Cloud Voice.

title: Walmart Enters the Cloud Wars and Challenges Microsoft, Salesforce, Oracle, and SAP
summary: Walmart is entering the highly competitive cloud computing market with SaaS-based retail and commerce solutions, challenging established players like Microsoft, Salesforce, Oracle, and SAP. This move stems from Walmart's decision to commercialize its extensive internal technology investments, transforming into both a consumer and creator of enterprise technology. The initiative, housed within Walmart Global Tech, aims to sell its "billion-dollar portfolio of cutting-edge technology" to other retailers, marking a significant shift in the industry-cloud segment.

title: Alphabet spins off its Sandbox AQ quantum computing unit
summary: Alphabet Inc.'s quantum computing unit, Sandbox AQ, has spun off into an independent company after raising a "nine-figure" funding round from prominent investors like Eric Schmidt and Marc Benioff. The new startup, led by CEO Jack Hidary, aims to develop commercially viable quantum technologies, focusing initially on post-quantum cryptography software and quantum simulation in healthcare and materials science. Sandbox AQ already has customers, including Mount Sinai Health System and SoftBank Group Corp.'s telecom business, and plans to work with multiple cloud providers, including Google Cloud.

title: CIBC tackles developer shortage with hackathons, skill training
summary: CIBC is addressing the tech worker shortage by upskilling its current developers in high-demand areas like blockchain and Microsoft Azure, rather than solely recruiting external talent. The bank offers growth opportunities through training programs and hackathons, aiming to retain existing employees and attract new ones. This strategy comes as Canadian banks face intense competition for tech talent, leading to rising salaries and turnover rates in the industry.

title: Executive Spotlight With Salesforce Business Development VP Michael Parker Highlights Company Initiatives, DOD’s IT Modernization Efforts
summary: Michael Parker, VP of business development at Salesforce, was featured in an Executive Spotlight interview discussing his three decades of public sector experience and its relevance to his current role. The interview covered the Salesforce Military Program, IT modernization efforts within the Department of Defense, and Salesforce's recruitment strategies. Parker specifically highlighted the various levels of cloud adoption and how Salesforce's platform-as-a-service and software-as-a-service solutions simplify IT management for customers and end-users, reducing infrastructure complexity.

title: Salesforce Changes Legal Name to Salesforce, Inc.
summary: Salesforce announced its legal name change from salesforce.com, inc. to Salesforce, Inc., effective April 4, 2022. The company's stock will continue to trade on the NYSE under the ticker symbol CRM. This change reflects the global CRM leader's ongoing evolution.

title: Accenture named 2022 MuleSoft Partner of the Year
summary: Accenture received four MuleSoft Partner of the Year Awards for 2022, recognizing its significant work in scaling its team of MuleSoft experts, driving growth, and delivering business outcomes for clients globally and specifically in the JAPAC region. These awards highlight Accenture's large and experienced MuleSoft practice and its ability to help clients build connected experiences faster by leveraging MuleSoft and Salesforce technologies.

title: 3 Dow Stocks That Can Turn $300,000 Into $1 Million by 2030
summary: The article identifies three Dow stocks – Salesforce, UnitedHealth Group, and Visa – that have the potential to turn a $300,000 investment into $1 million by 2030. Each company is highlighted for its strong market position, consistent growth, and specific catalysts that are expected to drive significant shareholder returns. This analysis provides a long-term investment perspective on these established businesses within the Dow Jones Industrial Average.

title: HP seeks to ride hybrid work boom with $1.7 billion Poly buyout
summary: HP Inc announced its intention to acquire audio and video devices maker Poly for $1.7 billion in cash, aiming to leverage the growing demand for electronic products driven by hybrid work models. The deal, valued at $3.3 billion including debt, is expected to position HP for long-term growth and is anticipated to close by the end of 2022. Poly's shares surged following the announcement, while HP's shares saw a slight decline in premarket trading.

title: What’s Changed: 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms
summary: This article analyzes changes in Gartner's 2022 Magic Quadrant for Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms, highlighting new market trends and vendor shifts. It details the leaders, challengers, visionaries, and niche players, noting additions and removals from the previous year's report. The report emphasizes visual self-service, augmented AI, and the divergence of traditional BI from data science and machine learning.

title: Practice Innovations: Non-lawyer ownership of law firms — Are winds of change coming for Rule 5.4?
summary: This article discusses the evolving landscape of non-lawyer ownership in law firms, examining how some states are beginning to challenge the long-standing restrictions of American Bar Association Model Rule 5.4. It highlights recent changes in Utah and Arizona that allow for varying degrees of non-lawyer ownership and investment, contrasting these with jurisdictions like Florida and the ABA's general stance which maintain stricter interpretations of the rule. The author suggests that despite resistance, competition from non-lawyer entities and the push for greater access to legal services will continue to drive debate and potential changes in the legal industry.

title: Clean Harbors’ CIO: Hybrid approach to the cloud is a win-win
summary: Clean Harbors, a hazardous waste cleanup giant, has adopted a hybrid cloud strategy, leveraging Microsoft Azure for advanced AI and RPA capabilities while retaining its core Waste Information Network (WIN) on-premises. This approach allows them to innovate with cloud services for customer-facing applications and data analytics, while ensuring the high availability and security of critical legacy systems and data, a model increasingly favored by enterprises. The company's CIO, Sharon Gabriel, highlights their cautious, methodical approach to cloud adoption, informed by past experiences and a need to manage 42 years of sensitive data.

title: Lark Health Announces Lark for Salesforce on Salesforce AppExchange, the World's Leading Enterprise Cloud Marketplace
summary: Lark Health has launched "Lark for Salesforce" on Salesforce AppExchange, aiming to simplify care management for health plans and their members through enhanced technology. This integration allows Lark's AI-powered chronic disease prevention and management platform to streamline workflows for health plans and guide members to appropriate care. The collaboration seeks to improve health outcomes and engagement by providing personalized digital counseling for chronic conditions at scale.

title: Salesforce to revolutionise Formula 1’s fan engagement and accelerate its sustainability efforts with 5-year partnership
summary: Formula 1 has announced a five-year global partnership with Salesforce, a leader in customer relationship management. Salesforce will help Formula 1 enhance fan engagement through its Customer 360 platform and accelerate its sustainability mission to achieve net-zero emissions by 2030 using Net Zero Cloud. This collaboration aims to deepen connections with existing fans and grow the global fanbase while contributing to environmental goals.

title: Digital Transformation Market [2022-2028] size to Hit USD 3,546.80 billion | Exhibiting a Stellar CAGR of 22.1%
summary: The global digital transformation market is projected to reach USD 3,546.80 billion by 2028, growing at a CAGR of 22.1% from USD 737.88 billion in 2020. This growth is driven by the increasing adoption of cloud computing and big data technologies across various industries. However, security risks and cyber-attacks could impede market expansion.

title: Labeyrie Fine Foods Partners with Rimini Street to Enable the Company’s Digital Evolution
summary: Labeyrie Fine Foods has partnered with Rimini Street to improve its Oracle JD Edwards and Oracle Database support, achieving operational value and cost efficiencies. This partnership allows Labeyrie Fine Foods to redeploy resources to accelerate its migration to the cloud and fund its digital evolution. Rimini Street provides customized support that meets Labeyrie Fine Foods' specific needs, with a focus on optimizing systems and reducing total cost of ownership.

title: In the age of composable technology, Accenture helps orgs rethink their technology stack
summary: Accenture PLC is heavily investing in composable technology to help global companies adapt their tech stacks in a dynamic environment. Brian McKillips, managing director at Accenture, explains that this approach allows organizations to combine cloud foundations, digital cores (like Salesforce and Oracle), and composable parts (such as other software packages or IoT devices) to solve evolving industry problems and improve customer experiences. This shift, enabled by advancements in hyperscale cloud compute, edge computing, and 5G, is crucial for companies to stay competitive.

title: Amazon unexpectedly renews employee monitoring debate
summary: Amazon's consideration of an employee monitoring tool that would block certain words and phrases like "injustice," "ethics," "living wage," and "robots" on an internal messaging app has sparked renewed debate about employee monitoring. While Amazon states its intention is to screen offensive or harassing language, critics like Paul Starkman and Andrew Konya argue that such tools risk stifling employee voices and can lead to discontent, higher turnover, and a company missing crucial truths. The article suggests that alternative HR tools exist for gathering authentic employee feedback without resorting to surveillance that could harm company culture and reputation.

title: NVIDIA enters Top 5 of Fortune's '100 Best Companies to Work For'
summary: NVIDIA has been ranked #5 on Fortune's 2022 list of the "100 Best Companies to Work For," placing ahead of major financial institutions like Capital One and American Express. Cisco secured the top spot for the second consecutive year, followed by Hilton and Wegmans Food Markets, Inc., with Salesforce coming in fourth. The recognition highlights the importance of strong workplace culture during a period of significant workforce changes.

title: These 4 Houston companies are honored as Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For
summary: Four Houston-based companies, including David Weekley Homes, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Camden Property Trust, and Hilcorp, have been recognized on Fortune's 2022 100 Best Companies to Work For list. David Weekley Homes notably secured a top 10 spot, ranking No. 9, while other Texas companies also made the list. The rankings were determined by Great Place to Work, surveying employees on trust, care, and fairness.

title: Wells Fargo commits $210M to racial equity in wake of criticism
summary: Wells Fargo has pledged $210 million to advance racial equity in homeownership following criticism over its low approval rates for Black refinancing applicants. Of this, $150 million will be used to lower rates and costs for Black homeowners seeking to refinance through a new Special Purpose Credit Program. The bank aims to address systemic inequities and will report its progress annually.

title: What is Adobe Experience Cloud? CRM platform overview
summary: Adobe Experience Cloud is a comprehensive CRM platform designed for medium to large enterprises, offering tools to manage sales, marketing, and customer support. It facilitates the customer journey through data-driven insights with integrated features like targeted list generators, email campaigns, and real-time data updates. The platform also integrates with various third-party systems and social media, providing a unified view of customer interactions and supporting personalized digital experiences.

title: Worker expectations push employers to address pay compression, survey finds
summary: A Robert Half survey reveals that market conditions and employee expectations are compelling employers to address pay compression, with 56% observing discrepancies between new hires and tenured staff. In response, 62% of executives are regularly reviewing compensation plans and increasing salaries for existing employees. This proactive approach is driven by the fact that many employees plan to ask for raises due to living costs, and a significant portion would seek new employment if denied.

title: Infosys Public Services Introduces Infosys LaborForce, one of the First Cloud-native Unemployment Insurance Solutions in the Industry
summary: Infosys Public Services launched Infosys LaborForce, a cloud-native Platform as a Service (PaaS) solution for unemployment insurance (UI) systems. Built on the Salesforce Platform, it aims to help states modernize their UI systems by enhancing tax, benefits, and workforce programs with features like automated case management and advanced fraud detection. This solution is critical for improving efficiency and user experience in state unemployment systems, especially after challenges highlighted by the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Digital Transformation That Sticks: Creating a Capabilities Ecosystem for Effective Learning
summary: This article argues that successful digital transformation requires creating a capabilities ecosystem rather than relying on traditional training models. It contrasts two hypothetical companies: one that fails due to an inadequate "learn as you go" approach, and another that succeeds by implementing a holistic capabilities ecosystem. This ecosystem integrates organizational change management, instructional design, and other disciplines to align learning with business strategy, foster continuous support, and build organizational resilience.

title: State of Rhode Island
summary: In response to the COVID-19 pandemic, the State of Rhode Island partnered with IBM Consulting to improve its data processing and analytical capabilities. IBM helped the state build a cloud-based data lake, automate processes, and generate timely, data-driven insights to guide public health policies and communications, especially regarding health equity and vaccine distribution. This collaboration significantly enhanced Rhode Island's ability to respond effectively to the crisis and inform its citizens.

title: What do landlords learn in a background check? More than most renters realize
summary: Landlords are using increasingly sophisticated background checks that go beyond credit reports and evictions, incorporating facial recognition, AI algorithms, and continuous tracking to assess potential tenants. These screenings can include detailed financial data, past lease disputes, and even predict future behavior, raising concerns among consumer advocates about accuracy and potential biases. The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is stepping up scrutiny due to reports of inaccurate data leading to housing denials and urges tenants to dispute errors.

title: Equinix Q1 2022: xScale Quarterly Leasing Activity Drops to Zero
summary: Equinix reported its Q1 2022 earnings, showing a 10% year-over-year revenue increase but also a significant halt in leasing activity for its hyperscale xScale facilities. The company provided financial guidance for 2022, continued its global data center expansion, and outlined recent acquisitions and joint ventures, while noting that no new xScale capacity was leased in the quarter.

title: Slack is definitely part of Salesforce now, and here’s proof
summary: Salesforce and Slack are launching "Salesforce Platform for Slack," allowing developers to build functionality that integrates Salesforce data into Slack. This move solidifies Slack's integration with its parent company, offering enhanced collaboration and automation capabilities while still maintaining compatibility with third-party business tools. Slack cofounder Cal Henderson provides a nuanced perspective on the acquisition, highlighting the benefits of working with Salesforce's thriving ecosystem.

title: Salesforce extends ‘Silenced No More Act’ protections to all U.S. employees
summary: Salesforce Inc. has announced it will extend the protections of California’s “Silenced No More Act” to all of its U.S. employees by the end of the year. This move is a victory for a coalition advocating for transparency in employment contracts and aiming to free employees from nondisclosure agreements. The act protects current and former employees from being silenced on harassment, discrimination, and other unlawful acts in the workplace.

title: Salesforce Will Let Workers Break NDAs to Report Harassment, Discrimination
summary: Salesforce Inc. announced that its U.S. workforce will no longer be bound by non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) when discussing unlawful activities such as harassment or discrimination. This move by the software company, which employs 73,000 workers, adds to the momentum of the #MeToo movement and aligns with pressure created by new laws in California and Washington aimed at amending NDA rules. Employees will now be able to report workplace violations without fear of violating an NDA.

title: Here’s why TELUS International is a buy right now
summary: Greg Newman of Scotia Wealth Management recommends TELUS International (TSX:TIXT) as a buying opportunity, despite its recent dip alongside the broader software sector. He highlights the company's strong growth rate, its trading below issuance price, and attractive valuation at 19x its 2023 multiple. Newman suggests investors consider building a position gradually, expecting rewards over the next two to three years.

title: Western Digital investor calls for flash unit to be split
summary: Activist investor Elliott Management is urging Western Digital's board to split its hard disk drive and NAND flash divisions into separate, publicly traded entities. Elliott, which holds a 6 percent stake, believes this separation could double Western Digital's stock price by the end of 2023, reaching over $100 per share, and is offering to inject over $1 billion into the breakaway flash business. The firm argues that the combined structure has led to underperformance since the 2016 acquisition of SanDisk.

title: McKinsey acquires Spanish Salesforce partner S4G Consulting
summary: McKinsey & Company has acquired S4G Consulting, a Spanish firm specializing in Salesforce consulting and implementation services. This acquisition, McKinsey's third this year, brings S4G Consulting's team of approximately 160 employees into McKinsey's Marketing & Sales practice to enhance technology support for client growth. The integration aims to combine S4G's Salesforce expertise with McKinsey's growth offerings to deliver end-to-end growth transformations.

title: AutoRABIT Raises $26 Million in Series B
summary: AutoRABIT, a Salesforce DevSecOps platform provider based in San Francisco, CA, announced it has raised $26 million in Series B funding. The investment came from existing investor Full In Partners, a growth equity firm. AutoRABIT plans to use the funds for continued growth initiatives and product development, particularly focusing on security and development challenges in regulated industries using Salesforce.

title: Adobe Inc. stock underperforms Friday when compared to competitors
summary: Shares of Adobe Inc. (ADBE) fell 2.37% on Friday, closing at $391.01, amidst a generally negative trading session for the broader stock market. The stock underperformed several competitors, including Microsoft Corp. (MSFT) and Salesforce Inc. (CRM), which also saw declines. Adobe's stock ended the day significantly below its 52-week high.

title: Salesforce acquires Troops.ai to make useful Slack bots
summary: Salesforce announced its acquisition of Troops.ai, a bot-based service that integrates with Slack to enhance data retrieval and updating for sales teams across Salesforce's systems. The terms of the deal were not disclosed, but Troops.ai will become part of Slack after the acquisition closes in Q2 2023. This move aims to further integrate Slack into Salesforce's broader software portfolio amidst ongoing efforts to unify their product offerings.

title: Salesforce To Take Over Troops.ai For Microsoft Teams, Slack Integration Power
summary: Salesforce plans to acquire Troops.ai, a company that provides integration tools for Slack and Microsoft Teams, to enhance its Slack offerings. Troops.ai specializes in delivering real-time insights and revenue signals from CRM systems like Salesforce to communication platforms, aiming to improve sales velocity and collaboration. The acquisition, expected to close before July 31, will integrate Troops.ai's technology into Slack, bolstering its capabilities for customer-facing teams.

title: Oracle Corp. stock rises Friday, still underperforms market
summary: Oracle Corp. (ORCL) saw its stock rise 0.62% on Friday to $71.17, despite a generally positive day for the broader market with the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also increasing. However, Oracle underperformed compared to some competitors and remained significantly below its 52-week high. Trading volume was also below its 50-day average.

title: Salesforce dumped rest of its Snowflake shares during first-quarter market plunge
summary: Salesforce has sold off its remaining stake in data-analytics software maker Snowflake during the first quarter of 2022 as the market plunged. The company initially invested $250 million in Snowflake's IPO in 2020 and had already offloaded most of its shares by mid-2021, realizing a handsome return despite Snowflake's recent stock decline. Salesforce continues to hold stakes in other public companies like Robinhood and Monday.com.

title: 7 Tips for Conducting Performance Reviews With Remote Employees
summary: This article provides seven tips for conducting effective performance reviews with remote employees, acknowledging the shift to widespread remote work. It covers strategies such as utilizing software for evaluations, conducting calibration sessions with managers, scheduling ample time for discussions, and ensuring a private, distraction-free environment. The guide emphasizes the importance of making remote reviews a permanent, smooth process for organizations adopting remote work by choice.

title: Starbucks to cover employees’ travel expenses for abortions; gender surgeries
summary: Starbucks announced an expansion of its health care benefits to cover travel expenses for employees seeking abortions or gender-affirming procedures if these services are not available within 100 miles of their homes. This decision comes in the wake of a leaked draft U.S. Supreme Court opinion potentially overturning Roe v. Wade, with the company affirming its commitment to ensuring employee access to quality healthcare. Starbucks joins other major companies in offering this benefit, consistent with its history of advocating for liberal causes.

title: EBG Acquires Sparkfly Perks to Support Expansion of Corporate Client Base
summary: EBG, a prominent e-commerce solutions provider specializing in travel and entertainment, has acquired Sparkfly Perks, a national discount platform for employee benefits. This acquisition will allow EBG to broaden its corporate client base, including major organizations like The Coca-Cola Company, and integrate new products into its extensive offerings through the Working Advantage platform. This move solidifies EBG's position for continued growth, building on previous strategic acquisitions and investment partnerships.

title: Moat ETF | Moat Investing
summary: VanEck offers a suite of Moat ETFs based on the principle of investing in companies with sustainable competitive advantages, identified through Morningstar's forward-looking equity research. These ETFs aim to generate superior returns by focusing on undervalued companies with "economic moats" such as switching costs, intangible assets, network effects, cost advantages, and efficient scale. The article details four specific Moat ETFs, their characteristics, and the underlying philosophy and methodology behind their construction.

title: SalesScoreKeeper Launches Salesforce App for Agent Dealer
summary: SalesScoreKeeper has launched a new Salesforce App for Agent Dealer, designed to streamline commission automation for the office equipment industry. The app allows sales representatives and managers to view quotas, commission data, and status directly within Agent Dealer, providing real-time information to manage and motivate sales teams. This integration builds on a long-standing partnership between SalesScoreKeeper and Agent Dealer, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in commission processing.

title: SalesScoreKeeper Launches Salesforce App for Agent Dealer
summary: SalesScoreKeeper (SSK) has launched a new Salesforce App for Agent Dealer, aimed at simplifying commission automation for the office equipment industry. This app allows sales representatives and managers to view their quotas, obtainment, and commissions directly within Agent Dealer and provides live dashboards and reporting capabilities. The integration with Agent Dealer enhances the ability to track sales from configuration to commission payment, a collaboration praised by both SSK CEO Luis Gonzalez and Agent Dealer CEO Edward Barfield for its efficiency and accuracy.

title: Salesforce stock jumps as it raises profit forecast, CFO says company will be more 'measured' in hiring
summary: Salesforce (CRM) shares rose after the company beat fiscal first-quarter earnings expectations and raised its full-year earnings guidance. While the company boosted its profit forecast, it reduced its revenue guidance for the full fiscal year and announced it would be more measured in its hiring practices. Salesforce also changed its legal name to Salesforce Inc. from Salesforce.com Inc. during the quarter.

title: Elastic Earnings Beat Expectations, but Headwinds Weigh On The Outlook
summary: Elastic (ESTC) reported better-than-expected results for its fiscal fourth quarter, mirroring the strong performance seen from Salesforce.com. However, the company's outlook is being hampered by various headwinds. Despite the positive earnings, Elastic's shares have declined almost 50% this year.

title: Optty and Payoneer Collaborate to Make Buy Now Pay Later Available to its Vast Merchant Base Around the Globe
summary: Optty and Payoneer have partnered to integrate Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) options into Payoneer's Payments Platform, making BNPL widely available to its global network of merchants. This collaboration allows B2B payment gateways and service providers to quickly offer various BNPL solutions, enhancing payment acceptance and customer choice across more than 59 markets. Optty's platform streamlines this integration, saving thousands of hours for providers like Payoneer, allowing retailers to easily activate BNPL options and accelerate sales.

title: Here are this year’s Fortune 500 companies by region
summary: The 2022 Fortune 500 companies collectively generated $16.1 trillion in revenue, reflecting a 19% increase from 2020. This article breaks down the geographical distribution of these companies across the U.S. and highlights dominant industries in the Western, Midwest, Northeast, and Southern regions. Insights into key companies and financial performances specific to each region are also provided.

title: Prothena Corporation, PLC Confirms Recent Data Breach Following Compromised Employee Email Account
summary: Prothena Corporation, PLC confirmed a data breach occurred when an unauthorized party accessed an employee's email account between December 20, 2021, and April 22, 2022. The breach resulted in the compromise of sensitive consumer information, including names, addresses, and Social Security or tax identification numbers. Prothena Corp. filed official notice and sent data breach letters to affected individuals on June 2, 2022, advising them on identity theft protection.

title: LiveRamp Joins Salesforce AppExchange, the World’s Most Trusted Enterprise Cloud Marketplace, to Transform Personalized Experiences at Scale for Consumer Brands
summary: LiveRamp has announced its integration with Salesforce AppExchange, aiming to enhance the Salesforce Marketing Cloud Customer Data Platform (CDP) ecosystem. This collaboration will enable consumer brands to leverage LiveRamp's RampID technology for improved customer understanding, personalized engagement, and privacy-compliant data activation. The partnership seeks to accelerate digital transformation by providing a robust, data-first approach for marketing campaigns.

title: Neustar, a TransUnion company, Joins Salesforce AppExchange, the World’s Most Trusted Enterprise Cloud Marketplace, to Transform Personalized Experiences at Scale for Consumer Brands
summary: Neustar, a TransUnion company, has joined the Salesforce AppExchange to enhance personalized experiences for consumer brands. Their "Unified Identity for Salesforce CDP" app will help marketers cleanse, enrich, and unify customer data, leading to more targeted advertising, reduced duplicate records, and increased audience reach. This partnership aims to accelerate digital transformation journeys and improve marketing campaign efficiency.

title: A Full Return to the Office? Does ‘Never’ Work for You?
summary: This article discusses the ongoing struggle between employers pushing for a return to office and employees who prefer remote work. It highlights that many companies are finding it difficult to enforce full-time office work, with some executives adapting to "remote-first" models or adopting hybrid approaches, while others, like C3 AI's CEO Tom Siebel, strongly advocate for employees to be in the office, citing competitive advantages and improved collaboration. The piece also notes a decrease in executive optimism regarding full in-office returns compared to early 2021.

title: Dow dives 800 points, S&P 500 posts worst week since January after inflation hits 40-year high
summary: U.S. stocks fell sharply on Friday, with the Dow dropping 880 points and the S&P 500 completing its worst week since January, following a higher-than-expected inflation report for May. The consumer price index reached its highest level since 1981, showing an 8.6% year-over-year increase, fueling concerns about a potential recession and prompting fears of a more aggressive Federal Reserve. Tech stocks, banks, and cyclical stocks were particularly impacted as the 2-year Treasury yield surged above 3%.

title: ServiceNow CEO Bill McDermott: This Downturn Is “Not a Crisis”
summary: ServiceNow CEO Bill McDermott, an SAP SE veteran, believes the current economic downturn is "not a crisis" compared to the 2008 recession. He sees it as a "crisis of opportunity" for companies to invest in digital transformation, which he considers essential for fighting inflation and keeping employees and customers happy. McDermott's own net worth is estimated at $89.4 million, accumulated through decades in the tech industry, including roles at Xerox and SAP SE before leading ServiceNow.

title: 7 Founder-Led Stocks to Buy and Hold Forever
summary: This article highlights seven founder-led stocks, including Tesla, Nvidia, Salesforce, Blackstone, Steel Dynamics, Block, and Apollo Global Management, that are considered strong long-term buys due to their history of outperformance. The author emphasizes the sustained engagement of founders in their companies and provides a brief overview of each company's financial health, leadership, and recent performance. The piece suggests that founder-led companies tend to outperform those without a founder in the CEO role.

title: MBK Partners in talks to buy Kakao Mobility
summary: MBK Partners is in negotiations to acquire Kakao Mobility, the largest mobility platform in South Korea, from its parent company Kakao. The deal, potentially valued around 8.5 trillion won ($6.6 billion), could also involve purchasing shares from existing financial investors TPG Inc. and The Carlyle Group. The acquisition comes after Kakao Mobility postponed its IPO due to market conditions, and MBK Partners sees significant potential for corporate value growth through M&A and business expansion, despite challenges like market dominance concerns and the complex negotiations involving multiple shareholders.

title: UPS names AT&T executive to lead digital transformation
summary: UPS has appointed Bala Subramanian, formerly chief digital officer at AT&T, as its new executive vice president and chief digital and technology officer, effective July 18. In this newly created role, Subramanian will oversee UPS's technology, industrial engineering, and digital transformation initiatives, reporting directly to CEO Carol Tomé. He will focus on enhancing digital connections with customers and across the organization, succeeding some of the responsibilities previously held by Juan Perez.

title: Salesforce Sales Cloud Unlimited Edition adds AI, automation
summary: Salesforce has integrated eight AI and automation tools into its Sales Cloud Unlimited Edition, maintaining the current pricing of $300 per user per month. This move aims to streamline operations and enhance sales productivity by automating manual tasks. Additionally, Salesforce plans to incorporate sales-oriented Slack features through its acquisition of Troops.ai, and Box Inc. has deepened its integration with Salesforce to include e-signature functionality and support for Salesforce Flow.

title: ‘A business imperative’: How Salesforce developed its employee-centric hybrid model
summary: Salesforce developed its "Success from Anywhere" hybrid work model in 2021 based on extensive employee surveys, revealing that only 3% desired full office work while most preferred remote or mixed arrangements. This employee-centric approach, which empowers teams to decide how they work, has led to Salesforce being recognized as a top workplace globally. The company also implemented a "digital HQ" and "Async Weeks" to improve collaboration and reduce stress, while still encouraging in-person gatherings like those at its new Trailblazer Ranch.

title: Victoria’s Secret brand Happy Nation launches first metaverse experience
summary: Victoria's Secret's new brand, Happy Nation, has launched its first metaverse experience on Roblox, featuring three obstacle courses. For every player who completes these courses by July 31st, Happy Nation will donate one pair of underwear, up to 10,500, to Undies for Everyone. This initiative aims to engage Gen Alpha in a digital space while promoting inclusivity and philanthropy.

title: Fujitsu and Salesforce Japan start collaboration on healthcare solutions for the Japan market
summary: Fujitsu and Salesforce Japan have announced a collaboration to develop new digital solutions for the healthcare sector in Japan. Their initial focus will be on creating digital solutions for insurance companies, aiming to optimize risk assessment for diseases using AI and medical data to support personalized insurance products. The companies plan to commercialize these solutions by fiscal year 2023, addressing issues like increasing treatment costs and extending life expectancy.

title: Exela Technologies Inc. stock underperforms Tuesday when compared to competitors
summary: Exela Technologies Inc. (XELA) shares fell 3.61% on Tuesday, closing at $0.14, despite a positive trading day for the broader market. The stock underperformed compared to competitors like AudioEye Inc. (AEYE), Conduent Inc. (CNDT), and Salesforce Inc. (CRM), which all saw gains. This marked the second consecutive day of losses for Exela Technologies.

title: Microsoft Viva Sales takes on Salesforce-Slack tandem
summary: Microsoft is set to launch Viva Sales, an AI-powered automation tool designed to integrate sales data from Microsoft 365 and Teams directly into CRM systems, challenging Salesforce's offerings. Viva Sales aims to streamline sales processes by reducing manual data entry and app-switching, particularly for remote workers. This move intensifies the rivalry between Microsoft and Salesforce, with both companies focusing on enhancing employee experience through AI and automation in sales.

title: PGY Stock Price, Forecast & Analysis | PAGAYA TECHNOLOGIES LTD -A (NASDAQ:PGY)
summary: This article provides a detailed analysis of Pagaya Technologies Ltd. (NASDAQ: PGY) stock, covering its price performance, technical and fundamental analysis, analyst ratings, and financial highlights. As of February 20, 2026, the stock price is $11.89, and analysts project a significant price increase of 244% in the next year. The company, which specializes in AI and data networks for the financial industry, has an average fundamental rating but shows concerns regarding profitability.

title: Narvar Awarded "Best in Fulfillment" By Salesforce Commerce Cloud
summary: Narvar has been named a Salesforce Commerce Cloud Partner of the Year for Fulfillment, recognizing its outstanding contribution to digital transformation in commerce. The award highlights Narvar's ability to help retail brands reduce operational costs, enhance the fulfillment process, and build customer loyalty through its post-purchase platform, which includes branded tracking, proactive messaging, and returns management. This recognition validates the impact of their combined offering with Commerce Cloud in the retail industry.

title: Amplience Named Winner of Salesforce Commerce Cloud Partner Awards
summary: Amplience, a leading commerce experience platform, has been recognized as a Salesforce Commerce Cloud Partner of the Year for Best Headless Implementation in 2022. This award acknowledges Amplience's decade-long partnership with Salesforce and its investment in headless technologies, enabling B2C Commerce Cloud customers to transition to PWA Kit and a composable commerce future. The integration allows marketing and technical teams to create rich, content-led experiences directly within Amplience, leveraging the performance of PWA Kit and the reliability of B2C Commerce Cloud.

title: Why treasury automation is a must
summary: The COVID-19 pandemic significantly accelerated the urgency of treasury automation for corporate treasurers. Companies had to quickly adopt digital processes to ensure resilience and maintain cash visibility amidst lockdowns and supply chain disruptions. The article highlights that automation is an ongoing task, with banks and fintechs collaborating to provide accessible and cost-effective solutions for tasks like cash flow forecasting, receivables reconciliation, and liquidity management, which were previously out of reach for many businesses.

title: Salesforce-Backed Front Valued at $1.7 Billion in Funding Round
summary: Customer communication software maker FrontApp Inc. has achieved a valuation of $1.7 billion following a $65 million financing round led by Salesforce Ventures and Battery Ventures. This funding round significantly increases its valuation from $859 million in 2020. FrontApp, based in San Francisco, serves approximately 8,000 customers globally, including major companies like Shopify Inc., Airbnb Inc., and Lyft Inc.

title: Worldwide Public Cloud Services Revenues Grew 29.0% to $408.6 Billion in 2021, According to IDC
summary: The worldwide public cloud services market saw significant growth in 2021, reaching $408.6 billion—a 29.0% increase year over year, as reported by IDC. The top five providers (Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Salesforce Inc., Google, and SAP) captured nearly 40% of the market share, with Microsoft holding the leading position at 14.4%. This growth highlights the increasing reliance of organizations on cloud services for digital transformation, innovation, and navigating economic disruptions.

title: How B2B Software Buyers Use Reviews to Make a Purchase Decision
summary: B2B software buyers heavily rely on online reviews throughout their purchasing journey. Reviews influence 66% of software buyers, with 85% trusting them as much as personal recommendations and 71% focusing on recent reviews. The article also highlights the importance of localized reviews and categorizes B2B buyers into explorers, comparison shoppers, and loyalists, each using reviews differently to inform their decisions.

title: Will Salesforce Be a Trillion-Dollar Stock By 2030?
summary: This article analyzes whether Salesforce (CRM) can achieve a $1 trillion market capitalization by 2030, considering its market position, acquisition strategy, and growth projections.
