While it's a remote possibility, sustained strong revenue growth and free cash flow generation are identified as crucial factors for reaching this ambitious goal. The author concludes that regardless of the trillion-dollar milestone, Salesforce remains a strong growth story for investors.

title: 5 Interesting Learnings from Workday at $6 Billion in ARR
summary: This article examines Workday's financial and operational performance as it reaches $6 billion in Annual Recurring Revenue (ARR). Key takeaways include high customer ACV, strong Gross Revenue Retention (GRR), impressive free cash flow generation, a break-even approach to professional services, and efficient revenue per employee. The article also touches on Workday's subscription backlog, European expansion, revenue concentration in the U.S., and continued growth projections despite economic shifts.

title: RE/MAX begins major push for new brokerages, layoffs to come with third-party tech adoption
summary: RE/MAX Holdings Inc. is implementing a multi-faceted strategic plan to boost growth, including attracting new brokerages with financial incentives, expanding its agent-teams model, and investing in its Motto Mortgage and wemlo lines. A significant part of this strategy involves adopting Inside Real Estate’s kvCORE technology platform, which will replace existing in-house systems and lead to approximately 120 layoffs in the company's tech department. The goal is to increase profitable growth and streamline operations by focusing on core strengths and leveraging new technology.

title: Gurus foresee 'virtual humans' enhancing many industries
summary: Experts predict that virtual humans, fueled by AI advancements, will revolutionize various industries such as retail, finance, and education. Production costs and development times for digital avatars are expected to decrease significantly, leading to widespread adoption. Companies like Baidu are already investing heavily in this technology, with the market in China projected to reach 10.24 billion yuan ($1.5 billion) by 2026.

title: Salesforce harnesses Dell PowerMax for mission-critical storage
summary: Salesforce Inc. leverages Dell Technologies Inc.'s PowerMax for its mission-critical storage needs, prioritizing comprehensive cyber resiliency, multicloud flexibility, and adaptable software architectures. Dell PowerMax offers advanced security features and superior performance compared to software-defined storage for large-scale applications, as highlighted by discussions at Dell Technologies World. This partnership emphasizes trust and a customer-first mentality from both companies, with Salesforce being the largest PowerMax customer globally.

title: OSF Digital Acquires Salesforce Marketing Cloud Integrator Aarin
summary: OSF Digital has acquired Aarin Inc., a U.S.-based full-stack Salesforce Marketing Cloud systems integrator, to strengthen its Salesforce Marketing Cloud expertise and expand its North America presence. This acquisition is part of OSF Digital's ongoing acquisitive growth strategy, supported by Salesforce Ventures. The deal aims to enhance OSF Digital's position as a global Salesforce multi-cloud solution provider.

title: Alnylam Reaches a Broader HCP Audience Using Integrated Customer Data
summary: Alnylam Pharmaceuticals has successfully utilized an integrated customer data strategy, primarily leveraging Veeva OpenData and Veeva CRM, to enhance its targeting and engagement with healthcare professionals (HCPs). This approach allows them to efficiently identify relevant doctors, especially in niche rare disease markets, and simplifies data management through seamless integration and proactive updates. The system also facilitates efficient market analysis and secure data sharing with partners, significantly improving productivity and market access for their therapies.

title: AiThority Interview with Julie Lock, Senior Manager, UK&I Marketing at HubSpot
summary: Julie Lock, Senior Manager, UK&I Marketing at HubSpot, discusses her role, HubSpot's customer-centric approach, and the evolution of CRMs. She highlights how HubSpot's platform differs from competitors and addresses key challenges CRMs solve for different departments. Lock also shares insights on the integration of AI with CRMs, the relationship between CRMs and CDPs, and market differences between the UK and North America, all while emphasizing the importance of solving for the customer in a strong economic climate.

title: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce – Digital Transformation Strategies
summary: This report details Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce's (CIBC) digital transformation strategies, focusing on its use of AI, cloud, blockchain, and online payments. It covers CIBC's ICT spending, technology focus areas, partnerships, investments, and initiatives to enhance its digital banking capabilities. The article also provides insights into key ICT spending categories and technology themes for the company.

title: Top Software Trends for Financial Advisors
summary: This article analyzes the key findings of the T3/Inside Information Technology Survey, providing insights into the software used by financial advisors and emerging technology trends. It highlights the widespread adoption of CRM and financial planning software, while also pointing out surprising gaps in the use of portfolio management, account aggregation, and cybersecurity tools. The author emphasizes the importance for advisors to leverage technology to provide comprehensive services and remain competitive.

title: NetApp CloudOps boss jumps ship to Palantir
summary: Anthony Lye, NetApp's cloud business general manager, has resigned to become the Global Head of Palantir's Apollo business unit. Lye was instrumental in growing NetApp's cloud business from less than $1 million to over $500 million ARR and building its CloudOps category. At Palantir, he will focus on a new consumption-based motion for its Foundry software.

title: Enter Microsoft Viva Engage. A Real Social Network For The Enterprise?
summary: Microsoft has launched Viva Engage, a new application within Microsoft Viva, which is described as an "Instagram for the enterprise." This platform aims to provide a dedicated space for personal connections, employee belonging, and social interactions at work, separate from work-oriented collaboration tools like Slack or Microsoft Teams. The author argues that such platforms, which allow employees to share personal interests and engage in non-work-related discussions, can significantly benefit companies by fostering a stronger sense of belonging and making work more engaging.

title: Compare top email marketing services
summary: This article reviews 14 top email marketing services, including Adobe Campaign, Mailchimp, Constant Contact, and HubSpot, detailing their key features and ideal use cases. It aims to help businesses of all sizes choose the most suitable platform based on their specific needs, subscriber list size, and marketing strategy. The article also provides guidance on important factors to consider when selecting an email marketing service.

title: Balance raises $56M for B2B payments
summary: Balance, a B2B e-commerce payments provider, announced it raised $56 million in new funding, bringing its total to $87 million since February 2021. The company plans to use the capital to expand internationally and help B2B sellers increase online sales. This funding round occurs as B2B e-commerce sales are predicted to grow significantly, with Balance positioning itself to digitize B2B payments in this expanding market.

title: Gartner Magic Quadrant for Personalization Engines 2022
summary: This article examines the 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Personalization Engines, categorizing vendors into Leaders, Challengers, Visionaries, and Niche Players. It details Gartner's definition of personalization engines and highlights the strengths and cautions of 13 prominent providers like Dynamic Yield, Insider, Salesforce, Adobe, and SAP. The report aims to help businesses understand the market and choose suitable personalization solutions.

title: The need for customer centric government just got real. Thankfully, the support is already here.
summary: Pegasystems has been assisting leading brands for nearly four decades in solving significant challenges and transforming for the future. The company is now applying its industry-leading AI-powered decision and workflow automation capabilities to the public sector in over 20 countries, including Australia, to enhance digital customer service. Through case studies like the UK Royal Navy, US Department of Agriculture, Services Australia, and the NSW ePlanning Portal, the article highlights Pega's success in streamlining processes, improving citizen engagement, and driving efficiency and cost savings in government services.

title: Diabsolut Acquires Emelar Consulting Group, a Full-Service Salesforce Consulting Firm With Expertise That Includes Manufacturing and Revenue Management
summary: Diabsolut has acquired Emelar Consulting Group, a Salesforce consulting partner specializing in CPQ and Salesforce Field Service. This acquisition aims to enhance Diabsolut's expertise in Field Service and Revenue Cloud, particularly expanding capabilities for manufacturing organizations and adding senior technical resources in key areas. The move reinforces both companies' commitment to client empowerment and community outreach.

title: How Capital One improves visibility into Snowflake costs
summary: Capital One has launched Capital One Software, a new business selling its internal cloud cost management and governance tools, with its first product, Slingshot, targeting the Snowflake platform. This move allows Capital One to monetize its extensive cloud migration work and helps other enterprises manage Snowflake costs and automate governance, while also showcasing Snowflake's capabilities for highly regulated industries. Slingshot has already helped Capital One reduce Snowflake costs by 27%, improve cost per query by 45%, and save over 50,000 hours of work.

title: Lotte Mart Chooses Rimini Street Support Services for its Oracle Applications
summary: Lotte Mart, a South Korean hypermarket chain, has switched to Rimini Street for Oracle application maintenance support services, citing a need for higher quality service and faster response times. This move allows Lotte Mart to focus its IT resources and savings on strategic business growth initiatives and digital transformation, enhancing efficiency and regaining control over its IT roadmap. Rimini Street's tailored support and quick response times have significantly improved IT satisfaction and operational efficiency for Lotte Mart.

title: Deloitte Canada acquires digital transformation consultancy, Nubik Inc., to fortify its mid-market Salesforce capabilities
summary: Deloitte Canada has acquired Nubik Inc., a Montreal-based digital transformation consultancy specializing in Salesforce, FinancialForce, and Rootstock Cloud ERP. This acquisition aims to strengthen Deloitte's Salesforce practice, enhance its offerings for mid-market clients, and expand its expertise in manufacturing, distribution, high technology, and professional services. The entire Nubik team, including key leadership, will join Deloitte's Consulting practice across North America.

title: Salesforce Shuts Hong Kong Office Amid Brewing US - China Tensions; Consolidates Partnership With Alibaba
summary: Salesforce is closing its Hong Kong office and consolidating its strategic partnership with Alibaba Group Holding Limited to expand its software relationship management presence in Greater China. This move comes amid increasing US-China tensions and new Chinese data regulations, following other tech giants scaling back their presence. Salesforce will focus on hiring in Guangzhou, with Alibaba handling sales in mainland China and Hong Kong, and Singapore managing Taiwan.

title: Gartner CFO Survey Reveals Real Estate and Finance Functions Most Likely to Face Cuts Within a Year
summary: A July 2022 Gartner survey of over 200 CFOs indicates that real estate/facilities management and finance functions are most vulnerable to budget cuts in the next year due to factors like increased remote work. Conversely, IT and sales functions are expected to see spending increases, with 40% of CFOs planning to boost IT investment, reflecting a focus on digital technology and automation to combat inflation and drive growth. The report suggests that "efficient growth" companies, which strategically invest during economic difficulties, achieve better long-term results.

title: Third-party SAP support offers migration flexibility
summary: This article discusses how third-party SAP support providers offer greater flexibility and lower costs for customers facing SAP's 2027 deadline to end mainstream maintenance for existing ERP products. Companies like Rimini Street and Spinnaker Support allow customers to control their migration timeline to S/4HANA or modernize their systems with other applications. While offering benefits like cost savings and extended flexibility, switching to third-party support requires careful consideration of its impact on future SAP relationships and license compliance.

title: BlackLine CEO Marc Huffman Named a Judge for 2022 Forbes Cloud 100
summary: BlackLine CEO Marc Huffman has been named a judge for the 2022 Forbes Cloud 100 list, a prestigious ranking of top private cloud companies. BlackLine itself was recognized in the inaugural Cloud 100 in 2016 before going public. Huffman, a seasoned SaaS executive, brings over 25 years of experience to the judging panel, which includes CEOs from other market leaders like Hubspot, Twilio, and Zoom.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock falls Tuesday, underperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) shares fell 3.96% on Tuesday, closing at $182.24, underperforming the broader market as the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also declined. This marked the third consecutive day of losses for the stock, placing it significantly below its 52-week high. Salesforce also lagged behind some competitors, with Microsoft Corp. rising while Adobe Inc. and SAP SE ADR experienced smaller declines.

title: Salesforce adds headless commerce capabilities
summary: Salesforce has launched new headless commerce tools, including a progressive web app (PWA) toolkit called Salesforce Composable Storefront, to give large retailers and web-only sellers more control over their digital storefront designs. These tools allow businesses to create unique user interfaces separate from the underlying commerce platform. This strategy enables greater customization and reduces the reliance on common design templates, aiming to lower development time and cost for customers by offering more flexible design options and integrating with various independent software vendors.

title: Megazone Cloud receives $343 mn from MBK, IMM PE in Series C funding
summary: Megazone Cloud, South Korea’s largest managed cloud service provider, has closed its Series C funding round with 450 billion won ($343 million) from MBK Partners and IMM Private Equity. This investment, combined with an earlier one from KT Corp., brings the company's valuation to 2.4 trillion won, making it a unicorn. Megazone Cloud is also preparing for an IPO by the end of 2023.

title: How Microsoft secures its spot among the world's most valuable brands
summary: Microsoft has become one of the world's most valuable brands, with its brand value reaching $661 billion in 2022, securing the number four spot in Kantar BrandZ Most Valuable Global Brands. The company's success is attributed to its meaningful, different, and salient offerings, including superior cloud, software, and hardware products, as well as its commitment to sustainability. Under CEO Satya Nadella, Microsoft has focused on specific market segments, leading to a tenfold increase in brand value and solidifying its position as the world's most valuable business services brand, further boosted by the continued digital transformation and remote work trends.

title: Why 2023 is the year of passwordless authentication
summary: The article argues that 2023 should be the year of passwordless authentication due to increasing password vulnerabilities and user friction with traditional methods. It highlights the benefits of FIDO-based passwordless authentication, which uses public-key cryptography and biometrics/PINs, making it more secure and convenient than passwords or MFA. Despite being standardized since 2019, IAM vendors and startups are now widely implementing these solutions, with surveys showing significant positive impacts on risk reduction, user experience, and IT efficiency.

title: Value For Customers: A 60-Second Look At The Top 11 Driver Categories
summary: This article emphasizes that organizations cannot "deliver" value to customers but rather help them realize it. It introduces four dimensions of customer value—economic, functional, experiential, and symbolic— and explains how qualitative research identified 40 value drivers across 11 categories within these dimensions. The author provides a link to a video and a full report for more details on these value drivers.

title: Transforming Behavioral Health With the Help of a CRM Platform
summary: RethinkFirst, a behavioral health technology company, leverages Salesforce's CRM platform to manage and optimize its business operations, supporting significant growth and improving client outcomes. The company utilizes various Salesforce tools, including CPQ, Heroku, Marketing Cloud Account Engagement, and Shield, to streamline processes, enhance customer experience, and integrate behavioral health data across different settings. This strategic use of Salesforce has enabled RethinkFirst to achieve double-digit percentage growth year over year and expand its impact in the behavioral health sector.

title: McDonald's Announces Key Changes to Board of Directors
summary: McDonald's Corporation announced changes to its Board of Directors, with Sheila A. Penrose retiring after 15 years of service. Three new members, Tony Capuano (Marriott International), Jennifer Taubert (Johnson & Johnson), and Amy Weaver (Salesforce), have been elected to the Board. These changes aim to bring diverse and experienced leadership to guide the company's continued growth, particularly in areas like sustainability, global business, and digital customer engagement.

title: Veruna, Inc. Announces Launch of New Website
summary: Veruna, a leading insuretech provider specializing in solutions for independent insurance agents, has launched a redesigned and enhanced company website. The new site aims to better reflect Veruna's position as an innovative technology partner and features interactive tools, a self-assessment for AMS, and a dynamic resource library. The company's goal is to empower independent insurance agents and drive transformative change in the industry through advanced SaaS agency management systems built on Salesforce.

title: What’s Changed: 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Multichannel Marketing Hubs
summary: This article analyzes the 2022 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Multichannel Marketing Hubs, detailing the evolving market criteria and the strengths of 17 significant providers. It categorizes vendors into Leaders, Challengers, Niche Players, and Visionaries, highlighting Adobe, Salesforce, and Oracle among others. The report also notes changes like SAP Marketing Cloud being replaced by SAP Emarsys and the addition of MoEngage.

title: Forecourt Technology to Take Your C-store to New Heights
summary: This article discusses how convenience store (c-store) operators can leverage forecourt technology to meet evolving consumer expectations, particularly in light of digital shifts and fluctuating fuel prices. It emphasizes that investing in advanced, digital fuel dispensers can enhance customer experience, drive loyalty, and increase in-store sales by offering personalized promotions, contactless payments, and entertainment options. The piece highlights that while technology investment is crucial, retailers must understand their market and anticipate future challenges to ensure a strong return on investment.

title: Customers get "more measured" and Salesforce follows suit as company veteran Brian Millham steps up as COO
summary: Salesforce veteran Brian Millham has been appointed as the new COO, coinciding with the company issuing lower guidance due to customers becoming more "measured" in their buying decisions amidst the current economic climate. Despite strong Q2 numbers, Salesforce acknowledged longer deal cycles and increased scrutiny on purchases. The company also announced a $10 billion share repurchase program, signaling self-confidence.

title: 7 Top-Rated Zendesk Training Courses and Videos for Beginners
summary: This article compiles a list of top-rated Zendesk training courses and videos for beginners, sourced from platforms like Udemy and YouTube. These resources are designed to help new users become familiar with Zendesk's functionalities, covering aspects suitable for administrators and customer service agents alike. The courses and videos delve into configuring the platform, managing tickets, utilizing analytics, and understanding various tools within the Zendesk ecosystem.

title: Salesforce Leapfrogs SAP as World’s Largest Enterprise-Apps Vendor
summary: Salesforce has surpassed SAP as the world's largest enterprise applications vendor, fueled by its strong cloud revenue growth. This milestone highlights the transformative power of the cloud market, though SAP also demonstrated impressive cloud growth, underscoring the fierce competition in the "Cloud Wars." Marc Benioff of Salesforce acknowledged SAP's long-standing excellence while celebrating his company's achievement.

title: Pix-Based Fintech Pagaleve is Salesforce Ventures’ First Investment in Brazil
summary: Brazilian fintech Pagaleve, which offers a Pix-based buy-now-pay-later (BNPL) service, has raised $25 million in a Series A funding round led by Salesforce Ventures. This marks Salesforce Ventures' first investment in Brazil. Pagaleve's founders, Henrique Weaver and Michael Greer, aim to provide an "intelligent installment" payment method without credit cards or interest, targeting consumers without credit cards, those with no available limits, and Gen Z.

title: Is a Discord community right for your brand?
summary: This article explores whether brands should invest in a Discord community, highlighting its role as a platform for deepening relationships with existing fans rather than for organic growth. It details how to set up and nurture a Discord server, emphasizing the importance of providing unique experiences and fostering connections among community members. The author concludes that while Discord may not be for rapid audience growth, it is ideal for building a long-term, engaged community that can advocate for a brand.

title: Artificial Intelligence at U.S. Bank – Two Current Use Cases
summary: This article explores two current use cases of Artificial Intelligence at U.S. Bank: automated savings and investments through its 'Pay Yourself First' application, and increasing lead conversion for small business customers using Salesforce Einstein. U.S. Bank leverages predictive analytics and machine learning to achieve these business goals, partnering with companies like Personetics and Salesforce. The article details how these AI solutions work and highlights reported business outcomes.

title: Focus Cloud Acquires Microsoft, ServiceNow Cloud Talent Provider Cognitive Group -
summary: IT recruiting firm Focus Cloud has acquired Microsoft specialist Cognitive Group to form the new Focus Cloud Group. This expands Focus Cloud's recruitment expertise across major cloud platforms including Microsoft, Workday, SAP, Salesforce, and ServiceNow, as well as the life sciences and cybersecurity industries. The acquisition aims to build a global cloud recruitment powerhouse and grow internationally while benefiting shareholders and staff.

title: Northern Trust Corporation Reports Data Breach Affecting Clients’ Financial Account Numbers
summary: Northern Trust Corporation announced a data breach on August 30, 2022, which compromised the financial account numbers of certain individuals. The company sent out data breach letters to affected parties, particularly in Massachusetts where an estimated 129 people were impacted. While names and account numbers were leaked, Social Security numbers were reportedly not compromised, and Northern Trust is offering free credit monitoring to victims.

title: Formula 1 uses Salesforce to improve fan experience and sustainability
summary: Formula 1 is leveraging Salesforce to significantly enhance its fan experience and advance its sustainability goals, aiming for carbon neutrality by 2030. This collaboration focuses on using data from various F1 platforms to create personalized content for fans and employing Salesforce Net Zero Cloud to track and reduce the sport's environmental impact. The initiative seeks to deepen fan engagement, increase commercial opportunities, and improve Formula 1's public image regarding sustainability.

title: Aloware Unveils New Talk 2.0 Product
summary: Aloware Inc. has announced the release of its new product, Aloware Talk, an all-in-one cloud-based contact center solution designed to supercharge sales and support operations. This platform offers unlimited calling, texting, and automation tools with deep CRM integrations. To celebrate its launch, Aloware will be sponsoring and attending HubSpot's INBOUND and SaaStr Annual 2022, offering free trials.

title: Responsible Use of Technology: The Salesforce Case Study
summary: This case study, published by the World Economic Forum, examines how Salesforce operationalized technology ethics, emphasizing their journey from a company focused on ethics to one that adapted to changing technology and society. It details the process of transformation and institutionalization of ethics through their Office of Ethical and Humane Use of Technology. The report aims to share experiences of major technology companies to help other organizations implement similar ethical practices.

title: Buy stocks with wide moats to protect your profits
summary: The article discusses Warren Buffett's "economic moat" concept, highlighting companies with sustainable competitive advantages. It outlines five key characteristics of such companies—intangible assets, cost advantage, switching costs, network effects, and efficient scale—and provides examples like Coca-Cola, Salesforce, and Alphabet. The piece concludes with advice on how investors can identify and invest in these wide-moat companies, including building a personal portfolio or using ETFs and investment trusts.

title: 6 Key HR Strategies in a Recession
summary: This article outlines six key HR strategies for businesses navigating a recession, drawing comparisons with the 2007-2009 Great Recession and current economic conditions. It emphasizes the importance of communication, tailored benefits, employee retention, flexible work arrangements, technology adoption, and a long-term vision to manage costs and maintain productivity amidst labor shortages and economic uncertainty.

title: Salesforce Selects Workday Financial Management to Support Continued Growth
summary: Salesforce has expanded its partnership with Workday, adopting Workday Financial Management, Workday Accounting Center, Workday Adaptive Planning, and Workday Prism Analytics to complement its existing use of Workday Human Capital Management (HCM). This move aims to unify finance, HR, and operational data within Workday's Enterprise Management Cloud, providing Salesforce with enhanced insights, agility, and streamlined processes to support its continued global growth and workforce management needs. The decision underscores both companies' commitment to leveraging cloud technology for digital transformation.

title: News | Tech Companies Still Need Offices. But Here's How Their Look and Location Are Changing.
summary: Tech companies are rethinking their office real estate strategies, moving away from large, centralized headquarters to more flexible, dispersed models. Influenced by the pandemic shift to remote and hybrid work, companies like Salesforce and Google are opting for smaller, more purposeful spaces, often with enhanced amenities, or expanding to satellite offices in various cities. This change reflects a balancing act between cost-saving, attracting talent, and recognizing the value of in-person collaboration, while also acknowledging a broader geographic distribution of the tech workforce.

title: Otonomo Joins Salesforce in Dreamforce Panel Session on Powering New Revenue Streams Through Connected Vehicle Data
summary: Otonomo Technologies Ltd. announced that its Chief Revenue Officer, Anders Truelsen, will participate in a panel session at Dreamforce 2022 alongside Salesforce and Upstream Security executives. The discussion will focus on leveraging connected vehicle data to generate new revenue streams in the automotive industry. Otonomo also highlighted its AppExchange solutions that enable access to mobility data for fleet management within Salesforce Sales Cloud and Service Cloud.

title: U-Haul International, Inc. Files Notice of Data Breach After Two Passwords Were Compromised
summary: U-Haul International, Inc. reported a data breach on September 9, 2022, after two passwords were compromised, granting an unauthorized party access to the company's contract search tool. This breach exposed the names and driver's license or state identification numbers of certain individuals, impacting at least 5,568 people in Montana alone. The company has begun notifying affected individuals and is investigating how the passwords were obtained, with phishing attacks being a common method for such incidents.

title: What’s New in Artificial Intelligence from the 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle™
summary: The 2022 Gartner Hype Cycle for Artificial Intelligence highlights key AI innovations expected to drive significant business benefits and will see mainstream adoption within two to five years. These innovations are categorized into data-centric, model-centric, applications-centric, and human-centric AI, with a focus on impact on both business leaders and engineering teams. The article emphasizes technologies like composite AI, decision intelligence, edge AI, and responsible AI as crucial for competitive advantage and solving complex business problems.

title: 6 customer self-service best practices
summary: This article outlines six best practices for optimizing customer self-service, emphasizing its role in improving customer experience (CX) and sales. Key recommendations include continuously updating knowledge bases, identifying common customer issues suitable for self-service, and utilizing virtual assistants to guide customers. The piece also stresses the importance of offering omnichannel capabilities, embracing AI technologies for maintenance, and systematically measuring the success of self-service strategies to ensure they meet organizational goals.

title: Uber investigating 'cybersecurity incident' after report of breach
summary: Uber is investigating a cybersecurity incident following a reported network breach that led the company to shut down several internal systems. The incident reportedly involved a hacker compromising an employee's Slack account and claiming access to internal databases and security vulnerability information. This comes after a 2016 hack exposing personal information of 57 million users and drivers, and Uber's shares were down nearly 4% after the news broke.

title: Dreamforce Returns to SF in Person, With 40,000 Expected to Attend
summary: Dreamforce, Salesforce's annual conference, is returning to San Francisco in person for its 20th year, expecting 40,000 attendees. This marks the first in-person event since the pandemic, bringing an estimated $40 million to the local economy. The conference will feature notable speakers like Matthew McConaughey, Magic Johnson, Jennifer Hudson, and Bono, with a performance by the Red Hot Chili Peppers.

title: Quiet quitting energized by employee fearlessness
summary: Quiet quitting, characterized by employees doing only what is required, is being fueled by a strong job market and a lack of fear among employees regarding job loss. This trend, while a new term for an old problem ("quitting in place"), has broadened since COVID-19, leading employers to reconsider how they manage and reward their workforce. Companies are exploring "stay interviews," training managers, and adopting employee monitoring technology to address this societal shift.

title: Salesforce unveils Genie, a real-time data platform to power its apps
summary: Salesforce Inc. has unveiled Salesforce Genie, a new real-time data platform designed to power its entire suite of customer relationship management products. Genie aims to unify and personalize customer data in real-time, enabling highly personalized experiences across marketing, sales, and commerce, and addressing data fragmentation issues caused by numerous separate applications.

title: Salesforce Tops SAP as World’s Largest Enterprise Application Company
summary: Salesforce has surpassed SAP as the world's largest provider of enterprise applications, driven by its consistent revenue growth in cloud technology. In Q2 FY2023, Salesforce reported higher revenue than SAP, despite SAP's strong performance in the cloud segment. Salesforce, however, reduced its fiscal year guidance, leading to a stock drop, and announced its first-ever $10 billion stock buyback program.

title: PR News | WPP Scoops Up JeffreyGroup - Wed., Sep. 21, 2022
summary: WPP has acquired Miami-based JeffreyGroup, an agency with over 330 staffers and a significant presence in Latin America. JeffreyGroup, founded in 1993, will retain its brand within Hill+Knowlton Strategies, with its current CEO, Brian Burlingame, leading H+K's Latin American operations. This acquisition aims to strengthen WPP's regional presence and leverage JeffreyGroup's established experience in delivering tailored communications.

title: Salesforce aims for 25% operating margin in 2026 with more efficient spending
summary: Salesforce announced a new long-range goal to achieve a 25% adjusted operating margin by its 2026 fiscal year, an increase from its prior target, signaling a focus on more efficient spending. The company plans to reduce sales and marketing expenses as a percentage of revenue and manage general and administrative spending, while reaffirming its $50 billion revenue target for fiscal 2026 despite currency headwinds. This move comes as cloud software companies face increased investor scrutiny over profitability amidst rising interest rates.

title: BUILD-A-BEAR WORKSHOP LAUNCHES NEW E-COMMERCE SITE AND ENHANCES OMNI-CHANNEL CAPABILITIES
summary: Build-A-Bear Workshop has launched a new e-commerce website and enhanced its omni-channel capabilities, aligning with its strategic pillars of digital transformation and evolving the retail experience. This investment aims to provide customers with more engaging ways to interact with the brand, both online and in-store, following record-setting financial results. The redesign features improved functionality, a mobile-first approach, and integration with Salesforce Commerce Cloud and Loyalty Cloud to streamline the customer journey and foster deeper brand engagement.

title: Patagonia founder giving away company is 'inspiring and incredible,' Salesforce's Marc Benioff says
summary: Salesforce co-CEO Marc Benioff praised Patagonia founder Yvon Chouinard's decision to donate his $3 billion company to fight climate change, calling it "inspiring and incredible." Benioff highlighted Chouinard's value-driven leadership and suggested it sets a new standard for entrepreneurs. Benioff, a philanthropist himself, also discussed Salesforce's ongoing educational grants and a $60 million gift he and his wife made to UC Santa Barbara for marine research.

title: Dreamforce 2022: The 14 Coolest Exhibitors
summary: This article highlights 14 standout exhibitors from Salesforce's Dreamforce 2022 conference, including services partners and technology vendors. Companies like PagerDuty, Aisera, Provus, and Slalom showcased their innovations and partnerships within the Salesforce ecosystem. The event also featured major announcements from Salesforce, such as the new Genie feature and Slack's collaboration application updates.

title: Sprout Social and Salesforce Extend Partnership With New Service Cloud Integration
summary: Sprout Social announced an extended partnership with Salesforce, introducing a new integration with Salesforce Service Cloud. This integration aims to provide brands with a comprehensive 360-degree view of customer interactions by allowing social customer care management directly within Service Cloud and enriching CRM profiles with social data. Additionally, Sprout will integrate with Marketing Cloud Intelligence to bring social data into overall marketing dashboards, enhancing omnichannel customer experience and strategic decision-making.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock rises Wednesday, still underperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. stock rose 0.86% on Wednesday to $150.17, despite an overall positive day for the stock market where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also saw gains. However, the company's stock still underperformed several key competitors, including Microsoft, Adobe, and SAP SE. Salesforce Inc. remains significantly below its 52-week high.

title: Dr Reddy's Labs, IQVIA ink pact for CRM solution for India field force
summary: Dr. Reddy's Laboratories has partnered with IQVIA, selecting its Orchestrated Customer Engagement (OCE) platform as the core CRM solution for its entire field force in India. This multi-year agreement aims to digitally transform Dr. Reddy's sales and marketing operations, improve customer engagement, and streamline field processes. The OCE platform, powered by IQVIA Connected Intelligence, provides role-specific intelligent workflows and is built on best-in-class platforms like Salesforce.com.

title: IPG acquires Salesforce commerce specialist RafterOne
summary: Interpublic Group (IPG) has acquired RafterOne, a Salesforce solutions architect, to bolster its data business and integrated commerce offerings. RafterOne, formed recently from a merger of three Salesforce-specializing businesses, will operate as a standalone entity and partner closely with IPG's MRM agency. This acquisition aligns with IPG CEO Philippe Krakowsky's strategy to expand the company's commerce capabilities and capitalize on the booming e-commerce market.

title: MuleSoft Founder Seeks Backing for London-Based Venture Fund
summary: MuleSoft Inc. founder Ross Mason is raising a new $100 million venture capital fund to invest in early-stage software startups. This follows his successful first fund, which achieved a 50% return, after selling MuleSoft to Salesforce for approximately $6.5 billion in 2018. Mason's new fund, backed by institutional investors, will focus on B2B software companies.

title: IPG acquires Salesforce commerce specialist RafterOne
summary: Interpublic Group (IPG) has acquired Salesforce solutions architect RafterOne to enhance its data business and integrated commerce offerings, aligning with CEO Philippe Krakowsky's M&A strategy. RafterOne, formed recently from a merger of three Salesforce specialist businesses (Docmation, GearsCRM, and PixelMedia), will operate as a standalone entity under IPG, closely partnering with its digital marketing agency MRM. This acquisition is a strategic move for IPG to bolster its martech capabilities and leverage its data business Acxiom, given the significant growth in the e-commerce sector.

title: Another Salesforce specialist gets snapped up – this time by IPG
summary: Interpublic Group (IPG) has acquired RafterOne, a Salesforce specialist providing e-commerce services, for an undisclosed sum. This acquisition is part of a trend among agency holding companies to bolster their e-commerce and Salesforce expertise due to increasing marketing spend in this area. RafterOne will be aligned with IPG's commerce agency MRM to enhance Salesforce platform solutions across the network.

title: Immersive Labs Secures $66 Million in New Capital and Expands its Leadership Team to Accelerate Growth
summary: Immersive Labs has successfully raised $66 million in new capital, led by Ten Eleven Ventures with participation from existing investors, to further develop its Cyber Workforce Resilience platform. The company also strengthened its leadership team by appointing Sandra McDevitt as CHRO, Lucian Lui as CMO, and adding Dave Palmer from Ten Eleven Ventures to its Board of Directors. This investment aims to accelerate growth and enterprise adoption of Immersive Labs' cybersecurity training and assessment solutions.

title: N-able’s Cove Data Protection aims to compete with Veeam, Datto and Commvault Metallic
summary: N-able is rebranding its backup solution to Cove Data Protection, positioning it as a core offering to directly compete with major players like Veeam, Datto, Acronis, and Commvault Metallic. The multi-tenant cloud solution (SaaS) focuses on efficient file-level backups for endpoints and Microsoft 365, stored across N-able's global data centers, with an emphasis on competitive pricing for MSPs. While currently prioritizing Microsoft 365 support, N-able aims to differentiate itself through efficiency and cost-effectiveness, bringing enterprise-level technology to SMEs via MSPs.

title: GEE Group, Inc. Reports Data Breach Following Encryption Event
summary: GEE Group, Inc. filed an official notice of a data breach with the Vermont Attorney General on October 7, 2022, after an unauthorized party accessed and encrypted sensitive data. The breach compromised names, addresses, birthdates, and Social Security numbers, leading the company to send out data breach letters to affected individuals. The incident appears to be a ransomware attack, increasing the risk of identity theft for victims.

title: Qurate Retail Group Names Linda Aiello Chief People Officer
summary: Qurate Retail Group has announced the appointment of Linda Aiello as Chief People Officer, effective October 31, 2022. Aiello brings over 20 years of global human resources experience from technology, retail, and fashion brands, including Stitch Fix, Salesforce, and Uber Technologies. In her new role, she will oversee various team member-related functions to strengthen company culture and execute the company's strategic growth plan.

title: The female venture capitalist creating billions in a new world of work beyond the office
summary: Brianne Kimmel's Worklife Ventures has invested in 50 startups since 2019, with nine valued over $1 billion, focusing on the changing work/life balance and the future of remote work. Kimmel, whose venture is backed by Marc Andreessen and Zoom CEO Eric Yuan, plans to continue scaling businesses for freelancers and creators. Despite economic challenges, Worklife Ventures aims to support companies enabling productive work outside traditional office settings, a thesis Kimmel developed before the pandemic.

title: Gartner Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2023
summary: Gartner has identified the Top 10 Strategic Technology Trends for 2023, which are categorized into four key priorities: Optimize, Scale, Pioneer, and Sustainable Technology. These trends aim to help organizations enhance resilience, improve productivity, engage customers, and pursue sustainable solutions. The article details each of the ten trends and their potential impact on business strategies over the next three years.

title: Activist investor Starboard reveals stake in Salesforce, sees significant opportunity
summary: Activist investor Starboard Value has disclosed a significant stake in Salesforce (CRM), with founder Jeff Smith citing a "subpar mix of growth and profitability" as the reason for the company's current valuation discount despite its integral role in many businesses. Smith sees substantial opportunity in the enterprise software maker and intends to be a long-term investor. Shares of Salesforce jumped over 4% on the news, though they had fallen nearly 40% earlier in the year.

title: Activist investor Starboard Value buys stake in Salesforce
summary: Activist investor Starboard Value LP has acquired a "significant" stake in Salesforce Inc., causing Salesforce's share price to jump. Starboard believes Salesforce has a "subpar mix of growth and profitability" and aims to propose changes to improve its financial performance. This investment follows Starboard's recent stakes in Splunk Inc. and a previous attempt to influence Box Inc.

title: WithSecure adds Microsoft OneDrive protection to its cloud-based security platform
summary: WithSecure Corp. has expanded its cloud-based security platform, WithSecure Elements, by integrating Microsoft OneDrive for Business protection. This new feature enhances collaboration protection by continuously scanning and analyzing files uploaded or modified in OneDrive, leveraging real-time threat intelligence and isolated cloud sandboxing to detect and block malicious content. The move addresses the growing security concerns around cloud-based collaboration tools, which are becoming essential for many companies, especially with the shift to remote work.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock outperforms market on strong trading day
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) stock rallied 2.49% to $157.50 on a strong trading day, outperforming the broader market which saw the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average decline. This marked the stock's fourth consecutive day of gains, though it remained significantly below its 52-week high. Salesforce also outperformed several key competitors including Microsoft Corp. and SAP SE ADR.

title: Clean, local power wins in S.F. against PG&E monopoly | San Francisco News
summary: San Francisco's City Attorney announced a victory against PG&E, ending the company's efforts to obstruct the city's municipal power initiatives. The decision facilitates San Francisco's ability to provide affordable, public power and utilize its clean Hetch Hetchy hydropower system. PG&E's obstruction cost the city over $28 million since 2018, and this ruling helps ensure the city can expand its municipal grid, freeing up taxpayer funds.

title: DTEC Offers Diversification Across 10 Disruptive Tech Themes
summary: The ALPS Disruptive Technologies ETF (DTEC) provides diversification across ten disruptive tech themes, including healthcare innovation, Fintech, and AI, offering a balanced exposure to a sector often concentrated in mega-cap names. Despite recent gains, the fund is trading below previous highs, presenting a potential buying opportunity. This methodology aims to protect competitive advantages and address global challenges by investing in innovative technologies.

title: Zscaler Outage Analysis: October 25, 2022
summary: On October 25, 2022, Zscaler experienced an outage where traffic to a subset of its proxy endpoints suffered 100% packet loss, impacting customers using their Zscaler Internet Access (ZIA) services. The issue, stemming from a maintenance problem affecting proxy device VIPs, lasted about 30 minutes for significant packet loss, with full restoration across all user locations by approximately 15:34 UTC. The incident highlights the challenges of visibility and change management in SaaS environments, emphasizing the need for robust architectural resilience and independent visibility for quicker remediation.

title: Predictions 2023: AI Will Become An Indispensable, Trusted Enterprise Coworker
summary: In 2023, AI technology is predicted to become an indispensable and trusted enterprise coworker, transforming global markets. Key predictions include TuringBots writing 10% of worldwide code, one in four tech executives reporting to their board on AI governance, and 10% of Fortune 500 enterprises generating content with AI tools. These advancements signify AI's foundational role in successful enterprises and continued investment.

title: Media Tip Sheet: Elon Musk Acquires Twitter, Layoffs to Come
summary: Elon Musk has completed his $44 billion acquisition of Twitter, reportedly firing top executives and planning to lay off approximately 75% of the workforce. James R. Bailey, a professor of leadership development at the George Washington University School of Business, is available for expert commentary on the implications of this acquisition, focusing on leadership, organizational change, and business ethics.

title: The only way is out - why ServiceNow’s RiseUp may be the solution the industry has been waiting for
summary: The article discusses the escalating tech talent shortage, highlighting the significant need for skilled workers in the evolving digital landscape. It presents ServiceNow's RiseUp program as a crucial solution, aiming to upskill one million individuals by 2024 by offering free courses, certification paths, and networking opportunities. The program emphasizes the importance of diverse hiring and collaborative efforts to address the global talent gap.

title: Jack Henry debuts P2P payments tool
summary: Jack Henry & Associates has launched a new standalone peer-to-peer (P2P) payments service for its community and regional bank clients, building on its recent acquisition of Payrailz. This tool offers an alternative or complement to existing services like Zelle, allowing customers to make or split payments using phone numbers or email addresses, and is part of Jack Henry's broader strategy to expand technological capabilities and acquire new companies. The company aims to meet the strong and growing demand for instant payments, despite facing headwinds from a lack of bank mergers impacting its profit margins and increased scrutiny from regulators like the CFPB regarding concentration of power among core service payment providers.

title: SAP Sustainability Control Tower: Creating the Right Data Foundation for ESG Reporting and Steering
summary: The SAP Sustainability Control Tower provides a software-as-a-service solution for companies to manage and report on their environmental, social, and governance (ESG) data. It offers critical functionalities for data quality, integration with various sources including SAP S/4HANA, and support for established reporting frameworks. Upcoming features include reporting for EU taxonomy and TCFD, and a greenhouse gas (GHG) analytical application to help customers understand and manage their emissions.

title: Con una línea de factoraje de 1,600 mdp, BBVA México apoya a CEMEX a impulsar prácticas sostenibles con sus proveedores
summary: BBVA México has partnered with CEMEX to offer a 1.6 billion Mexican pesos revolving factoring line to CEMEX's sustainable suppliers. This initiative provides preferential financing conditions to suppliers evaluated as sustainable, helping them secure working capital for their operations. The collaboration aims to promote and recognize the approximately 3,000 suppliers in CEMEX's supply chain who meet ISO 26000 standards for corporate social responsibility, offering differentiated rates for those with strong environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices.

title: OSF Digital Acquires UK-Based Multi-Cloud Consulting Firm Oegen
summary: OSF Digital has acquired Oegen Ltd., a UK-based Salesforce consulting firm, marking its sixth acquisition this year. This move aims to strengthen OSF Digital's Salesforce multi-cloud expertise, particularly in Experience Cloud, and expand its team in the UK and EMEA. The acquisition will allow OSF Digital to deliver comprehensive digital transformation strategies and deepen customer relationships in the EMEA region.

title: Palo Alto Networks and Zoom Deliver Exceptional Insight into Meeting Experience
summary: Palo Alto Networks has integrated its Autonomous Digital Experience Management (ADEM) solution with Zoom's Quality of Service Subscription (QSS) to provide unprecedented insight into meeting experiences. This partnership aims to help organizations quickly identify and resolve infrastructure bottlenecks and performance issues that impact Zoom calls. By correlating comprehensive data from ADEM with real-time performance data from QSS, IT administrators gain actionable insights to improve user experience across their organizations.

title: Meta Layoffs Deepen Silicon Valley’s Jobs Losses
summary: Meta Platforms announced it is laying off 13% of its workforce, over 11,000 jobs, adding to job losses across Silicon Valley's tech sector. This decision, influenced by Mark Zuckerberg's admission of misjudging pandemic-driven growth, has been praised by investors and has boosted Meta's stock. The layoffs will also severely impact H-1B visa holders and have global repercussions, particularly for Twitter's international staff.

title: Apple hires former Facebook executive to lead its System Information team
summary: Apple has hired Timothy Campos, a former Facebook executive, to lead its information systems and technology (IS&T) department. This move follows the retirement of Mary Demby, who previously headed the company's information systems for three decades. Campos's appointment comes at a time when Apple is also slowing down hiring in most areas outside of research and development.

title: Apple hires former Facebook exec to lead its information systems and technology
summary: Apple has appointed Timothy Campos, a former Facebook executive, to head its information systems and technology (IS&T) department, replacing Mary Demby who is retiring. Campos previously worked at Facebook in a similar role and co-founded a calendar app acquired by Salesforce. This hiring occurs while Apple is experiencing other executive departures and has paused most hiring due to economic uncertainties.

title: Apple hires former Facebook exec as its new chief information officer
summary: Apple has appointed Timothy Campos, a startup founder and former Facebook executive, as its new Chief Information Officer. He will lead the Information Systems and Technology (IS&T) department, which is responsible for the infrastructure supporting Apple's online services, customer support, and website. This hire follows the retirements of Mary Demby, the current information chief, and her deputy, David Smoley.

title: M&A List: 106 Salesforce Cloud Consulting Partner Mergers and Acquisitions
summary: This article provides an extensive list of 106 mergers and acquisitions involving Salesforce cloud consulting partners, dating from September 2017 to November 2022. It highlights the active M&A landscape within the Salesforce ecosystem, driven by both partner companies and private equity/venture capital firms. The list details specific acquisitions, the involved companies, and the date of the deal.

title: Capgemini wins 2022 Salesforce Partner Innovation Award
summary: Capgemini has been honored with the 2022 Salesforce Partner Innovation Award in the 'Experience' category for its work with Pensioenfonds Detailhandel. They developed an innovative digital pension services solution that offers real-time insights and flexibility. This award highlights Capgemini's commitment to delivering transformative solutions and driving customer success leveraging Salesforce technology.

title: Salesforce Accessibility Execs Derek Featherstone, Catherine Nichols Talk Disability Inside And Out Of The Company In New Interview
summary: Salesforce accessibility executives Derek Featherstone and Catherine Nichols discuss the company's commitment to disability inclusion, both internally and externally. They highlight the collaborative efforts within the tech industry to promote accessibility, the role of Salesforce's Office of Accessibility and Abilityforce ERG, and the ethical component embedded in their product development. The executives emphasize that accessibility is a continuous journey and a core value for Salesforce, aiming to create a thriving environment for disabled employees and expanding their user base globally.

title: Gavin Patterson, Salesforce's chief strategy officer, is leaving
summary: Gavin Patterson, Salesforce's current president and chief strategy officer, is departing from the company. During his tenure as chief revenue officer, Salesforce's revenue reportedly doubled between fiscal years 2019 and 2022. This news comes amid other reports concerning Salesforce, including recent layoffs and an activist hedge fund taking a stake in the company.

title: Looka Collaborates with Leading Business Platforms to Help Grow Small Business
summary: Looka, an AI-powered design and branding platform, has partnered with leading business platforms like Microsoft, HubSpot, and Square to offer exclusive discounts and tools to small business owners. Through Looka's Brand Kit Subscription, entrepreneurs can access over $3,000 worth of exclusive offers to help streamline and automate tasks, reducing the costs and challenges of launching and scaling a business. These offerings span marketing, sales, customer success, CRM, finance, and payroll, aiming to empower small businesses for success.

title: PTC to Acquire Leading SaaS Field Service Management Provider ServiceMax
summary: PTC (NASDAQ: PTC) announced its definitive agreement to acquire ServiceMax, a leader in cloud-native field service management (FSM) software, for approximately $1.46 billion in cash. This acquisition aims to strengthen PTC's closed-loop product lifecycle management (PLM) offerings by integrating FSM capabilities and is expected to be accretive to PTC's SaaS ARR and cash flow in FY'23. The transaction is anticipated to close in early January 2023.

title: Big Deal: PTC Pays $1.46 Billion for ServiceMax
summary: PTC has acquired ServiceMax, a leading cloud-based field service management (FSM) company, for $1.46 billion. This acquisition is part of PTC's strategy to expand its closed-loop PLM offerings by integrating post-factory product monitoring and service history. The deal aims to leverage ServiceMax's FSM software, which has significant growth potential compared to the saturated CAD and PLM markets.

title: Veritone buys Vision Semantics, gets Deloitte nod for growth
summary: Veritone has acquired Vision Semantics, a video recognition company, and released Tracker, a tool that uses AI algorithms to track objects without relying on personal biometric identification. The new software addresses privacy concerns by not using facial recognition. Additionally, Veritone was recognized on Deloitte's Fast 500 list for its rapid revenue growth, underscoring its success in providing AI services and solutions.

title: Pegasystems updates CRM, RPA and low-code with Pega Infinity 8.8
summary: Pegasystems has released Pega Infinity 8.8, bringing significant updates to its CRM, RPA, and low-code solutions. Key enhancements include an AI-powered Developer Assistant Panel for Pega Platform, improved tools for Robotic Automation, and new pre-built data integrations for Pega Customer Decision Hub. The update also introduces 'call-wrapping' features in Pega Customer Service using AI transcription and enhanced integration between Customer Service and Customer Decision Hub.

title: Chris Gatt joins iMovo as new head of engineering
summary: iMovo Limited, a digitalization and consultancy firm, has appointed Chris Gatt as its new Head of Engineering. Gatt brings over 20 years of experience in technical, advisory, and project management roles across various sectors. In his new position, he will oversee the company's technology team, including the Data Science team.

title: Moat ETF | Moat Investing
summary: This article from VanEck introduces their Moat ETF suite, which invests in companies with sustainable competitive advantages identified by Morningstar's equity research. It details four specific Moat ETFs (US Wide Moat, US ESG Wide Moat, US SMID Moat, Global Wide Moat), their characteristics, and risk ratings. The article also explains the five sources of economic moats (Switching Costs, Intangible Assets, Network Effect, Cost Advantage, Efficient Scale) and the philosophy behind the strategy, emphasizing Morningstar's research methodology.

title: British CEO appointed by AI platform Boost.ai
summary: Boost.ai, a Norwegian conversational AI leader, has appointed Briton Jerry Haywood as its new CEO to drive global growth. Haywood, with 20 years of enterprise technology experience from companies like IBM, Cisco, and Salesforce, replaces founder Lars Ropeid Selsås, who will now focus on product development. The company aims to accelerate its growth and become a global category leader in conversational AI under Haywood's leadership.

title: Luddy School’s AI Development and Experience Lab Exposes Students to Real-World Experiences That Help Them Gain New Skills
summary: The Luddy School’s AI Development and Experience Lab, in collaboration with Salesforce, is providing students with real-world experience in AI application development and problem-solving. This client-based project allows students to work on practical business challenges, gaining valuable skills and perspective beyond traditional classroom settings. Students learn about client interaction, remote collaboration, and the practicalities of design thinking, enhancing their portfolios for future careers.

title: Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor leaving, stock falls after lower-than-expected forecast
summary: Salesforce's co-CEO Bret Taylor is departing the company, a move that coincided with a fourth-quarter forecast that fell short of Wall Street expectations. Despite outperforming in the third quarter, the cloud-software giant's shares declined about 7% in after-hours trading following the announcement, although they had risen 5.5% earlier in the regular session. The projected fourth-quarter sales were $900 million lower than Street estimates.

title: Opinion: Salesforce better get used to Marc Benioff in charge, because he keeps chasing off his chosen successors
summary: Salesforce co-founder Marc Benioff has seen two chosen co-CEO successors depart in less than three years, raising questions about the company's leadership transition. Despite his increasing focus on philanthropic ventures, Benioff has been unwilling to fully yield his CEO title, making it difficult to recruit future successors. This situation leaves Salesforce in a difficult position regarding its leadership path, as experienced executives like Keith Block and Bret Taylor have left.

title: Salesforce shares tumble after surprise exit of co-CEO Taylor
summary: Salesforce Inc (CRM.N) shares fell by about 10% after co-CEO Bret Taylor's unexpected departure, raising concerns about the company's co-CEO leadership model and slowing revenue growth. This exit prompted at least 17 brokerages to cut their price targets on the stock, with analysts noting it as a significant blow given Taylor's leadership role in product development. Taylor's departure comes after just one year in the co-CEO role, leaving co-founder Marc Benioff as the sole top boss.

title: Salesforce CSO Gavin Patterson to Leave in 2023 as Company Tightens Belt
summary: Salesforce President and Chief Strategy Officer Gavin Patterson is set to depart the company in January 2023, following a period of rapid growth and as Salesforce implements cost-cutting measures. Patterson, who earned approximately $14 million including stock options, is the latest executive to leave as the company faces slower vendor spending and plans employee layoffs. This move signals Salesforce's efforts to tighten its belt amid shaky economic conditions.

title: Salesforce's Bret Taylor to step down as co-CEO
summary: Bret Taylor is stepping down as co-CEO of Salesforce in January, with co-founder Marc Benioff becoming the sole CEO. The news led to a 5% drop in Salesforce's shares in extended trading, despite the company raising its annual profit forecast. Taylor stated his decision to return to his entrepreneurial roots.

title: Slack CEO Butterfield to depart next month
summary: Stewart Butterfield, CEO and co-founder of Slack, is planning to leave the workplace messaging platform in January. Lidiane Jones, senior vice-president of product management for Salesforce Commerce Cloud, will take over as CEO. This follows Salesforce's acquisition of Slack for nearly $28 billion and comes shortly after the unexpected exit of Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor, causing a slump in Salesforce's stock.

title: Slack CEO Stewart Butterfield is leaving in January
summary: Stewart Butterfield, co-founder and CEO of Slack, is set to leave Salesforce in January, less than two years after the company acquired Slack for $27.7 billion. His departure coincides with Salesforce CEO Bret Taylor's announced exit, though Butterfield states it's unrelated and planned for months. Lidiane Jones, currently Executive VP & GM of digital experiences clouds at Salesforce, will succeed him as Slack's CEO.

title: T-Mobile taps Salesforce for ‘next-generation’ CX vision
summary: T-Mobile has entered into a "transformational" deal with Salesforce to enhance its customer experience (CX) vision. While details are limited without full article access, the partnership aims to leverage Salesforce's capabilities to build a next-generation customer service platform for the wireless carrier. This collaboration suggests a strategic move by T-Mobile to significantly improve its customer interactions and operational efficiency through advanced technology.

title: Salesforce Just Lost Another CEO. Why Seemingly Nobody Wants to Work With Marc Benioff
summary: Salesforce recently lost two senior leaders, co-CEO Bret Taylor and Slack CEO Stewart Butterfield, raising questions about CEO Marc Benioff's leadership style. The article suggests that Benioff's difficulty in "getting out of the way" and allowing other leaders to grow may be contributing to the departures, despite Salesforce's success. This trend continues from past exits, such as former co-CEO Keith Block.

title: Exclusive | Tensions Grew at Salesforce Between Co-CEOs Benioff and Taylor Ahead of Leadership Change
summary: Tensions had been escalating between Salesforce co-CEOs Marc Benioff and Bret Taylor concerning their roles and business operations for months before Taylor's announced departure. Benioff reportedly grew frustrated with Taylor's allocation of time, specifically his focus on his role as Twitter Inc.'s chairman and engagements with other CEOs and customers, rather than Salesforce's product and engineering. Taylor is set to leave his position at the end of next month, leaving Benioff as the sole CEO.

title: Growing strains between Salesforce co-CEOs Benioff and Taylor in months ahead of departure announcement
summary: Tensions had been escalating between Salesforce co-CEOs Marc Benioff and Bret Taylor over their responsibilities and company management in the months leading up to Taylor's announced departure. Marc Benioff reportedly grew frustrated with Bret Taylor's allocation of time, specifically citing his role as Twitter Inc.'s chairman, and interactions with other CEOs and customers, suggesting it diverted focus from Salesforce's product and engineering efforts. This growing friction ultimately preceded the news that Taylor would be exiting his co-CEO role at the business-software provider.

title: You Need A Design System — Here’s Why
summary: The article highlights the growing importance of design systems in organizations, driven by the increasing recognition of design's business value. It explains that design systems democratize design practice, support accessibility efforts, and improve talent retention by enabling designers to focus on more challenging and innovative work rather than repetitive tasks. The author encourages companies to adopt and effectively utilize design systems.

title: Disqo names CFO
summary: Disqo, a customer experience intelligence platform, has appointed Scott Henderson as its new chief financial officer. Henderson will report to co-founder and chief executive Armen Adjemian and will oversee finance work, strategy, sales enablement, revenue operations, and business systems. He brings over 20 years of experience from Salesforce and other leadership roles at companies like Apple.

title: Scale up with hyper-personalization
summary: Hyper-personalization uses AI and machine learning to deliver tailored customer experiences at scale, leading to increased customer loyalty, revenue growth, and marketing ROI. The article outlines four key steps to implement hyper-personalization: collecting detailed customer data, organizing and synthesizing this data, creating targeted campaigns, and continuously analyzing progress. It also provides examples of how companies like Panera Bread, Signet Jewelers, U.S. Bank, EY, and NRG Energy have successfully leveraged hyper-personalization with Adobe solutions to enhance customer engagement and business outcomes.

title: Salesforce Gets Supreme Court Review of Shareholder’s Slack Suit
summary: The US Supreme Court has agreed to hear an appeal from Salesforce's Slack unit concerning a lawsuit filed by a shareholder. The case revolves around allegations that Slack's 2019 registration statement, for its direct listing, failed to adequately disclose potential financial liabilities related to customer credits for service disruptions. This ruling by the Supreme Court could significantly impact the ability of some shareholders to sue over company statements made during direct listings.

title: Tableau Software 2022.4 release adds external actions, allowing users to act on their data immediately
summary: Tableau Software has released its 2022.4 update, introducing powerful new features designed to enhance user productivity and streamline data-driven decision-making. Key additions include Tableau External Actions, enabling users to take action directly from their dashboards, and Image Role, which improves insight comprehension by integrating images into visualizations. The update also features a Usage Metrics tab for tracking workbook performance and a Custom Views REST API for personalized data experiences.

title: Now, Near, Next: How Software Startups Can Accelerate Growth in Uncertain Times
summary: In uncertain economic times, software startups can leverage the "Now, Near, Next" framework to maintain agility and accelerate growth. This framework helps businesses assess current challenges, identify near-term focus areas, and plan for future market conditions. By implementing these strategies, startups can outperform competitors and prepare for accelerated growth when economic conditions improve.

title: Casey’s Personalizes Experiences for Over 5.5 Million Loyalty Members
summary: Casey’s General Stores has significantly enhanced its customer loyalty program, personalizing experiences for over 5.5 million members through more than 1 billion marketing messages in 2022. Partnering with Salesforce, the company consolidated its technology, enabling 200 million personalized communications monthly based on purchasing history. This digital overhaul is credited with driving 30% of the retailer's revenue and improving customer connection and internal efficiencies.

title: Adobe mostly unscathed by economic downturn
summary: Adobe has shown resilience amidst an economic downturn, reporting 14% year-over-year revenue growth in Q4, reaching $4.5 billion. Its Adobe Experience platform achieved $1 billion in subscription revenue for the first time, marking a 16% annual increase. While other tech companies like Salesforce have faced layoffs and executive changes, Adobe's strong performance, attributed to its vertical supply chain and healthy balance sheet, positions it favorably despite a recent acquisition of Figma for an estimated $20 billion awaiting regulatory approval.

title: Best Large Workplaces in Technology
summary: Fortune partnered with Great Place to Work to identify the Best Workplaces in Technology for 2025 by analyzing survey feedback from over 149,000 U.S. employees. The article lists the top 40 companies in this ranking, with Cisco Systems, Nvidia, and World Wide Technology leading the list.

title: This Message From Salesforce's CEO Is Only 108 Words, but It Teaches a Master Class in How to Give Constructive Criticism
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff shared a succinct 108-word message in a company-wide Slack chat, raising questions about employee productivity, particularly among new hires from 2021 and 2022. The message, which inquired about factors like remote work, onboarding, and managerial support, is presented as an example of constructive and emotionally intelligent criticism. It invites broad responses to understand the challenges new employees face and how to improve productivity within the company.

title: 5 Technology Investing Trends for 2023
summary: This article outlines five key technology investing trends for 2023 identified by Morgan Stanley, focusing on the pervasive theme of interoperability and data exchange across various industries. These trends include the digitalization of industrial companies, the emergence of insurtech as the next fintech, advancements in healthcare technology for continuous care, the evolving landscape of digital infrastructure, and the adoption of cloud and AI for enterprise resource planning and human resources. The report highlights significant investment and M&A opportunities as companies seek solutions to connect disparate data sources and improve efficiency.

title: iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV), including its current stock price, key statistics, asset holdings, and dividend information. It highlights IGV's top holdings as of September 30, 2025, which include Palantir Technologies Inc, Microsoft Corp, Oracle Corp, Salesforce Inc, and ServiceNow Inc, and details the ETF's latest trades and historical performance data.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock rises Tuesday, outperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) stock rose 0.94% on Tuesday, closing at $130.66, outperforming the broader market which saw mixed results. The company's stock achieved its second consecutive day of gains, despite being significantly below its 52-week high. Salesforce also outperformed competitors like Microsoft and Alphabet.

title: ServiceNow Inc. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: ServiceNow Inc. (NOW) stock declined by 1.21% on Wednesday, closing at $376.05, despite a broader market downturn where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones also fell. Although the stock experienced losses, it outperformed some competitors like Salesforce Inc. (CRM) and Synopsys Inc. (SNPS), which saw larger percentage drops. ServiceNow's stock was significantly below its 52-week high, and its trading volume was lower than its 50-day average.

title: Top 14 project management software and tools to level-up collaboration
summary: This article identifies 14 top project management software and tools to enhance team collaboration and efficiency. It explores the benefits of using such software, key features to look for, and provides a breakdown of tools suitable for cross-functional collaboration, agencies, and enterprise companies. The article aims to help teams choose the right solution to streamline project planning, coordination, and execution.

title: News | Salesforce To Cut Office Space and Lay Off Employees
summary: Salesforce, a major software firm and San Francisco's largest real estate occupant, announced plans to cut 10% of its workforce and reduce its office space nationally. This move is part of a broader trend among tech companies to scale back after rapid growth during the pandemic. The company expects to incur $1.4 billion to $2.1 billion in restructuring charges, acknowledging over-hiring during the pandemic.

title: Salesforce to lay off 10% of workforce to cut costs amid economic downturn
summary: Salesforce announced it will lay off 10% of its workforce and reduce office space to cut operating costs amid a challenging economic environment. CEO Marc Benioff admitted the company "hired too many people" during the pandemic's revenue surge, and the company is now facing the consequences. This move follows similar cost-cutting measures by other tech giants like Amazon, Apple, and Meta Platforms.

title: Salesforce Customers Not Swayed by Slack, Analysts Say
summary: Analysts suggest that Salesforce customers have not been swayed by the integration of Slack, which Salesforce acquired for $27.7 billion. Despite Salesforce's claims that the acquisition would transform work, corporate technology buyers remain largely unimpressed. The deal aimed to capitalize on the booming market for communication software during the pandemic, but its impact on Salesforce's product appeal has been limited, according to a CIO statement.

title: WPP acquires Fēnom Digital
summary: WPP has announced the acquisition of Fēnom Digital, a rapidly growing digital transformation agency based in North America. Specializing in enterprise commerce and customer experience solutions, Fēnom Digital will integrate into WPP's global commerce capability within Wunderman Thompson. This acquisition aligns with WPP's strategy to expand its commerce offerings and enhance its digital capabilities for clients.

title: Software company Pegasystems to lay off 4% workforce amid recession fears
summary: Software company Pegasystems is set to lay off 4% of its workforce, totaling over 6,000 employees, due to looming recession fears in 2023. This move is part of the company's strategy to improve its go-to-market operating model and is expected to incur a charge of $18.9 million in Q4 2022 for severance and benefit costs. Pegasystems joins other major tech firms like Amazon and Salesforce in announcing significant job cuts amid economic uncertainties.

title: WPP strengthens Salesforce expertise with Fenom Digital acquisition
summary: WPP has acquired Fenom Digital, a digital transformation agency specializing in Salesforce solutions, to bolster Wunderman Thompson's e-commerce capabilities. This acquisition aligns with a trend of agencies expanding their e-commerce offerings, particularly those with strong Salesforce ties, as online retail continues to grow. The move aims to enhance client services across multiple Salesforce clouds, despite recent economic struggles for Salesforce itself.

title: Are You Ready To Step Up To B2B Marketing’s New Destiny?
summary: B2B marketing is undergoing a significant transformation due to changes in buyer behavior, disruptive business models, and rapid technology evolution. Marketers must shift from traditional roles to a broader purpose focused on customer value and sustainable business growth. This requires strategic mindset shifts from product-centricity to customer outcomes, funnel to buyer's journey, and acquisition to lifecycle relationship management, emphasizing personalized, data-driven, and trust-building engagements.

title: American Express to Acquire Nipendo to Grow B2B Platform
summary: American Express has announced its plan to acquire Nipendo, a B2B payments automation company, to enhance its end-to-end B2B platform. The acquisition aims to streamline B2B payments, making transactions faster, more efficient, and transparent.
