This move aligns with a broader industry trend toward automation in invoicing and accounting functions, with other major payment companies also boosting their B2B offerings.

title: Walmart partners with Salesforce to sell its delivery tech to retailers
summary: Walmart has partnered with Salesforce to make its GoLocal delivery and Store Assist technologies available to other retailers through Salesforce's app store. This collaboration aims to help businesses enhance their pickup and delivery operations, leveraging the same systems Walmart uses to fulfill millions of orders. The move also comes as Salesforce seeks to reduce operating costs and expand its presence in the digital technology market.

title: Accenture Positioned as a Leader in Asia Pacific Salesforce Implementation Services 2022 in IDC MarketScape Report
summary: Accenture (NYSE: ACN) has been recognized as a leader in the IDC MarketScape: Asia/Pacific Salesforce Implementation Services 2022 Vendor Assessment. This recognition highlights Accenture's strong advisory and design capabilities, technical talent, and expertise in driving experience-led transformation initiatives across various industries in the Asia/Pacific region. The report specifically cited Accenture's large talent pool, industrialized delivery approach, and CX transformation expertise as key strengths.

title: nCino lays off 7% of workforce, CFO exits
summary: Fintech company nCino, headquartered in Wilmington, laid off nearly 7% of its workforce, impacting over 100 employees, due to a fluctuating market and the company's shift towards profitable growth. The layoffs occurred on the same day CFO David Rudow's exit was announced, with Greg Orenstein stepping in as his replacement. Affected employees will receive a severance package, and the company has mandated a return-to-office policy, citing in-person collaboration benefits.

title: ServiceNow Inc. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: ServiceNow Inc. (NOW) stock declined by 0.49% on Wednesday, closing at $416.20, despite a broader market downturn that saw the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average fall more significantly. This dip ended a seven-day winning streak for ServiceNow. The company's stock showed mixed performance compared to competitors like Salesforce Inc. (CRM), Oracle Corp. (ORCL), and Synopsys Inc. (SNPS), all of which experienced larger percentage declines.

title: A Survival Guide for When You’ve Been Laid Off
summary: This article offers a survival guide for individuals who have been laid off, acknowledging the increasing prevalence of job cuts across various sectors, including tech giants and financial institutions. It emphasizes the importance of having a plan in place, even though layoffs can be unpredictable. The article aims to help individuals cope and navigate the next steps after losing their job.

title: Here are the layoff severance packages Google, Microsoft, Amazon and other tech giants have promised
summary: As major tech companies like Google, Microsoft, and Amazon announce significant layoffs, this article compares the severance packages offered by these and other tech giants like Meta, Salesforce, and Twitter. The packages vary widely, from Google's 16-week base severance plus additional weeks per year of service to Amazon's 60-day full pay period followed by several weeks of severance. The article highlights the differing approaches to severance, health benefits, and stock vesting amidst an uncertain job market for laid-off tech workers.

title: Activist investor Elliott Management buys multibillion-dollar stake in Salesforce
summary: Activist investor Elliott Management has acquired a multibillion-dollar stake in Salesforce, increasing pressure on Chairman and co-CEO Marc Benioff amidst slowing growth and recent layoffs. Elliott is known for pushing for board representation and operational changes to boost profitability, having previously influenced companies like Pinterest and EMC. This move follows another activist investor, Starboard Value LP, taking a stake in Salesforce, suggesting a widespread belief that the company is undervalued and underperforming.

title: Activist investor Elliott Management takes big stake in Salesforce after software giant sheds workers, real estate
summary: Activist investor Elliott Investment Management has acquired a substantial stake in Salesforce, following recent layoffs and a significant drop in the software giant's stock value. This move by Elliott, known for pushing strategic changes and seeking board representation, marks them as the second prominent activist investor, after Starboard Value, to take an interest in Salesforce's direction. Elliott aims to work constructively with Salesforce to enhance its value, particularly in light of management changes and the company's efforts to adjust to slowing demand and previous over-hiring.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | Elliott Management Takes Big Stake in Salesforce
summary: Activist investor Elliott Management Corp. has acquired a significant, multibillion-dollar stake in Salesforce Inc., intensifying pressure on the business-software provider. Elliott Management is known for seeking board representation and advocating for operational improvements and other corporate changes. This investment follows recent announcements by Salesforce regarding layoffs and office space reductions.

title: Empowered Customers Seek Three Types Of Brand Experiences
summary: In 2023, Forrester's updated "Empowered Customer Segmentation" reveals that Progressive Pioneers, representing 27% of the US population, are vital for brand strategy. These tech-savvy consumers actively seek hybrid, empowering, and enriching experiences. Brands must understand these needs to innovate and deliver differentiated value to win with this discerning segment.

title: News | King Charles's Property Company 'Sues' Twitter Over Unpaid Rent
summary: King Charles's property company, the Crown Estate, has filed a lawsuit against Twitter in the High Court in London for alleged unpaid rent at its London headquarters in the West End. This action comes as Twitter, under Elon Musk's ownership, reportedly ceased paying rent at its global offices to cut costs. The Crown Estate seeks recovery of rent arrears, interest, and costs, with a legal expert suggesting summary judgment could be sought if Twitter lacks a valid defense.

title: What's Changed: 2023 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Low-Code Application Platforms
summary: Gartner has released its 2023 Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Low-Code Application Platforms (LCAPs), evaluating 17 significant providers based on updated criteria reflecting market trends. The report categorizes vendors into Leaders, Challengers, Visionaries, and Niche Players, with new additions like Alibaba and Huawei. It highlights key strengths and differentiated offerings of each platform, including Mendix, OutSystems, Microsoft, Salesforce, Oracle, Appian, and Zoho.

title: Gartner Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Low-Code Application Platforms 2023
summary: Gartner has released its 2023 Magic Quadrant for Enterprise Low-Code Application Platforms (LCAPs), identifying 17 competitors and defining LCAP solutions as tools for rapid custom application development with minimal coding. The report categorizes vendors into Leaders (OutSystems, Mendix, Microsoft, Salesforce, ServiceNow), Challengers (Oracle), Visionaries (Appian, Zoho, Pegasystems), and Niche Players (Retool, Unqork, Huawei, Creatio, Newgen, Alibaba, Kintone, Quickbase). It provides an overview of each vendor's strengths and weaknesses, noting new additions to the Quadrant and anticipating increased demand for low-code platforms as businesses seek to streamline application development.

title: 5 Interesting Learnings from ServiceNow at $8 Billion in ARR
summary: This article analyzes ServiceNow's continued strong performance, reaching $8 billion in ARR with consistent 25% annual growth, despite broader economic headwinds. Key insights include steady gross renewal rates of 98-99%, over 1,500 customers with $1M+ ACV, and high revenue per employee, showcasing its resilience and profitability. The author highlights the effectiveness of long-term contracts and the significant expansion of customer ACV over time.

title: Accenture Rated Highest Leader in Everest Group Salesforce Industry Cloud Services PEAK Matrix® Assessment 2022
summary: Accenture has been recognized as the highest Leader in the Everest Group PEAK Matrix® Assessment for Salesforce Industry Cloud Services, excelling in Market Impact and Vision & Capability. The report highlights Accenture's consistent record of successful implementations, technological expertise, and a global talent pool in industry cloud resources. This recognition underscores Accenture's consulting-led approach and ability to deliver transformative impact to clients.

title: Tech layoffs continue as IBM, SAP announce massive cuts
summary: IBM and SAP have announced significant layoffs, with SAP cutting 3,000 jobs (2.5% of its workforce) and IBM eliminating 3,900 positions (1.5% of its workforce). These cuts follow a broader trend of mass layoffs across the tech sector, including Meta, Google's Verily, Salesforce, Coinbase, and Twitter. Concerns are rising that these widespread job losses could signal an impending economic recession.

title: Salesforce adding ValueAct's Mason Morfit, two other directors (update)
summary: Salesforce (CRM) is appointing three new independent directors to its board, including Mason Morfit, CEO and CIO of activist hedge fund ValueAct Capital. This move comes as the company faces pressure from several activist investors. An update confirmed Salesforce's decision to add these directors.

title: Salesforce appoints new board directors amid activist investor pressure
summary: Salesforce has appointed three new board directors, including hedge fund ValueAct Capital's chief, Mason Morfit, Mastercard CFO Sachin Mehra, and former Carnival Corp CEO Arnold Donald. This move comes amidst increasing pressure from activist investors seeking better cost control and management changes at the cloud-based software firm. While these appointments were planned to enhance operational skills, they also respond to demands from prominent activist investment firms like Elliott Management, Starboard Value, Inclusive Capital, and ValueAct, who have all engaged with Salesforce regarding their concerns.

title: Big tech layoffs may ease software engineer shortage
summary: Recent layoffs in the big tech sector, totaling over 228,000 workers since early 2022, are creating a significant influx of software engineers into the job market. This situation presents an opportunity for smaller enterprises to recruit talented individuals, though challenges such as cultural fit and visa costs still exist. Experts suggest that smaller companies can attract talent by offering benefits beyond compensation, including flexibility and the chance for employees to make a greater impact.

title: NetApp to lay off 8% of workforce, blames economy
summary: NetApp plans to lay off 8% of its global workforce by May 2023, citing a "challenging macroeconomic environment" and "conservatism in IT spending." This move will cost the company an estimated $85 million to $95 million in severance, and analysts suggest the layoffs are a result of slower hardware sales and redundancies from past acquisitions. While NetApp's cloud business is growing, its mainstream storage business has been flat.

title: PayPal to lay off 2,000 employees in coming weeks, about 7% of workforce
summary: PayPal announced plans to lay off 2,000 employees, about 7% of its workforce, due to a "challenging macroeconomic environment." CEO Dan Schulman stated the company is focusing resources on core priorities and rightsizing its cost structure. This move follows a trend of recent job cuts across the tech industry, including Google, Microsoft, and Salesforce.

title: BlackRock Increases Position in salesforce.com (CRM)
summary: BlackRock has increased its stake in salesforce.com (CRM), now owning 70.72 million shares, representing 7.1% of the company as of February 7, 2023. This is an increase from their previous reported ownership. Analysts project a 14.96% upside for salesforce.com, with an average one-year price target of $194.33, and the company is also expected to see significant increases in annual revenue and EPS.

title: Microsoft unveils plans to revamp Bing using AI
summary: Microsoft is revamping its Bing search engine and Edge Web browser with artificial intelligence, aiming to challenge Google's dominance in consumer technology markets. This move is part of Microsoft's strategy to invest billions in AI, leveraging its partnership with OpenAI and its chatbot ChatGPT to offer more powerful and user-friendly search capabilities and integrate AI across its product suite. The company believes this technology will reshape software categories and generate significant revenue increases for Bing.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | Third Point Has a Stake in Salesforce
summary: Dan Loeb’s Third Point LLC has acquired a stake in Salesforce Inc., according to sources, making it the fifth activist shareholder to invest in the software company. Third Point is known for pushing for changes at major companies, having previously targeted Campbell Soup Co., Shell PLC, and Walt Disney Co. This move signals increasing activist interest in Salesforce's shares.

title: Former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor to launch new AI startup with Google veteran Clay Bavor
summary: Former Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor is partnering with outgoing Google VP Clay Bavor to establish a new artificial intelligence startup. The venture, set to launch in March, aims to apply AI to critical business problems. Bavor’s departure from Google will shift his current responsibilities within Google's Labs unit, distributing emerging technology and augmented reality projects to other internal teams.

title: Wall St dips as Treasury yields rise after auction
summary: U.S. stock indexes closed lower on Thursday, reversing earlier gains as Treasury yields increased after a poorly received auction of 30-year bonds. This overshadowed strong earnings reports from companies like Disney and PepsiCo. Weak demand for the $21 billion sale of 30-year Treasury bonds led to a rise in yields, making bonds a more attractive alternative to equities for investors.

title: Brazil's Zenvia Inc. Brings ChatGPT To Brand Messaging Solutions 02/14/2023
summary: Zenvia, a Brazilian cloud-based customer experience software company, has integrated OpenAI's ChatGPT into its mass texting service, Zenvia Attraction. This aims to personalize customer relations for its 14,000 clients by providing assertive message suggestions across various messaging channels. The move follows similar integrations by other tech giants, and Zenvia hopes it will enhance communication campaigns and drive sales.

title: Post-quantum cryptography startup Sandbox AQ raises $500M
summary: Sandbox AQ, a quantum computing software startup that spun off from Alphabet Inc., has successfully raised $500 million in funding. The company specializes in post-quantum cryptography software designed to safeguard data from future quantum computer attacks, as well as quantum simulation software for drug development and quantum sensors. Sandbox AQ plans to target telecommunications, financial services, government, healthcare, and cybersecurity sectors, citing existing customers like Mount Sinai Health System and SoftBank.

title: Zscaler To Acquire Canonic Security To Thwart SaaS Attacks
summary: Zscaler announced its agreement to acquire Canonic Security, a startup specializing in protecting against software-as-a-service (SaaS) attacks. This acquisition aims to enhance Zscaler's data protection offerings, particularly its cloud access security broker (CASB) and SaaS security posture management (SSPM) tools. The move comes as the threat landscape shifts towards supply chain security and API vulnerabilities, which Canonic's technology is designed to address by providing visibility and governance over third-party applications connected to critical SaaS platforms.

title: Broker Darlings of the Dow: Salesforce Ranks As a Top 15 Analyst Pick
summary: A study of analyst recommendations indicates that Salesforce Inc (CRM) is the #12 broker pick among the 30 Dow Jones Industrial Average stocks. Salesforce also ranks #165 out of 500 S&P 500 components. The article notes CRM operates in the Application Software sector alongside companies like Microsoft and Alibaba.

title: Technology Layoffs: Outlook and Accounting Considerations
summary: This article discusses the ongoing trend of layoffs in the technology sector, triggered by factors such as over-saturated valuations, rising interest rates, and a slowdown in financing. Despite the considerable job cuts throughout 2022 and early 2023, the article suggests an optimistic outlook due to overall job market growth. It also highlights critical accounting and business considerations for companies undertaking layoffs, including severance liabilities and the potential for discontinued operations reporting.

title: Autobound Raises $4 Million in Seed Round
summary: Autobound, a San Francisco-based company providing ChatGPT for sales emails, has successfully raised $4 million in a seed funding round. The funding, led by Dundee VC, will be used to accelerate product development and scale its marketing, design, and machine learning operations. Autobound's platform aims to automate and personalize sales emails, helping B2B sellers increase reply rates, and recently launched "Autobound Anywhere" to integrate with popular sales tools.

title: Union Pacific CEO to step down as hedge fund presses for change
summary: Union Pacific announced that CEO Lance Fritz will step down in 2023, following pressure from hedge fund Soroban Capital Partners. Soroban, which holds a $1.6 billion stake, had called for Fritz's replacement to improve operational efficiency and suggested former COO Jim Vena as a strong candidate. The company's board is seeking a new CEO both internally and externally, having considered shareholder input, and aims to find a leader for a long-term tenure.

title: CX Leaders, Prove Us Wrong: Defy 2023’s Troubling Trends
summary: Forrester analysts predict two troubling trends for customer experience (CX) in 2023: erosion of CX differentiation in nearly three-fourths of industries and a critical lack of design, data, and journey skills in four out of five CX teams. The erosion of differentiation is attributed to declining experience quality, reduced customer obsession in organizations, and changing consumer values. The article urges CX leaders to address skill gaps and refocus on customer obsession to counteract these predictions.

title: Tech giant Salesforce is caught in a war with employees that sums up the pandemic workplace
summary: Salesforce is experiencing internal conflict between its "wellness culture" and "high performance culture," exacerbated by CEO Marc Benioff's comments and layoffs. A controversial line in Benioff's V2MOM strategy document — suggesting that "wellness culture overpowered high performance culture during pandemic" — caused significant employee backlash, leading to its removal. This friction highlights a broader challenge for companies balancing employee well-being with productivity expectations in the post-pandemic workplace.

title: Amid layoffs, Salesforce reportedly has been paying Matthew McConaughey more than $10 million a year
summary: Salesforce Inc. has reportedly been paying actor Matthew McConaughey over $10 million annually as a creative adviser and TV pitchman, even while the company was undergoing layoffs and cost-cutting measures. This compensation, a mix of cash and equity, required approval from Salesforce's compensation committee. Salesforce founder and co-CEO Marc Benioff stated he was not involved in the deal.

title: Salesforce stock spikes 14% after beating Q4 estimates; Tableau revenue grows 6% to $636M
summary: Salesforce stock surged over 14% after beating Q4 revenue expectations, reporting $8.38 billion and $1.68 non-GAAP EPS. Tableau, a Salesforce acquisition, saw its revenue grow 5.6% year-over-year to $636 million, marking its highest quarterly revenue since the acquisition, despite facing competition and recent layoffs impacting its workforce and leadership. The company is undergoing cost-cutting measures, including a 10% workforce reduction, amid pressure from activist investors and a challenging economic environment.

title: S&P 500 fell 2.6% in February with some stocks crashing up to 35% in one month
summary: The S&P 500 dropped 2.61% in February, with some individual stocks experiencing crashes of up to 35%, as inflation concerns revived. Investors are now awaiting new US manufacturing and construction data, as well as corporate earnings reports, to gauge future market direction. Meanwhile, positive manufacturing data from China offers some good news amidst the US market's struggles.

title: Elliott nominates slate of directors to Salesforce board - source
summary: Activist investor Elliott Management Corp has nominated a slate of directors to the board of Salesforce Inc, following their multi-billion dollar stake acquisition in January. Elliott praised Salesforce's recent announcements, including accelerated margin targets and a $20 billion share repurchase, as steps toward regaining investor trust. This move adds pressure on Salesforce to deliver on promises and enhance accountability through board oversight.

title: Salesforce shares climb as forecast, buyback plan allay activist concerns
summary: Salesforce's shares jumped 14% after the company provided an upbeat full-year profit forecast and doubled its share repurchase program, addressing concerns from activist investors pushing for changes amid slowing growth. The company's fourth-quarter results exceeded expectations, forecasting an adjusted operating margin of 27% for the year, significantly higher than previous figures and Wall Street estimates. This positive outlook and commitment to shareholder returns placated activists like Elliott Management.

title: 'Just a politician': Marc Benioff shrugs off investor who accused Salesforce of being 'woke'
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff dismissed accusations of the company being "woke" from activist investor Vivek Ramaswamy, co-founder of Strive Asset Management, calling him "just a politician." Ramaswamy, who is running for president, and his firm argue that Salesforce prioritizes politics over profits, a charge Benioff refutes, stating he's open to feedback from legitimate investors but not those with "political agendas." This exchange is part of a broader conservative movement targeting "corporate wokeness" and ESG principles.

title: Salesforce continues office purge with headquarters sublease
summary: Salesforce is subleasing six floors of its namesake Salesforce Tower in San Francisco, amounting to 125,000 square feet, as part of a wider cost-cutting initiative. This move, following other real estate pullbacks and a 10% workforce reduction, would reduce its headquarters' footprint by half. The company expects to spend up to $650 million this year on exiting office space commitments, reflecting a shift in office culture and the impact of hybrid work.

title: Salesforce Deepens Real Estate Cuts, Offloading Space in Namesname San Francisco Tower
summary: Salesforce is continuing to cut its real estate footprint by listing 125,000 square feet in its San Francisco tower for sublease, bringing its total city-wide offerings to over 1 million square feet. This move is part of a broader restructuring strategy to achieve more profitable growth, following layoffs and a re-evaluation of its global real estate portfolio in response to a souring economic climate. The company anticipates up to $650 million in charges from these reductions, aiming for completion by 2026.

title: Behind Synchrony’s decision to join Project Black
summary: Synchrony has pledged $100 million to Project Black, an investment fund managed by Ariel Alternatives, with the goal of supporting businesses owned by Black and Latinx entrepreneurs. This initiative stems from Synchrony's commitment to address racial inequality issues that became prominent in 2020. Project Black aims to invest in and transform companies into minority-owned entities, placing executives of color in leadership roles and connecting them with Fortune 500 companies as suppliers.

title: Salesforce follows Microsoft in launching A.I. tools for salespeople with help from OpenAI
summary: Salesforce is launching new AI-powered tools, including Einstein GPT for sales and service and a ChatGPT app for Slack, leveraging OpenAI's technology. These tools aim to assist salespeople, customer service agents, and marketers by generating responses and content, with an emphasis on human review to mitigate the spread of incorrect information. This move follows Microsoft's similar integration of AI into its business software, highlighting the competitive rush among tech giants to capitalize on generative AI.

title: News | Salesforce Executive Calls In-Office Work Critical to Tech Giant’s Profitability
summary: Salesforce's Chief Operating Officer Brian Millham states that in-person work is crucial for the company's future growth and profitability, reversing a previous stance on remote work. He noted a drop in productivity among remote employees during the pandemic. The company's shift back to a hybrid model, requiring sales and service employees in the office four days a week, appears to be positively impacting revenue growth.

title: Nearly 350 Bay Area workers laid off by major health care company
summary: Johnson & Johnson subsidiaries have laid off over 340 Bay Area employees, with the largest cuts affecting surgical robotics company Auris Health. Other affected companies include Verb Surgical, Ethicon Endo-Surgery, and C-SATS. Johnson & Johnson stated that these changes are part of their effort to be more innovative and competitive in a rapidly changing healthcare environment.

title: Wix Appoints Gavin Patterson and Francesco de Mojana to Board
summary: Wix (Nasdaq: WIX) has announced the appointment of Gavin Patterson and Francesco de Mojana to its Board of Directors, effective March 8, 2023. These appointments are part of Wix's strategy to refresh and enhance its board, focusing on product-led growth, sustained profitability, and achieving "Rule of 40" in 2025. Yuval Cohen and Roy Saar have resigned from the board after many years of service.

title: Top Companies for Employee Engagement and Development
summary: Adobe Inc. leads the Management Top 250 ranking for employee engagement and development, followed by Nvidia and Salesforce. This ranking, developed by the Drucker Institute, assesses corporate effectiveness across various metrics including customer satisfaction, social responsibility, innovation, and financial strength. Adobe also ranks in the top 10 for social responsibility.

title: The 10 highest paid people in cloud networking
summary: The article lists the top 10 highest-paid executives in the cloud networking industry, detailing their salaries, stock awards, and contributions to their respective companies. It highlights that while base salaries have remained steady for most, significant bonuses and stock awards have led to multi-million dollar paydays, especially for those instrumental in growing cloud and AI divisions. Andrew Jassy of Amazon tops the list with $212 million, largely from stock awards.

title: Vodafone Builds Its Future-Ready Workforce on Cloud HR Foundations
summary: Vodafone is investing in cloud HR, specifically SAP SuccessFactors solutions, to transform its culture and employee experience, aiming to create a future-ready workforce. This initiative focuses on building a high-performance learning culture, integrating cloud HR for actionable insights, and providing a simple, accessible, personalized employee experience. Key results include increased new hires, improved diversity, reduced candidate cycle times, and outstanding engagement on its learning platform.

title: Get ready to Roam: This Miami startup is building a better virtual workplace
summary: Howard Lerman, founder of Yext, launched Roam in 2022 to create a more integrated and dynamic virtual workplace experience, addressing the disengagement often found in traditional digital communication platforms. Roam, based in Miami, aims to combine features of Zoom, Slack, and other collaboration tools into a single platform for a more natural office feel. The platform has seen rapid adoption with a $30 million Series A funding round and a strong conversion rate from free to paid users, highlighting its potential to reshape remote work.

title: 7 Cloud Computing Stocks That Can Make You a Millionaire as Data Explodes
summary: The article highlights seven cloud computing stocks—Salesforce, Microsoft, Snowflake, Amazon, IBM, Veeva Systems, and Alphabet—that are poised for growth as the demand for data storage and processing continues to explode. Despite a challenging 2022 for tech stocks, the public cloud sector demonstrated significant growth, indicating a strong migration of data to the cloud. Each company is detailed with its market position, recent financial performance, and reasons for its potential as a millionaire-maker investment.

title: Tech leaders from Vimeo, Slack, and 776 share insights on staying innovative during an economic downturn
summary: During a panel at SXSW, tech leaders from Vimeo, Slack, and 776 discussed strategies for innovation amidst economic turbulence, including recent layoffs and the Silicon Valley Bank collapse. They emphasized the importance of focusing on customer needs, transparent communication, and maintaining employee morale through difficult periods. The panelists concluded that constraints often foster innovation, leading to the creation of valuable new products and services.

title: SAP Introduces SAP Datasphere to Simplify Customers’ Data Landscape
summary: SAP announced SAP Datasphere, the next generation of its data management portfolio, designed to simplify customers’ data landscapes and provide easy access to business-ready data. The company also unveiled strategic partnerships with Confluent, Databricks, Collibra, and DataRobot to enrich SAP Datasphere, enabling organizations to create unified architectures combining SAP and non-SAP data. This initiative aims to eliminate the complexity and "hidden data tax" associated with integrating disparate data sources, empowering customers with faster insights and improved decision-making.

title: NICE Achieves Milestone of One Million Agents on CXone
summary: NICE has reached a significant milestone with one million agents and supervisors now using its CXone cloud platform, following its recognition by Gartner and integration of OpenAI's generative modeling. The company reported strong financial results for 2022, including a 10% increase in total revenue and 26% growth in cloud revenue, securing several eight-figure deals. NICE projects continued growth for 2023, leveraging its strong market position, cloud expansion, and AI advancements.

title: Building A Broader IT Modernization Strategy
summary: Government agencies are facing significant challenges in IT and application modernization due to the need to manage vast data volumes and operate securely in multi-cloud environments. This article highlights the perspectives of various IT leaders on building a comprehensive IT modernization strategy, featuring a series of video spotlights and executive insights from both government and industry.

title: Oracle Cuts Cerner Jobs After CEO Promised to ‘Clean Up’ Health Unit
summary: Oracle has initiated job cuts within its recently acquired Cerner digital health-records unit, particularly affecting marketing and creative services, as the company integrates the $28.3 billion acquisition. This move follows CEO Safra Catz's promise to "clean Cerner up" to improve profitability, with Oracle having already spent $585 million on a restructuring program primarily for employee severance. Despite the job reductions, Cerner has contributed significantly to Oracle's cloud growth and revenue, and its operating margin has reportedly increased since the acquisition.

title: News | Salesforce Seeks To Offload Large Block of Office Space in New Chicago Tower
summary: Salesforce is looking to sublease up to 125,000 square feet of its office space in the new 60-story Salesforce Tower in Chicago, citing recent job cuts and a desire to reduce real estate holdings. This move aligns with a broader trend of companies, including Meta, reducing their office footprints post-pandemic, while also highlighting the "flight to quality" as tenants seek premium spaces. The sublease offering is expected to attract high demand, given the limited availability of large, quality office spaces along the Chicago River.

title: Digital Economy Discovers a Potential Frontier for Growth Thanks to Generative AI
summary: Generative AI, exemplified by large language models like GPT-3, is revolutionizing artificial intelligence, offering significant leaps in capabilities, speed, and cost-effectiveness. This new wave of AI is poised to drive massive innovation, boosting productivity and creating new applications across various sectors. The article explores how this technology will particularly impact and create opportunities in cloud computing, cybersecurity, and digital media, leading to substantial investment and growth in these areas.

title: Which tech firms are most exposed to the banking crisis?
summary: The banking crisis introduces significant headwinds for IT spending, disproportionately affecting tech firms with high exposure to the financial sector and decelerating spending momentum. Companies like Splunk, Dynatrace, SailPoint, Informatica, DocuSign, and Zoom are identified as highly exposed, while Workday, Databricks, Confluent, and Hashicorp show accelerating momentum within financial services. The article delves into the historical context of easy money policies and the current economic landscape to explain these market dynamics, using ETR survey data to assess tech companies' financial services penetration and spending velocity.

title: Salesforce avoids proxy fight with Elliott after improved results
summary: Salesforce Inc. and activist investor Elliott Management have reached an agreement where Elliott will not pursue a board challenge, following Salesforce's improved financial results and commitment to boosting profits and efficiency. Salesforce agreed to double its share buybacks to $20 billion and reduce acquisitions, satisfying Elliott and avoiding a costly proxy contest. This resolution is part of a trend among prominent activist investors, with similar withdrawals seen at Disney and Bath & Body Works.

title: Brisbane Airport Corporation scales up its security operations with an end-to-end Managed detection and response service
summary: Brisbane Airport Corporation (BAC), operator of Brisbane Airport, has partnered with ParaFlare for an end-to-end Managed Detection and Response (MDR) service to enhance its cybersecurity. This partnership addresses the need to protect critical infrastructure from sophisticated cyberattacks and comply with strict regulations. Leveraging Microsoft Sentinel, Defender for Endpoint, and Defender for Identity, the service provides 24/7 monitoring, improved alert fidelity, and rapid incident response, significantly reducing detection times for critical cyber threats.

title: Developer John Kilroy says he will retire as CEO later this year
summary: John Kilroy, a prominent commercial real estate developer and investor, is set to retire as CEO of Kilroy Realty Corp. later this year. He has been responsible for some of the most significant and notable Bay Area projects over the last decade. The article mentions his roles as chairman of the board, president, and chief executive officer.

title: The RealReal Upgrades Seller Experience in Bid to Bring in More Big-Ticket Items
summary: Luxury resale platform The RealReal has launched "RealService," an enhanced concierge-style seller experience aimed at securing more high-value inventory and boosting profitability. The service includes a dedicated Consignor Concierge team and new product features like a Resale Insights Center, all powered by Salesforce technology to personalize customer interactions. This initiative is part of The RealReal's broader efforts to achieve profitability by early 2024 amidst shareholder pressure.

title: Best-Performing Stocks of Q1 2023
summary: The first quarter of 2023 saw a significant rebound in technology and communication services stocks, with Nvidia, Meta Platforms, and Salesforce among the top performers. This resurgence was driven by factors such as better-than-expected earnings, cost-cutting measures, and growing enthusiasm for artificial intelligence, contrasting sharply with the downturn experienced in 2022. Other sectors like entertainment and media, cryptocurrency, and electric vehicles also saw notable gains.

title: Big block of Salesforce office space in Uptown Dallas hits sublease market
summary: Salesforce Inc. has put two of its four office floors at The Union in Dallas on the sublease market. This move follows major job cuts by Salesforce and other large U.S. technology companies, impacting their rapidly expanded payrolls during the pandemic.

title: Google Cloud brings new blood into its go-to-market organization
summary: Google Cloud is making significant changes to its go-to-market organization, bringing in new executive hires and rebranding its consultancy services to enhance sales efficiency. These changes follow the elevation of Adaire Fox-Martin as the top sales executive, indicating a strategic effort to strengthen Google Cloud's market position amidst slowing industry growth and increasing pressure for profitability. Industry analysts view these moves as a concerted effort to improve coverage, relevance, and access in the enterprise market, leveraging the new executives' deep experience.

title: Zennify Appoints Chris Conant, Former Salesforce SVP, as CEO
summary: Zennify, a Salesforce and nCino consultancy specializing in financial services, has appointed Chris Conant, former Salesforce SVP, as its new Chief Executive Officer. Matt Henwood has also joined as Chief Delivery Officer. These appointments are aimed at guiding the company's next phase of growth and expanding its focus on customer success and innovative solutions.

title: Salesforce Is Leaving a San Francisco Office Tower Bearing Its Name
summary: Salesforce is subleasing its remaining 104,051 square feet of office space across six floors at 350 Mission St., also known as Salesforce East, as part of a broader restructuring. This move adds to the company's significant sublease holdings in San Francisco, making it the largest sublessor in the city with over 700,000 square feet on the market. The decision stems from cost-cutting measures, including a 10% layoff, influenced by activist investors and a review with Bain & Co.

title: Best Workplaces in Canada 2023: 1000+ employees
summary: This article lists the Best Workplaces in Canada for 2023 in the 1000+ employees category. It highlights various companies and the unique employee benefits and initiatives that earned them this recognition, focusing on aspects like well-being, flexibility, career development, and social impact. The featured companies span diverse sectors, including technology, finance, professional services, and manufacturing, showcasing a wide range of employee-centric practices.

title: Salesforce giving up 25% of its space in state’s tallest building
summary: Salesforce Inc. plans to sublease nearly a quarter of its office space in the Salesforce Tower in Indianapolis, amounting to three contiguous floors or about 61,700 square feet. This move is part of the company's broader strategy to cut costs and restructure its real estate holdings amidst a possible economic downturn, following an earlier announcement to lay off 10% of its workforce. The sublease includes floors 20, 21, and 22, and is set to expire on June 30, 2030, with each floor fully furnished.

title: Final Touches and Landscape Work Seen at Salesforce Tower in River North
summary: The 60-story Salesforce Tower at 333 W Wolf Point Plaza in River North is receiving its finishing touches and gearing up for an imminent spring opening. This mixed-use office tower, a collaboration between Hines and the Joseph P. Kennedy Family, completes the three-tower Wolf Point masterplan. Salesforce will occupy 500,000 square feet, with Kirkland and Ellis LLP taking the remainder of the 1.4 million square feet, featuring retail, restaurant spaces, and a unique "Ohana Floor."

title: Salesforce rolls out new healthcare software tools with a focus on home health, AI and automation
summary: Salesforce has updated its Health Cloud software with new tools focusing on home health, AI, and automation to streamline processes for healthcare providers. These enhancements aim to improve patient experiences by automating tasks like prior authorizations and scheduling, connecting clinical and nonclinical data, and supporting more personalized care. The company emphasizes the need for advanced technologies to meet patient expectations and reduce operational costs.

title: TCS, Infosys, Wipro: Are huge bench sizes dragging down Indian IT majors?
summary: Indian IT giants like TCS, Infosys, and Wipro are grappling with increasing "bench sizes" where a significant portion of their workforce is not actively assigned to projects, impacting profitability and employee morale. This situation is attributed to macroeconomic headwinds, a drop in demand, and over-hiring during the pandemic. Experts suggest that if the trend continues, it could lead to mass layoffs, making reskilling and upskilling existing employees crucial for improved utilization and talent retention.

title: Gartner Magic Quadrant for Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms 2023
summary: This article summarizes the 2023 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Analytics and Business Intelligence Platforms, categorizing vendors into Leaders, Challengers, Visionaries, and Niche Players. It details the strengths and cautions for each vendor based on Gartner's evaluation of their ABI platforms. The report highlights Microsoft, Salesforce, and Qlik as leaders, and notes movements of several companies since the 2022 report, particularly Pyramid Analytics' jump to visionary status.

title: Sonos (SONO) Launches Subscription-Based Sonos Pro in US
summary: Sonos (SONO) has launched Sonos Pro, a new subscription-based software-as-a-service offering in the US for businesses, priced at $35 per month per location. This service provides commercially licensed music, individualized support, and a web-based dashboard to manage Sonos systems across multiple locations, building on existing Sonos hardware. The company developed Sonos Pro to meet the growing demand from businesses for sound solutions in commercial spaces as customers return to physical retail and restaurants.

title: Microsoft to shed more office space with Redmond sublease
summary: Microsoft is planning to sublease more office space in Redmond as part of its efforts to consolidate its office footprint and cut costs. This move aligns with a trend among other major tech companies in the Puget Sound area to reduce their physical office presence. The article also lists related instances of companies like UW, F5, and Salesforce making similar adjustments to their office space.

title: Salesforce Loses Longtime Executive Ebony Beckwith
summary: Ebony Beckwith, Salesforce's Chief Business Officer and a 14-year veteran of the company, is reportedly leaving the software giant. Beckwith previously served as Chief of Staff to CEO Marc Benioff since 2021 and was heavily involved in the company's philanthropic efforts. Her departure marks another executive exit as Salesforce prioritizes profit.

title: Former Salesforce Co-CEO Keith Block Launches Venture Capital Firm
summary: Former Salesforce Co-CEO Keith Block is launching a new venture capital firm called Smith Point Capital LLC. The firm is targeting $400 million for its inaugural fund and will focus on growth-stage investments in enterprise software companies, specifically those with $50 million to $250 million in annual recurring revenue.

title: Hearing on "Addressing America’s Data Privacy Shortfalls: How a National Standard Fills Gaps to Protect Americans’ Personal Information"
summary: The Subcommittee on Innovation, Data, and Commerce of the Committee on Energy and Commerce held a hearing on April 27, 2023. The hearing, titled "Addressing America’s Data Privacy Shortfalls," focused on how a national standard can protect Americans' personal information. Witnesses included representatives from ACT | The App Association, REGO Payment Architectures, Inc., Salesforce, Inc., and the Public Interest Privacy Center.

title: Salesforce’s Einstein GPT promises to accelerate sales with generative AI
summary: Salesforce is integrating new generative AI and real-time data capabilities into its Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Data Cloud offerings, highlighted by the enhanced Einstein GPT. This aims to boost seller efficiency by automating tasks like email generation and lead qualification, and to improve customer service with personalized experiences and automated responses. Key additions include Tableau for Sales, Activity 360, and Sales Planning, all leveraging AI to provide insights and streamline operations.

title: Tableau's chief revenue officer elevated to CEO
summary: Ryan Aytay, Tableau's chief revenue officer and a long-time Salesforce employee, has been promoted to CEO. He will remain based in San Francisco, where Salesforce is headquartered. This change follows previous executive shakeups and layoffs within Tableau and Salesforce.

title: The Definition Of “More From Less” In B2B Content Strategy And Operations
summary: This article discusses the concept of "more from less" in B2B content strategy, shifting the focus from content volume to delivering more value with fewer resources. It highlights that buyers feel overwhelmed by excessive content and are more interested in substance, not just style. The author provides actionable tips for B2B organizations to achieve this through strategic content planning, optimized production, effective promotion, and focused performance measurement, emphasizing prioritization and saying "no" to unnecessary content creation.

title: Insider Announces Steve Cakebread, Legendary IPO Leader for Salesforce, Pandora, and Yext, to Join Advisory Board
summary: Insider, a cross-channel experience platform, has announced that Steve Cakebread, a legendary IPO leader known for his work with Salesforce, Pandora, and Yext, will join its advisory board. Cakebread's extensive experience in leading companies through successful IPOs will be invaluable as Insider plans for future growth and potential M&A activities, especially after recently achieving unicorn status with a $1.22B valuation. Both the CEO and Cakebread expressed excitement about leveraging his financial and strategic expertise to further solidify Insider's position as a market leader in customer experience solutions.

title: Travel CX Case Study: Salesforce and British Airways
summary: This article details how British Airways leveraged Salesforce CRM to enhance its customer experience and operational efficiency. By implementing Salesforce Sales Cloud and Community Cloud, British Airways improved personalized engagement, streamlined sales planning, and made its workforce more efficient, leading to better customer interactions and internal collaboration. The case study highlights the benefits of a centralized platform for managing customer data and optimizing business processes in the travel industry.

title: Self-Reported Attribution (or, “How Did You Hear About Us?”): A Practical Guide
summary: This article defines self-reported attribution and its value in understanding customer acquisition, especially in the context of "dark marketing." It explains how to implement "how did you hear about us" surveys, emphasizing best practices for gathering data without negatively impacting conversion rates. The guide also outlines seven practical ways to leverage self-reported attribution data for trend analysis, identifying opportunities, measuring untrackable channels, and aligning marketing strategies.

title: Is BULZ Stock a buy?
summary: The article discusses BULZ, the ticker symbol for the MicroSectors FANG & Innovation 3X Leveraged ETNs, which trades on NYSE Arca. It explains that BULZ is an unsecured debt security providing leveraged exposure to the Solactive FANG Innovation Index, tracking 15 large-cap US tech stocks, and is not suitable for "buy and hold" investments. The article also mentions Bank of Montreal as the issuer and highlights Barclays' recent decision to redeem some of its own ETNs due to past issues, noting this does not directly impact BULZ but provides context on the ETN market.

title: Markets Brief: Why Vanguard Sees a Brighter Outlook for Investors’ Portfolios
summary: Vanguard Group forecasts a brighter outlook for investors, primarily due to higher bond yields that now offer meaningful contributions to portfolios. While stock valuations remain stretched in the U.S., increasing interest rates have made fixed-income investments more attractive, particularly government bonds. Vanguard's long-term forecasts suggest improved returns for both bonds and stocks compared to recent years, highlighting a more balanced investment landscape.

title: Salesforce looks to sublease Tableau HQ building in Seattle
summary: Salesforce is looking to sublease over 200,000 square feet of space in the NorthEdge building, which serves as Tableau's headquarters in Seattle. This move follows a previous statement from Salesforce about consolidating its presence by shedding all Tableau-devoted office space except for one location near Gas Works Park. The article highlights Salesforce's ongoing strategy to adjust its real estate footprint related to Tableau.

title: Everything you need to know about Salesforce’s Q1 2024 financial results
summary: Salesforce, Inc. reported increased first-quarter adjusted earnings in Q1 2024 ($1.69 per share) and revenue growth of 11% year-over-year to $8.25 billion. All key operating segments showed growth, driven by its generative AI ecosystem including Einstein GPT, Slack GPT, and Tableau GPT. CEO Marc Benioff highlighted the role of the Salesforce GPT Trust Layer in securing customer data and enhancing enterprise automation.

title: Salesforce Gives Forecast for Slowing Sales Growth in Push for Profit
summary: Salesforce Inc. experienced a significant stock drop after forecasting slower sales growth, signaling a shift in focus towards generating higher profits. Despite topping analysts' estimates for revenue, earnings, and operating profit margin in the fiscal first quarter, the company's lackluster outlook for future sales and unchanged annual revenue forecast led to a 4.7% stock decline. This indicates the market's reaction to the company prioritizing profit over rapid expansion.

title: Salesforce could be repositioning itself as a data company
summary: Salesforce's latest earnings report highlighted its fastest-growing segment, Data Cloud, suggesting a strategic shift towards becoming a data company. This move is driven by the increasing importance of data in the age of generative AI, where Salesforce's extensive customer data could offer a competitive edge. The company hopes this focus on data and AI will reignite revenue growth and redefine its role in the enterprise software landscape.

title: Salesforce shares drop on slowest revenue growth in more than 10 years
summary: Salesforce Inc (CRM.N) shares dropped about 7% after the company reported its slowest quarterly revenue growth in over 10 years, attributing it to companies cutting back on cloud-based software spending amid an uncertain U.S. economy and weaker demand. Despite the slowdown, analysts remained largely positive, citing Salesforce's push into AI and improved profitability as factors for future growth, leading to several price target increases.

title: Broadcom Stock Pulls into the Buy Zone: Analysts Raise Targets
summary: Broadcom's stock experienced a correction after rallying on AI-related news, despite reporting strong Q2 revenue and higher guidance. Analysts have responded by raising price targets, suggesting the company's uptrend is likely to continue. The company's performance was driven by a 9% increase in semiconductor solutions and robust free cash flow, with expectations for continued growth into Q3.

title: Salesforce CEO Benioff shakes up executive team with new hires
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has announced significant changes to the company's executive management team, including new hires for chief revenue officer and chief marketing officer. This shakeup occurs six months after the departure of co-CEO Bret Taylor and follows recent layoffs impacting 10% of Salesforce's global workforce. The changes aim to address challenges highlighted by Benioff, including a difficult economic environment and questions about new hire productivity.

title: Nvidia and Oracle back $270M funding round for generative AI startup Cohere
summary: Generative AI startup Cohere Inc. has secured $270 million in a Series C funding round with significant backing from Nvidia Corp., Oracle Corp., Salesforce.com Inc.'s venture capital arm, and SentinelOne Inc., led by Inovia Capital. Cohere, founded by former Google AI researcher Aidan Gomez (co-author of the Transformers paper), offers AI models via cloud APIs for tasks like text generation, summarization, and search, and is currently valued at $2.2 billion.

title: Is Salesforce’s Stock a Buy, Sell, or Fairly Valued After Earnings?
summary: Morningstar assesses Salesforce's stock after its Q1 2023 earnings report, deeming it fairly valued at $245 per share due to good results and a strong outlook for margins. While some cracks emerged in the Q2 outlook due to macro conditions and services weakness, the core thesis points for Salesforce around profitability and shareholder-friendly capital allocation remain unchanged. The company holds a wide economic moat and a high uncertainty rating, with both bull and bear cases presented for investors.

title: Workday hires Salesforce veteran as CMO
summary: Workday has announced the appointment of Emma Chalwin, a veteran from Salesforce, as its new Chief Marketing Officer. This move brings experienced leadership to Workday's marketing division. The article also touches on other marketing news, including AI's role in recent campaigns and agency accounts in review.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff: The AI wave will be ‘the biggest that anyone has ever seen’
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff believes that the current wave of artificial intelligence will be the most impactful technological shift ever seen, surpassing revolutions like cloud, social, and mobile. Salesforce is heavily investing in generative AI, launching "AI Cloud" to integrate AI capabilities into its products for businesses, including features that auto-generate content and code while prioritizing data security. Although some Wall Street analysts are positive about Salesforce's unified data strategy and privacy focus, there are concerns about the early monetization of GenAI and continued cautious customer spending affecting Salesforce's near-term outlook.

title: NetSuite ERP aims to reconcile the books faster
summary: NetSuite ERP is introducing a new module called NetSuite Account Reconciliation to automate and simplify account reconciliation processes for its customers. Built on Oracle Fusion Cloud EPM, this module aims to help medium-sized enterprises close their books faster and with greater accuracy. Industry experts believe this automation will significantly improve work-life balance for accounting professionals by reducing the burden of manual, tedious reconciliations.

title: 16 Top Austin Consulting Firms You Should Know
summary: Austin, known as "Silicon Hills" due to its burgeoning tech community, is experiencing significant growth, leading to an increased demand for consulting firms. This article highlights 16 top Austin-based consulting firms that cater to a diverse range of companies, from government agencies to global tech giants, offering services such as data management, business planning, IT, and specialized industry expertise. Each firm profile includes its location, focus areas, services, and notable clients to help businesses find the right partner for their specific needs.

title: More Loop Tenants Shy Away From Offices With Subleases
summary: PayPal and Omnicom Group have added a combined 122,000 square feet of office space to Chicago's sublease market, contributing to a record high of over 8 million square feet available. This increase highlights a trend where the amount of sublease space being added significantly outpaces leasing, driven by companies adapting to hybrid and remote work. The West Loop and Central Loop are particularly affected, holding the largest portions of the available sublease inventory.

title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: Michael Platt, Steve Cohen, Elliott Management, AQR Capital Management, Citadel LLC, Akamai Technologies, Inc. (AKAM), Salesforce, Inc. (CRM), and More
summary: This article summarizes recent hedge fund and insider trading news, including BlueCrest Capital Management's court win against a compensation claim, Steve Cohen's $5 million donation for psychedelic research, losses faced by funds betting against Ocado, and a Citadel portfolio manager moving to Marshall Wace. It also highlights a new study on hedge fund management fees varying by investment strategy.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock falls Friday, underperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) stock dropped 1.50% on Friday, closing at $210.09. This decline occurred during a broader market downturn, with both the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average also falling. The company's stock ended $14.91 below its 52-week high.

title: “Abysmal” Survey Results Show Cracks in Salesforce’s Culture
summary: A leaked internal survey of 57,000 Salesforce employees reveals widespread dissatisfaction concerning job security, management, and trust, following a tumultuous year of layoffs and executive changes. While ethical concerns were low, only a minority of employees believed the company was retaining talent or that senior leadership aligned with core values. Salesforce's HR head acknowledged the results and committed to improving culture and trust.

title: IBM to buy software co Apptio for $4.6 billion to bolster cloud offerings
summary: IBM announced it will acquire Apptio from Vista Equity Partners for $4.6 billion in cash to strengthen its cloud and automation capabilities. This acquisition comes as companies are trimming technology budgets, and IBM aims to integrate Apptio's software-as-a-service business to benefit its Red Hat, AI, and consulting divisions. The deal is expected to close in the latter half of 2023.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock rises Tuesday, still underperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. shares rose 0.70% on Tuesday, closing at $208.82, amidst a generally positive trading day for the broader market. Despite the gain, the stock underperformed both the S&P 500 Index and the Dow Jones Industrial Average. This increase ended a two-day losing streak for Salesforce.

title: AI Startup Typeface Raises $100 Million From Salesforce, GV
summary: Typeface Inc., an AI startup specializing in content creation services for businesses, has successfully raised $100 million in funding from investors including Salesforce Ventures and Alphabet’s GV. This investment values Typeface at $1 billion and increases its total fundraising to $165 million, reflecting growing investor interest in generative AI technologies.

title: Typeface lands $100M for its generative AI content creation engine
summary: Typeface Inc., a generative AI content creation platform, announced a $100 million Series B funding round, bringing its total raised to $165 million and valuing the company at $1 billion. The funding, led by Salesforce Ventures and other major VCs, will be used for sales and product development. Typeface's platform helps businesses automate and personalize content creation across various functions, including text and image generation, and has already secured partnerships with Salesforce and Google Cloud.

title: Vimeo (VMEO) CEO Sud to Step Down; Adam Gross Named Interim Chief
summary: Vimeo Inc. CEO Anjali Sud will step down from her position at the end of August. Board member Adam Gross will become interim CEO on September 1 while the company searches for a permanent replacement. Gross has been a member of Vimeo's board since May 2021 and previously held executive positions at Salesforce Inc.

title: Worldwide Public Cloud Services Revenues Surpass $500 Billion in 2022 -
summary: Worldwide public cloud services revenue reached $545.8 billion in 2022, a 22.9% increase from the previous year, with SaaS – Applications being the largest revenue source. Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Salesforce Inc., Google, and Oracle remain the dominant providers, collectively capturing over 41% of the global revenue. IDC predicts continued growth in foundational cloud services, especially IaaS and PaaS, driven by digital transformation and AI integration.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock outperforms competitors on strong trading day
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) shares increased by 3.93% to $221.17 on Tuesday, outperforming the broader market. This rise occurred during a favorable trading session where the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average also saw gains. This marks the stock's second consecutive day of increases.

title: Trading Analysis Tools - Analytics and Chart Tools
summary: FOREX.com offers a suite of trading analysis tools, including Performance Analytics powered by Chasing Returns to help traders refine their skills through behavioral science insights. The platform also provides advanced charts integrated with TradingView, offering extensive indicators, drawing tools, and customization options for technical traders. Additionally, users can access real-time market news from Reuters, expert market analysis, an economic calendar, and various alert features to keep track of market movements.

title: Digital Transformation Services
summary: EPAM offers integrated digital transformation services to help businesses adapt to changing customer expectations and remain competitive. Their approach involves defining a digital North Star vision, systems blueprinting, master planning, and developing, launching, and scaling new platforms and processes. EPAM leverages expertise in experience, business, technology, and data to drive fundamental change and optimize operations for growth.

title: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com launches own large language model, ChatRhino
summary: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com has launched its own large language model (LLM) called ChatRhino, aiming to integrate AI into various industrial applications. The company emphasizes that the value of LLMs will be realized through industrial use cases, with ChatRhino designed to offer targeted solutions across sectors like retail, logistics, finance, and healthcare by combining general data with intelligent supply chain data. This move reflects the broader Chinese tech industry's efforts to catch up with Western advancements in AI and aligns with the government's push to regulate LLMs.

title: ServiceNow CEO Bill McDermott: Generative AI Could Boost Global GDP By Almost $7 Trillion
summary: ServiceNow CEO Bill McDermott believes generative AI could boost global GDP by nearly $7 trillion, seeing it as a transformative moment comparable to the internet or iPhone. ServiceNow is integrating generative AI into all its workflow offerings and is partnering with Nvidia to accelerate customer value realization from AI. The company also reported strong second-quarter results, exceeding analyst expectations, driven by its role in digital transformation.

title: Slack Unveils New Sales-Specific Edition at $60 Per Month
summary: Salesforce Inc. has released a new sales-specific version of Slack, integrating it with Sales Cloud features, costing an additional $60 per month per user. This move is part of Salesforce's efforts to further integrate its largest acquisition, Slack, and will be followed by other specialized editions for customer service and marketing. Slack’s new CEO, Lidiane Jones, is focusing on product updates to drive these changes.

title: Akkio Closes $15 Million in Series A
summary: Akkio, a Cambridge, MA-based AI company specializing in generative analytics and machine learning, has successfully closed a $15 million Series A funding round. The investment, led by Bain Capital Ventures (BCV) and Pandome, Inc., will be used to accelerate the commercialization of Akkio's user-friendly and affordable AI platform. This platform enables businesses to leverage AI, including GPT-4, for insights, visualizations, and predictive modeling without coding, making advanced AI accessible to small and medium-sized businesses.

title: PhishForce: New phishing attack involving Salesforce and Facebook uncovered
summary: Security researchers at Guardio Labs have uncovered a new, sophisticated phishing attack dubbed "PhishForce" targeting Salesforce customers. This attack cleverly spoofs Salesforce email servers and domain names and uses legitimate email gateways to hide malicious emails that redirect users to phishing pages designed to steal Facebook account details. Both Salesforce and Facebook have been notified and have taken steps to address the vulnerability.

title: Salesforce launches Einstein Studio: What you need to know
summary: Salesforce has launched Einstein Studio, allowing customers to integrate their own large language models (LLMs) from various services with Salesforce Data Cloud without data movement. This platform provides a control panel for AI models, zero-ETL integration, and no-code tools, enabling businesses to leverage existing LLMs and accelerate AI investments for business use cases. Analysts highlight the strategic importance of this "bring your own model" approach for Salesforce and its customers, addressing model sprawl and data movement challenges.

title: Top 20 Atlassian Competitors and Alternatives
summary: This article identifies and details 20 major competitors and alternatives to Atlassian, an Australian software company known for products like Jira and Confluence. The list includes technology giants such as Microsoft, IBM, Google Workspace, and ServiceNow, as well as specialized platforms like GitLab, Asana, and Slack. Each competitor's founding year, headquarters, market focus, and key offerings are highlighted, demonstrating the diverse landscape of tools available for project management, collaboration, DevSecOps, and enterprise software.

title: Thunder Secures $16M in Investment From Recognize and Salesforce Ventures
summary: Thunder, a Salesforce and Cloud consulting company, announced it has secured $16 million in a Series A funding round. The investment was led by Recognize, with existing investor Salesforce Ventures also participating. This funding will support Thunder's global team expansion and fuel new cloud innovation, IP, accelerators, and programs to enhance customer services.

title: AWS and Five9 Become Leaders in 2023’s Gartner CCaaS Magic Quadrant
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Five9 have achieved leader status in Gartner's 2023 CCaaS Magic Quadrant, driven by their significant investments in innovation and market expansion respectively. AWS was recognized for its agile pricing and extensive partner network, while Five9's enterprise deployment growth and AI competency were key factors. Conversely, Talkdesk dropped out of the leader quadrant due to sales and service operation cautions outside of Europe and the US, despite its continued growth.

title: 9 customer journey mapping tools that can improve your CX
summary: This article explores nine customer journey mapping tools that can help companies improve their customer experience (CX) by analyzing customer paths across various channels. It discusses key features to consider when choosing a tool, such as ease of use, flexibility, collaboration, and integration capabilities. The article also provides a list of specific tools, ranging from simple diagramming software to comprehensive customer experience platforms.

title: Ready for Whatever Is Next Thanks to a Cutting-Edge CRM Platform
summary: The article highlights how Ncontracts, a risk and compliance management company, leveraged Salesforce's CRM platform to support its pivot to remote work and achieve steady growth. Salesforce provided a unified view of customer data and extended capabilities through Appexchange, enabling Ncontracts to efficiently manage its expanding customer base. The partnership emphasizes the importance of strategic technology adoption and continuous innovation for business success.

title: Jim Cramer calls Monday.com a 'junior' Salesforce
summary: Shares of Monday.com surged 11% after the company reported strong quarterly results that surpassed analyst estimates for both earnings and revenue. CNBC's Jim Cramer referred to Monday.com as a "junior" Salesforce, noting its impressive 42% year-over-year revenue growth. This performance suggests a potential rebound for the enterprise software sector, which has recently faced pressure.

title: Activists back off Salesforce after share price recovery
summary: Several activist investors, including Starboard Value and Third Point LLC, have cut their stakes in Salesforce Inc. or exited completely after the company's share price recovered due to better-than-expected results, cost cuts, and strategic changes. The shift in investor sentiment follows a period of heavy criticism and pressure on Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff earlier in 2023, with the stock surging 57% since January.

title: ‘All a lie’: Former exec hits Salesforce with fiery allegations
summary: A former Salesforce executive, Karl Wirth, has filed a lawsuit against the company, alleging retaliation and fraud. Wirth claims that Salesforce's "Genie" software, announced at Dreamforce last year, was falsely advertised as real-time, despite his internal warnings that the technology was not ready. He was fired shortly after raising concerns with key executives.

title: VF Corp. Taps Gap, Salesforce Vet as Chief People Officer
summary: VF Corp. has appointed Brent Hyder, a veteran from Gap Inc. and Salesforce, as its new chief people officer, effective September 5th. Hyder will report to CEO Bracken Darrell and oversee global human resources, focusing on talent acquisition, development, and retention during VF's ongoing turnaround. This executive change follows recent financial challenges for the company, including widened net losses and an 8% revenue decline in the first quarter.

title: Report: AI startup Hugging Face hoping to raise millions from Salesforce and other investors
summary: AI startup Hugging Face is reportedly seeking to raise $200 million in venture capital, with Salesforce Inc. expected to lead the funding round. This investment would more than double Hugging Face's current $2 billion valuation, bringing it to $4 billion. The funds will support its platform which hosts over 100,000 open-source AI models and offers paid functionalities like AutoTrain and Inference API.

title: Salesforce boosts field service support features
summary: Salesforce Inc. has extended its Service Cloud features to better support field service workers with new AI-powered capabilities. These enhancements include customer self-booking, improved job duration prediction, ensuring field workers have necessary equipment, and reserving work capacity in advance. The goal is to increase efficiency and attract new talent to skilled trades by providing modern technological tools.

title: Building a Retail Media Business – Challenges and Solutions for Retailers
summary: This article discusses the challenges retailers face in building and scaling a retail media business, dubbed the "third wave of digital advertising." It emphasizes understanding goals, strategic technology integration, and developing strong delivery teams. Experts from Kellogg's, Criteo, and GoPuff Ads contribute insights on the importance of robust tech ecosystems, data access, and tailored approaches for success.

title: Leveraging Generative AI to Build Personalized Customer Journey Mapping
summary: This report details how marketing teams are utilizing Generative AI (GenAI) for customer personalization and workflow improvements. Based on a survey of 100 marketing professionals, it highlights GenAI's role in content creation, personalization, and the use of synthetic data, while also addressing its integration with existing marketing automation platforms. The findings indicate widespread adoption and positive impacts on efficiency, suggesting GenAI is a valuable, though not always central, tool for future customer journey mapping.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff warns upcoming Dreamforce may be last in San Francisco
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has warned that the upcoming Dreamforce conference might be the last held in San Francisco if issues like homelessness and open drug use continue to affect the city. The conference is a significant event for San Francisco, expected to draw 40,000 people and inject $57 million into the local economy, with Salesforce being the city's largest private employer. Benioff's warning comes despite a donation for homeless programs, highlighting potential consequences if the city's condition impacts the event.

title: CRM Earnings: A snapshot of Salesforce’s Q2 2024 financial results
summary: Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE: CRM) reported strong financial results for the second quarter of 2024, with adjusted earnings increasing significantly to $2.12 per share from $1.19 per share in the prior year. Revenues for the quarter grew 11% year-over-year to $8.60 billion, with all key operating segments showing growth. Unadjusted profit also saw a substantial rise to $1.27 billion, or $1.28 per share, compared to $68 million, or $0.07 per share, in the corresponding period of 2023.

title: Salesforce CEO says San Francisco homelessness, drug use could force relocation of Dreamforce conference
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has warned that ongoing issues with homelessness and drug use in San Francisco could lead to the relocation of the company's annual Dreamforce conference. This major event brings 40,000 people and $57 million to the city's economy. Benioff emphasized the importance of a successful conference for both Salesforce and the city, which is also preparing to host the APEC leaders' meeting.

title: PwC, Slalom, Infosys Named Among Top Salesforce Partners
summary: PwC, Slalom, and Infosys were recognized among the top Salesforce partners in the 2023 Salesforce Partner Innovation Awards. These awards highlight partners who excel in using various technologies to enhance customer experience, with AI integration playing a significant role this year. The Salesforce partner ecosystem, comprising 200,000 certified professionals, is crucial to customer success and accounts for 70% of implementations.

title: Jotform | Powerful online forms and workflow automation for Salesforce now available on the Salesforce AppExchange
summary: Jotform has launched Jotform for Salesforce on the Salesforce AppExchange, integrating its form automation tools directly with Salesforce accounts. This integration provides Salesforce customers access to Jotform's suite of products, including a no-code form builder and workflow automation, to streamline data collection and reduce manual tasks. The collaboration aims to empower organizations to make critical decisions and improve lead generation by efficiently managing data.

title: Bank of America most favored for activism defense in first half of 2023, LSEG data show
summary: Bank of America has emerged as the top financial adviser for companies facing activist investors in the first half of 2023, advising on 33 campaigns, according to LSEG data. This marks a significant jump from its fifth-place ranking a year ago, surpassing rivals like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase. Sidley Austin remained the leading law firm for corporations in defense, while Olshan Frome Wolosky was the busiest working for activists.

title: How Blackstone Sprinted Ahead of Its Peers in AI
summary: Blackstone, the world's largest alternative-asset manager, has aggressively integrated artificial intelligence into its operations thanks to a directive from CEO Stephen Schwarzman. The firm uses AI for risk assessment, demand forecasting, dealmaking, and optimizing its portfolio companies, leveraging its massive amount of proprietary data. While facing industry-wide concerns about cybersecurity and job displacement, Blackstone believes AI provides a significant competitive advantage and plans to double its assets under management with AI-driven strategies.

title: McKinsey teams up with Salesforce to deliver on the promise of AI-powered growth
summary: McKinsey and Salesforce have announced a new collaboration to accelerate the introduction of trusted generative AI for sales, marketing, commerce, and service. This partnership will combine Salesforce's CRM technologies with McKinsey’s AI and data models to improve customer experiences, increase sales productivity, and personalize marketing. The collaboration aims to help companies realize the potential of generative AI, which McKinsey research estimates could unlock $4.4 trillion in global productivity.

title: SAP Versus Salesforce: Who’s World’s Third-Largest Software Vendor?
summary: This article analyzes the competition between SAP and Salesforce for the title of the world's third-largest software vendor, behind Microsoft and Oracle. While Salesforce recently surpassed SAP in quarterly revenue, SAP maintains a lead in trailing-12-month revenue. The author projects that SAP is poised to solidify its lead due to its faster-growing cloud business.

title: OpenAI’s Sam Altman tells Salesforce’s Marc Benioff that AI ‘hallucinations’ are more feature than bug
summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman suggested to Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff that AI "hallucinations" should be seen as a feature, not a bug, emphasizing their creative potential. This discussion took place at the Dreamforce conference where Salesforce rolled out new AI products, integrating with platforms like Google Workspace. Altman's perspective highlights a focus on generative AI's creative capabilities over its strict adherence to factual accuracy.

title: Northfield Bank Reports Third-Party Data Breach Stemming from Vendor’s Use of MOVEit
summary: Northfield Bank announced a third-party data breach caused by one of its vendors using the MOVEit file transfer application, which suffered a critical vulnerability. The breach exposed sensitive customer information including names, account numbers, Social Security numbers, and online banking usernames.
