Although Northfield Bank's own network was not affected, customers are at an increased risk of identity theft due to the compromised data held by the vendor.

title: Salesforce to hire 3,300 people after layoffs earlier this year, Bloomberg reports
summary: Salesforce Inc. is planning to hire 3,300 new employees across various departments, including sales, engineering, and data cloud product development. This move comes after the company cut 10% of its workforce in January following rapid pandemic hiring. CEO Marc Benioff stated the hiring is essential for growing the company and maintaining strong margins.

title: In Silico Part - IV : AI and its impact on labor, productivity, and tech-driven deflation
summary: This article examines the uncertain macroeconomic impacts of Artificial Intelligence, focusing on its potential effects on labor, productivity, and deflation. It discusses AI's role in creative destruction, its likelihood of augmenting rather than fully replacing human labor in the near term, and its historical and future contributions to productivity growth and deflationary pressures. The authors conclude that AI is anticipated to boost productivity and exert deflationary forces, while acknowledging that long-term labor displacement is possible, leading to the creation of new job categories.

title: Another San Francisco Bay Area Tech Giant Will Lay Off Hundreds
summary: Cisco Systems Inc. is set to lay off 350 workers across its Milpitas and San Jose offices, effective October 16, adding to previous cuts this year. The company stated these layoffs are part of a strategic transformation rather than cost-cutting, emphasizing investment prioritization and support for affected employees. These job reductions occur amidst a general slowdown in tech layoffs in the Bay Area after a peak earlier in the year.

title: Salesforce turns to 'boomerangs,' luring back former execs to help reignite growth
summary: Salesforce is actively recruiting former executives, dubbed "boomerangs," to help reaccelerate growth and navigate a challenging economic environment. At least eight executives have rejoined the company this year, including Ariel Kelman as chief marketing officer and Miguel Milano as chief revenue officer. This strategy is part of a broader effort to refine sales and marketing approaches following workforce reductions and pressure from activist investors, with the company focusing on making the most of existing products and improving efficiency.

title: Avalara Shares New Integrations and APIs in Advance of Avalara NEXT, Its Annual Virtual Conference for Developers
summary: Avalara announced new APIs and integrations ahead of its annual virtual conference, Avalara NEXT, taking place September 20-21, 2023. These new offerings include the first tax compliance provider integration for Salesforce Service Cloud and the launch of AvaTax for Accounts Payable API. Additionally, Avalara is expanding its Avalara E-Invoicing and Live Reporting (ELR) solution, now available for Oracle Cloud Fusion ERP, and introducing five new API extractors to streamline data for Avalara Returns for Accountants.

title: Persona-Powered Onboarding for Better Employee Engagement and Retention
summary: The article discusses the evolution of employee onboarding in the hybrid digital workplace, emphasizing the shift from traditional in-person processes to tailored, persona-based experiences. It highlights how organizations are leveraging digital tools and insights to create customized onboarding journeys that address the diverse needs of remote and hybrid employees, ultimately aiming to boost engagement and retention. The piece also stresses the importance of balancing technology with human connection to create a truly inclusive and productive workplace.

title: 11 Five9 Contact Center Features for Incredible CX
summary: This article details eleven key Five9 contact center features designed to enhance customer experience (CX). It highlights Five9's commitment to leveraging AI, offering robust omnichannel capabilities, and providing tools for agent assistance, productivity, and workforce management. The platform aims to provide a scalable, customizable, and integrated solution for businesses to improve customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

title: SAP brings the energy of generative AI to platform with Joule
summary: SAP has introduced Joule, a natural language, generative AI Co-Pilot designed to transform business operations and improve productivity across its cloud applications. Joule will be embedded across SAP's portfolio, starting with SuccessFactors and SAP Start site in late 2023, and expanding to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, SAP Customer Experience, SAP Ariba, and SAP Business Technology Platform in 2024. This new AI assistant aims to streamline tasks, provide data insights, generate content, and maintain data privacy, reinforcing SAP's commitment to responsible Business AI.

title: Salesforce + Contentstack Composable Commerce Accelerator
summary: EPAM's Composable Commerce Accelerator leverages Contentstack's Digital Experience Platform and Salesforce Composable Commerce to deliver advanced, customizable commerce experiences. This accelerator enhances personalization through modular Salesforce Commerce and Einstein AI capabilities, streamlines content management for marketers via an integrated loop, and allows for rapid feature deployment and cost reduction through API-driven, independent services.

title: What’s Changed: 2023 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Sales Force Automation Platforms
summary: This article summarizes Gartner's 2023 Magic Quadrant for Sales Force Automation Platforms, identifying 13 significant providers. It categorizes vendors into Leaders, Challengers, Niche Players, and Visionaries, detailing their key solutions, recent updates, and differentiating strengths. The report highlights Salesforce, Microsoft, and Oracle as Leaders, and discusses emerging trends like generative AI and enhanced mobile capabilities within SFA solutions.

title: What Is a CTA and Why It Matters In Marketing (Plus Cool CTA Examples)
summary: This article explains what a Call-to-Action (CTA) is and why it's crucial for digital marketing conversions. It highlights how strong CTAs transform visitors into customers, providing statistics on their effectiveness and offering best practices for creating and optimizing them, including clarity, urgency, and personalization. The article also covers how to measure CTA performance using metrics like Click-Through Rate, Cost Per Click, and Conversion Rate, and provides examples from Spotify, CrazyEgg, and ClickUp.

title: ConocoPhillips goes global with digital twins
summary: ConocoPhillips is expanding its use of digital twin technology across its entire portfolio after initial successes in its major fields, aiming to optimize safety and efficiency. This global program, awarded a 2023 CIO 100 Award, helps the company maximize extraction from existing assets, manage volatile industry prices, and reduce GHG emissions. The company is developing a common platform and community to accelerate deployment and connect digital twins with other systems for greater insights and value.

title: America First Legal Files Federal Civil Rights Complaint Against Salesforce for Race and Sex-Based Discrimination; Warns Management of Violations of Fiduciary Duties
summary: America First Legal (AFL) has filed a federal civil rights complaint against Salesforce, Inc. with the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC), alleging race and sex-based discrimination in its hiring and promotion practices. AFL claims Salesforce uses a "Racial Equity and Justice Taskforce" and gender-discriminatory hiring programs with "representation goals as part of our executive compensation programs." The organization also sent a letter to Salesforce’s Board of Directors, accusing management of violating its fiduciary duty to shareholders.

title: theNET | Phishing keeps evolving
summary: Phishing attacks are continuously evolving, moving beyond simple malicious links to exploit human behavior across multiple communication channels. Attackers are increasingly adept at brand impersonation and bypassing email authentication checks, making traditional security measures less effective. Modern defense strategies emphasize cloud email security, layered protection, and a zero-trust model to combat these sophisticated threats.

title: Mphasis strengthens Salesforce capabilities with acquisition of Silverline, a Salesforce partner
summary: Mphasis has announced the acquisition of Silverline, a digital transformation consultancy and Salesforce partner, to enhance its Salesforce capabilities. This acquisition aims to reinforce Mphasis' position as an end-to-end Salesforce enterprise cloud solutions provider and capitalize on growing opportunities including Generative AI within the Salesforce ecosystem. The integration will allow Mphasis to offer advanced digital experiences, expand its global reach, and drive AI-led innovation for clients.

title: 70% of Companies Use AI, Other Tech to Optimize Business Travel: Weekly Stat
summary: A significant majority, 70% of companies, are now utilizing AI and other technologies to streamline and manage aspects of business travel, according to new data from American Express’ Trendex Business Travel Edition. These technologies aim to improve visibility and governance over employee spending, particularly through generative AI's ability to monitor and predict expenses. The article also highlights a shift towards virtual cards for business travel, with 73% of current users planning to increase their use, due to enhanced security, customization, and cash flow management.

title: JLL completes transactions at notable Buckhead highrise
summary: JLL announced two significant office deals at Salesforce Tower in Buckhead, Atlanta, including Rubicon's renewal of its 6,338-square-foot lease and Clearent by Xplor signing a new 18,134-square-foot lease. These transactions highlight continued demand for high-quality, amenity-rich office spaces in prime locations like Buckhead, where firms seek attractive environments for their employees. The Salesforce Tower boasts amenities such as a premium fitness facility, collaborative spaces, and access to public transport, confirming its appeal as a destination workplace.

title: Predictions 2024: Automation Influenced By LLMs, Regulators, And Enterprise App Vendors
summary: In 2024, automation will be significantly influenced by large language models (LLMs), regulators, and enterprise application vendors. LLMs, acting as autonomous workplace assistants (AWAs) or "digital coworkers," will automate 10% of operational processes, while autonomous product deliveries will surpass robotaxi transit in adoption. Enterprise app vendors will also disrupt the digital process automation (DPA) market, capturing a substantial portion of new automation spending.

title: Gen Digital Confirms CCleaner Experienced MOVEit Related Data Breach
summary: Gen Digital has informed CCleaner users of a data breach stemming from a vulnerability in the MOVEit file-transfer software. The breach, confirmed by an investigation, allowed unauthorized access to sensitive consumer information including names, contact details, and product purchase history. Affected individuals are advised to understand their risks and legal options, as Gen Digital began sending out notifications on October 25, 2023.

title: CarMax takes gen AI for spin
summary: CarMax is utilizing generative AI, specifically GPT-3.5, to summarize customer car reviews for its website. An SEO team implemented this to efficiently gather detailed insights on specific makes and models, addressing the challenge of processing thousands of reviews manually. While many executives recognize AI's potential, actual implementation is slow due to concerns about regulatory requirements, data understanding, and developing clear use cases, highlighting CarMax's experimental approach within a specific team rather than a company-wide mandate.

title: Time Is On Your Side (Seriously)
summary: A recent PCT survey revealed that 55% of pest management professionals (PMPs) prioritized reducing task time, leading to increased productivity and efficiency in the past year. This article details six key areas—routing, training, communication, equipment, office/admin, and workday adjustments—where PMPs made improvements, emphasizing the importance of technology and process optimization. Companies adapted to rising costs and labor shortages by focusing on strategies like route density, specialized training, enhanced internal communication, and software integration to boost their bottom line and improve work-life balance for technicians.

title: Fujitsu strengthens Salesforce Marketing Cloud business through share purchase agreement with Japanese market-leader toBe Marketing
summary: Fujitsu announced its acquisition of toBe Marketing, a top Japanese firm in Salesforce marketing automation, through a share purchase agreement. This acquisition, expected to close in December 2023, strengthens Fujitsu's enterprise cloud business and enhances its Fujitsu Uvance strategy by adding marketing automation expertise to its existing SFA/CRM capabilities for comprehensive Salesforce Customer360 support. toBe Marketing will operate as "toBe Marketing, a Fujitsu company" and contribute to Fujitsu's goal of improving customer value through digital transformation and sustainability transformation.

title: Slack to Name CEO ‘Soon’ After Second Executive Departure in Less Than a Year
summary: Slack CEO Lidiane Jones is departing the company to become the CEO of dating app Bumble Inc., making her the second leader to leave Slack in less than a year. Jones announced in a memo that her successor as Slack CEO would be named "very soon" and that she would help with the transition through the end of the year. This marks a significant leadership change for Salesforce Inc.'s workplace communication unit.

title: Austin-based dating app Bumble finds a new match with current Slack CEO
summary: Whitney Wolfe Herd is stepping down as CEO of Austin-based dating app Bumble, effective January 2, 2024, and will transition to Executive Chair. Lidiane Jones, current CEO of Slack, will take over as Bumble's new CEO. This leadership change comes amidst a fluctuating stock value for Bumble since its 2021 IPO.

title: Microsoft is named a Leader in 2023 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for the CRM Customer Engagement Center
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2023 Gartner Magic Quadrant for CRM Customer Engagement Center, a testament to its fast-paced innovation and customer success, especially with the integration of generative AI capabilities through Copilot. This recognition highlights Microsoft's end-to-end CRM solutions and cloud functionality, empowering organizations like Lufthansa Cargo and Xiaomi to modernize customer service with AI-enhanced platforms like Dynamics 365. The company continues to evolve its offerings to provide differentiated, best-in-class service experiences, streamline operations, and deliver consistent, personalized customer interactions.

title: Principal Financial unifies IT to lay foundation for growth
summary: Principal Financial Group is unifying its IT operations under CIO Kathy Kay to create a holistic data and cloud architecture. This centralization aims to improve customer experience, leverage advanced AI technologies, and better compete in the financial services market, particularly after acquiring Wells Fargo’s Institutional Retirement and Trust business. The company is actively adopting cloud solutions, machine learning models, and exploring generative AI to modernize its services and drive new revenue streams.

title: Commvault re-integrates Metallic service into expanded security cloud
summary: Commvault Systems Inc. has launched Commvault Cloud, an integrated cloud offering that combines its SaaS and packaged software products with a focus on cyber resilience, AI for threat diagnosis, and recovery. This new platform re-integrates the Metallic Cloud Storage Service and introduces Arlie, an AI "co-pilot," to simplify cybersecurity tasks and enhance recovery capabilities. The service also includes features like Cloudburst Recovery, Cleanroom Recovery, and Platinum Resilience, aiming to address the increasing complexity of cyber incidents and ensure rapid data recovery.

title: Slack’s Latina CEO Lidiane Jones Brings Tech Expertise To Bumble, Replaces Founder As CEO
summary: Bumble has announced that Lidiane Jones, current CEO of Slack, will replace founder Whitney Wolfe Herd as CEO starting next year. Jones, with a strong background in tech from companies like Microsoft, Sonos, and Salesforce, will bring her expertise to Bumble, particularly focusing on integrating AI into the platform. This leadership change comes as the dating app market faces challenges, with Bumble's stock significantly down since its IPO.

title: HEC Montréal’s Tech3Lab: $18 million for accelerating digital transformation in organizations
summary: HEC Montréal's Tech3Lab has secured a historic $18 million in funding over five years, the largest research funding in the School's history, to accelerate digital transformation and enhance user experience (UX) in organizations. This funding, from NSERC, PROMPT, and 13 industry partners, will support two research programs focused on developing user-friendly technological interfaces and improving UX measurement methods. The initiative also aims to train the next generation of UX experts, offering unparalleled opportunities for students through collaborations with industrial partners.

title: 3 undervalued artificial intelligence stocks
summary: This article identifies three undervalued artificial intelligence stocks—Snowflake, Cognizant Technology Solutions, and Salesforce—according to Morningstar analysts, while also highlighting dominant but fairly valued AI players like Nvidia and Microsoft. It emphasizes the significant impact of generative AI and offers insights into how investors can approach the AI boom by breaking down the space into various themes and subthemes with representative companies. The piece also notes the strong rally in AI stocks following ChatGPT's release and details the economic moats and fair value estimates for the featured companies.

title: OpenAI Says Sam Altman to Return as CEO in Dramatic Reversal
summary: Sam Altman is set to return as CEO of OpenAI after being ousted less than a week prior, following intense negotiations and pressure from investors like Microsoft and nearly all of the company's employees. The agreement includes a new initial board of directors led by Bret Taylor, with Larry Summers and Adam D’Angelo, and an internal investigation into the conduct that led to Altman's dismissal. This dramatic reversal comes after widespread calls for Altman's reinstatement and highlights the significant influence of investors and employees on the future of the AI startup.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock rises Friday, outperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) stock rose 0.24% on Friday, closing at $224.38, outperforming the broader market. This increase ended a two-day losing streak for the company's shares. The S&P 500 Index and the Dow Jones Industrial Average also saw gains on the same trading day.

title: Winners and losers of Black Friday 2023
summary: Black Friday 2023 saw record online spending of $9.8 billion, a 7.5% increase from the previous year, with mobile shopping dominating. Despite this, some analysts lowered their overall holiday season forecasts due to cautious consumer spending influenced by inflation, leading retailers to offer deals earlier. While mobile and online sales thrived, traditional in-store doorbuster events saw reduced urgency, reflecting a shift in consumer behavior towards patiently waiting for better discounts and utilizing more convenient shopping methods like mobile.

title: Accenture Expands its Salesforce Capabilities with Acquisition of Incapsulate
summary: Accenture has acquired Incapsulate, a digital transformation consulting firm specializing in Salesforce solutions, to bolster its Salesforce capabilities, particularly in the public sector and financial services industries. Incapsulate's team of over 275 Salesforce practitioners and software engineers will join Accenture's Salesforce Business Group, enhancing Accenture's ability to drive digital transformation for clients. This acquisition strengthens Accenture's position as a leader in delivering large-scale Salesforce projects globally.

title: Salesforce soars 8% as cost cutting shows its ‘brand new religion’ to increase profits
summary: Salesforce stock soared over 8% after announcing a profit forecast that exceeded analyst estimates, driven by its aggressive cost-cutting measures, including workforce reductions and a focus on increasing profit margins. CEO Marc Benioff's strategy, dubbed a "brand new religion," has pleased Wall Street despite some concerns about revenue growth, as the company integrates acquisitions and introduces AI features.

title: Salesforce set to unveil downtown Chicago office tower
summary: Salesforce Inc. is preparing to open its new 60-story, 1.2 million-square-foot office tower in downtown Chicago on December 5th. The company will anchor the building, marking a significant development for the city's commercial real estate landscape.

title: 2024 Tech Trends in Retail: Insights to Attract and Retain Software Buyers
summary: This article analyzes retailer software purchasing behaviors based on Gartner Digital Markets' 2024 Tech Trends Survey, revealing that 57% of retailers plan to increase software spending, prioritizing marketing and IT, despite nearly half (49%) experiencing regret over past software purchases. Key drivers of regret include difficulty with user training, poor tech support, and higher-than-expected costs. The insights emphasize that software providers must address usability, support, and cost transparency while understanding nuanced buyer needs to mitigate churn and effectively target the retail market.

title: She conceived of Pottery Barn Kids. Now Williams Sonoma’s CEO is expanding another new business—furnishing hotels and stadiums
summary: Laura Alber, CEO of Williams Sonoma, is recognized as the longest-serving female CEO in the Fortune 500, having led the company for 13 years after starting as a senior buyer in 1995. Despite various market challenges like the retail apocalypse and housing slowdown, Williams Sonoma's stock has outperformed the market under her leadership. Alber is now focusing on new growth opportunities, including expanding the company's B2B business to furnish hotels and stadiums, international expansion, and integrating AI into home design services.

title: Guess walks inventory tightrope while retail buyers stay ‘very careful’ on purchasing
summary: Guess Inc. reduced its inventory by 2% year-over-year in Q3 while increasing sales and gross margin, contrasting with a 19% inventory spike in the prior year. This cautious approach is in response to broader market uncertainty and retailers maintaining lean inventory levels. Guess is focusing on dynamic supply chain management and technology adoption to meet demand without accumulating excess stock, aiming for a 10% YoY inventory reduction by fiscal year-end.

title: Salesforce Tower Chicago Makes Its Debut, Company Commits $1.25M in Grants
summary: Salesforce Inc. has officially opened its new Salesforce Tower Chicago, a 60-story, 1.2 million-square-foot office building in downtown Chicago, where the company is the anchor tenant. Coinciding with the grand opening, Salesforce announced $1.25 million in grants to support communities in Chicago and Illinois, benefiting organizations like CASEL and Peer Health Exchange. The tower also features "Ohana Floors" dedicated to employees, guests, and local nonprofits for fundraising events, which have collectively raised over $108 million.

title: Five9 Breaks General Policy to Quash Acquisition Rumors
summary: Five9 has issued a statement to deny recent market rumors, initially reported by Bloomberg, suggesting the company was exploring options for a sale. Although Five9 confirmed it was approached with an acquisition opportunity, it stated it is not pursuing any such deal. The article suggests that a Zoom acquisition is unlikely given Zoom's development of its own contact center platform and recent acquisitions, and speculates on other potential enterprise tech juggernauts if Five9 were considering an offer.

title: Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting 2023
summary: The 2023 Microsoft Annual Shareholders Meeting featured discussions on record financial results for FY23, strategic investments in AI, and responsible technology development. Key executives, including Satya Nadella, Amy Hood, and Brad Smith, addressed topics ranging from AI integration across product lines and revenue generation plans to safeguards against AI misuse, partnerships, and commitments to privacy and social responsibility. The meeting also covered the election of directors and various shareholder proposals.

title: Cohu moves to Oracle Cloud to boost efficiency, scale quickly
summary: Cohu adopted Oracle Cloud applications, including ERP, SCM, and CPQ, to standardize processes, improve efficiency, and accelerate integration of acquired companies. The move allowed the semiconductor equipment manufacturer to gain company-wide visibility, streamline supply chain operations, and enhance customer experience. This digital transformation, supported by Inspirage (Part of Accenture), has enabled Cohu to focus on business growth rather than system maintenance.

title: Salesforce’s Benioff Cashing Out at Rate of $3 Million a Day
summary: Marc Benioff, co-founder of Salesforce, has been consistently selling 15,000 shares of the company's stock, worth about $3 million, almost daily since July. This strategy has resulted in unloading over $475 million worth of shares through approximately 170 transactions this year, a practice he employs to fund charitable gifts. Experts view his systematic selling approach as a "safest" way for CEOs to diversify their holdings without significantly impacting stock prices or violating insider-trading rules.

title: IIT-BBS placement drive sees 200 offers in 10 days
summary: IIT-Bhubaneswar has received close to 200 job offers within the first 10 days of its ongoing placement drive, which began on December 1. This includes four international offers and a highest domestic package of Rs 64 lakh per annum. Despite a challenging global economic climate, the institution's placements are showing positive momentum, with computer science students receiving the most offers.

title: Midmark improves performance by up to 75 percent by migrating and running Oracle on Azure
summary: Midmark Corporation, a healthcare solutions provider, significantly improved its system performance by up to 75 percent through the migration of its business-critical Oracle environments to Microsoft Azure. Facing an explosion of on-premises data and aging infrastructure, Midmark utilized Azure DevOps pipelines and Terraform code to achieve greater flexibility, scalability, and better hardware. This successful transition has prompted Midmark to explore further Azure capabilities and adopt a cloud-first roadmap, benefiting employee perception and overall operational efficiency.

title: After Earnings, Is Adobe Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar raised its fair value estimate for Adobe to $610 from $510 per share after strong fourth-quarter earnings, despite management’s unclear communication regarding the impact of 2023 price increases. The company maintains a wide economic moat due to switching costs and network effects, particularly in its Digital Media segment. Although Adobe's stock is currently considered fairly valued, Morningstar sees better opportunities in other large-cap stocks like Microsoft, Salesforce, and ServiceNow.

title: nCino and Salesforce Expand Strategic Partnership to Further Modernize the Financial Services Industry
summary: nCino and Salesforce have expanded their strategic partnership to enhance cloud solutions for the financial services industry, building on a collaboration that began in 2011. This expanded agreement will deepen nCino's integration with Salesforce's CRM platform, powered by AI and automation, and Financial Services Cloud, aiming to modernize customer experiences for financial institutions. The partnership also includes updated commercial terms, expected to improve nCino’s subscription gross margins and extends the agreement through 2031.

title: Megatrends: How to Invest in the AI Boom
summary: This article from Morgan Stanley discusses investment opportunities in the rapidly growing artificial intelligence (AI) industry, projected to reach $3 trillion. It identifies four types of AI leaders for investors to watch: Margin Expanders, Trailblazers, Price Raisers, and Input Suppliers, while also cautioning about potential risks and the need for selective investing.

title: Will You be Hired by AI?
summary: A report from Citi Global Insights explores how artificial intelligence is transforming the job market for both candidates and employers. AI tools are being used to automate hiring processes, expand talent reach, and guide job seekers, significantly improving efficiency and reducing costs. While AI can increase market liquidity, it also necessitates more AI to manage the overwhelming volume of applications.

title: Prakash Khot
summary: Prakash Khot serves as the Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer at athenahealth, a position he has held since January 2016. In this role, he oversees all aspects of the company's technology vision, development, and the advancement of its core technology platform, athenaNet. Khot brings 24 years of experience from previous CTO and senior engineering roles at companies like Kaseya, Inc. and salesforce.com, inc., and holds degrees in Physics and Computer Applications.

title: Generative AI for HR: 3 Fascinating Use Cases for Practitioners
summary: This article explores how generative AI can transform HR systems from basic record keepers into intelligent agents, enhancing self-service, automation, and user experience. It highlights three key use cases for generative AI in HR: digital assistants, automating timesheet approvals, and improving new-hire onboarding. The author emphasizes the importance of choosing a trustworthy technology partner like ADP to manage security and privacy risks when implementing AI.

title: SAP Is a Leader in the 2023 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Configure, Price, and Quote Application Suites
summary: SAP has been recognized as a Leader in the 2023 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Configure, Price, and Quote Application Suites for the sixth consecutive year. This recognition is based on SAP's "ability to execute" and "completeness of vision" for its CPQ solution, which is a crucial component of SAP's quote-to-cash process, helping organizations manage sales opportunities and accelerate monetization. The article highlights customer success stories from Cleaver-Brooks and EXFO Inc., demonstrating how SAP CPQ improves sales efficiency and accuracy.

title: Zendesk acquires Klaus for AI-backed quality assurance in CX
summary: Zendesk has acquired Klaus, an Estonia-based vendor specializing in AI-powered quality assurance for customer service, to enhance its CX portfolio and workforce management capabilities. This acquisition aims to automate and improve QA processes for contact centers by using AI to analyze customer interactions, identify efficiency gaps, and provide agent coaching insights. This move, following the acquisition of Tymeshift, is seen as part of Zendesk's strategy to expand its offerings in AI and workforce management, driven by its private equity owners.

title: Accelerating Digital Transformation
summary: Subha Tatavarti, CTO of Wipro, has significantly accelerated the company's digital transformation, notably through the innovation division Lab45 and its Blockchain-powered DICE ID. DICE ID enhances digital identification and credential verification, putting users in control of their personal data. Tatavarti emphasizes India's tech-savvy population as a strong foundation for AI adoption and believes GenAI will empower individuals, making them more efficient rather than replacing jobs.

title: Dow’s customer experience overhaul yields tripling of online sales
summary: Dow Chemical Co. has dramatically transformed its customer experience, leading to a tripling of online sales and significant improvements in lead generation and call center efficiency. The overhaul, initiated in 2018 under CEO Jim Fitterling, involved implementing a centralized approach to customer sentiment analysis using Qualtrics and recognizing the intertwined nature of customer and employee experiences. This digital transformation, accelerated by changing buying patterns and the COVID-19 pandemic, has also led to lower inventory volumes and increased cash flow.

title: Monday.com review: Work management platform works best when you pay for it
summary: This review offers an in-depth look at Monday.com, a versatile "Work OS" designed for project management, process monitoring, and team collaboration. While it excels in power, flexibility, and ease of use, the review highlights that its full potential and most compelling features are unlocked in its paid tiers. The analysis covers pricing, core features like intelligent tables and integrations, low-code programming capabilities, and its workflow advantages compared to rivals, ultimately recommending the Standard tier for its value.

title: Asana vs. monday: Which Is Better for Your Business?
summary: This article compares Asana and monday, two popular project management platforms, to help businesses decide which is better suited for their needs. It details their features in project management, collaboration, reporting, integrations, and pricing. While monday excels in CRM functionalities and external communications, Asana is highlighted for its advanced project management capabilities, intuitive workflow automation, and sophisticated analytics for complex internal projects.

title: Blueshift Receives $40 Million Growth Investment
summary: Blueshift, a San Francisco-based company specializing in marketing engagement automation and personalization, secured $40 million in growth investment from Runway Growth Capital LLC. The funding will be used to scale operations and enhance its commitment to delivering personalized experiences for global brands. Blueshift leverages customer AI and generative AI to automate and personalize engagement across various marketing channels.

title: Eastman Energizes HR Reporting to Deliver One-Stop Insights to Leaders
summary: Eastman, a global specialty materials company, has transformed its HR reporting by implementing story reports in SAP SuccessFactors solutions, drastically reducing the time spent on report generation and providing real-time, data-driven insights to leaders. This shift from older technology to cloud-based HR solutions has enabled Eastman to make informed decisions about its workforce and optimize its people strategy with enhanced efficiency and user-friendliness. The company plans to further integrate data to track progress toward inclusion and diversity goals.

title: The 5 best monday.com alternatives
summary: This article reviews five alternatives to monday.com CRM, highlighting their strengths for small businesses. It identifies ClickUp for customization, Zoho CRM for customer service, Freshsales Suite for usability, HubSpot Free for marketing tools, and Pipedrive for integrations. The piece compares features, pricing, and specific use cases for each alternative, helping businesses choose the best fit.

title: Companies are struggling to keep private data safe from generative AI, Cisco says
summary: A new Cisco report indicates that despite corporate bans and restrictions on generative AI tools, employees are still entering private company data into them. The survey of 2,600 privacy and security professionals found that a significant number of companies have either banned or limited AI usage due to concerns about data leaks and intellectual property infringement. This highlights a struggle for companies to balance the benefits of AI with the imperative to protect sensitive information.

title: Salesforce slashes 700 jobs, adding to brutal string of 2024 tech layoffs
summary: Salesforce Inc. is reportedly laying off approximately 700 workers, continuing a trend of recent job cuts in the tech industry at the beginning of 2024. These layoffs affect less than 1% of its workforce and follow a 10% reduction a year prior, as the company focuses on cost-cutting and expanding profit margins under shareholder pressure. Other major tech firms like Microsoft, Google, and Amazon have also announced layoffs this month.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: Salesforce Inc. stock (CRM) experienced a 2.31% decline to $281.09 on Wednesday, marking its second consecutive day of losses. Despite this, the stock outperformed the broader market, as the S&P 500 Index (SPX) fell 1.61% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) decreased by 0.82% on the same dismal trading day.

title: ServiceNow Reports Fourth Quarter And Full-Year 2023 Financial Results
summary: ServiceNow reported strong Q4 and fiscal year 2023 financial results, exceeding expectations for both top- and bottom-line growth, largely attributed to AI integrations into its core products. The company also provided optimistic guidance for Q1 and full-year 2024, signaling an aggressive push into the CRM market. Despite facing competition from CRM giants, ServiceNow aims to carve out its own niche by leveraging its unified data model and generative AI innovations.

title: Microsoft Project Review: Features, Pricing & Alternatives
summary: This article provides a detailed review of Microsoft Project, evaluating its features, pricing, ease of use, customer support, and security. The review rates Microsoft Project at 3.4/5 and offers comparisons with alternatives like monday.com, Wrike, and Smartsheet. It concludes that while comprehensive, Microsoft Project has a steep learning curve and works best for specific use cases like software and product development.

title: Northern Trust invests in client services with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
summary: Northern Trust, a global financial firm, invested in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service to modernize its client services. This digital transformation addressed aging CRM systems and inefficient workflows, leading to faster response times, increased efficiencies, and a unified 360-degree view of client health and team performance. The initiative has significantly improved client engagement, compliance, and employee productivity across the company's asset servicing business.

title: Invisible Experiences: Anticipate Customer Needs With Real-Time Interaction Management
summary: This article discusses how Real-Time Interaction Management (RTIM) helps brands anticipate customer needs and deliver seamless, personalized, "invisible experiences." RTIM aims to provide peace of mind, build trust, and empower customers by offering contextually relevant solutions. The author highlights Forrester's latest Wave™ evaluation of RTIM vendors and resources for understanding and implementing RTIM.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock underperforms Tuesday when compared to competitors
summary: On Tuesday, Salesforce Inc. (CRM) shares fell by 1.15% to $286.39, marking its second consecutive day of losses. This decline occurred during a generally poor trading session, with the S&P 500 Index (SPX) dropping 0.60% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA) falling 0.17%. The company's stock underperformed its competitors amidst the broader market downturn.

title: Vice Media to stop publishing on its website, lay off 'several' hundreds
summary: Vice Media has announced it will cease publishing content on its website, vice.com, and lay off several hundred of its employees. CEO Bruce Dixon stated that distributing digital content is no longer cost-effective, and the company will focus on other distribution channels. This move reflects the ongoing financial struggles in the media industry, with many legacy and digital media brands facing job cuts or shutdowns.

title: All things AI with Melissa Waters
summary: Melissa Waters, CMO of Upwork, discusses her company's approach to AI, emphasizing a human-centered policy that prioritizes safety and responsible data handling. She details how Upwork's marketing teams are using AI tools like ChatGPT and Regie.ai to boost productivity, customize content, and expand their online presence. Waters also highlights the potential of AI for hyper-personalization in marketing and advises brands to encourage experimentation among employees while addressing concerns about job redundancy.

title: Top 25 Cloud Computing Companies of 2024
summary: The Software Report has released its list of the Top 25 Cloud Computing Companies of 2024, highlighting the industry's rapid growth and innovation. These companies, ranging from security and compliance solutions to managed services and IaaS, were selected based on market impact, revenue growth, product reliability, strategic vision, and sustainability efforts. Noteworthy awardees include Visma, Qualys, Cloudflare, Samsara, and Mirantis, each contributing significantly to the evolving cloud landscape.

title: George Mason University Engages Accenture to Transform Student Experience with Salesforce Education Cloud
summary: George Mason University has partnered with Accenture to implement Salesforce Education Cloud and new marketing solutions to enhance the student experience. This two-year agreement will initially focus on student success, recruitment, and admissions by aligning data through Education Cloud tools. The initiative aims to improve collaboration, streamline operations, and support individual student needs from recruitment through graduation.

title: Rimini Street Custom offers expanded third-party support
summary: Third-party support provider Rimini Street has launched "Rimini Custom," a new service offering tailored support packages for a wider range of enterprise applications beyond their traditional SAP, Oracle, and Salesforce systems. This initiative aims to help customers reduce the cost and complexity of managing heterogeneous IT environments. Industry analysts view Rimini Custom as a timely offering that addresses the challenges of SaaS spend and the need to manage diverse IT landscapes.

title: Transforming healthcare marketing technology with Chris Vitti of The Cigna Group
summary: Chris Vitti, Senior Director and Head of Marketing Technology at The Cigna Group, discusses how technology can bridge gaps in the healthcare customer journey, personalizing experiences and improving patient outcomes. He emphasizes the importance of modern marketing technology, embracing AI, and continuous learning for those aspiring to a career in the field. Vitti also highlights Cigna's mission and the impact of technology in transforming the healthcare industry.

title: 5 Best Mind Mapping Software & Tools (Free & Paid)
summary: This article reviews the five best mind mapping software and tools for project management, including options for free and paid users. It highlights FigJam for visual workflows, Miro for collaboration, Lucidchart for complex projects, Canva for custom graphics, and WorkCanvas by monday.com for integrations. The review provides detailed information on features, pricing, pros, and cons for each tool, helping businesses choose the best fit for their project visualization and collaboration needs.

title: OpenAI signs open letter to build AI responsibly just days after Elon Musk sued the company for putting profit ahead of people
summary: OpenAI, alongside other tech companies like Salesforce, has signed an open letter advocating for the responsible development of AI, emphasizing a collective responsibility to maximize benefits and mitigate risks. This initiative comes shortly after Elon Musk sued OpenAI, alleging it deviated from its founding mission by prioritizing profit over humanity's benefit. The letter, started by venture capitalist Ron Conway, compares AI's impact to historical innovations but does not detail specific actions for responsible development.

title: As Salesforce Legacy Growth Flatlines, Benioff Flips from Apps to Data
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff is rebranding the company as a "data company," shifting its focus from traditional applications as its legacy business growth flattens. This strategic pivot, driven by the AI Revolution and the rapid growth of Salesforce's Data Cloud, aims to inject new life into its core offerings and address the challenge of single-digit growth projections. Benioff emphasizes that AI is inseparable from data, positioning Salesforce to capitalize on this critical nexus in the evolving technology landscape.

title: Salesforce's CEO Marc Benioff sends Hawaii hospitals a $150M gift
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff and his wife Lynne have donated $150 million to Hawaii hospitals, including Hawai'i Pacific Health and Hilo Medical Center, to address infrastructure gaps and enhance specialized care. This gift is part of their broader philanthropic efforts in Hawaii, totaling over $250 million, and follows recent scrutiny over Benioff's land acquisitions in the state. The hospitals plan to use the funds for critical areas like ICUs, neurosurgical programs, and hospital renovations.

title: Tapestry Takes Data-Driven Approach to Customer Identification
summary: Tapestry, the parent company of Coach, Kate Spade, and Stuart Weitzman, is expanding its use of the Bluecore customer identification platform to enhance shopper recognition and understand customer movement. Following successful implementation for Coach and Stuart Weitzman, the technology will now be rolled out to Kate Spade New York, aiming to utilize data for insights into purchase intent, lifetime value, and product affinity. This initiative is part of Tapestry's broader strategy to leverage AI and data-gathering technologies across its value chain to improve consumer experience and individualized connections.

title: Elon to honor W. Lee Williams III and James S. “Chip” Mahan III with top entrepreneurship award
summary: W. Lee Williams III and James S. “Chip” Mahan III, founders of Live Oak Bancshares, will be honored with the 2024 Elon University Medal for Entrepreneurial Leadership. This marks the first time two individuals will receive the award simultaneously. The event will take place on March 21st, recognizing their significant contributions to the banking industry and their innovative impact.

title: 1How AI Enabled Smart Carts Can Bring Retail Into The 21st Century
summary: This article explores how AI-enabled smart carts can revolutionize the retail industry by addressing challenges like labor shortages, theft, and the demand for personalized shopping experiences. Despite past failures and slow adoption, new innovations in smart cart technology are making them more affordable, user-friendly, and capable of integrating with in-store media and CRM systems. The author suggests that these advancements, combined with aligning market conditions and a focus on positive user experience, could finally push smart carts into widespread use, potentially replacing self-checkout stations and funding adoption through new revenue channels.

title: News | Salesforce Cuts San Francisco Office Footprint by 45% Over Past Year — And It May Not Be Done
summary: Salesforce has significantly reduced its office footprint in San Francisco, cutting its leased or owned space by 45% over the past year to 900,000 square feet. This reduction is part of a broader corporate strategy that includes workforce cuts and offering an additional 2 million square feet for lease. The move reflects the ongoing struggles in San Francisco's office market, which faces high availability rates, although there's some optimism from recent AI company leases.

title: How Salesforce continues to bring generative-AI tools into its products with Einstein
summary: Salesforce is leveraging its Einstein framework to integrate generative AI tools into its products, making it one of the most innovative companies of 2024. Einstein allows enterprises to develop and deploy AI solutions within their CRM applications and other workflows, supporting both structured and unstructured data while ensuring data security. CEO Marc Benioff reported that 17% of the world’s 500 largest companies are now Einstein customers, contributing to over 10% revenue growth for the company last year.

title: Salesforce Inc. stock rises Tuesday, still underperforms market
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) stock gained 0.31% on Tuesday, closing at $301.45. Despite this rise, the stock underperformed the broader market, as the S&P 500 Index and Dow Jones Industrial Average saw larger gains. This marks the second consecutive day of increases for CRM shares.

title: Lisa Larson-Kelley
summary: Lisa Larson-Kelley is the founder and CEO of Quantious, an Inc5000 honoree and a trailblazer for women in the tech sector for nearly two decades. She specializes in bridging the gap between technology and marketing strategies, having worked with major companies like Meta, Google, Shopify, and Salesforce. The article also lists various articles she has authored for Inc., covering topics from AI implementation for executives to successful agency partnerships and avoiding burnout.

title: Dropbox Sign (Hellosign) vs DocuSign: Pricing, Features, Safety
summary: This article provides a comprehensive comparison between Dropbox Sign (formerly HelloSign) and DocuSign, two leading e-signature solutions, focusing on their pricing, features, and safety in 2024. It highlights DocuSign's greater customization and functionality versus Dropbox Sign's unlimited transactions, while also pointing out their respective limitations and suggesting PandaDoc as a potential alternative for more robust document creation and integration needs. The comparison also delves into user limits, transaction limits, and overall e-signature workflows for both platforms.

title: Salesforce looks to reinvent itself again with its fledgling AI business
summary: Salesforce is looking to reinvent itself by focusing on its burgeoning generative AI business, betting that this technology will transform both the company and the industry. The company, which previously led the software-as-a-service and cloud eras, believes it is well-positioned to capitalize on the estimated $40 billion gen-AI market, which Bloomberg Intelligence projects to skyrocket to $1.3 trillion over the next decade. This move comes despite skepticism from rivals also vying for dominance in this rapidly evolving tech space.

title: SLB to invest nearly $400 million in carbon capture company in push to scale technology
summary: SLB, formerly Schlumberger, is investing nearly $400 million in Norway's Aker Carbon Capture to accelerate the deployment of carbon capture technology. This investment supports SLB's goal of achieving $3 billion in revenue from its new energy business by the end of the decade, with carbon capture and storage expected to be a significant contributor. The deal, valued at approximately $380 million, is anticipated to close by the end of the second quarter.

title: Salesforce injects more AI into its B2B ecommerce platform
summary: Salesforce Inc. has upgraded its B2B commerce software, integrating new AI capabilities into its Commerce Cloud platform to enhance efficiency and revenue for B2B enterprises. The updates include AI-driven tools like Einstein Copilot for buyers, generative SEO optimization, and enterprise-scale cart features, along with integrated shipping, tax, and checkout services. These improvements aim to capitalize on the 17% growth observed in B2B ecommerce sales last year, according to a Digital Commerce 360 report.

title: Salesforce Selects Ironclad for Contract Lifecycle Management
summary: Salesforce has chosen Ironclad as its contract lifecycle management (CLM) platform to streamline contracting processes, increase deal velocity, and gain insights for its legal, sales, and procurement teams. The seamless integration between Ironclad and Salesforce is expected to empower teams to close deals faster, work more efficiently, and better manage risk, while providing real-time contract data for improved forecast accuracy. Ironclad, used by major innovators like L'Oréal and OpenAI, aims to redefine contracting on a global scale through this partnership and its AI capabilities.

title: HubSpot Acquisition Could Boost Google's Cloud Computing Business
summary: Alphabet (Google's parent company) is reportedly exploring its largest-ever acquisition by potentially buying HubSpot, a major online marketing software company. This strategic move aims to expand Google's presence in the lucrative customer relationship management (CRM) market and leverage its significant cash reserves. The potential deal raises important discussions about regulatory scrutiny, especially given the current antitrust environment under the Biden administration, and could significantly impact the competitive landscape for CRM providers like Salesforce and Microsoft.

title: An auction to have lunch with Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff to launch in early May
summary: A San Francisco nonprofit, Glide, will host a virtual auction from May 5-10 for a lunch with Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff, continuing a fundraising tradition previously held with Warren Buffett. The "Power of One Charity Lunch Auction" will begin bidding at $25,000, offering the winner lunch for eight. This initiative follows over two decades of similar auctions with Warren Buffett, which raised $53 million for the nonprofit's services for poverty, hunger, and homelessness.

title: Salesforce seeks competitive edge with its climate and nature action
summary: Salesforce is making climate and nature action a business priority, focusing on emissions reduction, carbon removal, ecosystem restoration, education, innovation, and policy. The company aims for net-zero emissions by 2050 and has developed a Nature Positive Strategy to measure and reduce its environmental impact. Salesforce also supports customers in their sustainability journeys through initiatives like Net Zero Cloud and the Nature Tech Alliance, leveraging both internal efforts and collaborations to drive competitive advantage and collective action towards a sustainable future.

title: Software giant Salesforce in advanced talks to buy Informatica
summary: Salesforce is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire Informatica, signaling increased deal-making in the technology sector. The potential acquisition would be Salesforce's largest since 2020 and follows recent scrutiny of its M&A strategy. Informatica, valued at about $11.35 billion, offers subscription-based data management services.

title: Insider Sell: Salesforce Inc (CRM) President and CFO Amy Weaver Sold 5,864 Shares
summary: Salesforce Inc's President and CFO, Amy Weaver, sold 5,864 shares of CRM stock for a total of $1,611,318.28 on April 16, 2024. This transaction adds to a pattern of 354 insider sells and no insider buys over the past year. The company's stock is currently considered modestly overvalued based on its price-to-GF-Value ratio of 1.11, with a P/E ratio of 65.79.

title: Slack’s new generative AI features now available for all paid customers
summary: Salesforce has rolled out new generative AI features for all paid Slack customers, including channel recaps, conversational search, and conversation summaries. These features aim to enhance productivity by helping users quickly catch up on information and find answers within their Slack content, with early adopters reportedly saving significant time. Slack AI is available as a $10 per user per month add-on and will continue to expand its capabilities, including integration with Salesforce's Einstein Copilot.

title: How to Find Cloud Software Company Stocks to Trade and Invest
summary: This article provides guidance on investing in cloud computing stocks, detailing different types of cloud services (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and key factors influencing stock performance like market demand and financial health. It offers investment strategies, including individual stocks (e.g., ServiceNow, Zoom) and ETFs (e.g., Global X Cloud Computing ETF), and lists major players like Amazon, Microsoft, and Adobe in the cloud software industry.

title: Salesforce abandons pursuit of Informatica, source says
summary: Salesforce has reportedly abandoned its talks to acquire data-management software firm Informatica after the two companies failed to agree on terms. The potential deal, which would have been one of Salesforce's largest acquisitions, had Informatica valued at about $11.2 billion, including debt, with shares discussed in the mid-$30s. Salesforce's history of significant acquisitions has faced scrutiny from activist investors, leading to recent changes in its M&A strategy.

title: CoStar revenue up 12%, but Homes.com advertising eats into profits
summary: CoStar reported a 12% increase in revenue for Q1 but saw net profits significantly decline due to heavy advertising spending for Homes.com. Despite the profit dip, CEO Andy Florance highlighted the success of Homes.com's agent subscription program and record traffic, asserting the platform's goal to become the top U.S. real estate portal. The company also announced the acquisition of Matterport to enhance its property data and digital listing experiences.

title: Salesforce Unveils New Feature to Boost Sales Productivity
summary: Salesforce has launched Salesblazer, a new Slack community designed to boost sales productivity by facilitating connections and knowledge exchange among sales professionals. The platform allows members to interact with experts, share tips, and access industry news, which Salesforce believes will enhance learning beyond traditional methods. This initiative aims to provide a digital home for salespeople to collaborate and improve their skills.

title: Salesforce Co-Founder Parker Harris on Why AI Keeps Him Up at Night
summary: Salesforce co-founder Parker Harris discusses the anxieties and challenges of integrating AI into enterprise software while maintaining quality and trust. He emphasizes the need for speed to catch up with rivals like Microsoft, despite concerns about AI's potential for inaccuracies. Harris and co-founder Marc Benioff realize they need to fully commit the company to AI development.

title: ServiceNow, Inc. (NYSE:NOW) Q1 2024 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: ServiceNow reported outstanding Q1 2024 results, outperforming guidance across all top-line and profitability metrics, driven by strong adoption of its GenAI offerings and strategic partnerships. The company's subscription revenue grew by 24.5% year-over-year in constant currency, and its GenAI product, Pro Plus, is the fastest-selling offering in company history. ServiceNow raised its 2024 top-line outlook despite FX headwinds, emphasizing its strong market position and the increasing relevance of its AI platform for business transformation.

title: Artificial Intelligence at Humana
summary: Humana, the fourth-largest health insurance provider in the U.S., utilizes AI through partnerships with naviHealth and Salesforce to support core business goals such as determining patient care duration and ensuring patient outreach. The company has faced scrutiny and lawsuits regarding its AI use for coverage decisions, especially concerning Medicare Advantage plans, which recent federal regulations are now restricting. Despite this, Humana has seen benefits like faster care delivery and significant cost savings through its AI implementations, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: 9 Top Data Classification Tools
summary: This article reviews nine top data classification tools designed to automate the process of finding, classifying, governing, and masking sensitive data. It details features, compliance support, and use cases for each tool, including Varonis, Fortra Digital Guardian, ManageEngine DataSecurity Plus, Satori, Imperva, OneTrust, Forcepoint, Atlan, and Securiti. The article emphasizes that these tools simplify compliance with various privacy regulations and enhance data security.

title: HubSpot CRM vs. Salesforce: Head-To-Head Comparison
summary: This article provides a detailed head-to-head comparison of HubSpot CRM and Salesforce, two leading customer relationship management solutions, for 2024. It evaluates both platforms across various criteria including pricing, core features, ease of use, customer support, data management, AI tools, reporting, and app integrations. The comparison aims to help businesses, particularly SMBs and large enterprises, determine which CRM best suits their specific needs and operational complexities, concluding that HubSpot is better for user-friendliness and affordability, while Salesforce excels in advanced features, customization, and AI capabilities.

title: Consider This Award-Winning Disruptive Tech ETF
summary: The article highlights the Fidelity Disruptive Technology ETF (FDTX), an award-winning actively managed fund providing exposure to disruptive tech companies. FDTX recently won the Best New U.S. Equity ETF award at the 2024 etf.com Awards and targets companies in areas like big data, cybersecurity, and AI. The fund's top holdings include Nvidia, Salesforce, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing.

title: Beyond Inc. expands investment in Salesforce to enrich customer experience
summary: Beyond Inc., owner of Bed Bath and Beyond, Overstock, and Zulily, is increasing its investment in Salesforce's data and marketing solutions to enhance customer loyalty and personalize shopping experiences. By integrating Salesforce Data Cloud and Marketing Cloud, powered by the Einstein 1 Platform, Beyond aims to unify customer data, gain insights into behavior, and execute targeted marketing campaigns. This strategy is expected to drive profitable customer engagement and deliver tailored online experiences akin to in-store shopping.

title: Salesforce Agrees to Settle ERISA Lawsuits
summary: Salesforce Inc. has agreed to a last-minute settlement in two class action lawsuits alleging that its $5 billion 401(k) plan charged participants excessive fees and breached fiduciary duties under ERISA. The settlement comes as a bench trial was set to begin, consolidating two separate lawsuits brought by plan participants. The plaintiffs in one lawsuit had requested over $5 million plus prejudgment interest to be distributed proportionally to affected individual accounts.

title: DocGo says hackers stole patient data in a recent cyberattack
summary: Mobile medical services provider DocGo has disclosed a cyberattack that compromised a limited number of healthcare records from its US-based ambulance transportation business. The company states that the incident has not had a material impact on its operations or financial condition and that it has contained the unauthorized activity. This incident highlights the heightened adversary activities targeting the healthcare sector, as seen in recent attacks on Change Healthcare and NextGen Healthcare.

title: EPAM Q1 Earnings Beat, Shares Fall on Downbeat FY24 Guidance
summary: EPAM Systems reported better-than-expected Q1 2024 earnings, but its shares dropped 27% due to a lowered full-year 2024 guidance amid a challenging demand environment. The company's Q1 revenues were in line with estimates but declined year-over-year, and while some segments like Life Sciences & Healthcare saw growth, others like Financial Services and Business Information & Media experienced declines. EPAM now projects lower revenue growth and slightly adjusted EPS for FY24, citing ongoing macroeconomic uncertainties.

title: Google Cloud Is the World's Hottest Major Cloud Vendor; Oracle, ServiceNow Tied for Second
summary: Google Cloud leads the Cloud Wars Top 10 as the fastest-growing major cloud vendor, with its Q1 growth accelerating to 28%. Oracle and ServiceNow are tied for second place, each increasing their cloud revenue by 25%. The article provides a detailed breakdown of the growth rates and cloud revenues for the top cloud companies, highlighting significant trends and challenges for each.

title: NTT DATA to Provide Digital Transformation Services for Salesforce
summary: NTT DATA has been selected by Salesforce to standardize and streamline Salesforce's internal application environment, including their internal instance of Salesforce. This partnership extends NTT DATA's role as a Salesforce reseller and AppExchange partner, leveraging its extensive experience in managed services and Salesforce expertise. The collaboration aims to help Salesforce focus on building new capabilities and utilizing data and AI for better insights and employee productivity.

title: MARC HASENFUSS: The difficulty in retrieving Brett Kebble’s lost treasure
summary: Randgold & Exploration Company is pursuing a 20-year-old claim to recover 22-million Randgold Resources shares unlawfully disposed of by Brett Kebble, along with $144m in dividends. The legal battle is against Gold Fields, which acquired Western Areas, the company involved in the original transaction. Despite Randgold's current low market capitalization, the potential retrieval of these assets, now representing hundreds of millions of dollars, could significantly impact its shareholders, although the outcome remains binary and uncertain.

title: Figma Sets $12.5B Valuation in New Equity Offering, Falling Short of Adobe's Acquisition Offer
summary: Figma has announced a tender offer for investors to sell shares at a $12.5 billion valuation, a 25% increase from its 2021 valuation but significantly less than Adobe's terminated $20 billion acquisition offer. The tender offer, expected to range from $600 million to $900 million, is backed by existing and new investors. This development follows the dissolution of the Adobe-Figma acquisition due to regulatory hurdles, highlighting Figma's independent growth despite the failed merger.

title: eBay Loses VP Communications As Michelle Friedman Moves On To Samsara
summary: Michelle Friedman, eBay's VP Global Communications, has left the company to become VP Communications at Samsara. Friedman joined eBay in September 2020, taking on the role shortly after the 2019 eBay Cyberstalking Scandal became public. Her departure comes as eBay is undergoing a significant strategy shift.

title: ServiceNow hires top talent from rival Salesforce
summary: ServiceNow has significantly expanded its workforce by hiring extensively from Salesforce, bringing in over 240 former Salesforce employees in the last year, including senior leadership. This aggressive recruitment strategy is contrasted with Salesforce's recent layoffs and ServiceNow's commitment to avoiding widespread job cuts. ServiceNow also embraces "boomerang hires" to retain talent, recognizing the evolving career paths of Gen Z and millennial employees.

title: This Top Dow ETF Is Crushing the Nasdaq and the S&P 500 Over the Last Month. Here's What That Means for the Market Rally.
summary: The article discusses the recent outperformance of the Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF (DIA) compared to the Nasdaq and S&P 500 over the last month. It suggests this trend indicates investors are becoming more defensive and rebalancing portfolios towards value and income, and away from growth stocks. The author recommends the SPDR Dow Industrial Average ETF as a low-cost option for investors seeking to increase exposure to blue-chip stocks and diversify beyond tech-heavy portfolios.

title: PagerDuty seeks to ease incident response with generative AI
summary: PagerDuty has announced enhancements to its Operations Cloud incident response platform, aiming to accelerate response and remediation of IT issues using generative AI. These new capabilities, including features within PagerDuty Copilot, are designed to significantly reduce the time taken to acknowledge and fix incidents by automating summarization, analysis, and conversational interactions for IR teams. An IDC analyst highlights the benefit of these integrated features within a single platform, consolidating functionalities that would typically require multiple disparate tools.

title: RBC rolls out AI-based tools to financial advisors
summary: RBC's U.S. wealth management arm has partnered with TIFIN AG to provide its financial advisors with AI tools designed to deepen client relationships and identify missed opportunities. The technology helps create ideal client profiles and detect significant financial events like inheritances, aiming to make it easier for advisors to prioritize client outreach and generate leads. The tool, which officially debuted in February to 2,200 advisors, analyzes money-in-motion events and demographic data to find prospects similar to ideal clients, reinforcing RBC's belief that AI enhances, rather than replaces, wealth management.

title: What You Need To Know Ahead of Salesforce's Earnings Report
summary: Salesforce is expected to release its first-quarter earnings report for fiscal 2025, with analysts projecting revenue of $9.15 billion and net income of $1.44 billion. Investors are keenly watching the company's data cloud segment for sustained growth and updates on the impact of artificial intelligence on its business. The Einstein 1 platform, which integrates AI, is also a key focus, though its revenue impact is not expected until later in fiscal 2025.

title: Kaseya Adds New Executive to C-Suite
summary: Kaseya has appointed Ryan Courson as its new chief operating officer and chief financial officer, sparking speculation about a potential IPO for the private equity-owned software provider. Courson brings extensive experience from both private equity and publicly held companies, with a background as CFO for several firms and as a technology investor. Kaseya CEO Fred Voccola stated that Courson's expertise is crucial for the company's objective of becoming one of the top 10 global software companies by the end of the decade, emphasizing his role in overseeing financial and corporate infrastructure operations.

title: Salesforce Shares Plunge by Most Since 2008 After Weak Outlook
summary: Salesforce (CRM) shares experienced their largest plunge since 2004 after the company projected its slowest quarterly sales growth in its history, renewing concerns about its position in the AI boom. The company expects revenue to rise as much as 8% to $9.25 billion in the current quarter, marking the first time it will see single-digit sales growth as a public company. Salesforce stock fell 20% to $218.01 on Thursday.

title: Salesforce shares tumble as soft cloud demand hurts forecasts
summary: Salesforce (CRM.N) stock tumbled over 16% after forecasting second-quarter profit and revenue below Wall Street estimates due to weak client spending on its cloud and enterprise business products. The company anticipates its slowest quarterly revenue growth in its history, despite significant investments in AI. Salesforce maintained its fiscal 2025 revenue forecast but cut operating margin expectations.

title: Salesforce shares tumble 20% in worst day since 2004
summary: Salesforce shares experienced their worst trading day since 2004, falling 20% after reporting weaker-than-expected fiscal first-quarter results and providing light guidance. While some analysts attributed the miss to broader macroeconomic challenges and execution issues, others remained optimistic about Salesforce's potential benefits from generative AI and reiterated buy ratings. The company missed Wall Street's revenue estimates for the first time since 2006.

title: Salesforce plummets as weak forecast sparks concerns of AI competition
summary: Salesforce shares slumped approximately 18% after its lowest-ever quarterly revenue growth forecast raised concerns that high interest rates and rival AI offerings are hindering demand. The company reported revenue below expectations for the first time since 2006, leading analysts to fear increasing competitive pressure from the generative AI innovation cycle. Several brokerages lowered price targets on the stock, indicating a broader slowdown in software demand.

title: After Earnings, Is Salesforce Stock a Buy, Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar has lowered its fair value estimate for Salesforce (CRM) to $285 per share from $300 after lower-than-expected Q1 revenue and guidance. Despite this, the stock is rated as undervalued with a 4-star rating, presenting a potential buying opportunity. The company maintains a wide economic moat due to switching costs and network effects, and its financial health is considered sound.

title: Five9 integrates with Salesforce to evolve into a CX platform
summary: Five9 has deepened its partnership with Salesforce, integrating Salesforce Einstein with its own AI tools to transform into a comprehensive customer experience (CX) platform. This collaboration, highlighted at Customer Contact Week, aims to improve agent efficiency and customer interactions through real-time call transcriptions, embedded call recording analysis, and enhanced quality assurance via Einstein Conversation Insights. By shifting from a traditional contact-center-as-a-service (CCaaS) vendor to a CX platform, Five9 seeks to broaden its market appeal beyond traditional agents to a wider audience.

title: Press Release | Merkle APAC | Merkle Celebrates 20 Years of Innovation with Salesforce
summary: Merkle, a dentsu company, is celebrating 20 years of partnership with Salesforce, highlighting their extensive collaboration, over 3,000 Salesforce-certified employees, and a global presence as one of the largest Salesforce Commerce Cloud partners. The company has significantly invested in its Salesforce practice in Asia, focusing on developing innovative, people-centric customer experiences. Merkle and Salesforce will also be co-exhibiting at upcoming industry events to showcase their joint customer experience innovations and AI-driven solutions.

title: Advance Auto Parts customer data posted for sale [updated]
summary: A cybercriminal is offering to sell 3 TB of customer and employee data allegedly stolen from Advance Auto Parts, asking for $1.5 million. The data purportedly includes personal information, order history, and loyalty card details for customers, alongside employee information. The breach is suspected to originate from Advance Auto Parts' use of Snowflake, a cloud data platform that recently urged its customers to enable multi-factor authentication due to increased cyber threat activity.

title: Cathie Wood's Ark missed Nvidia tech rally but eyes other AI wins
summary: Cathie Wood's Ark Investment Management largely missed Nvidia's significant tech rally after selling most of its shares at around $400, despite initially buying in 2014. Wood maintains that Ark is well-positioned for future AI growth through investments in other companies, including a continued bet on Tesla and stakes in AI startups like xAI and OpenAI, viewing autonomous driving as a major AI project. She also predicts surprisingly large interest rate cuts in 2024 due to rolling recessions in the US.

title: Five thoughts from Cisco Live 2024
summary: Cisco Live 2024 showcased the company's aggressive push into AI and the integration of Splunk across its portfolio. Key takeaways include Splunk's expansion beyond security and observability, Cisco's emerging comprehensive AI infrastructure story, significant advancements in its security offerings, and the growing importance of ThousandEyes for network visibility. The event highlighted Cisco's transition towards a cloud-centric strategy and the need for more cross-cloud solutions to create integrated customer experiences.

title: Databricks Launches AI Graphics Competitor to Salesforce, Microsoft
summary: Databricks Inc. is launching a new AI-powered visualization tool called AI/BI to compete with Salesforce Inc. and Microsoft Corp. This feature will allow users to input questions about their data using natural language, which the tool will then automatically translate into various charts and graphs for visualization, aiming to provide faster results in business intelligence. Databricks, already a highly valued private company, is expanding its offerings in the generative AI space.

title: Microsoft Strikes 2 Record-Breaking Carbon Credit Deals
summary: Microsoft has made two significant moves in the carbon credit market, signing a record-breaking deal with BTG Pactual Timberland Investment Group for 8 million carbon removal credits, and an additionally largest-ever individual purchase of 40,000 agricultural soil carbon credits from Indigo Ag. These agreements are part of Microsoft's ambitious commitment to become carbon-negative by 2030 and eliminate all historical emissions by 2050, demonstrating its strategy to invest in large-scale, high-quality carbon removal projects, especially in nature-based solutions. The company's efforts also include a collaboration with other tech giants and a focus on reducing its significant Scope 3 emissions.

title: Vivo, in collaboration with Microsoft, creates Generative AI for call center agents
summary: Vivo, in collaboration with Microsoft, has developed "I.Ajuda," a generative AI assistant for its 11,000 call center agents, integrating Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service. This initiative has reduced average service time by 9% for individual customers and 4% for companies, while also improving call resolution rates and service evaluation scores. The AI functions as a co-pilot, providing quick answers from over 30 systems and 2,000 processes, and future plans include suggesting offers and transcribing conversations for analysis.

title: GoDaddy Elects New Board Member
summary: GoDaddy Inc. announced the unanimous election of Graham Smith as an independent director to its board, effective June 26, 2024. Smith brings 30 years of experience in leadership, operational finance, and board service from leading technology companies, including Salesforce.com, Inc. and Splunk Inc. He will serve as a Class I director and join the board's Audit and Finance Committee.

title: Free Project Management Software: The Best 10 Options
summary: This article identifies and reviews the top 10 free project management software options available today, outlining their pros, cons, and unique features. It emphasizes factors like project scope, ease of use, collaboration, flexibility, and integrations as key criteria for selection. The piece aims to help individuals and small teams find the right cost-effective solution to boost productivity and streamline workflows.

title: Global Company Acquires Wilmington Entrepreneur's Software Firm
summary: Matt Cimino's Wilmington-based software firm, Amped, which specializes in pop-up software for e-commerce sites, has been acquired by global tech firm Intuit Mailchimp. The acquisition will see Amped's technology integrated into Intuit Mailchimp after three months, with the entire Amped team of approximately 15 employees being retained.
