Cimino views the acquisition as a significant win for both North Carolina and Wilmington, highlighting the region's ability to attract successful entrepreneurs and major tech companies.

title: Salesforce and other software stocks are expected to bounce back in a big way
summary: Despite a strong rally in the S&P 500 and its information-technology sector this year, some major software companies like Salesforce and Adobe have underperformed. Analysts, however, see significant upside potential for these stocks in the coming months. This presents an opportunity for investors seeking bargains within the tech sector, which has become increasingly concentrated among a few large companies.

title: Salesforce and other software stocks are expected to bounce back in a big way
summary: Despite a strong rally in the S&P 500 and its information technology sector this year, some software companies like Salesforce and Adobe have lagged behind. Analysts foresee a significant rebound for these underperforming software stocks, with Salesforce projected to have a 14% upside and Adobe a 5% upside over the next 12 months. This presents potential buying opportunities for investors looking for bargains in the tech sector.

title: IPO Market Outlook 2024: AI Fuels Tech Revival
summary: After a two-year downturn, the technology IPO market is experiencing a revival in 2024, largely driven by companies leveraging Artificial Intelligence. Morgan Stanley anticipates 10 to 15 tech IPOs this year, with AI's transformative potential attracting significant investor interest. Despite lingering economic uncertainties and higher interest rates compared to 2021, the market is adjusting, and successful IPOs in both tech and healthcare sectors demonstrate a renewed comfort with growth-focused investments.

title: Alphabet calls off multibillion-dollar HubSpot acquisition
summary: Alphabet Inc. has reportedly abandoned its plans to acquire marketing software firm HubSpot Inc., causing HubSpot's stock to fall over 11%. The deal, which would have been Alphabet's largest acquisition, was likely called off due to anticipated regulatory scrutiny and a potential lack of clear benefit for HubSpot's customers. Analysts suggest the negotiations did not progress to detailed discussions and that regulatory bodies would have likely opposed the union.

title: Salesforce Cuts About 300 Jobs in Latest Sign of Tech Austerity
summary: Salesforce Inc. has cut approximately 300 jobs as part of an effort to streamline operations, indicating a continued trend of cost control within the tech industry. These reductions follow similar layoffs announced by other tech companies like Intuit and UiPath this month, highlighting a broader period of austerity after years of rapid hiring. The software giant confirmed the job cuts, which are aimed at controlling expenses while investing in new products.

title: Meet Salesforce’s AI-Powered Customer Service Agent, Einstein
summary: Salesforce has unveiled Einstein Service Agent, an autonomous AI agent designed to replace conventional chatbots by leveraging proprietary data to customize interactions. Unlike traditional chatbots, it doesn't require pre-programmed conversation trees and can be rapidly deployed. The agent aims to improve customer service by handling inquiries grounded in company data, with OpenAI's GPT-4o as its primary LLM and future customization options for other LLMs.

title: Salesforce pressures its workers back into office
summary: Salesforce is mandating a return to office for most employees starting October 1, reversing its previous stance on remote work. The company will implement an internal dashboard to track employee badge scans and attendance against quarterly goals, while also continuing layoffs amidst a push for in-person connection and activist investor pressure regarding stock growth. This move comes as San Francisco faces a high office vacancy rate, and Salesforce, like other tech firms, has significantly reduced its office footprint.

title: How Salesforce Data Cloud supports CX for Principal Financial
summary: This article discusses how Principal Financial Group is utilizing Salesforce Data Cloud to enhance customer experience for its B2C and B2B2B businesses. Ryan Downing, VP and CIO of enterprise business solutions at Principal, explains their hybrid approach to data integration and the benefits of personalization for advisers and individual participants. The company also addresses the strategic use of AI, including Einstein AI, balancing innovation with the governance required in a regulated industry.

title: Salesforce and Workday Form Strategic Partnership, Unveil New AI Employee Service Agent
summary: Salesforce and Workday have announced a strategic partnership to launch a new AI employee service agent, aiming to automate tasks and provide personalized support using a unified data foundation. This collaboration integrates Salesforce's Einstein AI and Agentforce Platform with Workday's platform and AI, enhancing productivity, reducing costs, and improving the employee experience across various HR and financial functions. The partnership also includes an enhanced integration between Workday and Slack, allowing employees to manage records and collaborate seamlessly.

title: Nike appoints ex-Salesforce executive as new CIO amid tech division overhaul
summary: Nike has named Cheryan Jacob, formerly of Salesforce, as its new Chief Information Officer (CIO) to lead the modernization of its technology infrastructure. This appointment is part of ongoing efforts to simplify and standardize Nike's platforms, crucial for boosting direct-to-consumer sales through its digital channels. The global technology division has seen several leadership changes under CEO John Donahoe, aiming to transform Nike's foundational infrastructure.

title: Altana raises $200M for its supply chain analytics platform
summary: Altana Technologies Inc. has secured $200 million in a Series C funding round, bringing its valuation to $1 billion. The company specializes in a supply chain analytics platform that uses AI to identify regulatory compliance and reliability issues. Key investors include US Innovative Technology Fund, Salesforce Ventures, and Alphabet Inc.'s GV startup fund.

title: Another Minneapolis software business acquired for its AI technology
summary: Pluralytics, a Minneapolis-based language science company founded in 2020 by former Public Radio International executives, has been acquired by Dallas-based digital marketing agency Aletheia Marketing & Media Inc. Pluralytics' AI technology analyzes language to predict appeal to different audiences, securing clients like Great Clips and Best Buy. This acquisition marks the second Minneapolis AI company bought this month, reflecting a growing trend in AI mergers and acquisitions, particularly within the marketing sector.

title: Invest Like Congress: 2 ETFs to Add to Your Watchlist
summary: This article examines two ETFs, NANC and KRUZ, which allow investors to mirror the stock trades of Democratic and Republican members of Congress, respectively. It highlights their differing performance, with NANC significantly outperforming KRUZ due to its heavy allocation to the technology sector, while KRUZ favors financials and energy. The piece also delves into the ongoing ethical debate surrounding congressional stock trading, discussing concerns about conflicts of interest and insider information, urging investors to proceed with caution despite the ETFs' unique appeal.

title: With AI, Quantum, and Open-Source Initiatives, IBM Builds on Tech Innovation History
summary: IBM continues to build on its long history of technological innovation by focusing on AI, quantum computing, and open-source initiatives. With significant advancements in its watsonx platform, expanded open-source support, and strategic partnerships, IBM recorded over $2 billion in generative AI business. These efforts, combined with its strong financial performance and customer successes, position IBM for continued leadership in the evolving tech landscape.

title: Tech Essentials for Startup Success
summary: This article highlights how startups can leverage technology to foster growth and gain a competitive edge, based on insights from John Somorjai of Salesforce Ventures. It emphasizes aligning technology strategy with business objectives, choosing scalable tech solutions, and integrating AI for sales and customer service improvements. The article also stresses the importance of partnering with technology vendors whose values align with the startup's.

title: Debt, Debt, Debt, Debt, Debt
summary: This article analyzes the role and prevalence of debt among real estate tech companies by examining debt mentions in their annual reports. It highlights how companies like Anywhere use debt for long-term financing, incurring substantial interest expenses that limit other investments, while Opendoor utilizes short-term debt as a core part of its iBuying business, making it vulnerable to interest rate changes. The author concludes that while debt isn't inherently bad, its varying levels and management strategies significantly impact a company's financial health and future growth potential.

title: PayPal Rolls Out Its Fastlane Checkout Service for Online Sales
summary: PayPal has officially made its Fastlane checkout service available to all U.S. merchants. This one-click guest checkout solution aims to boost e-commerce conversion rates by reducing friction and speeding up purchases. Initial pilots have shown significant improvements in conversion and checkout times for merchants using Fastlane.

title: US 30-year mortgage rate drops on weak jobs data, Fed rate-cut signal
summary: The 30-year fixed-rate mortgage dropped to its lowest level in 15 months, reaching 6.55% after the Federal Reserve signaled potential rate cuts and weak jobs data bolstered market expectations for significant reductions. This decline offers relief to potential homebuyers and those looking to refinance, though low housing inventory continues to constrain purchase activity. The shift in the Fed's communication, now focusing on both inflation and the labor market, has already translated to lower mortgage rates as investors anticipate future central bank actions.

title: ADT Inc. Reports Cybersecurity Incident Exposing Customer Information
summary: ADT Inc., a leading security and smart home solutions provider, disclosed a cybersecurity incident affecting a limited subset of its customer base. The breach, detected on August 3, 2024, involved unauthorized access to databases containing customer email addresses, phone numbers, and postal addresses, with over 30,000 records reportedly compromised and made available online. ADT assures that sensitive data like home security system functionality, financial information, and credit card details were not affected, and the company's financial guidance for 2024 remains unchanged.

title: Bardeen Raises $3 Million in Funding
summary: Bardeen, a San Francisco-based provider of AI agents, has secured an additional $3 million in funding from strategic investors Dropbox Ventures and HubSpot Ventures, bringing its total funding to $22 million. Founded in 2020 by Artem Harutyunyan and Pascal Weinberger, the company offers an AI agent platform that automates repetitive knowledge work using natural language. This new investment will support Bardeen's goal of developing a fully autonomous AI platform to build time-saving automations, building on its rapid growth to over 300,000 users and 1,000 paying customers.

title: Activist Starboard Value takes stake in Starbucks, WSJ reports
summary: Activist investor Starboard Value has reportedly taken a stake in Starbucks (SBUX.O), aiming for the coffee giant to improve its stock price. The exact size of Starboard's stake and demands are unknown, though Starbucks is already in discussions with another activist investor, Elliott Investment Management. This move follows a reported drop in Starbucks' quarterly global sales, impacted by weak demand in the U.S. and a significant decline in China same-store sales.

title: SailPoint Appoints Gary Nafus as Chief Sales Officer
summary: SailPoint Technologies, Inc. has announced the appointment of Gary Nafus as its new Chief Sales Officer and the promotion of Matt Mills to President. This leadership expansion aims to strengthen SailPoint's ability to meet the demand for its enterprise identity security solutions. Nafus brings extensive sales leadership experience from companies like Microsoft, Salesforce, and Oracle, and will oversee SailPoint's global go-to-market field operations.

title: Implementasi Platform OCA Telkom Jadikan Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Perusahaan Lebih Optimal
summary: Telkom Indonesia has launched Omni Communication Assistant (OCA), an omnichannel platform to optimize Customer Relationship Management (CRM) for businesses in Indonesia. OCA helps companies track customer interactions, gather data, and provide personalized services, which enhances customer retention and acquisition. PT IPC Terminal Petikemas has successfully used OCA to handle 233% more customer complaints and inquiries daily, demonstrating the platform's effectiveness in improving customer service and analytical capabilities.

title: Daniel Peris: The Case for Dividend Investing
summary: Daniel Peris, a portfolio manager at Federated Hermes and author of "The Ownership Dividend," discusses the historical importance of dividends and argues for a paradigm shift back to dividend investing. He criticizes modern portfolio theory's overemphasis on share price appreciation and extreme diversification, advocating for a business-owner's perspective grounded in tangible cash flows. Peris attributes the past decline in dividends to falling interest rates, the rise of buybacks, Silicon Valley's growth, and global sociopolitical shifts, and believes a return to more normal interest rates will renew focus on cash payouts.

title: SAP Is a Leader in the 2024 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Recurring Billing Applications
summary: SAP has been recognized as a Leader in the inaugural 2024 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Recurring Billing Applications. This highlights SAP's commitment to providing agile cloud solutions for recurring revenue management through SAP S/4HANA Cloud and SAP Subscription Billing. The article emphasizes the growing importance of advanced billing software for fast-growing companies and showcases SAP's integrated modular ERP approach with customer success stories.

title: SailPoint hires first global sales chief amid leadership expansion
summary: Identity security specialist SailPoint has expanded its leadership team by appointing Gary Nafus as its first chief sales officer and promoting Matt Mills to president. Nafus, formerly of Microsoft and Salesforce, will lead SailPoint's global go-to-market operations. This expansion aims to enhance SailPoint's ability to meet demand for its enterprise-grade identity security solutions and capture new market opportunities.

title: Feared Activist Hedge Fund Starboard Value L.P. Pressures Alight, Inc. (ALIT)
summary: Starboard Value L.P., a prominent activist hedge fund, is pressuring Alight, Inc. (ALIT) by acquiring a 7.8% stake and pushing for board seats, aiming to unlock shareholder value. The article discusses activist investors' strategies, their impact on companies, and recent successes in the activist hedge fund landscape. Starboard Value, which manages a portfolio of $4.84 billion, is known for engaging with management to improve operational efficiency and margin improvement in undervalued companies.

title: E-Invoicing Market Worth $62.68 Billion, Globally, by 2031 - Exclusive Report by The Insight Partners
summary: The global e-invoicing market is projected to reach US$ 62.68 billion by 2031, growing from US$ 12.47 billion in 2023 at a CAGR of 22.4%. This growth is driven by digital transformation initiatives, increasing demand for cloud-based solutions, and the benefits of e-invoicing such as enhanced security, efficiency, cost savings, and accuracy. North America currently dominates the market, with Asia Pacific expected to show the fastest CAGR.

title: 6 Companies Hiring Sales Professionals in Colombia
summary: This article highlights six companies currently hiring sales professionals in Colombia, reflecting Latin America's increasing economic importance. Businesses across various sectors, including tech, financial services, and manufacturing, are seeking experienced individuals to expand into new markets. The featured companies include Coupa Software, PayJoy, Motorola Solutions, Visa Inc., TaskUs, and Mondelēz International, detailing their offerings and sales recruitment efforts in the region.

title: As ServiceNow Outgrows Salesforce by 2X, Marc Benioff Dismisses Bill McDermott's Company as 'Wienerschnitzel'
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff humorously dismissed ServiceNow as "Wienerschnitzel" compared to Salesforce's "McDonald's," despite ServiceNow's significantly faster growth in key financial metrics. The article highlights ServiceNow's strong performance, its ambitious AI strategy, and its higher market confidence regarding future prospects, contrasting it with Salesforce's slower growth and reduced guidance. It suggests Benioff's remarks might be premature given the changing landscape of the cloud application market.

title: Leading US oilfield company Halliburton struck by cyberattack
summary: Halliburton, a major US oilfield services company, experienced a cyberattack affecting certain systems and disrupting business operations at its north Houston campus and global networks. The company is working with external experts to resolve the issue and has advised some staff not to connect to internal networks. This incident highlights increasing cyber threats to the energy sector, following previous attacks like the 2021 Colonial Pipeline ransomware incident.

title: Workday Q2 solid, announces Equifax partnership
summary: Workday reported better-than-expected Q2 results with 16.7% revenue growth and reiterated its fiscal year 2025 subscription revenue outlook. The company also announced a strategic partnership with Equifax to integrate employment and income verification services, expanding its Workday Payroll offerings. Analysts are now looking to see if AI acceleration will propel Workday's growth into the 20% range in the second half of the year.

title: Halliburton alerts oil clients after cybersecurity breach, activates response plan
summary: Halliburton Co. has alerted customers and activated its cybersecurity response plan after an unauthorized third party gained access to some of its systems. The company is investigating the incident and has notified law enforcement, taking some systems offline for protection. This event highlights the increasing cybersecurity risks faced by the energy sector, following other attacks on critical infrastructure.

title: Salesforce to Settle Pair of 401(k) Lawsuits for $1.35 Million
summary: Salesforce Inc. has agreed to a $1.35 million settlement for two class-action lawsuits concerning its 401(k) plan's fees and investment options. This amount represents about 13.5% of the plaintiffs' maximum estimated damages of $10 million. The settlement resolves a 2020 lawsuit regarding the plan's investment lineup and a more recent 2024 lawsuit challenging the target date funds, with the agreement finalized in May.

title: JLL adds new brokers as it soft launches San Jose office at Santana Row
summary: JLL has soft-launched its new San Jose office at Santana Row, hiring four new brokerage professionals to expand its presence and better serve clients in Silicon Valley. The new hires, including Alex Lagemann, Sean Toomey, Bryte Bellotti, and Maryjane Archuleta, bring extensive experience in tenant and landlord representation, office, life science, and R&D lease transactions to the firm. This expansion complements JLL's Menlo Park location and aims to attract top talent in the commercial real estate market, with further growth anticipated.

title: Salesforce beats quarterly estimates on cloud demand, says CFO to step down
summary: Salesforce surpassed Wall Street's second-quarter revenue and profit expectations due to increased enterprise cloud product spending, causing its shares to rise. The company also announced that CFO Amy Weaver will step down and raised its annual profit forecast, although it projected third-quarter revenue below estimates, indicating a slow recovery in cloud spending. Analysts noted that AI is not yet a significant growth contributor and might be diverting some customer commitments.

title: Salesforce CEO Slams Microsoft Copilot: “So Many Customers Are So Disappointed”
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff criticized Microsoft Copilot during a recent earnings call, citing widespread customer disappointment with its accuracy. Benioff highlighted Salesforce's shift towards autonomous agents with its upcoming Agentforce platform, aiming to provide more effective AI solutions. He also proudly declared Salesforce the largest enterprise software company globally, excluding infrastructure providers, and shared positive early adoption results for Agentforce.

title: AI is revolutionizing the way we support corporate functions at Microsoft
summary: Microsoft Digital, the company's internal IT organization, is demonstrating how AI is transforming corporate functions like HR, legal, and real estate by improving operational efficiencies and accelerating growth. They highlight an AI-powered document lifecycle management platform that significantly reduces the time for document digitization and contract generation, as exemplified by a successful implementation with Xbox. Many capabilities of this internal solution will be integrated into SharePoint Premium, making Microsoft Digital "Customer Zero" for external product development.

title: Build relationship with customers, don’t just complete a transaction: ACC 2024 keynote speaker
summary: Branding expert Alex Hunter, former head of online for the Virgin Group, emphasized at the Asian Carriers Conference 2024 that companies should focus on building relationships with customers rather than just completing transactions. He highlighted how creating "wow moments" and understanding individual customer preferences, often aided by AI, fosters long-term consumer affinity and differentiates a brand. Hunter also discussed the importance of "phygital" experiences, blending physical and digital interactions to create unique customer journeys.

title: Salesforce Set to Boost Voice Capabilities with Tenyx Takeover
summary: Salesforce has announced its acquisition of Tenyx, a Voice AI technology company, with the deal expected to close in 2025. This acquisition aims to enhance Salesforce's autonomous agent capabilities for its Agentforce Service Agent and Service Cloud, aligning with Salesforce's goal to revolutionize customer service using AI. Tenyx's co-founders and team will join Salesforce, further strengthening the company's AI-driven solutions and customer experience offerings.

title: Williams-Sonoma adds Rejuvenation to loyalty program
summary: Williams-Sonoma Inc. has integrated its Rejuvenation brand into its free "The Key Rewards" loyalty program, allowing customers to earn and redeem rewards across all Williams-Sonoma banners. This move aims to unify operations and enhance customer engagement by offering unparalleled rewards and benefits. The loyalty program also offers a credit card for accelerated rewards and other perks.

title: Salesforce (CRM) Agrees to Buy Startup Own for $1.9 Billion
summary: Salesforce Inc. has agreed to acquire data protection and management solutions provider Own for $1.9 billion. This marks Salesforce's second acquisition this week and is their largest since buying Slack. The deal emphasizes Salesforce's commitment to providing secure, end-to-end data protection solutions for its customers.

title: Salesforce to buy data protection provider Own Company for $1.9 bln
summary: Salesforce announced its intent to acquire Own Company, a data protection and management solutions provider, for $1.9 billion in cash. This acquisition aims to bolster Salesforce's data security and privacy products amidst growing concerns over data loss. Salesforce expects the deal to be accretive on a free cash flow basis starting in the second year after closing, which is anticipated in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025.

title: In $1.9B deal, Salesforce buys data backup company Own
summary: Salesforce is set to acquire data backup vendor Own Company for $1.9 billion in cash, marking its third acquisition of 2024. This move aims to integrate Own's technology into Salesforce's data protection offerings, enhancing its security suite. This acquisition follows Salesforce's prior investment in Own and comes at a valuation lower than Own's 2021 Series E funding.

title: Salesforce snaps up Own Company in $1.9B bargain hunt
summary: Salesforce has acquired Own Company, a SaaS data protection and management outfit, for $1.9 billion in cash, ending its pause on major acquisitions initiated after the Slack purchase in 2021. This move, significantly below Own Company's 2021 valuation of $3.35 billion, aims to enhance Salesforce's data protection offerings and comes amidst investor scrutiny regarding growth and past merger values. The acquisition follows a recent deal where Salesforce adopted Own Company's technology for data backup.

title: How Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff Grew His Own AI Giant
summary: This article chronicles Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff's journey from a young software enthusiast to a visionary tech leader, highlighting his role in transforming Salesforce into an AI giant. It details his early career at Oracle, the founding of Salesforce with a mission to usher in 'The End of Software,' and his foresight in integrating AI into the company's core offerings through initiatives like Einstein. The piece emphasizes Benioff's commitment to technological innovation and his belief in business as a force for good.

title: Salesforce CEO Reveals its ‘Next Big Transformation’
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced that the company's "next big transformation" will be a "hard pivot" towards autonomous AI agents, with a new platform called ‘Agentforce’. This shift will be the centerpiece of their Dreamforce conference and a subsequent world tour, aiming to deploy AI agents for thousands of customers. Benioff is convinced that AI is the future of CRM despite skepticism from some analysts regarding the company's ability to deliver on these "game changing plans."

title: Southwest Airlines backs CEO; board chair to exit in 2025 amid changes by Elliot Investments
summary: Current Southwest Airlines executive chairman Gary Kelly announced his retirement in 2025 amidst pressure from activist investor Elliott Investment Management L.P. Six board members will resign and four new independent directors will join, with the board unanimously supporting current CEO Bob Jordan to remain in his position. These changes come as Elliott, having acquired over 10% of the company, advocates for business changes and new leadership after deeming Southwest's performance "stunning underperformance."

title: Klarna Plans to 'Shut Down SaaS Providers' and Replace Them With Internally Built AI. The Tech World Is Pretty Skeptical
summary: Klarna, the buy-now-pay-later giant, is severing ties with major SaaS providers like Salesforce and Workday to replace their services with internally built AI solutions. While Klarna's CEO cites cost savings and efficiency, many in the tech world are skeptical, viewing it as a potential PR move ahead of an IPO and questioning the feasibility of replicating complex systems in-house. This initiative follows the successful deployment of an AI customer service assistant and is part of a broader strategy to lean heavily into automation, potentially further reducing the company's workforce.

title: Seven Ways To Use GenAI For B2B Personalization
summary: This article outlines seven strategic ways B2B organizations can leverage Generative AI (GenAI) to enhance personalization throughout the customer lifecycle. It emphasizes moving beyond generic content variations to deliver highly relevant and responsive experiences, utilizing GenAI to interpret buying signals, engage anonymous visitors, fuel omnichannel interactions, simulate complex journeys, and localize content. The author stresses the importance of careful customization and transparency in GenAI-powered interactions.

title: With Salesforce push, AI Agents, agentic AI overload looms
summary: Salesforce is heavily promoting AI agents, or "Agentforce," at its upcoming Dreamforce conference, joining other enterprise tech giants like ServiceNow and Oracle in a rapidly expanding market for agentic AI. This push suggests a shift from generative AI to more autonomous AI agents that can make decisions and automate processes, potentially disrupting existing software revenue models and user interfaces. While the concept of AI agents has been around, significant venture capital and enterprise adoption are expected to accelerate its development and implementation across various business functions.

title: Signals from Salesforce: Data integration and gen AI in focus
summary: Salesforce is leveraging enhanced data integration and generative AI to unite its previously disparate platforms, aiming for a more cohesive presence in the enterprise software market. Analysts Christophe Bertrand and John Furrier from theCUBE Research discussed at Dreamforce 2024 how this strategy helps Salesforce overcome its reputation for fragmented systems by using gen AI as a "glue layer" to simplify workflows, improve operational efficiency, and enhance developer engagement. The integration also brings a focus on data protection and cybersecurity, underscored by Salesforce's collaboration with cloud providers and recent acquisitions like OwnBackup.

title: SHÁKA RASHEED JOINS OPEN OPPORTUNITY FUND AS GENERAL PARTNER TO LEAD CAPITAL DEVELOPMENT
summary: Sháka Rasheed has joined Open Opportunity Fund as General Partner, tasked with leading capital development and portfolio value creation. Rasheed brings extensive experience from top financial services and technology companies like Bridgewater, Lazard, Citadel, J.P. Morgan, Salesforce, and Microsoft. Open Opportunity Fund, which invests in software companies founded by diverse entrepreneurs, is currently raising its second fund after successful exits from its first $100 million fund.

title: Unlocking AI potential with Salesforce Data Cloud
summary: Salesforce Data Cloud is crucial for driving AI-powered customer experiences, enabling organizations to move beyond chatbots to AI-powered agents for more intelligent and human-like interactions. David Schmaier, president and chief product officer of Salesforce Inc., highlighted that Data Cloud integrates, harmonizes, and unifies various data sources, believing that this unified data powers AI agents, which in turn enhance the customer experience. The platform allows businesses to embed AI agents seamlessly, learning from processed data to provide precise and tailored interactions, fulfilling the long-held dream of CRM.

title: AI agents transform CRM: Salesforce Agentforce
summary: Salesforce is heavily investing in AI agents with its new Agentforce initiative, aiming to revolutionize enterprise AI adoption on its CRM platform. Agentforce, which leverages Data Cloud and an Atlas reasoning engine, is seen as the next major evolution in Salesforce's AI offerings, following its Einstein predictive platform and generative AI copilots. The company emphasizes the critical role of data in the success of these AI agents, designed to augment employee tasks and drive business results.

title: Salesforce Announces AI Analytics Platform: Tableau Einstein
summary: Salesforce has announced Tableau Einstein, a new AI visual analytics platform designed to scale and enhance data-driven workflows within its CRM ecosystem. This platform integrates various Salesforce components, including Agentforce and its privacy infrastructure, allowing data experts to create semantic models and facilitate internal collaboration. The announcement was made during Salesforce's Dreamsforce 2024 event, where the company also highlighted significant advancements in its Agentforce service and the integration of Slack.

title: Accenture delays promotions globally, after denying salary hikes to India staff in 2023
summary: Accenture Plc has announced a six-month delay for most staff promotions globally, pushing announcements to June 2025 due to economic uncertainties and reduced client spending. This decision affects over 750,000 employees and follows the company's denial of salary hikes for its India and Sri Lanka staff in fiscal year 2023. Other consulting firms are facing similar challenges, indicating an industry-wide impact from the economic slowdown.

title: Salesforce buys Israeli startup Zoomin to feed more data to its AI agents
summary: Salesforce Inc. has acquired Israeli startup Zoomin Software Ltd. for approximately $450 million to enhance its AI agents with unstructured data processing capabilities. Zoomin's technology will be integrated into Salesforce's Agentforce platform, allowing AI agents to deliver more accurate and autonomous responses by leveraging organizational data. This acquisition aims to differentiate Salesforce's AI offerings from competitors like Microsoft by improving the accuracy and utility of its AI agents.

title: Call it what you want, Taylor Swift is a model community manager
summary: This article defines social media community management, distinguishing it from social media management, and explains its importance for brands in building loyalty, gaining insights, and enhancing reputation. It outlines a strategic approach to community management including goal setting, audience identification, moderation, and measurement, offering best practices and real-world examples from brands like Oatly, Texas A&M University, and Lyft.

title: Is Salesforce's Premium Still Justified? (NYSE:CRM)
summary: Salesforce's revenue growth has slowed, prompting questions about its premium valuation despite improved operating margins and strategic focus on AI and multi-cloud services. The company's forward P/S ratio remains significantly higher than the sector median, raising concerns for investors despite strong customer adoption of new cloud services.

title: Salesforce Agrees a $430MN Deal for Zoomin, the Knowledge Unification Company
summary: Salesforce has agreed to acquire Zoomin, a knowledge unification and data management solutions provider, for $430 million, following their earlier collaboration on Salesforce Unified Knowledge. This acquisition aims to enhance Salesforce's Data Cloud with Zoomin's capabilities, particularly to support AI implementations across its platform, including Agentforce, and deliver more context-aware AI agents. The deal underscores Salesforce's "try before you buy" acquisition strategy and is expected to close in Q4 of its fiscal year 2025.

title: Salesforce Agentforce AI and insights from Dreamforce
summary: This article explores three key insights from Dreamforce '24, focusing on Salesforce's ambitious plans around automation and the new Salesforce Agentforce AI. Discussions from TheCUBE analysts Christophe Bertrand and John Furrier, alongside Salesforce executives, highlight how generative AI and agentic systems are set to transform Salesforce into a "mega giant" by integrating seamlessly into business workflows and enhancing customer solutions through strategic partnerships. The article emphasizes data utilization, advanced automation, and the company's evolution beyond its traditional CRM platform.

title: Finance KPIs Metrics, Analytics & Reporting for Success
summary: This article by Gartner discusses the importance of finance Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for organizational success, emphasizing how they help build cohesive, knowledgeable, and forward-thinking finance functions. It provides guidance on selecting, governing, and reporting finance KPIs to align with business goals, improve decision quality, and enhance dashboard viability. The article also includes a set of frequently asked questions covering what finance KPIs are, why they are important, and common examples.

title: Should You Invest in the iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV)?
summary: The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) offers diversified exposure to the Technology - Software segment, holding a Zacks ETF Rank of 1 (Strong Buy). With over $6.70 billion in assets and an expense ratio of 0.41%, it provides a low-cost option for investors. The ETF's top holdings include Adobe Inc (ADBE), Salesforce Inc (CRM), and Oracle Corp (ORCL), and it has shown strong performance with a 28.17% return year-to-date.

title: Boost Efficiency & Growth With Enterprise Applications
summary: This article from Gartner focuses on enhancing enterprise applications to drive digital business through efficiency and growth. It details how organizations can better quantify the value of enterprise apps to secure funding, align strategy with business outcomes, and leverage AI and automation for agility. The article also provides a four-step guide for creating an effective enterprise application strategy and discusses building high-performing application teams, emphasizing talent strategies, upskilling, and AI augmentation to meet future skill requirements.

title: How Sanofi Is Driving Efficiency and Growth with Agile Quality
summary: Sanofi launched QualiPSO, a quality transformation program integrating Veeva QMS and QualityDocs, to modernize its quality management across 40 manufacturing sites and over 100 legacy applications. This initiative has consolidated 40 legacy systems into one, reduced change control steps from 11 to 5, and enabled 60% of deviations to be fast-tracked, significantly improving efficiency and data integrity. The company aims to deliver innovative treatments to patients faster by digitizing and standardizing processes.

title: Conga Alternatives and Competitors: 9 Tools & Solutions
summary: This article explores nine alternatives to Conga Sign, an e-signature solution popular within the Salesforce ecosystem. It highlights key reasons to consider alternatives, such as expanded feature sets, broader integration options, and cost-effectiveness, and provides detailed descriptions, costs, and pros/cons for each competitor. The review aims to help businesses find an e-signature solution that better fits their evolving requirements and budget.

title: Salesforce employees wrap up first week of return to office
summary: Salesforce employees have completed their first week under a new return-to-office mandate, requiring some to work in the office at least four days a week. Employees like Levent Arabaci reported positive experiences, including increased networking, while local businesses observed a noticeable increase in traffic and customers, particularly on days that were previously quiet. The impact on downtown traffic is still being assessed, with more office workers, including LinkedIn employees, expected to return in the coming months.

title: Activist investor Starboard Value takes $1 bln stake in Pfizer, sources say
summary: Activist investor Starboard Value has acquired a $1 billion stake in Pfizer, aiming to facilitate a turnaround for the U.S. drug giant. Starboard has approached former Pfizer CEO Ian Read and CFO Frank D'Amelio, who have expressed interest in assisting. This move comes as Pfizer's shares have fallen over 13% in the past year, trading at about half their pandemic-era highs due to shrinking COVID product sales and challenges with new product launches despite significant acquisitions.

title: Ning Ning Yu Awarded “Best Tech Manager, North America” by Tech In Motion
summary: Ning Ning Yu, VP of R&D at Taboola, has been named the Best Tech Manager in North America by Tech in Motion (Timmy Awards). This award celebrates her leadership, innovation, and positive influence, highlighting her commitment to career growth, collaborative team culture, and inspiring innovation. Taboola also received the 2024 community choice award for “Best Tech Workplace For Diversity.”

title: Northern Trust, Workers Set to Settle 401(k) Litigation
summary: Northern Trust Co. has reached a tentative settlement in a class action lawsuit challenging its use of in-house target date funds in a company benefit plan. The dispute, dating back to 2021, alleged that the plan committee failed to prudently select and monitor investment options, specifically the Northern Trust Focus Funds, which allegedly underperformed and generated unreasonable fees. The terms of the settlement are pending court approval.

title: This dividend strategy can bring in income and help you sleep at night
summary: Federated Hermes' Daniel Peris advocates for dividend stocks as a consistent income source, particularly as the Federal Reserve cuts rates. He emphasizes investing in "old economy" companies with sustainable business models and growing dividends, citing a new era for dividend investing as more companies, including tech giants, begin to initiate payouts. Peris highlights the importance of real returns after inflation and the sustainability of income streams for long-term investors.

title: Honeywell and Salesforce Team Up to Deliver Life Sciences Solutions that Enable Safe and Streamlined Patient Care
summary: Honeywell and Salesforce have expanded their strategic partnership to deliver a comprehensive software platform for the life sciences industry. This collaboration combines Honeywell’s TrackWise Quality suite with Salesforce Life Sciences Cloud and other solutions to help pharmaceutical and medical technology companies bring critical medications and healthcare devices to patients more quickly, safely, and affordably. The platform aims to digitize and automate quality and compliance processes, improving operational efficiency and patient care through advanced technologies like AI.

title: Schneider Electric charges into the future with Microsoft Copilot for Sales
summary: Schneider Electric is leveraging Microsoft Copilot for Sales to enhance its global sales operations by automating tedious administrative tasks and improving data quality in Salesforce CRM. The deployment, which is already in use by 5,000 employees across 30 countries with a target of 10,500 users by the end of 2024, enables sales teams to focus more on customer engagement. Key benefits include AI-assisted contact creation, lightning-fast email summaries, and accurate meeting recaps, leading to increased efficiency, higher customer satisfaction, and improved data accuracy.

title: Investing In Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks Can Be Risky, but Buying This Global X ETF Might Be a Great Way to Do It
summary: Investing in individual AI stocks can be risky due to the difficulty of picking winners, as historical technological revolutions have shown. A safer approach for investors looking to capitalize on AI's growth is to buy an exchange-traded fund (ETF) with a high concentration of AI stocks, such as the Global X Artificial Intelligence and Technology ETF. This ETF offers diversification across 84 AI-focused companies and has historically outperformed the S&P 500 despite its higher expense ratio, making it a potentially attractive option for long-term growth as part of a diversified portfolio.

title: Charting Growth: Sales Insights From America’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies
summary: This article highlights how the fastest-growing private companies in the U.S. achieve consistent sales growth, based on a collaboration between Inc. and Salesforce. Founders emphasize strong sales talent, the role of AI and CRM technology in automating sales tasks, and strategies for connecting with customers. An e-book offers valuable takeaways for SMB owners on top-performing sales teams, technology transformation, and managing growth.

title: Google Cloud chief moves to ServiceNow as COO
summary: Amit Zavery, formerly of Google Cloud and Oracle, is joining ServiceNow as President, Chief Product Officer, and Chief Operating Officer, a move that comes after an executive hiring scandal involving the previous COO. Zavery's experience is expected to bolster ServiceNow's product development, particularly in areas competitive with Atlassian and Salesforce. His appointment aims to leverage his background in growing Google Cloud and Oracle's platform services.

title: Workday Named a Leader in 2024 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud HCM Suites for 1,000+ Employee Enterprises for Ninth Consecutive Year
summary: Workday has been recognized as a Leader in the 2024 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Cloud HCM Suites for 1,000+ Employee Enterprises for the ninth consecutive year, also being positioned highest for Ability to Execute. The company highlights its innovative solutions powered by Workday Illuminate, its AI platform built on the world's largest HR and finance dataset, adopted by over 5,525 organizations globally. Workday emphasizes its commitment to empowering HR teams with transformed workflows, total workforce strategies, and a flexible platform for innovation and customer outcomes.

title: Generative AI agent startup Sierra Technologies raises $175M at $4.5B valuation
summary: Sierra Technologies, an AI startup co-founded by ex-Salesforce co-CEO Bret Taylor, has secured $175 million in funding, pushing its valuation to $4.5 billion. The company develops AI-powered virtual assistants for customer service, featuring personalized conversational models capable of utilizing business data to resolve customer issues and reduce human agent intervention. Sierra differentiates itself through customizable AI agent personalities and a "constellation" approach to large language models for enhanced reliability.

title: Shopify Is Winning Salesforce Clients, Stoking E-Commerce Rivalry
summary: Shopify Inc. is increasingly targeting larger retailers, successfully attracting major clients like Mattel and Casper away from Salesforce Inc. This shift is fueled by Shopify's offering of lower costs and more flexible pricing models compared to Salesforce. The move signals an intensifying rivalry in the e-commerce platform space as Shopify seeks to accelerate growth beyond its traditional small business base.

title: Salesforce launches Agentforce AI agent platform into general availability
summary: Salesforce has announced the general availability of Agentforce, an AI agent platform designed to help enterprises build autonomous AI agents for various business functions. The platform aims to simplify the development and deployment of AI solutions for companies, offering an all-in-one approach to customize and integrate agents with existing data and applications. Early adopters like Wiley and BACA Systems have reported significant improvements in efficiency and self-service rates by using the Agentforce platform.

title: AI in CRM: The New Language of Customer Engagement
summary: This article discusses the transformative role of AI in Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, highlighting how AI can enhance personalization, automate tasks, and improve overall customer experience. It delves into the benefits of AI-powered CRMs, such as increased engagement and reduced acquisition costs, while also addressing critical challenges like high implementation costs, data privacy concerns, and potential biases. The piece emphasizes the importance of ethical considerations for successful and responsible AI integration in CRM.

title: Tecnoglass Ranks Among Fortune’s Fastest-Growing U.S. Companies for 2024
summary: Tecnoglass (NYSE: TGLS), a manufacturer of architectural glass and aluminum products, has been recognized by Fortune magazine as the 27th fastest-growing U.S. company for 2024. The company, which reported significant revenue and EPS growth over three years, was the only materials segment company to make the list. This achievement highlights Tecnoglass' strategic focus on vertical integration, high-end products, and operational efficiencies across its markets in the Americas.

title: VSS Backs Founder-Owned Salesforce Consultant Lane Four
summary: VSS Capital Partners has made a minority investment in founder-owned Salesforce consultant Lane Four Consulting, the second such deal for VSS in October. Lane Four, founded by Andrew Sinclair, provides consulting and managed services for Salesforce systems and plans to pursue M&A opportunities and expand its reach to private equity portfolio companies. The investment, estimated to be between $20 million and $50 million, aims to support Lane Four's growth, including potential bolt-on acquisitions in the Salesforce ecosystem and increased focus on PE clients.

title: Shopify Brags About Poaching “Hundreds” of Salesforce Customers, Salesforce Claps Back
summary: Shopify claims to have poached "hundreds" of Salesforce customers, including Toys R Us and Casper, by offering lower prices and flexible models, contrasting with Salesforce's costly practices. Salesforce, while acknowledging Shopify as a competitor, clapped back by asserting it has also taken customers from Shopify and that narrow use cases can make anything seem cheaper. This rivalry highlights Shopify's growth in the enterprise sector and Salesforce's shifting focus, making its commerce segment vulnerable.

title: Plan for new downtown SF park on the Embarcadero gets major boost
summary: San Francisco Mayor London Breed is spearheading a public-private partnership to redevelop Embarcadero Plaza into a new park. The plan involves the city, Salesforce Tower owner BXP Inc., and Downtown SF Partnership aiming to raise $30 million for the redesign and upgrade, which could include entertainment venues, a playground, or a marketplace. Initial renderings suggest the removal of the controversial Vaillancourt Fountain, with BXP committing $2.5 million for design and working with partners to secure an additional $25 million in public and private funding.

title: Ministry for Primary Industries polls market to establish specialist Pegasystems panel
summary: New Zealand's Ministry for Primary Industries (MPI) is seeking to establish a panel of up to six suppliers to support and develop solutions using Pegasystems technology. This initiative aligns with MPI's digital strategy to adopt a platform-based approach, encouraging reuse and simplification of its technology landscape, with Pega being central to its cloud-platform future. The ministry anticipates its new Pega environment will be ready for development work by February 2025, even after significant workforce reductions earlier in the year.

title: 3 Ways Stock-Split Stocks Nvidia and Sherwin-Williams Are Modernizing the Dow Jones Industrial Average
summary: This article discusses how the additions of Nvidia and Sherwin-Williams to the Dow Jones Industrial Average are modernizing the index. It highlights that stock splits are crucial for inclusion in the price-weighted Dow, unlike market-cap-weighted indexes. The changes signify a shift towards a more tech-focused and growth-oriented Dow, moving away from its traditional emphasis on blue-chip dividend stocks.

title: BBVA fue elegido “Mejor Banco 2024” en Argentina por LatinFinance
summary: LatinFinance, a leading publication in Latin America, has recognized BBVA as the "Best Bank 2024" in Argentina, as well as the best bank in the Latin America region, Mexico, and Colombia. BBVA Argentina's Country Manager, Jorge Bledel, attributed this success to teamwork, digitalization, and a continued focus on innovation. The bank was lauded for its strong customer relationships, sustainable practices, and integration of Salesforce solutions for CRM optimization.

title: Pandemic high to deep decline: How LivePerson’s valuation dropped from $4.7B to $60M
summary: LivePerson, once valued at $4.7 billion during the pandemic, has seen its valuation plummet to $60 million due to declining revenues, significant losses, and increased competition. Despite its AI-based customer service technology, the company has struggled with revenue growth, experiencing a 26% year-over-year decrease in Q3, leading to a 98.5% stock decline from its peak. Founder Robert LoCascio's departure and pressure from activist investor Starboard Value underscore the company's challenges and calls for leadership changes.

title: Polen Capital Focus Growth Strategy Exited Salesforce (CRM) for Better Opportunities
summary: Polen Capital's Focus Growth Strategy exited its position in Salesforce (CRM) during the third quarter of 2024 to pursue better opportunities in companies like Shopify and MSCI. The decision was driven by Salesforce's slower-than-expected revenue growth in a weakening macroeconomic environment and the maturity of its core end markets. Salesforce, Inc. saw an 18.51% one-month return and a 54.50% gain over the last 52 weeks but contributed negatively to Polen Focus Growth Strategy's performance due to a slowdown in revenue and bookings growth.

title: Final Trades: Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight, Salesforce Inc., Microsoft and Target
summary: The Investment Committee on CNBC's Halftime Report shared their final trade recommendations for the day, focusing on major companies and ETFs. Specifically, they discussed Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight, Salesforce, Microsoft, and Target. The article includes a short video clip featuring these recommendations.

title: Is Salesforce Stock a Buy Before Its Q3 Earnings Report?
summary: Salesforce (CRM) is set to announce its Q3 fiscal 2025 earnings on December 4th, with analysts expecting significant earnings growth driven by cost-saving initiatives and new AI-backed products like Agentforce and Einstein. Despite trading near all-time highs and an average "strong buy" rating from analysts, the stock's current price is about 7% above the average target price, and its forward P/E ratio is higher than the S&P 500, but lower than its historical average. The company aims to leverage its AI capabilities and expanding customer base to accelerate revenue growth, even as customer spending remains sluggish.

title: Pegasystems: Soaring Potential Backed By AI (NASDAQ:PEGA)
summary: Pegasystems (PEGA) is positioned for strong growth due to its leading AI integration, particularly with its GenAI Blueprint, which enhances productivity and reduces errors. The company shows robust financial health with consistent revenue growth, improving margins, and solid liquidity. With a 12-month price target implying a 27.0% upside, PEGA is an attractive investment, especially with international expansion and demand for CRM and DPA services.

title: Salesforce outage disrupts businesses across Asia Pacific
summary: Salesforce Inc. is experiencing a major service outage across the Asia Pacific region, affecting over one hundred companies and government bodies. The company is performing a rollback after identifying inconsistencies in databases and believing a recent change might have triggered the disruption. This outage follows other significant global cloud outages that have impacted various sectors this year.

title: Cloud software company ServiceTitan files to go public on Nasdaq
summary: ServiceTitan, a cloud software company providing services to contractors, has filed to go public on the Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "TTAN." This IPO filing signals increasing investor interest in next-generation software companies. The company reported a $35.7 million net loss on $193 million in revenue in the most recent quarter, with revenue up approximately 24% year over year.

title: Salesforce seals $1.9 billion cash deal to acquire cloud backup company Own
summary: Salesforce has completed its $1.9 billion acquisition of Israeli cloud backup company Own, marking its largest purchase since 2021. The deal, finalized with a cash transfer, provides returns for major investors like Vertex and Insight Partners, despite Own's valuation falling below its 2021 peak of $3.3 billion. The acquisition strengthens Salesforce's focus on data security and backup solutions.

title: Front acquires Idiomatic to bolster AI-driven customer service solutions
summary: Front, an AI-powered customer service platform, has acquired Idiomatic Inc., an AI-powered voice-of-customer intelligence platform, for an undisclosed sum. This acquisition aims to enhance Front's ability to provide automated customer insights and strengthen its position in the customer service sector by transforming customer feedback into actionable data. Idiomatic's founder and CEO, Kevin Yang, will now lead Front's AI strategy and product roadmap.

title: BlackLine announces $200 million stock buyback plan
summary: BlackLine, Inc. announced a new stock repurchase program allowing for the buyback of up to $200 million of its common stock, effective from Q1 2025 to Q1 2027. This strategic move aims to enhance shareholder value and coincides with recent strong financial performance, including exceeding Q3 2024 revenue guidance and significant product innovations. InvestingPro Insights suggest the buyback reinforces the company's high shareholder yield and strong financial position, despite a high Price/Book multiple.

title: CEO of Salesforce AI Clara Shih has left
summary: Clara Shih, CEO of Salesforce AI, has departed the company after 20 months to lead a new Business AI group at Meta. Adam Evans has stepped into the new role of executive vice president and general manager of Salesforce AI. This departure follows an earlier announcement by an investment analyst and reveals a trend of AI leadership changes, including Microsoft's VP of AI also leaving this week.

title: Salesforce Completes Its Own Company Acquisition, Ignites Ownership vs. Partnership Debate
summary: Salesforce has completed its $1.9 billion acquisition of Own Company, a specialist in SaaS data backup and recovery. This deal, Salesforce's largest since Slack, has sparked debate among customer experience community analysts regarding whether ownership or partnership is the better strategy for Salesforce's data protection focus. While some see it as a "smart pickup" to bolster Data Cloud's security, others believe Salesforce should maintain partnerships with third-party providers for broader consistency across cloud apps.

title: WestBridge Capital Offloads 2% Stake In Freshworks
summary: WestBridge Capital Management sold 2.75 Lakh shares, representing 2% of its stake, in Nasdaq-listed SaaS company Freshworks during the quarter ended September 2024. This transaction reduced WestBridge Capital's holding to just over 4%, valued at approximately $221 million. The news comes as Freshworks narrowed its consolidated net loss by 3.5% in Q3 2024, despite recently announcing layoffs and a $400 million stock buyback program.

title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff Thinks AI Has Hit a Roadblock
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff believes that the capabilities of large language model (LLM) AI chatbots are overhyped and nearing their limits. He suggests that the next significant advancements in AI will come from "agentic" AI, which can perform actions in online environments rather than just respond to queries. Benioff is advocating for the use of AI agents to automate bureaucratic tasks and improve workplace productivity.

title: Sagepath Reply Enhances Consumer Checking Onboarding Experience for SouthState
summary: Sagepath Reply partnered with SouthState Bank to significantly improve its consumer checking onboarding experience through a personalized, multi-channel approach. This initiative utilized Salesforce and Kentico to create custom emails, SMS reminders, and a central landing page, leading to higher customer engagement with increased email and SMS click-through rates. The enhanced journey not only streamlined essential onboarding tasks but also effectively introduced new customers to additional products and services.

title: Oracle generative AI approach based on Cohere, Meta models
summary: Oracle has strategically partnered with generative AI startup Cohere and Meta to integrate their foundation models into its various SaaS applications and Oracle Cloud Infrastructure. Rather than developing its own models, Oracle is leveraging Cohere's technology for its databases and vertical market applications, and customizing Meta's Llama models for its cloud platform. This approach prioritizes open architecture and deep partnerships to fine-tune AI models for enterprise-specific business solutions.

title: Sanofi CEO Paul Hudson takes inspiration from ‘Fight Club’ to get his team hooked on AI
summary: Sanofi CEO Paul Hudson is using unconventional methods, inspired by "Fight Club," to integrate AI throughout the pharmaceutical giant since announcing an "all in on AI" strategy in 2023. This includes a hackathon using the company's plai app, which optimizes supply chain and R&D with LLMs, leading to $800 million in reallocated funds. Hudson emphasizes that exclusivity and organic curiosity fostered by his "Fight Club" approach are key to successful AI adoption in large corporations.

title: AdTech Market: Trends, Innovations, and Growth Outlook 2032
summary: The global AdTech market, valued at USD 953.91 billion in 2023, is projected to reach USD 3,421.29 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 15.25%. This growth is driven by the shift to digital advertising, demand for personalized experiences, and key segments like on-premise deployment and large enterprises dominating the market. North America is currently the largest market shareholder, while Asia-Pacific is expected to be the fastest-growing region.

title: Microsoft is a Leader in the 2024 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ - Microsoft Dynamics 365 Blog
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in the 2024 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Cloud ERP for both Service-Centric and Product-Centric Enterprises. This recognition highlights Dynamics 365's ability to provide flexible, composable ERP solutions that address diverse organizational needs, driving results across financial, operational, and organizational models. The article emphasizes how Dynamics 365 empowers leaders with financial, operational, and organizational agility, leveraging AI and integrated tools like Copilot to enhance decision-making and optimize performance.

title: Lucas GC Limited Received a Significant Invention Patent in Artificial Intelligence Related to Human Resources
summary: Lucas GC Limited announced it has received its third patent of 2024, an invention patent titled "Talent Scout-Based Holistic Recruitment System" in China, bringing its total to nineteen patents. This new AI-driven patent leverages social media to match personalized recruitment content with potential candidates based on job requirements, profiles, and behaviors. Howard Lee, CEO, emphasized the patent's role in enhancing efficiency and accuracy in the hiring process through AI and Deep Learning technologies.

title: Equities weekly outlook: Salesforce, Dollar Tree, and Frasers
summary: This article provides an equities weekly outlook, analyzing the upcoming Q3 earnings for Salesforce and Dollar Tree, and H1 results for Frasers. Salesforce faces investor concerns over slowing growth and AI monetization, while Dollar Tree is expected to benefit from increased budget shopping amidst inflation. Frasers' results will offer insights into retail conditions given rising costs and weak consumer sentiment. Technical analysis for trading each stock's earnings is also included.

title: Salesforce shares rise after earnings beat on revenue, fourth-quarter guidance
summary: Salesforce (CRM) shares rose 9% after its fiscal third-quarter earnings and fourth-quarter guidance surpassed analysts' expectations. The company reported an 8% year-over-year revenue growth and a 25% increase in net income for the quarter, while also raising the lower end of its fiscal 2025 revenue guidance. CEO Marc Benioff highlighted the success of Agentforce, their AI system, as a key driver of transformation.

title: Salesforce stock price is surging today. Here are 3 reasons why
summary: Salesforce stock surged in premarket trading following its Q3 fiscal year 2025 results, driven by strong revenue growth and exceptional demand for its AI chatbot offering, Agentforce. The company also provided an optimistic Q4 guidance and received an upgraded price target from Citi. CEO Marc Benioff highlighted the transformative potential of Agentforce, emphasizing its role in revolutionizing global labor.

title: Salesforce Paid $344 Million in Zoomin Startup Acquisition
summary: Salesforce Inc. spent $344 million to acquire data management startup Zoomin Software Ltd. last month, a sum previously undisclosed. The acquisition cost for Zoomin's outstanding shares was revealed in a recent filing, highlighting Salesforce's new approach to dealmaking and bolstering its Data Cloud product. Salesforce had been a prior investor in Zoomin, already owning a minority stake.

title: Salesforce’s ‘hard pivot’ to AI agents pays off with an 11% stock surge. But now the company must hustle to actually sell the product
summary: Salesforce's "hard pivot" to its new AI agent platform, Agentforce, has led to an 11% stock surge after strong quarterly earnings. Despite investor optimism and a goal of tens of thousands of customers using the product by January 2025, Agentforce is not yet a material contributor to the company's revenue, and Salesforce is hiring more salespeople to drive its adoption. The company faces a critical test to prove the long-term payoff of its AI investments in a competitive market.

title: Inside Salesforce’s bold ambitions to deploy 1bn enterprise AI agents within a year
summary: Salesforce aims to deploy 1 billion enterprise AI agents within a year through its new Agentforce platform, which is designed to enhance sales, service, marketing, and commerce by proactively managing tasks. The company sees Agentforce as a way to compete with Microsoft in the enterprise AI market and offers rapid deployment and customization for businesses. Early adopters like OpenTable and Saks Fifth Avenue are already using Agentforce to automate operations, with Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff expressing confidence in its potential to revolutionize industries and achieve widespread adoption.

title: Why Is Adobe Inc. (ADBE) Among the Best Tech Stocks for Long Term Investment?
summary: This article examines why Adobe Inc. (ADBE) is considered a top tech stock for long-term investment, placing it among the 10 best tech stocks according to an analysis of hedge fund holdings and analyst sentiment. It highlights Adobe's expanded partnership with Amazon Web Services to integrate its Experience Platform on the AWS cloud, enhancing personalization capabilities for marketers through real-time customer data. The piece also discusses the broader AI revolution's impact on tech investments, emphasizing the shift towards AI infrastructure and application layers.

title: Asymbl Joins as Salesforce Foundations Launch Partner to Deliver Advanced Recruiting Capabilities to Firms of All Sizes with Asymbl ATS
summary: Asymbl, Inc. announced its integration of Asymbl ATS, an advanced Applicant Tracking System, with Salesforce Foundations. This collaboration positions Asymbl as a Salesforce Foundations Launch Partner, enabling firms of all sizes to streamline recruiting workflows and leverage Salesforce's Customer 360 and AI functionalities. The integration aims to optimize talent operations through powerful automation and seamless data flow, enhancing efficiency and ROI for recruiting teams.

title: Is Cabaletta Bio (NASDAQ:CABA) In A Good Position To Invest In Growth?
summary: This article analyzes Cabaletta Bio's financial position, specifically its cash burn rate and cash runway, to assess its ability to fund growth. As of September 2024, the company had US$183m in cash with a US$84m annual burn rate, giving it a cash runway of about 2.2 years. Analysts forecast the company will reach cashflow breakeven in 4 years, suggesting a potential need for further capital raising, especially given its high cash burn relative to its market capitalization.

title: Bullish AI spenders report higher ROI rates
summary: A recent EY survey indicates that businesses investing 5% or more of their total budget in AI achieve higher returns on investment compared to those spending less. These "bullish" AI spenders report increased ROI across various areas such as operational efficiency and employee productivity. However, the study also highlights that inadequate data infrastructure is a significant bottleneck, with 83% of senior business leaders believing stronger data infrastructure would accelerate their AI adoption.

title: Salesforce Inc (CRM) DCF Valuation: Is The Stock Undervalued?
summary: This article presents a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) valuation for Salesforce Inc (CRM) to determine if its stock is undervalued. Based on the analysis with a 9% discount rate and 2% terminal growth rate, the DCF value per share is calculated at $232.97, which is considerably lower than the current market price of $361.38, indicating a -55.12% margin of safety and suggesting the stock is overvalued. The article also provides a company profile and discusses recent stock performance.

title: ServiceTitan IPO: Stock price soars as CRM software platform goes public on the Nasdaq
summary: ServiceTitan, a maker of software for tradespersons, has gone public on the Nasdaq under the ticker TTAN. The company's stock opened at $101 per share on its trading debut, significantly above its IPO price of $71, reflecting strong investor interest. ServiceTitan raised approximately $625 million in its offering, achieving a valuation of about $6.3 billion.

title: Sprout’s product strategy for 2025 and beyond
summary: Erika Trautman, Sprout Social's Chief Product Officer, outlines the company's product strategy for 2025 and beyond, emphasizing customer-centric development. The strategy focuses on delivering company-wide value from social insights, harnessing AI's potential, providing personalized customer care, and transforming influencer marketing management. Sprout aims to build scalable solutions to meet the complex needs of brands of all sizes, guided by continuous customer feedback.

title: Dawn of digital labor: Salesforce’s Marc Benioff envisions a multitrillion-dollar opportunity for AI agents
summary: Salesforce Inc. CEO Marc Benioff views AI agents and digital labor as a multitrillion-dollar opportunity, expanding the company's AI offerings beyond CRM. The enhanced Agentforce 2.0 now crosses enterprise workflows and has demonstrated significant success in customer support, resolving 83% of cases with 50% fewer human escalations. Salesforce aims to differentiate itself by delivering autonomous agents at scale and creating a new industry.

title: Salesforce closes 1,000 paid 'Agentforce' deals, looks to robot future
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced over 1,000 paid deals for "Agentforce," its AI-powered virtual representative platform, and previewed improvements for building bots. Benioff stated the company now requires fewer humans for simple customer queries, aiming to expand its sales headcount, and plans a "robot force partner program" to connect real-world machines with virtual ones. He also discussed the future impact of "digital labor" on the economy and expressed hope for engagement with the incoming Trump administration on the topic.

title: Shriram Finance, Anant Raj, PPL among 9 stocks that saw brokerage initiations with 40% upside
summary: Several brokerage firms have recently initiated coverage on nine buzzing stocks, including Shriram Finance, Anant Raj, and Piramal Pharma, all with 'buy' or 'add' ratings and an upside potential of up to 40%. The brokerages highlight strong growth prospects, expanding market share, and strategic initiatives as key drivers for these companies. Each company's specific investment case, target price, and expected upside are detailed in the report.

title: YAAS - Youxin Technology Ltd Latest Stock News & Market Updates
summary: This page provides the latest news and insights on Youxin Technology Ltd (NASDAQ: YAAS), a SaaS and PaaS provider focusing on digital transformation for retail enterprises. Recent updates include strengthening its balance sheet through warrant exercises, regaining compliance with Nasdaq listing requirements, and strategic expansion via the acquisition of Celnet Technology Co., Ltd. The company also received the Hong Kong Innovation Leadership Award for its technological contributions.

title: Intermedia Unite Review
summary: Intermedia Unite offers comprehensive voice administration features, chat, file syncing, and video calls, making it a strong unified communications platform. Despite a slightly less straightforward contact import process and a Chrome-only web app, its competitive pricing, AI Assistant, and excellent call routing earned it an Editors' Choice award. The service performs reliably, providing crisp phone calls, clear video, and an intuitive interface across desktop, web, and mobile platforms.

title: Amazon Accused of Mismanaging Millions of 401(k) Forfeiture Funds
summary: Amazon.com Inc. and its 401(k) plan administrative committee are facing a lawsuit for allegedly mismanaging millions in employee forfeiture funds. A participant, Cory Curtis, claims that Amazon used these funds to offset its own contributions rather than reducing administrative fees for plan participants between 2018 and 2023. The lawsuit highlights a growing trend of forfeiture-related litigation against large companies, although critics argue that such cases weaponize ERISA given Amazon's already low plan fees.

title: ValueAct Posts 21% Returns in 2024 on Salesforce, Meta Holdings
summary: ValueAct Capital Management achieved a 21% net return in its flagship fund in 2024, outperforming the average activist fund return of 11.5%. The investment fund focused heavily on technology and media companies, with top holdings including Salesforce Inc., Meta Platforms Inc., and Walt Disney Co. This strong performance highlights ValueAct's successful strategy in these sectors.

title: AI in 2025 – Intuit Tech Leaders See Beyond the Hype
summary: Intuit tech leaders anticipate that 2025 will be a pivotal year for AI, marked by both excitement and skepticism. They emphasize that customer control, trust, and practicality will drive the success of AI-powered experiences, including agentic AI, code-free solutions, and enhanced security measures. The article highlights key areas such as balancing autonomous efficiency with user authority, the importance of AI governance, the convergence of fintech and AI, and the emerging threat of deepfakes.

title: Lead Generation World 2025: Key Takeaways and Trends Shaping the Future
summary: This article summarizes key takeaways from the Lead Generation World 2025 conference, highlighting innovation, compliance, and long-term growth as critical pillars for success. It discusses trends in navigating the changing landscape, the evolution of affiliate marketing towards data-driven brand building, and strategies for success in mortgage lead generation. The author emphasizes adaptability, embracing new tools, and creating value as essential for thriving in the lead generation space.

title: Where Brazil's big financial institutions are investing in tech
summary: Brazilian banks are significantly increasing their technology investments to enhance customer service, boost efficiency, and compete with fintechs. Key areas of focus include database integration, cloud adoption, and especially artificial intelligence solutions. Major banks like Itaú Unibanco, Bradesco, Santander Brasil, and Banco do Brasil are allocating substantial resources to AI, cloud migration, and developing "superapps" to personalize services and streamline operations.

title: At NRF, companies like Dick’s Sporting Goods and Sweetgreen talk up expanded uses of AI
summary: At the 2025 NRF Big Show, retailers demonstrated tangible applications of AI beyond basic customer service, focusing on operational efficiency. Dick's Sporting Goods showcased an AI-powered pricing model for inventory optimization, while Sweetgreen highlighted its "Infinite Kitchen" robotics for faster food preparation. Despite the benefits, experts like Centric Software's Joe Groves noted the overwhelming number of AI solutions on the market and the continued need for human oversight and contextual data in AI models, as emphasized by Dick's Sporting Goods.

title: INDA: A Compelling Value After A Big Pullback, Technical Support In Play
summary: I have a buy rating on INDA due to its compelling valuation, robust long-term EPS growth, and solid corporate earnings trends despite recent economic softness. India's manufacturing PMI hit an 11-month low, and output prices reached an 11-year high, impacting INDA's 2024 performance, underperforming the S&P 500. Despite technical concerns like a bearish death cross and oversold RSI, INDA's pullback to key support levels presents a 'buy the dip' opportunity, making it a compelling value.

title: CCPA Compliance: A Guide for Marketing Pros
summary: This article explains CCPA compliance for marketing professionals, outlining who it applies to, the rights it grants to California consumers regarding their personal data, and the penalties for violations. It also provides a marketer's checklist for compliance, emphasizing transparency in data collection, usage, and the provision of opt-out mechanisms. The piece distinguishes CCPA from GDPR and highlights the shift towards first-party data collection it encourages.

title: 7 Best Content Distribution Platforms to Grow Your Reach
summary: This article identifies and compares seven top content distribution platforms for 2026, including Buffer, Bynder, Distribution.ai, Hootsuite, Mailchimp, RELAYTO, and StoryChief. It emphasizes the critical role of content distribution in ensuring content is seen by a wide audience, especially with evolving search engine algorithms and AI. The article also provides guidance on how to choose a suitable platform, highlighting factors like UI, usability, integrations, and cost, alongside advice for building an effective content distribution strategy.

title: How to Leverage AI for Innovation & Growth in Your Consumer-Facing Organization: 3 Real-world Use Cases
summary: This article discusses how consumer-facing organizations can leverage AI, particularly generative AI (GenAI), for innovation and growth. It highlights the significant increase in GenAI investments and emphasizes the need for a strategic and responsible approach. The piece presents three real-world use cases: personalized image creation, content creation, and "talk to your data" scenarios, demonstrating AI's potential to enhance customer experiences and operational efficiency.

title: Marc Benioff says that from now on CEOs will no longer lead all-human workforces—enter the new era of AI coworkers
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff stated at the World Economic Forum that current CEOs will be the last to lead exclusively human workforces, predicting a future where AI agents act as "digital workers."
