He emphasized that AI will support human employees to achieve higher productivity rather than replace them, a sentiment echoed by Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei who foresees AI surpassing human capabilities by 2026 or 2027. While employers like Salesforce are readily adopting AI agents, the concept faces resistance from workers concerned about job displacement, as seen in the backlash received by HR company Lattice.

title: ETF of the Week: DGRW
summary: This article highlights the WisdomTree US Quality Dividend Growth Fund (DGRW) as the ETF of the Week, discussed by VettaFi’s Head of Research Todd Rosenbluth and Chuck Jaffe. DGRW focuses on high-quality companies with a forward-looking approach to dividend growth, suitable as a core or complementary holding in a portfolio. Despite a modest 2% yield, it offers capital appreciation potential and has received strong ratings from Lipper and Morningstar.

title: West Coast owners optimistic about return-to-office policies
summary: Apartment REIT executives are optimistic about the performance of properties in San Francisco and Seattle, following major companies like Amazon and Salesforce implementing return-to-office mandates. This shift has led to increased demand for rental units in these cities, driving up touring activity and occupancy rates. Despite past struggles, particularly in San Francisco, the return-to-office trend, coupled with minimal new apartment construction, is expected to boost rental markets in 2025 and beyond.

title: First Solar Adopts First of its Kind Deep Sea-Mined Mineral Exclusion Policy in the Solar Power Sector
summary: First Solar Inc. has committed to exclude deep sea-mined minerals from its supply chain, a move supported by shareholder representative As You Sow. This decision challenges the need for deep sea mining for the energy transition and aligns with the Global Moratorium on Deep Sea Mining. First Solar's long-standing commitment to circularity, demonstrated by its solar panel recycling program, underpins this new policy.

title: 3 Reasons Vanguard’s VGT ETF Belongs in Your Portfolio
summary: The Vanguard Information Technology ETF (VGT) is presented as a strong option for investors seeking aggressive tech exposure, especially in the growing AI boom. The article highlights three key advantages: its superior focus on tech compared to the Nasdaq 100, its heavy concentration in leading tech giants like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, and its competitive low expense ratio of 0.09%. These factors position VGT as a viable choice for future-proofing portfolios despite concerns about an overextended AI trade.

title: JLL arranges $1.125B refinancing for 3 Bryant Park in Midtown Manhattan
summary: JLL's Capital Markets group has arranged a $1.125 billion refinancing for 3 Bryant Park, a trophy office tower in Midtown Manhattan, for owners Ivanhoé Cambridge and asset manager Hines. The loan, led by Wells Fargo, Bank of America, and Bank of Montreal, signifies increasing liquidity for large office loans and confidence in the sector, especially given the property's high occupancy, elite tenant roster, and prime location. This transaction is considered one of the most significant office refinancings of its scale post-pandemic, reflecting a positive shift in market perception.

title: Citi maintains Buy rating on monday.com with $298 target
summary: Citi has reiterated its Buy rating and $298 price target for monday.com (NASDAQ: MNDY) after the company reported strong Q4 2024 financial results, surpassing consensus estimates for revenue, EBIT, billings, and free cash flow. Despite concerns about overvaluation by InvestingPro's Fair Value analysis, monday.com's revenue growth, gross profit margin, and improving net dollar retention rate were highlighted. The article also touches on varying analyst price targets and recommendations from other firms like TD Cowen, Baird, and Scotiabank.

title: Scaling AI at Coca-Cola: From Marketing to Supply Chain and Beyond
summary: Coca-Cola's CIO, Neeraj Tolmare, discusses the company's extensive AI integration, spanning marketing to supply chain, highlighting their digital transformation journey, cloud adoption, and data modernization. The interview emphasizes the role of analytical and generative AI in enhancing creativity, efficiency, and consumer engagement, while also addressing challenges like deepfakes and the need for robust governance and talent development for global scaling.

title: Salesforce, Inc. (CRM): Among the Large-Cap Stocks Insiders Are Selling Recently
summary: Salesforce, Inc. (CRM) is identified as one of the large-cap stocks with significant insider selling activity recently. The article details that eight insiders, including top executives, sold over $535 million worth of shares. Despite this, some analysts remain bullish on CRM due to its AI application, Agentforce, and a consensus "Buy" rating with a price target significantly above its current trading price.

title: Institutional investors may overlook Salesforce, Inc.'s (NYSE:CRM) recent US$19b market cap drop as long-term gains remain positive
summary: Institutional investors hold an 82% stake in Salesforce, meaning they significantly influence the company's share price. Despite a recent US$19 billion market cap drop, the one-year return for shareholders remains positive at 16%, softening the impact. The top 24 shareholders collectively own 50% of the company, with The Vanguard Group and BlackRock being the largest institutional holders.

title: SAP announces Databricks partnership to power AI with Business Data Cloud
summary: SAP has launched the Business Data Cloud, a new solution designed to unify SAP and third-party data to power AI applications and provide deeper insights. This initiative includes a strategic partnership with Databricks, embedding their data engineering and AI technologies directly into SAP's cloud offerings. The Business Data Cloud aims to provide businesses with enhanced control over their data, enabling more reliable AI functionalities and offering "high-octane" data products for specific industry use cases, along with supercharging SAP's generative AI copilot, Joule.

title: 3 Options to Capitalize on Cloud & AI Growth
summary: This article discusses investment opportunities in the growing cloud computing and artificial intelligence (AI) sectors. It highlights two Direxion leveraged ETFs, CLDL and UBOT, for traders seeking amplified exposure to these industries. Additionally, it suggests Microsoft, with a corresponding leveraged ETF MSFU, as a strong single-stock option leveraging both cloud and AI advancements.

title: Q&A: ManpowerGroup exec explains how to manage an AI workforce
summary: Carolyn Balkin, general manager for Global Client Solutions at ManpowerGroup, discusses the evolving landscape of workforce management with the adoption of AI. She emphasizes the need for soft skills like problem-solving and complex reasoning in human employees, as AI takes over repetitive tasks. Balkin also highlights the emerging challenge of managing AI agents as "digital employees," requiring new approaches to upskilling, talent acquisition based on skills rather than job titles, and extensive collaboration and governance across business functions.

title: If You’re Not Using a CRM, What Are You Waiting for?
summary: The article highlights the critical importance of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software for businesses, particularly small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Despite its benefits in managing customer relations and scaling operations, a recent survey revealed that over half of SMBs are not utilizing a CRM system. The author, a business owner, emphasizes that she could not have grown her company without one, urging others to adopt this essential tool.

title: Lee Enterprises Experienced Ransomware Attack, Raising the Possibility of a Data Breach
summary: Lee Enterprises recently experienced a ransomware attack, causing disruptions to its operations. While the company is investigating the incident with cybersecurity experts, it is still determining whether a data breach occurred and if confidential consumer or employee information was compromised. If a breach is confirmed, Lee Enterprises will be obligated to notify affected individuals.

title: Earnings call transcript: Booking Holdings Q4 2024 beats forecasts, stock surges
summary: Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) reported strong financial results for Q4 2024, surpassing market expectations with an EPS of $41.55 against a forecast of $36.13 and revenue of $5.47 billion over a projected $5.19 billion. The company's stock rose 4.32% in aftermarket trading, reflecting positive investor sentiment. Strategic investments in AI, growth in room nights and gross bookings, and ongoing efforts to enhance its "Connected Trip" vision were highlighted as key drivers for future growth and operational efficiencies.

title: AIG elects Salesforce’s Juan Perez as Independent Director to its Board
summary: American International Group (AIG) has appointed Juan Perez, Executive Vice President and CIO of Salesforce, as an independent director to its Board. Perez brings over three decades of experience in strategic technology initiatives, including expertise in AI, data strategy, and digital transformation from his roles at Salesforce and previously UPS. His appointment is expected to significantly contribute to AIG's ongoing data and digital strategy, aiming to enhance value for clients and stakeholders.

title: Among Canadians in Silicon Valley, talk of a trade war has a techno-optimist spin
summary: Canadian technology entrepreneurs and leaders gathered in San Francisco for the C100 Summit amidst escalating U.S.-Canada trade tensions. Despite the geopolitical friction posed by potential tariffs, attendees largely expressed techno-optimism, believing the crisis could spur Canada to enhance its global competitiveness in technology rather than relying on traditional goods trade. Many also saw it as an opportunity for Canada to address internal economic policies and foster a more business-friendly environment to retain and attract tech companies.

title: Can Tech Save Small Ski Resorts From Extinction?
summary: Entabeni Systems, a small tech consultancy, is working to help independent ski resorts survive increasingly difficult economic and environmental conditions. Founded by Erik Mogensen, the company streamlines operations and introduces technology to make resorts more efficient and skier-friendly, collecting data on skier behavior and sales to optimize performance. Mogensen also bought Indy Pass and Black Mountain ski area, using the latter as a laboratory to develop custom hardware and software solutions focused on making skiing more accessible and sustainable.

title: Salesforce Earnings Preview: Google Deal in Focus as Stock Slides
summary: Salesforce (CRM) is set to report quarterly earnings, with analysts expecting an EPS of $2.61 on $10.04 billion in revenue. A recent expanded partnership with Google (GOOGL) will integrate Google's Gemini AI chatbot into Salesforce's Agentforce platform, aiming to enhance AI capabilities. Despite the strategic partnership, the stock has fallen from its all-time high, and high implied volatility in options suggests significant market anticipation for the earnings report.

title: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 Earnings
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) reported its Q4 CY2024 earnings, missing Wall Street's revenue expectations with sales of $9.99 billion, though this represented a 7.6% year-on-year growth. The company's revenue guidance for the next quarter and the upcoming financial year 2026 also fell below analyst estimates, implying a deceleration in growth. Despite the revenue miss, Salesforce's non-GAAP profit of $2.78 per share beat estimates by 6.4%, and it achieved record cash flow and RPO.

title: CRM Earnings: Highlights of Salesforce’s Q4 2025 report
summary: Salesforce (NYSE: CRM) reported its Q4 2025 financial results, showing an adjusted net income of $2.78 per share, an increase from $2.29 per share in the prior year. The company's unadjusted profit for the quarter was $1.71 billion, or $1.75 per share. Salesforce also announced revenues of $10.0 billion for the January quarter, up from $9.29 billion in the corresponding period of fiscal 2024.

title: Flywire acquires Sertifi for $330m to expand travel & hospitality payments
summary: Flywire Corporation has acquired Sertifi, a platform that digitizes hospitality workflows and payments, for $330 million using a combination of cash and debt. This acquisition is set to expand Flywire's existing travel payments business by adding new product categories and providing immediate access to new subsegments of the global travel industry. Sertifi, which serves major hotel brands like Marriott and Hilton, is expected to generate approximately $35-40 million in revenue for Flywire in FY 2025.

title: 6sense Named a Leader in B2B Intent Data Providers Evaluation by Independent Research Firm
summary: 6sense, a leading B2B revenue generation platform, has been recognized as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Intent Data Providers For B2B, Q1 2025 report. The independent analyst firm Forrester highlighted 6sense for its innovative approach, differentiated analytics, strong partner ecosystem, and superior identity resolution capabilities. 6sense's platform, powered by the 6sense Signalverse, received top scores in accuracy, noise filtering, buying cycle analysis, and insight generation, demonstrating its ability to help revenue teams prioritize opportunities and engage buyers effectively.

title: What’s Happening With Palantir Stock?
summary: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) experienced a significant rally followed by a sharp decline, raising questions about its current valuation. Morningstar equity analyst Mark Giarelli views Palantir as having strong growth potential, especially given its leadership in AI technologies, and currently sees the stock as fairly valued despite its high volatility. Investors are cautioned to consider the stock's wide swings, the impact of potential government spending cutbacks, and the large but uncertain total addressable market for its analytical software.

title: Avalara Announces Integration for Salesforce Revenue Cloud on Salesforce AppExchange
summary: Avalara has released an updated connector for Salesforce's Revenue Cloud, now available on Salesforce AppExchange, to simplify tax compliance for businesses. This integration allows for automated field mappings and supports powerful configuration options, enabling businesses to calculate taxes quickly. The collaboration aims to streamline revenue management and tax compliance, benefiting mutual customers by providing an efficient solution within the Salesforce ecosystem.

title: Nadella vs. Benioff: The real story behind AI’s agentic future
summary: This article analyzes the contrasting visions of Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella and Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff regarding the future of enterprise software and agentic AI. Nadella predicts that AI-powered agents will redefine enterprise software by largely replacing traditional SaaS applications, while Benioff believes AI will augment existing platforms. The authors argue that the future will involve AI agents integrating with existing enterprise applications and highlight a seismic shift from rigid, linear value chains to dynamic, orchestrated platforms, with Salesforce currently holding an advantage in building out a cohesive digital business model.

title: 8 Top Performance Marketing Trends for SMBs To Know in 2026
summary: This article outlines eight key performance marketing trends for SMBs in 2026, focusing on how businesses can adapt to evolving technology and consumer behavior. Key trends include AI-driven optimization, personalized marketing, signal-based targeting in a post-cookie world, and the growing importance of various forms of video content, niche partnerships, outcome-based marketing, and creative as a primary performance lever. The article emphasizes that successful performance marketing in 2026 will blend technology with human oversight, prioritizing measurable results and creative agility in a privacy-conscious landscape.

title: 19 Affiliate Marketing Tools to Boost Conversions
summary: This article lists 19 essential affiliate marketing tools to help boost conversions, covering various aspects like SEO, social media management, email marketing, and content creation. Each tool is described with its features, pricing, pros, and cons. The article also provides best practices for choosing and leveraging these tools effectively, emphasizing goal setting, avoiding overlap, and consistency.

title: Salesforce launches AI agent skills marketplace with 200+ initial partners
summary: Salesforce has launched AgentExchange, a new marketplace for AI agent skills, expanding the capabilities of their Agentforce AI agents. The platform debuts with over 200 partners, offering tools to enhance productivity and efficiency by allowing AI agents to perform tasks autonomously. This initiative follows Salesforce's previous success with AppExchange and a recent $2.5 billion deal with Google Cloud to integrate Google Gemini models.

title: Salesforce lets AI agents run in the background with Agentforce 2dx launch
summary: Salesforce has launched Agentforce 2dx, an updated platform for AI agents that enables them to operate proactively in the background, autonomously, and with greater efficiency. This new iteration allows agents to be triggered by events rather than just chat interfaces, facilitating integration into various workflows. Additionally, Salesforce introduced new development tools, including Agentforce Developer Edition, to help both business and pro-code users build, customize, test, and deploy AI agents more rapidly, offering advanced analytics for performance optimization.

title: Ross Healy's Top Picks: Fortuna Mining, Power Corp., Oceana Gold
summary: Ross Healy, chairman of Strategic Analysis Corporation and portfolio manager at MacNicol & Associates Asset Management, has shared his top stock picks. His recommendations include Fortuna Mining, Power Corp., and Oceana Gold. The article highlights these selections for investors to consider.

title: Salesforce joins growing list of companies ending diversity hiring initiatives
summary: Salesforce Inc. has become the latest company to end its diversity hiring initiatives, removing language about diversity and inclusion from its annual financial disclosure. This decision follows executive orders signed by President Donald Trump targeting the elimination of DEI programs. Other major companies like Google, Meta, Target, Amazon, Walmart, and Deloitte have also rolled back similar initiatives.

title: 3 Companies Striving for Equal Pay Practices in 2025
summary: This article identifies three companies—Microsoft (MSFT), Albemarle (ALB), and Coty (COTY)—that are leading in equal pay practices as of 2025, according to Morningstar's Sustainalytics data and financial metrics. On International Women's Day, the author highlights these firms for their commitment to pay fairness, along with an update on companies featured in previous years. The selection criteria involved strong pay equity programs, disclosures, and positive Morningstar financial indicators like economic moat and valuation.

title: After Earnings, Is Salesforce Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Salesforce CRM recently released its fourth-quarter earnings, showing results generally in line with expectations, supported by healthy multi-cloud deals and an expanding AI platform. Morningstar maintains a fair value estimate of $315.00 per share, rating the stock as ★★★ (fairly valued) with a wide economic moat and high uncertainty. The company's financial strength is considered sound, with a solid net cash position and growing margins, despite risks related to leadership and revenue growth deceleration in certain segments.

title: ServiceNow to acquire AI firm Moveworks for $3B
summary: ServiceNow Inc. is reportedly nearing a $3 billion acquisition of AI firm Moveworks, with negotiations possibly concluding soon. This strategic move aligns with ServiceNow's focus on generative AI and aims to enhance its AI-driven enterprise automation leadership. Moveworks, founded in 2016 and valued at $2.1 billion in 2021, specializes in AI assistants for employee requests and is used by major companies.

title: Druva debuts fully integrated support for Microsoft Azure
summary: Druva, a SaaS platform for data security and backup, has introduced integrated support for Microsoft Azure, expanding its services beyond its decade-long AWS exclusivity. This move allows Druva customers to backup Microsoft Azure and Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud VMs to Azure Storage, with further services planned through a strategic partnership with Microsoft. The development addresses the growing multi-cloud environment used by enterprises and positions Druva to meet broader market demands.

title: AI Takes Flight: Singapore Airlines Taps Salesforce For Next-Gen Customer Service Tech
summary: Singapore Airlines (SIA) has partnered with Salesforce to enhance its customer service operations using AI. SIA will implement Salesforce's AI-powered Agentforce system and leverage Einstein's generative AI within Service Cloud for improved customer interaction summaries and personalized assistance. Both companies will also collaborate at Salesforce’s AI Research hub in Singapore to develop new AI solutions for the aviation industry.

title: Ford Mission Statement | Vision | Values | Strategy (2025 Analysis)
summary: This article analyzes Ford Motor Company's mission statement, vision, and core values, and their strategic implications for 2025. It details Ford's commitment to community strength, improving lives, and positive impact, supported by significant financial contributions and employee volunteering. The company's vision is to become the world's most trusted company, achieved through pillars of education support, safe driving promotion, and community enrichment.

title: Anthropic Enterprise Edge: How Investors Can Gain Exposure Through The AGIX ETF
summary: This article highlights Anthropic's significant position in the AI sector and its ethical approach to AI development. It explains how investors can gain exposure to this private AI company through the KraneShares Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AGIX), which holds Anthropic as its fourth-largest holding. The piece also details Anthropic's rapid growth, strategic partnerships with tech giants like Amazon, Google, Salesforce, and AWS, and the launch of its advanced Claude 3.7 Sonnet AI model.

title: Adobe Announces New Offerings with AWS and Amazon Ads for Marketers and Creatives to Deliver Impactful Customer Experiences at Scale
summary: Adobe has announced a strategic collaboration with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Amazon Ads to enhance customer experience orchestration. This partnership aims to provide marketers and creative teams with new tools and integrations, leveraging AWS's cloud services, generative AI, and Amazon Connect, to deliver personalized customer experiences at scale. The offerings include enhanced omnichannel experiences, AI-driven interactions, boosted marketing performance, and streamlined creative workflows through integrations with Adobe Experience Platform, Amazon Marketing Cloud, and Adobe Creative Cloud.

title: Fiserv, PayPal and FIS change up board members
summary: Payments companies Fiserv, PayPal, FIS, and Klarna have recently updated their board memberships amidst increased merger and acquisition activity and the industry's rapid evolution. PayPal welcomed Joy Chik, an AI expert, to its board, while Fiserv appointed Stephanie Cohen as an independent director shortly after acquiring Dutch payments company CCV. FIS saw a board reduction with Lee Adrean's departure, and Klarna added two new members ahead of its planned initial public offering, a move that often precedes M&A or IPO events.

title: Business Process Management Market: 15 Key Players
summary: This article identifies 15 key players in the rapidly expanding Business Process Management (BPM) market. It highlights how these companies are driving business transformation through solutions that optimize workflows, improve efficiency, and enhance decision-making using AI, cloud computing, and low-code platforms. The BPM market is projected to reach USD 30.07 billion by 2031, with these companies at the forefront of innovation.

title: The 16 best HubSpot updates from February 2025
summary: HubSpot introduced 115 updates in February 2025, with this article highlighting the 16 most impactful changes. These updates focus on smarter automation, deeper insights, and improved customization across various HubSpot Hubs. Key enhancements include AI-powered tools like Remix for content repurposing, advanced A/B testing for CTAs, more granular revenue tracking, and significant improvements for administrators in managing data and workflows.

title: US tech sector now decently undervalued
summary: The US technology sector, as of March 26, is now considered decently undervalued, shifting from being modestly overvalued a quarter ago. The median tech stock is 13% undervalued on a price-to-fair-value basis, with hardware, software, and semiconductors also below fair value estimates. Wide-moat names like Microsoft, Salesforce, ServiceNow, and Tyler Technologies, along with cybersecurity firms like Palo Alto Networks and Okta, are highlighted as attractive long-term investments due to their recurring revenue models and sticky customer bases.

title: Baozun returns to the black as Gap expansion accelerates
summary: Baozun Inc. reported its first quarterly net profit in over three years, driven by strong growth in its brand management and e-commerce services business, with plans to open a net 40 new Gap stores in China this year. Despite the positive financial turnaround and respectable revenue growth, the company's stock experienced a significant drop following the earnings announcement, indicating investor skepticism about its valuation compared to peers. Baozun aims for 2025 to be a "transformative" year, focusing on expanding its brand management, including Gap and Hunter stores in China, while navigating shifts in its traditional e-commerce services.

title: AI Chatter Hits Record on European Earnings Calls Across Sectors
summary: Mentions of "AI" on European earnings calls have surged to a record high, with 1,788 mentions on fourth-quarter calls for Stoxx Europe 600 companies, a 20% increase from the previous year. This rise isn't limited to tech firms; companies in sectors like recruitment, health care, and telecommunications are also increasingly discussing AI to boost efficiency and competitiveness. The trend indicates a broader adoption of AI-enabled tools across various industries, making the technology a significant topic of discussion among European businesses.

title: Spring Cleaning for Your Finances
summary: This article suggests "spring cleaning" for finances, comparing it to decluttering a home. It provides actionable advice on improving financial health by tidying up budgets, organizing documents, assessing credit scores, and refreshing savings and investment strategies. The goal is to encourage better financial habits and a more secure future.

title: What a study at consumer giant P&G says about AI's potential impact on teamwork
summary: A new study conducted at Procter & Gamble reveals that AI significantly enhances both individual and team performance, particularly in brainstorming new product ideas. While AI-assisted individuals outperformed unassisted human teams, AI-assisted teams generated a higher number of "exceptional" ideas. The study suggests that AI should be viewed as a complement to human labor, fostering collaboration and encouraging more holistic problem-solving rather than merely a tool for automation and headcount reduction.

title: Microsoft named a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Customer Relationship Management, Q1 2025
summary: Microsoft has been recognized as a Leader in The Forrester Wave™: Customer Relationship Management, Q1 2025, for its Dynamics 365 platform. The platform is lauded for its unified approach to sales, marketing, and service, driven by generative AI advancements like Copilot and AI agents. This recognition highlights Microsoft's commitment to providing an integrated, secure, and responsible AI-powered CRM solution that helps organizations meet evolving customer expectations and improve operational efficiency.

title: Valley National Bank takes commercial lending to the cloud
summary: Valley National Bank, a $23 billion financial institution, is implementing nCino’s Bank Operating System for commercial lending. This cloud-based solution is built on Salesforce.com and is expected to provide greater transparency into the loan process and improve communication with customers. The bank views this move as part of its multiyear journey towards customer centricity, digitization, and data-driven decision making.

title: SPECIAL REPORT: Move by Move, Beyond Looks To Rewrite the Traditional Retail Model
summary: Beyond, the entity formed from Overstock.com after acquiring Bed Bath & Beyond assets, is undergoing a significant strategic overhaul under executive chairman Marcus Lemonis. The company is pivoting to an asset-light, holding company structure focused on monetizing customer data through a "LifeChain" and leveraging tokenized digital securities for its brands like Buy Buy Baby and Overstock. This new model aims to build a community of vested investors and customers while re-establishing its core brands and expanding through partnerships like the one with Kirkland's for brick-and-mortar presence.

title: 3 Reasons Why Salesforce is the Worst-Performing Dow Stock of 2025
summary: Salesforce (CRM) is the worst-performing Dow stock of 2025, primarily due to slower-than-expected revenue growth, concerns over AI adoption and its pricing models, and broader market skepticism regarding high-valued tech stocks. Despite strong institutional ownership and a dividend increase, the stock has tumbled, though analysts maintain a "Strong Buy" rating for its long-term potential. Technical indicators suggest CRM might be oversold, hinting at a potential short-term rebound.

title: MySize Reports 2024 Full-Year Financial Results: Revenue Grows 18% to $8.26 Million and Cash Reserves More Than Double
summary: MySize, Inc. announced strong financial results for the full year 2024, with revenue increasing by 18% year-over-year to $8.26 million. The company also more than doubled its cash and cash equivalents to $4.88 million, while reducing its net loss by 37% to $3.99 million. These results reflect the adoption of its AI-driven sizing solutions by over 100 fashion brands and continued e-commerce strength.

title: Salesforce on Its New Contact Center Integration Program & the Future of Service Cloud
summary: Salesforce is expanding its Service Cloud integrations to include deeper contact center capabilities beyond just voice, partnering with CCaaS vendors like Amazon Connect, Genesys, and Five9. This initiative, part of the "Bring Your Own Channel for CCaaS" program, aims to streamline agent experiences, centralize service data, and enhance AI innovation by allowing open integration with various contact center platforms. The company is also making Service Cloud more predictive and prescriptive through tools like Salesforce Customer Success Score and My Service Journey, which help customers identify and implement high-impact features and create tailored transformation roadmaps.

title: How to Follow Up With Qualified Leads: 3 Best Practices to Seal the Deal
summary: This article outlines three best practices for following up with qualified leads to increase conversion rates. It emphasizes the importance of speed-to-lead, personalizing the approach based on detailed lead notes, and persistent but value-driven engagement. The strategies are supported by insights from Gartner Digital Markets and examples from FreeAgent CRM and Swipeclock, highlighting the critical role of sales and marketing alignment.

title: Salesforce shrinks Bellevue office footprint in lease renewal
summary: Salesforce has signed an early extension for its office space in Bellevue's 929 Office Tower, but in doing so has decided to shrink its footprint. This move is reportedly an effort to "rightsize its footprint to align with evolving workplace needs." The report comes from Broderick Group.

title: The AIs of Texas: The ANA's Conference on AI and Technology for Marketers Delivers on Insights and Inspiration
summary: The ANA's AI and Technology for Marketers Conference in Austin gathered over 1,000 marketers to discuss the integration of AI, MarTech, and data in the advertising world. Key themes included the shift to generative AI activation, the rise of agentic AI, the impact of AI search tools on traditional SEO, and the evolution of the Metaverse. The conference also highlighted new AI and MarTech products for ANA members and featured discussions on AI regulation, with a focus on transparency and accountability.

title: Salesforce Downsizes Bellevue Office Footprint
summary: Salesforce Inc. has reduced its office space in Bellevue, Washington, by renewing a lease for 98,000 square feet in the 929 Office Tower while simultaneously terminating an existing 78,000 square feet across three floors. The software giant has been an anchor tenant in the building since 2015. This move reflects a broader trend of companies, including Warner Bros. Discovery, downsizing their office footprints in the region.

title: Kubernetes development is transforming app building
summary: Kubernetes is revolutionizing application development by simplifying complex infrastructure and making app building accessible to a wider range of creators, including those without deep technical expertise, as highlighted by Vish Abrams of Salesforce's Heroku. This shift is particularly crucial in an AI-driven, cloud-native world, empowering developers and even non-technical users to quickly deploy applications. The evolution reflects a broader industry trend towards leveraging Kubernetes to manage backend complexities while maintaining intuitive front-end user experiences.

title: Salesforce, Intuit, and ADP Execs on AI-Powered Solutions Designed to Fuel SMB Growth in 2025
summary: Executives from Salesforce, Intuit, and ADP discuss how AI-powered solutions are enabling small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) to automate routine tasks, boost efficiency, and drive revenue growth in 2025. The article highlights how these technologies help SMBs compete with larger enterprises by freeing up time for critical growth activities like customer relationship building. It also addresses the increasing adoption of AI by SMBs, while cautioning businesses to establish clear policies for its use.

title: Five9 Confirms Its Second Round of Layoffs in a Year, Affecting 4% of Its Workforce
summary: Five9 has announced a second round of layoffs in a year, affecting 4% of its workforce, or approximately 120 employees, despite consistent double-digit revenue growth. This decision follows similar workforce reductions by other contact center companies and activist investor pressure. The article also discusses how AI and the increasing presence of hyperscalers in the market are reshaping the contact center industry, impacting pricing models and traditional providers.

title: Digital Marketing Grad Makes Data-Driven Decisions at Johnson & Johnson
summary: Full Sail graduate CeCe Taylor, a Senior Manager of Marketing at Johnson & Johnson, leverages her digital marketing and storytelling skills to promote J&J's talent development programs. Her career path involved a pivot from broadcast journalism to marketing after realizing her passion for the field, leading her to pursue a master's degree in Internet Marketing at Full Sail. Taylor emphasizes the importance of data-driven decisions and hands-on experience in her successful marketing career.

title: Elliott Management Now a Top HPE Investor as Juniper Acquisition Looms
summary: Elliott Management has become a major investor in Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), acquiring an 8% stake valued at over $1.5 billion, making it one of HPE's top five investors. This move comes as HPE's stock has declined and while its $14 billion acquisition of Juniper Networks is being challenged by the U.S. Department of Justice due to antitrust concerns. Elliott's past activism in companies like Salesforce and SAP suggests it may seek to influence HPE's strategic decisions, especially concerning the Juniper acquisition and the company's financial performance.

title: Salesforce draws a sharper edge on agentic AI with Agentforce and Google Cloud
summary: Salesforce is heavily investing in agentic AI by expanding its Agentforce offering and strengthening its partnership with Google Cloud, according to Susan Emerson, SVP for AI product at Salesforce. Agentforce provides a flexible AI architecture with guardrails and instructions to prevent hallucinations, enabling broader enterprise AI adoption. The integration with Google Gemini offers multimodal capabilities and open LLM support, while a new agent-to-agent framework aims to enhance interoperability across different systems and break down process silos.

title: 2 Penny Stocks With $10 Potential
summary: This article highlights two penny stocks, KORE Group Holdings (KORE) and Banzai International (BNZI), that are positioned for significant growth due to their involvement in the AI service industry and IoT sector, respectively. KORE is an IoT services provider seeing a resurgence in growth and institutional interest, while Banzai International, specializing in web-based event platforms, is considered a ripe takeover target. Both companies are expected to achieve substantial growth, with analysts projecting significant upside for BNZI.

title: SAP Quarterly Statement Q1 2025
summary: SAP SE announced strong financial results for Q1 2025, with cloud revenue up 27% and non-IFRS operating profit increasing by 60%. The company reported a current cloud backlog of €18.2 billion and total revenue up 12%. SAP reiterated its financial outlook for 2025, anticipating continued growth in cloud revenue and operating profit, driven by its resilient business model and AI-powered portfolio.

title: Productivity Management Software Market to reach USD 200.39 Billion by 2032, driven by demand for automation, collaboration, and cloud solutions | SNS Insider
summary: The Productivity Management Software Market is projected to grow significantly, reaching USD 200.39 billion by 2032 from USD 61.14 billion in 2023, driven by increasing adoption of cloud solutions, AI tools, and workflow optimization, with a CAGR of 14.14%. North America currently leads the market, but Asia Pacific is expected to show the fastest growth, while the Content Management & Collaboration segment holds the largest revenue share and AI & Predictive Analytics is the fastest-growing solution type. Cloud-based solutions dominate deployment, large enterprises are the largest segment, and the BFSI sector leads industry adoption.

title: ServiceNow and Devoteam Join Forces to Redefine CRM Transformation for Europe and Middle East Businesses
summary: ServiceNow and Devoteam have announced a multi-year strategic partnership to accelerate CRM modernization for businesses across Europe and the Middle East. This collaboration leverages ServiceNow’s AI-fueled Customer Service Management (CSM), Sales & Order Management (SOM), and Field Service Management (FSM) capabilities with Devoteam’s AI-first digital transformation services. The partnership aims to enhance customer, agent, and seller experiences, driving innovation and efficiency in the rapidly growing CRM market.

title: AVPT Stock Price, News & Analysis | Avepoint
summary: AvePoint, Inc. (AVPT) specializes in data security, governance, and resilience for organizations utilizing SaaS and cloud collaboration platforms, offering its "Confidence Platform" to manage and protect critical data across various environments like Microsoft, Google, and Salesforce. The company is particularly focused on AI governance, including agentic AI systems, with solutions like the AgentPulse Command Center to track and manage AI agents. AvePoint emphasizes its multi-SaaS and multi-cloud data protection capabilities and operates a global channel partner program, with its shares dual-listed on Nasdaq and the Singapore Exchange.

title: INFA Stock Price, News & Analysis
summary: Informatica Inc. (INFA) is highlighted as a leader in AI-powered enterprise cloud data management, primarily through its Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) platform. The company's technology, including CLAIRE AI, CLAIRE Agents, and CLAIRE Copilot, automates data management tasks and supports AI initiatives for customers across various sectors. Notably, Informatica ceased to be an independent public company, becoming a wholly owned subsidiary of Salesforce on November 18, 2025, leading to the delisting of its INFA stock from the NYSE.

title: Behavioral Targeting: What It Is, How It Boosts Conversions
summary: Behavioral targeting is a marketing technique that leverages a consumer's online activities like website visits, product views, and search queries to deliver personalized advertisements. This method is crucial for increasing ad relevance, boosting conversion rates, and reducing wasted ad spend by focusing on high-intent audiences. The article explains how behavioral targeting works through data collection, profiling, audience segmentation, and AI-powered ad delivery, contrasting it with contextual and demographic targeting.

title: This CEO took on the innovator’s dilemma. Here’s how he did it
summary: Michael Weening, CEO of Calix, Inc., successfully transitioned his company from a networking gear maker to a software and managed services provider for rural broadband, overcoming the innovator's dilemma. This transformation took 13 years and involved significant financial losses in the interim, but was supported by a key shareholder. The article highlights the ongoing challenge for CEOs to disrupt their own businesses effectively.

title: Ansys provides brief updates on $35B proposed acquisition by Synopsys, still requires some regulatory approval
summary: Ansys has provided an update on its proposed $35 billion acquisition by Synopsys, noting that it has received approval in the U.K. while other regulatory reviews are ongoing. The company still expects the deal to finalize in the first half of 2025. This acquisition represents a significant transaction in the technology sector.

title: Five9 Opens Up on Its Layoffs, Impacting “Most” Departments
summary: Five9 announced that recent layoffs, affecting four percent of its workforce (approximately 120 employees), impacted most departments and primarily focused on the US. The company cited an "extensive operational review" aimed at increasing long-term profitable growth and surgically investing in AI and go-to-market initiatives. Five9 also highlighted burgeoning partnerships with IBM, Salesforce, and ServiceNow, including a new unified CRM-CCaaS offering with Salesforce and WEM integration with ServiceNow.

title: Code.org and CEOs push AI classes for high school students
summary: Over 200 CEOs, including leaders from major tech and business companies, have signed a letter urging state leaders to mandate AI and computer science classes as a high school graduation requirement. This push, spearheaded by Code.org, aims to address skills gaps, boost future earning potential for students, and maintain America's competitiveness in a technology-driven world. The initiative follows President Trump's creation of an AI education task force, highlighting a growing consensus on the importance of early AI literacy.

title: AI Will Send 1 in 4 Workers to a New Job, Salesforce Predicts
summary: Salesforce predicts that one in four workers will be shifted to new roles due to the widespread adoption of AI agents in the workplace. These AI tools can perform tasks autonomously, leading to significant efficiency gains and changes in workforce composition. HR leaders anticipate reskilling initiatives, a greater emphasis on soft skills, and a future where human and AI workers collaborate.

title: Gartner Survey Shows Half of C-Suite Executives Considering Cuts in Their Function in the Second Quarter of 2025
summary: A Gartner survey reveals that half of C-suite executives are contemplating budget cuts in their functions for Q2 2025 due to anticipated supply chain disruptions, decreased consumer demand, and inflation. CFOs are tasked with implementing these cuts strategically to maintain competitiveness and long-term performance. The report emphasizes operational flexibility, including adaptable resource allocation, agile decision-making, and investing in future value sources, to navigate economic uncertainties.

title: Izzi mejora la experiencia del cliente y el aumento de sus ingresos con Oracle
summary: Izzi, una subsidiaria de Grupo Televisa, está modernizando sus sistemas de soporte empresarial (BSS) al migrar a la última versión de Oracle Communications Digital Business Experience en Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI). Esta actualización ha permitido a Izzi reducir en un 70% los tiempos de facturación y en un 60% los de emisión de facturas, mejorando así el flujo de caja y posicionando a la empresa para el crecimiento futuro. La estrategia centralizada en la nube de Oracle, que incluye la integración de aplicaciones en otras nubes y el fortalecimiento de la arquitectura, busca ofrecer a los clientes una experiencia más confiable y expandir las capacidades de gestión de clientes.

title: Conversion Funnel: Importance, Stages, Benefits
summary: This article explains the concept of a conversion funnel, which visualizes the customer journey from initial awareness to final purchase. It highlights the importance of optimizing each stage to improve marketing efficiency, reduce customer acquisition costs, and maximize customer lifetime value, especially with the aid of modern AI-driven marketing tools. The article also covers the stages of a conversion funnel (TOFU, MOFU, BOFU), how to measure its performance, and common challenges faced by marketers.

title: Education giant Pearson hit by cyberattack exposing customer data
summary: Education company Pearson suffered a cyberattack where threat actors stole corporate and customer data, primarily "legacy data." The breach, which reportedly began in January 2025, exploited an exposed GitLab Personal Access Token, allowing attackers to access source code and subsequently steal terabytes of data from various cloud platforms like AWS, Google Cloud, Snowflake, and Salesforce CRM. The stolen data allegedly includes customer information, financials, support tickets, and source code, impacting millions.

title: Cadence Design Systems, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:CDNS) 32% Jump Shows Its Popularity With Investors
summary: Cadence Design Systems (CDNS) shares recently surged 32%, reflecting investor confidence despite a modest 9.1% annual return and a high P/E ratio of 77.9x compared to the market average. The high P/E is justified by analyst forecasts predicting 17% annual earnings growth over the next three years, significantly outpacing the broader market's 10%. Investors appear to be looking past the company's recent uninspiring short-term earnings performance, focusing instead on its strong future growth prospects.

title: monday.com Integrations for 2026: Improve Your Workflow
summary: This article details how to effectively use monday.com integrations to enhance workflow and project management. It outlines the process of adding integrations, categorizes beneficial integrations such as CRM, email, team management, and communication tools, and highlights the expanded possibilities through Zapier for connecting a wider range of applications. The piece emphasizes that leveraging these integrations can significantly improve team efficiency and communication within monday.com.

title: The Future of Customer Experience in Financial Services with Agentic AI - with Abhii Parakh of Prudential Financial and James Wood of Interactions
summary: This article explores the application of AI, particularly agentic AI, to transform customer experience in the financial services and insurance sectors. Featuring insights from Abhii Parakh of Prudential Financial and James Wood of Interactions, the discussion centers on shifting from reactive to proactive and personalized customer engagement. It also highlights the importance of designing outcome-driven agentic AI systems that incorporate human oversight for complex or high-risk tasks, ensuring both efficiency and trust in a highly regulated industry.

title: After Earnings, Is Palantir Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Morningstar maintains a narrow moat rating on Palantir Technologies and has raised its fair value estimate to $100 per share following strong Q1 earnings, driven by increased demand from government and commercial customers. Despite impressive revenue growth and profitability, the stock trades at a significant premium, leading to a "fairly valued" assessment. Investors are advised that while the company shows strong performance, its very high uncertainty rating and premium valuation temper expectations for substantial upside unless the stock drops to the $80 level.

title: Churchill Capital to Acquire Skillsoft and Global Knowledge
summary: Churchill Capital Corp II is set to merge with Skillsoft in a $1.3 billion transaction, and the combined company will then acquire Global Knowledge for an additional $233 million, bringing the total deal to $1.5 billion. The new entity, operating as Skillsoft, will be listed on the New York Stock Exchange and aims to become the leading digital learning company globally. This acquisition will expand its course portfolio and client base, including over 70% of Fortune 1000 companies, to address the growing demand for digital learning and workforce upskilling.

title: Roper Technologies, Inc. (NASDAQ:ROP) Shares Could Be 25% Below Their Intrinsic Value Estimate
summary: Roper Technologies, Inc. (NASDAQ:ROP) is estimated to be 25% undervalued based on a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) model, with a projected fair value of US$768 compared to its current share price of US$577. The analysis uses a two-stage DCF model, and analysts predict a target price of US$624, which is still 19% below Simply Wall St's fair value estimate. The article highlights key assumptions, strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats for Roper Technologies.

title: What Recession? Markets Have Erased Every Last Bit Of Economic Pessimism
summary: Markets have recovered from a period of economic pessimism triggered by tariff announcements, with key indicators showing investors are no longer pricing in a U.S. recession. High-yield bond spreads have tightened, the VIX has dropped significantly, and analysts are raising growth forecasts while lowering recession odds. Communication services and technology sectors are expected to lead in this new phase of market clarity.

title: Box expands its toolbox with more AI agents for search, deep research and data extraction
summary: Box Inc. is expanding its artificial intelligence capabilities by launching new AI agents for search, deep research, and data extraction, along with a Box AI Agent for Microsoft 365 Copilot. These new agents aim to automate various tasks for users and integrate Box content seamlessly into Microsoft applications. Box emphasizes its vision of an "intelligent content management platform" and highlights the need for clean data architecture to maximize AI benefits.

title: Wyndham boosts speed and service with AI agents
summary: Wyndham Hotels & Resorts partnered with PwC to implement AI agents, significantly improving support for franchise owners and enhancing guest experiences. This initiative led to a 94% reduction in brand standard review times, a 30-50% decrease in call handling times, and 28% of incoming calls managed by AI. The strategic use of AI has driven efficiency, cut costs, and enabled Wyndham to scale its operations while maintaining high service quality.

title: Darren Sissons' Top Picks: AstraZeneca, Canadian Pacific Kansas City & Linde Plc
summary: Darren Sissons, partner and portfolio manager at Campbell, Lee & Ross Investment Management, has announced his top stock picks. His selections include AstraZeneca, Canadian Pacific Kansas City, and Linde Plc, which he advises investors to watch in the current market. The article also features links to other market call videos and related content.

title: Shashua's artificial expert intelligence co AA-I raises funds
summary: Prof. Amnon Shashua's new AI startup, AA-I Technologies, has successfully raised $20-30 million in a seed financing round. The funding, led by Dell Technologies Capital, BRM Capital, and Pitango First, will be used to hire experienced AI staff. AA-I focuses on "Artificial Expert Intelligence" (AEI), which aims to develop reasoning models that mimic human expert decision-making, differentiating itself from the pursuit of artificial general intelligence (AGI).

title: Three Key Findings From The Forrester Wave™: Sales Training Services, Q1 2025
summary: This article discusses three key findings from The Forrester Wave™: Sales Training Services, Q1 2025. It highlights the importance of flexibility in sales training offerings, emphasizing customized approaches and AI integration. The report also stresses continuous learning reinforcement, a focus on modern buyer behavior, and leveraging AI for personalized and scalable training.

title: Takeda partners with Salesforce for AI-powered healthcare engagement
summary: Takeda has announced a partnership with Salesforce to enhance its healthcare engagement through AI-powered solutions. This collaboration aims to leverage Salesforce's technology to improve interactions within the healthcare ecosystem.

title: How data and intelligent applications will reshape business
summary: Irfan Khan, President and Chief Product Officer for Data & Analytics at SAP SE, discusses how businesses can navigate increasing instability and leverage AI by implementing a robust data strategy. He highlights SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) as a solution for unifying data and enabling intelligent applications that can adapt to changing market demands. The article emphasizes that the future of business belongs to data-driven organizations that can turn intelligence into action at scale.

title: 10 impact.com alternatives for partner marketing in 2026
summary: This article lists ten alternatives to impact.com for partner marketing in 2026, useful for businesses looking to scale influencer collaborations, manage B2B SaaS partnerships, or optimize affiliate payouts. It defines partner marketing as a strategic collaboration between entities to achieve shared marketing goals and expand their collective audience. Each alternative is detailed with its unique features, helping businesses choose the best platform based on their specific needs and objectives.

title: Salesforce Is Back in Talks to Acquire Informatica (CRM, INFA)
summary: Salesforce Inc. is reportedly in renewed discussions to acquire software company Informatica Inc., picking up a pursuit that had previously fallen through. An announcement could come as early as next week if a deal is reached, though no final decision has been made and talks could still collapse or another buyer could emerge.

title: Sweep raises $22.5M Series B to embed AI directly into business infrastructure
summary: Sweep, an Israeli startup, has successfully raised $22.5 million in a Series B funding round led by Insight Partners, with participation from Bessemer Venture Partners. The company, founded by Ido Gaver and Eran Kirshenboim, develops an "agentic workspace" that uses AI to create self-evolving go-to-market systems for businesses like Brex and SailPoint. This funding will be used to expand the team, deepen platform integrations, and accelerate the development of adaptive, learning, and fast GTM systems.

title: Closed-Loop Marketing: What It Is, How It Works, How to Implement
summary: Closed-loop marketing is a data-focused methodology that links marketing efforts directly to customer actions and revenue, allowing businesses to optimize campaigns based on real outcomes. It involves tracking the entire customer journey, integrating systems, and continually refining strategies to improve return on ad spend (ROAS) and lower customer acquisition costs (CAC). This approach helps small to medium-sized businesses achieve scalable growth by focusing resources on what demonstrably works.

title: Salesforce CEO Says $8B Informatica Buy Will Create ‘Most Complete’ AI Data Platform In The Industry
summary: Salesforce is acquiring Informatica for $8 billion to create the industry's most complete AI data platform, focusing on agentic AI. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff stated the acquisition will combine the power of Data Cloud, MuleSoft, and Tableau with Informatica’s data management capabilities to enable autonomous agents for smarter outcomes. The deal, expected to close in early fiscal year 2027, will integrate Informatica's technology stack into Salesforce's platform, enhancing its data foundation for responsible AI deployment and strengthening its position in the enterprise data market.

title: Salesforce (CRM) Nears $25-Per-Share Deal for Informatica
summary: Salesforce Inc. is reportedly in advanced discussions to acquire Informatica Inc. for approximately $8 billion, including debt. The proposed deal values Informatica shares at around $25 each, and an announcement could come as early as Tuesday. This potential acquisition highlights Salesforce's strategy to expand its offerings, likely in data management and cloud services.

title: Salesforce to acquire Informatica for $8bn to advance AI data capabilities
summary: Salesforce plans to acquire cloud data management company Informatica for approximately $8 billion, paying $25 cash per share. This acquisition aims to significantly strengthen Salesforce's data foundation, crucial for developing and deploying advanced agentic AI solutions by integrating Informatica's data management capabilities. The deal is expected to enhance Salesforce's Data Cloud, Agentforce, and Customer 360 platforms, creating a more unified and intelligent data architecture to support scalable and responsible AI applications across enterprises.

title: Salesforce posts strong results and bullish guidance as it looks forward to buying Informatica
summary: Salesforce reported strong first-quarter earnings and revenue, surpassing analyst expectations, and provided optimistic guidance for the current quarter and full year. These results come as the company plans to acquire data management software pioneer Informatica for $8 billion, an acquisition that CEO Marc Benioff believes will significantly boost Salesforce's data integration, governance, and AI capabilities. Despite the positive financial performance, investor reaction was modest, and some analysts expressed concerns regarding Salesforce's historical challenges in integrating acquired companies.

title: There Is A Reason EverCommerce Inc.'s (NASDAQ:EVCM) Price Is Undemanding
summary: EverCommerce Inc.'s P/S ratio of 2.6x is significantly lower than the Software industry average, suggesting it might be undervalued. However, this low P/S is likely due to sluggish revenue growth and a forecast of declining revenue, contrasting with industry growth predictions. Investors should consider these factors and EverCommerce's balance sheet when evaluating the stock.

title: Informatica CEO sees Salesforce acquisition as strategic expansion, not exit
summary: Informatica CEO Amit Walia views the company's $8 billion acquisition by Salesforce as a strategic expansion and growth opportunity, not an exit. He emphasizes that Informatica's data integration and governance tools complement Salesforce's AI ambitions, particularly as "there is no AI without data." Walia also noted the acquisition accelerates Informatica's global reach, leveraging Salesforce's extensive infrastructure and sales force.

title: Blackbaud Names Bill Fort Senior Vice President of North America Sales
summary: Blackbaud has appointed Bill Fort as its Senior Vice President of North America Sales. Fort, with 25 years of experience in software sales leadership, previously served as an area vice president at Salesforce and will report to Chief Commercial Officer David Benjamin, focusing on serving social impact customers in the U.S. and Canada. His role emphasizes delivering customer value and leveraging his experience to benefit charitable organizations.

title: Klarna Saved $2 Million After Cutting Ties With Salesforce
summary: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski announced that the company saved approximately $2 million by ending its contract with Salesforce. Klarna opted to develop its own AI-powered data tools to consolidate merchant relationship data. This move aims to streamline information previously scattered across multiple platforms, emails, and cloud documents.

title: Top Mobile Recruiting Strategies for 2025 to Attract Talent
summary: This article outlines key mobile recruiting strategies for 2025, emphasizing the importance of adapting to job seekers' increasing use of mobile devices. It covers optimizing job postings, leveraging social media, implementing mobile-friendly application forms, and embracing video interviews to attract top talent. The goal is to provide companies with a competitive edge by streamlining the hiring process and reaching a wider candidate pool.

title: Docusign shares fall on billings outlook despite strong earnings
summary: Docusign's shares dropped over 17% despite strong fiscal Q1 2026 earnings, primarily due to a lowered full-year billings forecast. The company reported adjusted EPS of 90 cents and revenue of $763.7 million, both exceeding analyst expectations, and introduced new AI-powered product features like Iris and Workspaces to enhance agreement workflows. The slight downward adjustment in billings guidance, from $3.3 billion-$3.354 billion to $3.285 billion-$3.339 billion, raised investor concerns about future growth.

title: Looking for Exposure to Salesforce Stock (NYSE:CRM)? Try These Two ETFs
summary: This article suggests two ETFs, iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) and First Trust Dow Jones Internet Index Fund (FDN), for investors looking to gain exposure to Salesforce (CRM) stock. Both ETFs have substantial holdings in CRM and offer diversification, lower costs, and liquidity compared to direct stock investment. Salesforce's growth is driven by its AI platform, cloud ecosystem, and strategic acquisitions, leading to projected revenue growth.

title: The Closing Bell: Robinhood Support Flunks My Responsible Gaming Test
summary: This article examines issues with Robinhood integrating sports betting alongside traditional investments, highlighting concerns about responsible gaming support. The author details interactions with Robinhood's chatbot that failed to address problem gambling concerns adequately. It also covers legal battles prediction market Kalshi faces in several states and the upcoming Senate hearing for Brian Quintenz, President Trump's nominee for the CFTC chairmanship, which could impact the future of prediction markets.

title: Looking for Exposure to Salesforce Stock (NYSE:CRM)? Try These Two ETFs
summary: This article suggests two ETFs, iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF (IGV) and First Trust Dow Jones Internet Index Fund (FDN), for investors looking to gain exposure to Salesforce (CRM) stock. Salesforce's growth is driven by its AI platform, cloud ecosystem, and strategic acquisitions, with strong demand for its products. Both ETFs offer diversified investment in the tech sector with significant holdings in CRM.

title: Survey: Work-From-Home Realities
summary: A LendingTree survey of 2,000 Americans, including over 450 remote workers, explores the realities of working from home. Key findings reveal that 78% of remote workers face challenges like distractions and social isolation, and 39% have used software to appear busy when not. Despite these, remote work offers benefits such as improved work-life balance, more sleep, and significant cost savings.

title: Jim Cramer Says He is "Never Going to Say a Bad Word About ServiceNow (NOW)"
summary: Jim Cramer expressed strong approval for ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW), stating he would "never say a bad word" about the company and green-lighting it for purchase. He highlighted its adherence to the "Rule of 40" and effective integration of AI, as noted by Jensen Huang. ServiceNow provides a cloud platform leveraging AI, automation, and low-code technology for digital workflows across various business functions.

title: Asana vs Jira: Which Tool Is Right for Your Team?
summary: This article provides a comprehensive comparison between Asana and Jira, two leading project management tools. It delves into their features, pros, and cons, helping organizations determine which software best suits their specific needs based on factors like team size, project type, budget, and desired functionalities. The comparison covers aspects like pricing, core features, security, user-friendliness, and integration capabilities, concluding that Jira is often preferred by development teams while Asana caters well to small and scaling teams managing diverse projects.

title: Was Jim Cramer Right to Defend Salesforce (CRM) After Its Post-Earnings Collapse A Year Ago?
summary: Jim Cramer defended Salesforce (CRM) a year ago after a significant post-earnings stock drop, advising investors to buy on weakness. Despite initial disappointing metrics, Cramer maintained a long-term belief in Salesforce's resilience and growing profitability, highlighting its transition into an "earnings growth play." Currently, Salesforce ranks 1st on Insider Monkey's list of stocks discussed by Cramer, with the stock up 12.62% since his initial defense.

title: Procurement Platform Remarcable Raises $15 Million Series A Led by Global Software Investor Insight Partners
summary: Remarcable, a procurement platform for the construction industry, has secured $15 million in Series A funding led by global software investor Insight Partners. This investment will accelerate Remarcable's mission to enhance efficiency, real-time visibility, and communication in construction material management. The platform aims to modernize material management, leveraging deep integration with suppliers and accounting systems to automate workflows and improve procurement processes for contractors and suppliers.

title: Smart collaborates with Salesforce to deliver AI-powered digital experiences for customers on unified e-commerce website
summary: Smart Communications Inc. has partnered with Salesforce to enhance its digital customer experience through an AI-powered unified e-commerce website. This collaboration will leverage Salesforce's Commerce Cloud, AI solutions, and MuleSoft to provide seamless transactions and personalized plan recommendations for Smart's more than 50 million subscribers. The initiative aims to improve customer satisfaction, streamline operations, and drive business growth by allowing customers to complete various transactions online that previously required physical store visits.

title: HP Dimension with Google Beam Takes Virtual Collaboration to the Next Level at InfoComm 2025
summary: HP Inc. unveiled HP Dimension with Google Beam at InfoComm 2025, an AI-powered 3D video communication solution designed to enhance virtual collaboration by replicating in-person experiences without wearables. Developed with Google, this technology aims to create more authentic connections in distributed workforces through features like 3D imaging, natural eye contact, and spatial audio. Additionally, HP introduced Poly Studio A2 Audio Solutions, providing advanced audio for various meeting room sizes, with both products becoming available to customers in late 2025.

title: Why do shareholders oppose executive pay at CT-based elevator-and-escalator firm Otis?
summary: Shareholders at Otis Worldwide, a Connecticut-based elevator and escalator firm, voted down a proposal to approve executive compensation for CEO Judy Marks and other top executives, with roughly 60% of votes cast against it. Marks' compensation jumped to $42 million in 2024, largely due to stock awards, placing her among the highest-paid CEOs in the S&P 500. Despite this, the company reported a "solid" first quarter in 2025 and its stock performance has been sturdy.

title: Smart Communications unifies digital storefront for over 50M subscribers - Cloud - Digital Transformation
summary: Smart Communications Inc. is launching a unified digital storefront for its over 50 million subscribers, utilizing Salesforce Commerce Cloud and AI solutions to enhance the customer experience. This platform will enable customers to conduct various transactions online, including purchasing devices and renewing plans, and will feature AI-driven recommendations. The initiative aims to improve customer satisfaction, drive business growth, and streamline e-commerce operations.

title: Smart collaborates with Salesforce to deliver AI-powered digital experiences for customers
summary: Smart Communications Inc. is partnering with Salesforce to implement Commerce Cloud, aiming to create a unified digital storefront for over 50 million subscribers in the Philippines. The collaboration will leverage Salesforce AI solutions to recommend suitable plans and facilitate seamless data integration using MuleSoft. This initiative seeks to streamline e-commerce operations, enhance customer experience, and support online transactions that traditionally required in-person visits.

title: Brianne Gardner's Top Picks: ATS Corp, Altius Minerals & Salesforce
summary: Brianne Gardner, Senior Wealth Manager at Velocity Investment Partners, Raymond James, shares her top stock picks for the market, which include ATS Corp, Altius Minerals, and Salesforce. The article provides the date and time of her current picks and includes links to her past appearances and market outlooks.

title: Here is What You Need to Know Before Investing in Upland Software, Inc. (UPLD)
summary: Upland Software, Inc. (UPLD) is identified as an undervalued stock despite a challenging year where its shares dropped over 60% due to contracting revenues. The company is divesting nonstrategic lines to focus on core business, a move expected to stabilize adjusted EBITDA and potentially lead to a 137% upside from its current trading level, with analysts maintaining a Hold rating while acknowledging its streamlining efforts.

title: Jeff Parent's Past Picks: Altagas, Microsoft & Mueller Water Products
summary: Jeff Parent, Chief Investment Officer at Castlemoore, discusses his previous stock selections including Altagas, Microsoft, and Mueller Water Products.
