title: Citigroup hires Drago Rajkovic as co-head of M&A from JPMorgan, memo says
summary: Citigroup has hired Drago Rajkovic from JPMorgan Chase to serve as its co-head of mergers and acquisitions, effective September. Rajkovic, who was previously global chairman of M&A at JPMorgan and has over three decades of experience, will work alongside Kevin Cox. This strategic hire follows several other senior appointments by Citi's head of banking, Viswas Raghavan, and comes after a significant surge in Citi's investment banking and M&A fees in the first quarter.

title: Pathward Financial Inc. Builds on Recent Momentum, Progress Toward Enhancing Financial Inclusion
summary: Pathward Financial, Inc. (Nasdaq: CASH) has concluded a transformative 12-month period marked by significant business developments aimed at enhancing financial inclusion. The company officially launched its new name and brand identity, Pathward, in October 2022, emphasizing its commitment to serving the unbanked, underbanked, and underserved. Pathward has also formed strategic partnerships with companies like Finix, Propel Holdings Inc., Viridi Energy, American Organic Energy, Avolta, Clair, and Dash Solutions to streamline payments, offer credit, fund sustainable energy projects, provide wage advances, and deliver custom payout solutions, all while achieving ESG goals.

title: Teal Linde's Top Picks: Pembina Pipeline, Delta Air Lines & UiPath
summary: Teal Linde, Manager at Linde Equity Fund, has shared his top stock picks. His selections include Pembina Pipeline, Delta Air Lines, and UiPath. This announcement provides investors with insights into potential investment opportunities.

title: NetApp Appoints Disruptive Innovator Syam Nair as Chief Product Officer, Underscoring its Commitment to Bold Product Vision
summary: NetApp (NASDAQ: NTAP) has announced the appointment of Syam Nair as its new Chief Product Officer, effective July 7, 2025. Nair, a former Salesforce and Microsoft executive, is recognized for his innovation in scaling cloud platforms and driving hyper-growth. In his new role, he will lead NetApp's product and engineering teams to accelerate innovation in hybrid cloud and AI offerings, advancing the company's strategic vision for data-driven business growth.

title: Asana Names Dan Rogers as Chief Executive Officer
summary: Asana, Inc. has announced Dan Rogers as its new Chief Executive Officer, effective July 21, 2025. Rogers, previously CEO of LaunchDarkly, will succeed Asana Co-Founder Dustin Moskovitz, who will transition to Board Chairocusing on product vision and AI initiatives. This leadership change aims to drive Asana's next phase of growth, leveraging Rogers' experience in scaling high-growth technology companies in the evolving AI landscape.

title: Five9 Review and Pricing Plans in 2026
summary: This article provides a comprehensive review of Five9, an omnichannel call center software and VoIP platform, highlighting its strengths in data security and compliance for highly regulated industries. It delves into Five9's features, ease of use, artificial intelligence integrations, pricing plans, and limitations. The review concludes that while Five9 is an excellent choice for businesses prioritizing cybersecurity and compliance, its higher cost and additional charges for certain features might make it less suitable for businesses with limited budgets.

title: Roper Technologies (NASDAQ:ROP) Seems To Use Debt Quite Sensibly
summary: Roper Technologies (NASDAQ:ROP) appears to use debt responsibly, with a net debt of approximately US$7.08 billion as of March 2025, offset by a strong capacity to generate free cash flow. The company's debt to EBITDA ratio of 2.5 and interest cover of 7.6 times suggest a sensible approach to leveraging its business for growth, aligning with its strong EBIT to free cash flow conversion.

title: TechTarget Careers
summary: Informa TechTarget highlights career opportunities within its B2B marketing leadership, emphasizing a culture of rapid growth, inclusive innovation, and strong values. The company encourages individuals who seek direct responsibility and a collaborative environment where their contributions can significantly impact team success and overall company growth. Testimonials from various employees underscore the supportive atmosphere, opportunities for professional development, and the global reach of their work.

title: Gartner Predicts 80% of Enterprise Software and Applications Will Be Multimodal by 2030, Up from Less Than 10% in 2024
summary: Gartner predicts that by 2030, 80% of enterprise software and applications will be multimodal, a significant increase from less than 10% in 2024. This transformation is driven by multimodal generative AI (GenAI), which will revolutionize enterprise applications by adding new features and functionalities across various sectors. Companies are advised to integrate multimodal capabilities to enhance user experiences and operational efficiency by leveraging diverse data inputs and outputs.

title: Appian Strengthens Leadership Team with Key Hires in UK and EMEA
summary: Appian has expanded its sales leadership team in the UK and EMEA with three strategic hires to drive growth in AI and process orchestration. Vicky Nesbit joins as SVP of Sales UK and EMEA, Vincent Perrin as VP of EMEA North, and Rob Cook as AVP of EMEA North for Broad Markets and Public Sector. These appointments aim to strengthen Appian's market presence and deliver value to customers in the region, leveraging the new leaders' extensive experience in enterprise software sales.

title: We're Hopeful That DouYu International Holdings (NASDAQ:DOYU) Will Use Its Cash Wisely
summary: DouYu International Holdings (NASDAQ:DOYU) has a substantial cash runway of 7.7 years, with CN¥1.9 billion in cash reserves as of March 2025, despite its increase in cash burn by 128% in the last year and an 18% drop in revenue. The company's cash burn of CN¥252 million represents about 15% of its market capitalization, suggesting it could raise more capital if needed without significant shareholder dilution. While its increasing cash burn is a concern, the long cash runway provides some comfort to investors.

title: Revenues Working Against Five9, Inc.'s (NASDAQ:FIVN) Share Price
summary: Five9, Inc.'s low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 2x, compared to an industry average of 5.4x, is attributed to modest revenue growth and an underwhelming future outlook. While the company has seen decent revenue gains in the past, analyst forecasts project a slower growth rate for Five9 compared to its industry peers, contributing to investor pessimism and a depressed share price.

title: An Interview with Jennifer Tejada, Chairperson and Chief Executive Officer, PagerDuty
summary: Jennifer Tejada, Chairperson and CEO of PagerDuty, discusses the company's culture, which is built on a shared purpose of creating products that give teams time to change the world. She emphasizes the importance of evolving culture as the company scales and advises young people to be curious and take ownership of their career paths. Tejada also talks about balancing technological advances with the human touch, especially concerning AI, and the value of diverse perspectives in fostering innovation.

title: SuRo Capital Corp. Second Quarter 2025 Preliminary Investment Portfolio Update
summary: SuRo Capital Corp. announced a strong second quarter for 2025, driven by investments in AI infrastructure companies like CoreWeave and OpenAI, leading to an anticipated NAV per share of $9.00 to $9.50. This performance led the Board of Directors to declare an initial cash dividend of $0.25 per share, with expectations of further dividends throughout the year. The company also made a new $5.0 million investment in Plaid and exited positions in CoreWeave and ServiceTitan, leveraging its publicly traded common stock to provide access to high-growth private companies.

title: Why Coca-Cola’s CIO prioritizes big-impact AI pilot projects
summary: Coca-Cola's CIO, Neeraj Tolmare, focuses on AI pilot projects that promise significant revenue generation or efficiency gains, a strategy driven by the company's leadership. He highlights successful AI applications in predicting retail demand and generating marketing content, while also acknowledging the challenges and ethical considerations of AI in creative applications. Tolmare emphasizes the company's strategic approach to AI vendor partnerships and its exploration of agentic AI.

title: We Think Artiva Biotherapeutics (NASDAQ:ARTV) Needs To Drive Business Growth Carefully
summary: Artiva Biotherapeutics (NASDAQ:ARTV) is a loss-making biotechnology company with a cash runway of about 2.7 years, based on its March 2025 cash balance of US$166m and a cash burn of US$61m. While this runway is decent, the company's cash burn rate increased by 23% in the last year, suggesting careful management is needed. Furthermore, its annual cash burn of US$61m represents 148% of its current market capitalization of US$41m, which raises concerns about potential funding difficulties should it need to raise capital by issuing new shares.

title: Knox lands $6.5M to compete with Palantir in the federal compliance market
summary: Knox, a federal managed cloud provider, has raised $6.5 million in seed funding to help software vendors achieve FedRAMP security compliance quickly and efficiently. Founded by Irina Denisenko, Knox aims to streamline the certification process, which typically takes years and millions of dollars, by offering a solution that can accelerate it to three months at a fraction of the cost. The company's offering directly competes with Palantir's FedStart, with Knox already handling compliance for clients like Adobe and Class.

title: Thinking of Buying C3.ai Stock? Here Are 2 Red Flags to Consider.
summary: This article discusses two major red flags for investors considering C3.ai stock: high cash burn despite years of operation and increasing competition in the enterprise AI market. While C3.ai has a strong position in enterprise AI and is making strategic moves, its growth rate has not kept pace with its spending, and it faces significant challenges from both big tech companies and agile startups. The author suggests that an investment in C3.ai remains highly speculative until these issues are addressed.

title: Amgen Inc. (NASDAQ:AMGN) is a favorite amongst institutional investors who own 82%
summary: Institutional investors hold a dominant 82% stake in Amgen Inc. (NASDAQ:AMGN), indicating their significant influence over the company's stock price and decisions. The Vanguard Group, BlackRock, Inc., and Capital Research and Management Company are among the largest shareholders, with insiders owning less than 1% of the company. Despite the strong institutional presence, the article advises considering risks and analyst forecasts for a comprehensive investment perspective.

title: Salesforce (CRM) $430 PT, Market Outperform Reaffirmed by JMP
summary: JMP Securities analyst Patrick Walravens reaffirmed a "Market Outperform" rating and a $430 price target for Salesforce (CRM) after reviewing details of its merger with Informatica. The decision was based on Informatica's proxy statement, which revealed six other potential acquirers and a mix of positive and negative factors influencing the transaction. Despite Salesforce's 20% year-to-date underperformance, the rating is maintained as the company continues its pursuit of Informatica.

title: Workato Completes Workday Certified Integration for Salesforce CRM and CPQ
summary: Workato has achieved Workday Certified Integration status for its Salesforce CRM and CPQ accelerators, enhancing the existing partnership between Workato and Workday. These certified integrations provide pre-built workflows and documentation to help customers accelerate their integrations, streamline sales processes, ensure data consistency, and reduce administrative burdens. The solutions specifically address Opportunity-to-Cash use cases for CPQ and bidirectional interoperability between Workday PSA/ServicesCPQ and Salesforce CRM.

title: Stifel Ranks #1 in J.D. Power’s Advisor Satisfaction Study for Third Consecutive Year
summary: For the third consecutive year, Stifel Financial Corp. (NYSE: SF) has been ranked the number one wealth management firm in the U.S. for employee advisor satisfaction by the J.D. Power 2025 U.S. Financial Advisor Satisfaction Study. Stifel achieved an impressive score of 819 out of 1,000, significantly above the industry average, and also led in five out of six individual categories. CEO Ron Kruszewski emphasized the firm's commitment to continuously improving advisor support and its culture of deliberate growth and core values.

title: Impact of the ‘One Big Beautiful Bill Act’: How to respond
summary: The newly signed One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA) of 2025 introduces sweeping federal tax changes, making permanent some 2017 tax cuts and adding new provisions impacting individuals, families, and businesses. Tax professionals need to understand key changes like modified SALT deductions, senior bonuses, increased estate and gift tax exemptions, renewed bonus depreciation, and sunsetting energy credits. The article emphasizes proactive client communication, scenario planning, advisory services, and leveraging technology to navigate these legislative shifts and maintain a strategic advisory role.

title: Why IDEX Corporation (NYSE:IEX) Could Be Worth Watching
summary: IDEX Corporation (NYSE:IEX) has seen a recent share price rally, but its stock may still be undervalued according to Simply Wall St's analysis, with an intrinsic value of $288.92 against a current trading price of US$185. The company's future earnings are expected to increase by 41%, suggesting strong growth potential not yet fully factored into its share price, presenting a potential buying opportunity for investors.

title: Analyst Explains Why He’s Bullish on Broadcom (AVGO) Amid AI Agent Revolution
summary: An analyst from Melius Research is bullish on Broadcom (AVGO) due to the rise of AI agents and the increasing need for custom AI chips. He believes that while "seat-based" software models are threatened by AI, infrastructure software companies like Broadcom, which produces ASICs for major AI spenders, are well-positioned for growth. Broadcom's strong portfolio and its role in developing custom chips are seen as key drivers for substantial revenue and profit growth.

title: Rimini Street breaks University of Melbourne out of its cycle of Oracle upgrades
summary: The University of Melbourne has partnered with Rimini Street to support its Oracle Database, EBS, and Hyperion systems, moving away from a constant cycle of upgrades necessitated by its previous vendor. This switch allows the university to reinvest savings into digital solutions and online access for its 55,000 students and 10,000 staff. Rimini Street's Rimini Support, Connect, and Protect solutions address past issues of slow responsiveness and lack of customization support, ensuring system stability and proactive security.

title: At US$552, Is HubSpot, Inc. (NYSE:HUBS) Worth Looking At Closely?
summary: HubSpot's (NYSE:HUBS) shares have experienced significant price movements, leading investors to question its current valuation at US$552. According to Simply Wall St's model, the stock appears fairly valued, trading slightly below its intrinsic value. The future looks bright for HubSpot, with expected revenue growth of 59% over the next couple of years, which should contribute to a higher share valuation.

title: Pegasystems Inc. Just Beat EPS By 179%: Here's What Analysts Think Will Happen Next
summary: Pegasystems Inc. recently reported strong second-quarter results, beating revenue and EPS forecasts significantly. Following these results, analysts have become more optimistic about the company's earnings potential, upgrading their EPS estimates and raising price targets. Despite this, revenue growth is projected to slow and fall behind the broader industry's growth rate.

title: JOURNEYS: Genesco, Inc. Sued in TCPA Class Action Over Promotional SMS Messages From Journeys Brand
summary: Genesco, Inc. is facing a TCPA class action lawsuit alleging it continued to send promotional SMS messages from its Journeys brand after a consumer texted "STOP". The complaint details several messages sent after a stop request on December 5, 2024, and raises questions about potential issues with Salesforce Marketing Cloud and Twilio integrations. The lawsuit seeks to represent a class of individuals who received multiple promotional texts from Genesco within a 12-month period after submitting a do-not-call request.

title: The 5 Best EDI Software I’d Recommend to Any Team
summary: This article reviews the five best EDI software solutions for various business needs, including wholesale, retail, mid-sized enterprises, logistics, and ERP integration. The author, Soundarya Jayaraman, analyzed features, integrations, and real-world user feedback from G2 to provide practical recommendations and help businesses choose the right solution. Key considerations emphasized include reliable ERP integration, user-friendly interfaces, support for major EDI standards, responsive customer support, and scalability.

title: Five9 CEO to Retire, Seeks an AI Innovator as His Replacement
summary: Five9 CEO Mike Burkland has announced his retirement, citing health issues, and the company is now searching for a successor with a strong background in AI innovation and operational excellence. This news comes amidst rumors of a potential sale of Five9, fueled by recent senior executive departures and layoffs, as well as increased investor scrutiny and activism. The board is prioritizing a leader who can accelerate the company's evolution and target significant revenue growth beyond its current $1 billion ARR milestone.

title: Analyst Estimates: Here's What Brokers Think Of Tyler Technologies, Inc. (NYSE:TYL) After Its Second-Quarter Report
summary: Tyler Technologies (NYSE:TYL) saw its shares rise 4.5% after its second-quarter report, with revenue largely in line with forecasts and EPS beating expectations. Analysts have reconfirmed their price target of US$678, indicating the company is performing as anticipated despite projected slower revenue growth compared to its historical rate and the broader industry. The consensus suggests no major change to the business's prospects, with stable earnings and revenue forecasts.

title: PLTY ETF Delivers 69% Yield with Covered-Call Exposure to Palantir
summary: The NYSEARCA:PLTY ETF, launched in October 2024, has generated a 29.7% total return and an annualized yield of 69% by leveraging covered calls on Palantir Technologies (PLTR) stock, outperforming other covered-call ETFs. The fund strategically uses PLTR's volatility to harvest premium income, while a 5.1% yielding U.S. Treasury buffer helps maintain its NAV. Investors are advised to consider a "Buy" stance on PLTY between $65.00 and $68.00, especially before PLTR's Q2 earnings report, to capitalize on elevated implied volatility and income streams.

title: Tenable Holdings’ Free Cash Flow Shines Amid Billings Slowdown
summary: Tenable Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ: TENB), a mid-cap cybersecurity company, is demonstrating strong free cash flow generation despite a general slowdown in billings growth and a 20% year-to-date stock decline. The company exceeded Q2 revenue expectations and is gaining traction in the public sector, with an estimated total addressable market of $50 billion for its exposure management solutions. While growth has moderated, Tenable's strong cash flow, expanding margins, and relatively low valuation make it an appealing option for value-oriented investors.

title: (3⁺) FRESENIUS – Führen die Zahlen zum großen Kaufsignal?

The article suggests that despite the muted initial market reaction, the recent financial performance and strategic moves, like planned share sales in Fresenius Medical Care, could be setting the stage for a significant buy signal for the stock.

title: AI Recording/Notetaking Tools Trigger Wave of Lawsuits -- Could Your Business Be At Risk? (via Passle)
summary: This article discusses the surge in lawsuits related to AI-powered recording and transcription tools, focusing on two recent class-action cases: one against Heartland Dental and RingCentral alleging Federal Wiretap Act violations, and another against Cresta Intelligence for California Invasion of Privacy Act breaches. It highlights the legal risks for businesses using such AI tools and provides five recommendations to minimize these risks, including updating privacy policies, obtaining explicit consent, developing usage policies, checking vendor settings, and staying current with evolving legislation.

title: CRMG Financial Statements & Charts - Themes Etf Trust - Leverage Shares 2x Long Crm Daily Etf MacroTrends
summary: This article provides financial information and charts for CRMG, the Themes ETF Trust - Leverage Shares 2X Long CRM Daily ETF, from MacroTrends. title: How to use agentic AI workflows in professional services
summary: This white paper explores the application of agentic AI workflows in professional services, including legal, tax, and risk sectors. It explains how agentic AI, unlike generative AI, can perform multistep tasks, make decisions, and adapt, significantly enhancing efficiency and accuracy. The article also addresses common barriers to adoption and outlines strategies for successful implementation, emphasizing human oversight and strategic planning.

title: 4 Stocks to Buy From a Top-Performing Fund Manager
summary: Bill Nygren, manager of the Oakmark Fund (OAKMX), recently added four undervalued large-cap stocks to his portfolio: Nike (NKE), Amazon (AMZN), Salesforce (CRM), and Zimmer Biomet (ZBH). Morningstar analysts confirm these stocks are currently undervalued and possess strong economic moats, aligning with Nygren's investment strategy of targeting companies trading significantly below their intrinsic value.

title: What Enterprise Users Should Know About GPT-5
summary: Gartner's analysis indicates that GPT-5 provides meaningful improvements, particularly for coding, due to its modular architecture and expanded context windows. However, it is an evolution rather than a revolution, still requiring strong governance and careful integration planning for enterprise users. GPT-5 is not a seamless drop-in replacement for GPT-4 and does not achieve artificial general intelligence, necessitating continued human oversight for critical decisions.

title: The New Salesforce Investment Thesis—Growth Is Dead, Long Live Profits (NYSE:CRM)
summary: Salesforce's stock has dropped significantly despite the company remaining a dominant and highly profitable CRM leader. The article suggests that while revenue growth has slowed, the business model's stickiness, high switching costs, and strong pricing power ensure consistent subscription revenue and customer retention. Profitability is increasing due to AI-driven cost optimization, stable SG&A expenses, and share buybacks, leading the author to view the current valuation as a buying opportunity, despite the risk of AI disruption.

title: Who's Moving Where In Wealth Management? – SEI, Raymond James, EP Wealth
summary: This article details recent significant personnel changes and appointments within the North American wealth management sector. SEI has appointed Robert Hum as head of investment product development and activation, while Raymond James has brought in five financial advisors to its independent channel in Depew, New York. Additionally, EP Wealth Advisors has named Justin Mikhalevsky as its new chief product and technology officer to integrate product strategy and enhance digital experiences.

title: Morgan Stanley lowers NICE Systems stock price target to $193 on delayed growth
summary: Morgan Stanley has lowered its price target for NICE Systems (NASDAQ:NICE) to $193 from $202, while maintaining an Overweight rating due to delayed growth acceleration. Despite the adjustment, the firm remains optimistic about NICE's competitive position in AI and CCaaS, noting strong financials and promising AI monetization. NICE's recent acquisition of Cognigy and renewed partnerships with Salesforce and RingCentral further underscore its strategic growth initiatives.

title: Getty Refiles Copyright Case Against Stability AI In Calif.
summary: Getty Images has refiled its copyright infringement lawsuit against artificial intelligence startup Stability AI in California, after voluntarily dropping the original suit in Delaware. The case alleges that Stability AI used millions of Getty's photos without permission. The move to California aims to have the case heard in a jurisdiction that the startup acknowledges.

title: Retail Platform Market Size, Share and Global Forecast to 2030
summary: The global retail platform market is projected to grow from $39.16 billion in 2025 to $95.49 billion by 2030, exhibiting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 19.5%. This growth is fueled by increasing adoption of generative AI, unified commerce, and social commerce, which enhance omnichannel experiences and operational efficiency. Key industry players like Oracle, Salesforce, and Shopify are actively driving market expansion through both organic and inorganic strategies, including product innovation and strategic partnerships.

title: Analog Devices, Autodesk, Salesforce
summary: This article details revisions in ratings and price targets by Wall Street securities analysts for various U.S.-listed companies, including Analog Devices, Autodesk, and Salesforce. Key highlights include Susquehanna raising Analog Devices' price target to $300, Baird increasing Autodesk's to $345, and TD Cowen reducing Salesforce's to $335, alongside numerous other adjustments for a wide range of companies.

title: Oracle Named a Leader in the 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Sales Force Automation Platforms for the 9th Consecutive Year | cx
summary: Oracle has been recognized as a Leader in the 2025 Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Sales Force Automation (SFA) Platforms for the ninth consecutive year, highlighting its continued progress in transforming sales processes. The company attributes this recognition to its focus on embedding AI and Agents directly into its products, enhancing productivity and delivering intelligent selling experiences. Oracle plans to continue investing in usability, automation, and AI to drive effective revenue generation for its customers.

title: Live: Will Box. Inc (BOX) Beat Q2 Earnings Estimates?
summary: Box Inc. (BOX) reported its Q2 earnings, beating both revenue and EPS estimates with $294.0M and $0.33 respectively, driven by strong demand for its Intelligent Content Management platform and AI solutions. Despite a slowdown in billings due to an earlier renewal pull-forward, the company maintained steady margins and saw 16% YoY growth in remaining performance obligations. Guidance for FY26 revenue and EPS remained in line or slightly raised, reinforcing investor confidence in its AI monetization strategy and public-sector traction.

title: Stanford study finds AI has reduced availability of entry-level programming jobs
summary: A Stanford University study indicates a significant decline in entry-level programming jobs in the U.S. since ChatGPT's launch, with positions for workers aged 22-25 decreasing by 6% overall, and 20% for entry-level programming. The research, based on ADP employment data and Anthropic's Economic Index, attributes these reductions to AI-driven automation, particularly affecting software development, customer service, accounting, and administrative support. Older workers and roles where AI augments tasks rather than automates them show increased employment.

title: Exclusive: San Francisco scores long-term conference commitment from Visa
summary: Visa has committed to holding its annual Payments Forum conference at San Francisco's Moscone Center through 2030, a significant boost for the city's convention business. This multi-year pledge comes after major tech companies had previously canceled conferences due to tough street conditions. Mayor Daniel Lurie sees Visa's investment as further evidence of San Francisco's comeback, attributing it to improvements in safety, cleanliness, and a growing real estate market driven by the AI boom.

title: Who Owns Salesforce? Top Shareholders and Recent Insider Trades
summary: This article examines the ownership structure of Salesforce (NYSE: CRM), highlighting its top institutional shareholders like Vanguard and BlackRock, and significant insider ownership by CEO Marc Benioff. It details recent trading activities by these major investors and insiders, noting a cautious stance from insiders and mixed signals from active fund managers. The analysis provides insights into investor confidence and the company's market position.

title: UBS Lowers PT on Salesforce from $300 to $260, Keeps Neutral Rating on the Stock
summary: UBS has lowered its price target on Salesforce (CRM) from $300 to $260 while maintaining a Neutral rating on the stock. This revision comes due to expected delays in the Informatica integration and issues with expanding distribution capacity. Despite some caution, Salesforce's Agentforce platform is gaining traction, and the average analyst price target for CRM remains at $350, suggesting a potential upside of over 41%.

title: My Honest Evaluation of 7 Best Corporate LMS Software in 2025
summary: This article evaluates the 7 best corporate LMS software in 2025, detailing their features, pros, and cons to help businesses choose the right platform for their training needs. The author, Shreya Mattoo, provides an in-depth review of each system, including Rippling, Absorb LMS, Paylocity, Docebo, Paycom, iSpring Suite, and Litmos, based on factors like customization, content delivery, HR integration, AI personalization, and gamification. The evaluation emphasizes the importance of scalability, analytics, and seamless integration with existing HR systems for effective employee development and compliance.

title: The Agentic Business Fabric: AI’s Architectural Transformation Of Business Applications
summary: This Forrester Vision Report outlines how AI will fundamentally change business applications, moving from complex, siloed solutions to an "agentic business fabric." It describes a future where AI automates and orchestrates data and workflows, and provides a strategic framework for CIOs and enterprise leaders to prepare for this architectural transformation. The report identifies three phases of transition: the current state, a chaotic middle, and the final agentic business fabric.

title: Breach of Salesloft Drift integration exposes data at Cloudflare, Zscaler and Palo Alto Networks
summary: A breach originating from Salesloft's Drift AI chat integration with Salesforce has affected Cloudflare, Zscaler, and Palo Alto Networks. Attackers exploited a vulnerability to harvest OAuth and refresh tokens, gaining access to CRM data including customer support tickets and contact information. While affected companies have taken precautionary measures like revoking tokens and strengthening authentication, the incident highlights significant security concerns for SaaS compromises involving sensitive support data.

title: SoFi Announces the Agentic AI ETF, Providing Access to Next Wave of AI
summary: SoFi has launched the Agentic AI ETF (AGIQ), listed on NYSE Arca, to allow investors to access companies involved in developing or utilizing agentic AI technologies. The ETF tracks the BITA US Agentic AI Select Index, which includes companies like Salesforce, Tesla, and NVIDIA, and aims to capitalize on the paradigm shift agentic AI brings to productivity across various sectors. This new offering expands SoFi's ETF suite, providing members with opportunities to diversify their portfolios into sophisticated investment strategies within the rapidly evolving AI market.

title: Tomorrow’s Tech Today: How Client Expectations Are Driving Innovation
summary: Modern client expectations, fueled by seamless digital experiences, are compelling wealth management firms to integrate technology deeply into their operations. The article emphasizes that being "digital-first" is no longer a competitive edge but a necessity for relevance and growth. It highlights the critical roles of AI, strategic integration, robust data infrastructure, and user adoption in meeting these evolving client demands.

title: monday.com vs. Salesforce: Which Workflow Stock Has More Upside?
summary: This article compares monday.com (MNDY) and Salesforce (CRM) in the context of the growing enterprise software market, evaluating which stock offers more upside potential. monday.com faces challenges with high spending and slowing customer expansion despite gaining traction with small and mid-sized teams, while Salesforce, a dominant player, demonstrates more stable performance and profitability aided by its diversified portfolio and AI initiatives. The analysis concludes that Salesforce holds a relative edge due to its more balanced valuation, stable margins, and established market presence.

title: Building pricing confidence: Data systems allow tax, audit & accounting firms to stay competitive
summary: Tax, audit, and accounting firms are facing financial challenges due to rising costs and client demands for value, leading to a lack of confidence in pricing strategies. A Thomson Reuters Institute report suggests that leveraging data benchmarking and robust data infrastructure is crucial for firms to achieve confident pricing, move beyond outdated assumptions, and maximize their services' value. The article emphasizes that foundational technology systems are necessary for effective data-driven pricing and predictive decision-making in the future.

title: “She’s Incredibly Smart,” Says Jim Cramer About Williams-Sonoma, Inc. (WSM)’s CEO
summary: Jim Cramer has been frequently discussing Williams-Sonoma, Inc. (WSM), highlighting CEO Laura Alber's intelligence and efforts to keep prices low despite market pessimism. Cramer noted WSM's use of Salesforce and previously commented on the challenges Alber faces with tariffs and manufacturing capacity. The article also suggests that while WSM has potential, there might be AI stocks with greater upside.

title: Jim Cramer Reveals Major Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR) Rival
summary: Jim Cramer highlighted Salesforce (CRM) as a potential major rival to Palantir Technologies Inc. (PLTR), referencing a Salesforce call where its CEO mentioned beating Palantir out of a contract. Despite this, Cramer expressed strong confidence in Palantir, dismissing a short seller report and praising Palantir's team and leadership. The article also notes Palantir's significant stock performance in 2025.

title: Asana Stock Plummets Following Recent Market Volatility
summary: Asana Inc. (ASAN) stock has fallen by 8.07% due to market volatility and uncertainties in key technology sectors. Despite strong revenue growth, Asana faces significant profitability challenges, evidenced by negative margins and high debt, leading to a precarious financial position. The article advises caution for investors, suggesting that a clear turnaround will depend on effective communication of future growth prospects and operational efficiencies.

title: Why I Like Salesforce Stock More Than HubSpot or Monday.com
summary: The author prefers Salesforce stock over HubSpot and Monday.com, primarily due to its significantly lower forward price-to-earnings ratio (19 for Salesforce vs. 40 for HubSpot and 38 for Monday.com). Salesforce also benefits from its inclusion in the Dow Jones and S&P indexes, indicating greater stability, and has a longer, more established expansion path since its 2004 IPO. The article suggests Salesforce is a strong choice for investors interested in software creation with Data Cloud features and AI integration.

title: Qualys, Tenable Latest Victims of Salesloft Drift Hack
summary: Cybersecurity providers Tenable and Qualys have become the latest victims of the Salesloft Drift supply chain attack, also known as the ‘SalesDrift’ hack. This attack involves the theft of OAuth authentication tokens from Salesloft Drift, a third-party application integrated with Salesforce, leading to unauthorized access to customer information stored in Salesforce instances. The Google Threat Intelligence Group first identified this ongoing campaign, which has affected a growing list of companies including Google, BeyondTrust, Cloudflare, and Palo Alto Networks.

title: Dynatrace Confirms Data Breach via Salesforce Compromise
summary: Dynatrace has confirmed a data breach affecting customer data stored in its Salesforce environment, stemming from a cyberattack on Salesloft's Drift application. The breach granted unauthorized access to basic business contact information in CRM databases but did not impact Dynatrace's core products, services, or sensitive customer usage data due to system segmentation. Dynatrace has disabled the compromised integration and advises customers to be vigilant against phishing, while emphasizing its commitment to data protection.

title: 80 Certification Exams: Pearson Takes Over Global Salesforce Testing Program in Major Tech Ed Deal
summary: Pearson has secured an exclusive multi-year partnership with Salesforce, designating its Pearson VUE business as the sole global provider of Salesforce certification exams. This collaboration will offer 80 certification exams through a streamlined pathway and flexible delivery formats, including online proctoring, in-person testing, and event-based testing. The initiative aims to equip professionals with current Salesforce skills, addressing the increasing demand for expertise in advanced technologies and AI.

title: Autodesk Stock: Is ADSK Underperforming the Technology Sector?
summary: Autodesk (ADSK) has underperformed the broader technology sector, as represented by the Technology Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLK), over the past three months, year-to-date, and the last 52 weeks. Despite this, the company reported strong Q2 2026 earnings, surpassing expectations and raising its full-year guidance. Analysts remain bullish on ADSK, with a consensus "Strong Buy" rating and a price target indicating significant upside.

title: Salesforce, Inc. (CRM) CEO Benioff Sells $564,422 in Shares, Exercises Options for 2,250 Shares
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff sold over $564,000 worth of CRM shares and simultaneously exercised options to acquire 2,250 shares. Despite this activity, Benioff maintains a significant investment in the company, holding over 11.9 million shares directly and indirectly. The article also notes that Salesforce remains invested in its long-term growth but suggests that other AI stocks might offer better upside potential with less risk.

title: Huntington Bank's plan to obtain a return on gen AI
summary: Huntington Bank is focusing on generating a measurable return on its generative AI investments, targeting 10-15% in cost reductions and revenue increases. CFO Zach Wasserman emphasized balancing the urgency of AI adoption with ensuring ROI and usability, contrasting with a report stating 95% of businesses see zero return on gen AI. The bank is deploying AI across various use cases, including software development, streamlining internal processes, general employee productivity, and personalization, with agentic AI expected to further automate multi-person tasks.

title: Adobe’s stock gains as its AI investments start bearing fruit
summary: Adobe's stock saw gains after exceeding Wall Street's third-quarter expectations and providing a strong outlook, signaling that its significant AI investments are beginning to pay off. The company's AI-driven growth has led to a raise in its full-year revenue and EPS targets, with AI products generating over $5 billion in annual recurring revenue. Analysts praise Adobe's strategic, ethical approach to AI, which differentiates its offerings and enhances user workflows, even amidst increased competition from AI-native startups.

title: Kellanova Launches AI Solution on WhatsApp to Turn Salespeople into Business Consultants
summary: Kellanova, a global food sector leader, has developed an AI-powered virtual assistant, "Kell," integrated into WhatsApp to empower its sales team. This solution aims to transform salespeople into business consultants for small and medium-sized retailers, offering streamlined ordering, promotions, and strategic insights. The initiative seeks to strengthen relationships and digitize small retailers, enhancing operational efficiency and market intelligence.

title: Top Companies That Had Their IPO in 2004
summary: The article reviews 10 notable companies that went public in 2004, highlighting their performance since IPO. It covers major successes like Google, Baidu, and Salesforce, which profited from scalable models in large markets. Conversely, it also notes less successful IPOs from the education and low-margin retail sectors.

summary: Box (NYSE:BOX) recently launched AI-powered products like Box Shield Pro and Box Automate, signaling a shift towards AI and automation in its growth strategy. The article explores different valuation perspectives, including a DCF model, which also indicates potential undervaluation.

summary: The Procter & Gamble Company (NYSE: PG) is focusing on innovation and efficiency to drive future growth, as reiterated at the Barclays 18th Annual Global Consumer Staples Conference 2025. It also anticipates mid-to-single-digit price increases on 25% of its U.S. portfolio due to tariff headwinds, positioning itself as a strong defensive stock according to Steve Cohen.

title: Ex-Dividend Reminder: Huntington Bancshares, NXP Semiconductors and Salesforce
summary: Huntington Bancshares (HBAN), NXP Semiconductors (NXPI), and Salesforce (CRM) are set to trade ex-dividend on September 17, 2025. Investors can expect their stock prices to open lower by 0.87%, 0.46%, and 0.17% respectively, reflecting their upcoming quarterly dividend payouts. The article provides details on the dividend amounts and payment dates for each company, alongside historical dividend charts and current annualized yield estimates.

title: OpenText upgraded at National Bank
summary: National Bank Financial Capital Markets analyst Richard Tse upgraded OpenText (NASDAQ:OTEX) to "Outperform" from "Sector Perform," raising his target price to $45.00. Tse sees a renewed investment opportunity driven by near-term catalysts like divestitures and leadership changes, and a longer-term re-rating potential linked to AI. OpenText, Canada's largest enterprise software company, is focusing on data and AI opportunities, leveraging its vast management of unstructured data.

title: Sales
summary: Cox Automotive offers a suite of integrated sales tools designed to accelerate sales and improve customer experience for automotive dealerships. These solutions include VinSolutions Connect CRM for customer relationship management, Dealertrack's F&I Solutions for finance and insurance, and Deal Central for intelligent deal-making, all aimed at streamlining operations, enhancing profitability, and ensuring compliance. The platform emphasizes real-time buyer insights, instant credit decisions, and built-in compliance to facilitate a seamless sales process both online and in-store.

The sales were executed in two transactions at prices ranging from $49.39 to $50.82. Following these transactions, Blasing directly owns 100,639 shares of the company.

title: Palantir's Defense Dominance Faces First Real Threat—And It's Already Winning
summary: Salesforce's new national security division, Missionforce, is posing a significant challenge to Palantir's long-held dominance in government AI software. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff announced a win against Palantir for a U.S. Army deal, suggesting that Palantir's premium pricing model might be under threat as agencies consider more cost-effective alternatives. While Palantir maintains a high market cap due to the exclusivity of its AI solutions, Salesforce's aggressive entry and existing government contracts could intensify competition for government AI dollars.

title: Extreme architects the AI network for enterprises
summary: Extreme Networks is transforming the AI network from mere "plumbing" into a driver of enterprise innovation and business value. Dan DeBacker, SVP of product management, emphasizes a holistic, cloud-native, AI-powered network that collects and analyzes data across the entire infrastructure, from edge to core. This approach is crucial for managing the massive influx of AI data and correlating device health with network performance to ensure seamless user experiences across various industries.

title: No more AI silos: The CIO integration playbook
summary: This article emphasizes the critical role of CIOs in integrating AI across organizations to overcome fragmented efforts, reduce risks, and unlock enterprise-wide value. It outlines a six-pillar integration playbook covering strategy, data, platform approach, collaboration, change management, and governance. The piece also includes case examples from CIOs at Flexera, DeVry, and One Inc, highlighting successful strategies for AI adoption and governance.

title: Elliott builds a position in Workday after software company unveils a multiyear plan to boost value
summary: Elliott Investment Management has taken a significant position in Workday, expressing support for the company's new multiyear plan to boost shareholder value. This plan, announced after Carl Eschenbach took over as CEO, includes a $5 billion share repurchase program, GAAP margin expansion targets, and a free cash flow target by fiscal year 2028. Elliott's involvement is seen as an amicable engagement, leveraging a relationship with Eschenbach from his previous role at VMware, and indicates a strategic shift towards profitability and leveraging AI opportunities for Workday.

title: ShadowLeak Zero-Click Flaw Leaks Gmail Data via OpenAI ChatGPT Deep Research Agent
summary: Cybersecurity researchers have uncovered a zero-click flaw, dubbed ShadowLeak, in OpenAI ChatGPT's Deep Research agent. This vulnerability allows an attacker to exfiltrate sensitive Gmail data by sending a specially crafted email containing invisible instructions. The attack bypasses traditional security measures by occurring directly within OpenAI's cloud infrastructure, posing a significant risk to user privacy across various integrated platforms.

title: Thoma Bravo buys PROS for $1.4 billion
summary: Thoma Bravo has acquired PROS Holdings, a pricing and revenue management software company, for $1.4 billion. This marks the third acquisition for Thoma Bravo in under a month, as it previously took Verint and Dayforce private. PROS will continue to advance its agentic AI product plans as a private company, with the aim to be more agile and flexible in investing in innovation.

title: PepsiCo, Inc: Digital Transformation Strategies
summary: This report details PepsiCo's digital transformation strategies, innovation programs, and technology initiatives. The report also lists key technology partners and outlines the business benefits expected from these strategies.

title: Open Text upgraded at Scotia Capital

title: New Okta Innovations Secure the AI-Driven Enterprise and Combat Fraud with an Identity Security Fabric
summary: Okta has announced new capabilities for its Okta Platform and Auth0 Platform, designed to secure AI agents and combat AI-powered fraud through an identity security fabric. These innovations allow organizations to build secure AI agents with end-to-end lifecycle management and issue tamper-proof digital credentials to establish trust. Key features include Okta for AI Agents, Cross App Access (XAA) for secure agent and app interactions, and Verifiable Digital Credentials (VDC) to prevent fraud.

title: "AI security is identity security" - how Okta is weaving agents into the security fabric
summary: Okta, with Auth0, is addressing the significant security deficit caused by the widespread adoption of AI agents by introducing new security principles at its Oktane 2025 event. The company aims to seamlessly integrate AI agents into identity security frameworks through features like "Okta for AI Agents" for managing non-human identities, open industry-leading standards like Cross App Access (XAA) to secure app-to-app interactions, and future Verifiable Digital Credentials (VDC) to combat AI fraud and establish trust. These initiatives are designed to help organizations leverage AI's productivity gains without fear of exposure, providing centralized control, visibility, and governance over AI agent activities.

title: Salesforce CEO says its AI program Agentforce is "part and parcel" of the company - CNBC
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff emphasizes that Agentforce, the company's AI program, is a fundamental and integrated part of Salesforce's products and platform. Benioff highlighted Agentforce's significant development and 10s of thousands of deployments, helping companies use autonomous bots to increase efficiency, despite Salesforce's stock performance this year. He also addressed concerns about AI negatively impacting software, asserting that enterprise and AI are converging to transform businesses.

title: Benioff tries to duck Guard comments - San Francisco Examiner
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff faced scrutiny at Dreamforce regarding his recent call for President Trump to deploy the National Guard to San Francisco. He attempted to pivot discussions towards the conference and his company's new AI product, Agentforce, while defending his comments by citing concerns for attendee safety and the ongoing issues of public safety in San Francisco. City officials and crime statistics contradict Benioff's claims, highlighting declining crime rates and widely denouncing the idea of military deployment.

title: Salesforce (CRM) Projects Revenue Surge to $60 Billion by 2030
summary: Salesforce (CRM) anticipates its revenue will exceed $60 billion by 2030, driven by over 10% organic annual growth and advancements in artificial intelligence. The company also plans to repurchase approximately $7 billion of its stock over the next six months.

title: Salesforce & AWS deepen AI partnership to boost agentic adoption - ChannelLife New Zealand
summary: Salesforce and Amazon Web Services (AWS) have expanded their partnership to accelerate the adoption of AI-driven agentic systems across workflows, data, and customer service. title: Salesforce CEO Benioff sells $558,809 in CRM stock By Investing.com - Investing.com Australia
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff sold $558,809 worth of company stock. This transaction is noted by Investing.com Australia.

title: Newly-MAGA billionaire apologizes after telling Trump to send National Guard to San Francisco - NewsBreak: Local News & Alerts
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has apologized for suggesting that President Trump send the National Guard to San Francisco, a comment made out of concern for safety during the Dreamforce tech conference. His remarks drew significant backlash, including cancellations from entertainers and the resignation of a prominent donor from the Salesforce Foundation board. Benioff reiterated his commitment to a safer San Francisco and announced a $15 billion investment in the city and $1 million for police hiring bonuses.

title: Veteran VC resigns from Salesforce Foundation board over CEO’s political comments - Business Matters
summary: Veteran venture capitalist Ron Conway has resigned from the board of the Salesforce Foundation after a decade of service, citing CEO Marc Benioff’s comments supporting former President Donald Trump and the deployment of National Guard troops to San Francisco. This move highlights a rare public rift within the tech-philanthropy community and raises questions about corporate governance and alignment of values. Benioff has since apologized for his remarks, and Salesforce has reaffirmed its commitment to San Francisco with a $15 billion investment plan, yet the incident underscores growing tensions between political endorsements and corporate standing.

title: RBC Sees Intensifying Rivalry Between Salesforce (CRM) and ServiceNow - Insider Monkey
summary: RBC Capital reiterated a Sector Perform rating and $250 price target for Salesforce (CRM) after attending Dreamforce 2025, where Salesforce announced its transition to Agentforce 360, focusing on AI agents and contextual data. This strategic shift is expected to intensify competition with ServiceNow, as both companies converge on workflow automation, data context, and AI agent deployment. The report highlights Salesforce's increased focus on trust, governance, and extensibility, indicating a direct overlap with ServiceNow's market.

title: Salesforce’s experiment with AI-powered offices
summary: Salesforce is utilizing AI to transform its office spaces globally, focusing on optimizing productivity and employee experience. The company employs AI agents for tasks like maintenance automation and uses sensors to understand space utilization and refine office layouts. Salesforce also integrates AI into employee-facing tools, such as an internal Employee Agent on Slack, to provide quick HR support and dynamic space matching.

title: Salesforce: The tech giant is betting big on AI. But will companies pay for it? - The Sydney Morning Herald
summary: Salesforce is heavily investing in its AI product, Agentforce, which automates business processes through AI agents. Despite its CEO Marc Benioff hailing it as a "digital labour revolution," only a fraction of its total customer base currently pays for the service, leading to investor skepticism and a 25% stock drop this year. The company is trying to boost adoption through customer showcases, diversified pricing, and strategic partnerships, while projecting over $60 billion in revenue by 2030 amidst fierce competition.

title: Salesforce fallout: Benioff says he no longer believes National Guard needed in SF, issues apology
summary: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff retracted his previous call for the National Guard in San Francisco to address crime, issuing an apology after listening to local officials and residents. This apology follows controversy over Salesforce's reported pitch to ICE and the resignation of Silicon Valley billionaire Ron Conway from the Salesforce Foundation board. The article highlights the ongoing debate between Benioff's business dealings with the government and San Francisco's sanctuary city policies.

title: Salesforce leads enterprise software stocks higher as market climbs (CRM:NYSE)
summary: Salesforce led enterprise software stocks higher on Monday, with its shares jumping 4.6%. Other companies like Workday and Atlassian also saw gains as the broader market indices increased. The rally reflects a positive day for the technology sector and enterprise software companies specifically.

title: Enphase Energy Stock Forecast: Where Analysts See the Stock Going by 2027
summary: Enphase Energy (NASDAQ: ENPH) has experienced a significant stock drop, trading near $37/share, but is showing signs of stabilization with new product launches and production expansion. Analysts project a modest upside, with a median price target of ~$40/share by 2027, and a TIKR valuation model suggesting approximately $41/share by 2027, primarily due to anticipated stability rather than a sharp recovery. The company's strong balance sheet and international growth help mitigate slower U.S. demand and increased competition.

title: Moving Beyond Defense: A Resilient CISO’s Guide to What Cyber Resilience Should Be
summary: This article by CISO Harold Rivas emphasizes shifting from a defensive security mindset to one of cyber resilience, defined by NIST as the ability to anticipate, withstand, recover from, and adapt to adverse conditions. Rivas outlines a practical blueprint based on four pillars: maximum endpoint visibility and control, maintaining control hygiene, implementing a Zero Trust Architecture, and engineering for fast recovery and adaptation. The piece stresses the importance of gaining board alignment and treating cyber resilience as a shared organizational objective.

title: CrowdStrike (NASDAQ: CRWD) Stock Price Prediction and Forecast 2025-2030 (Oct 2025)

title: Using Microsoft, Salesforce, ChatGPT will cost more under Johnson’s Cloud Tax

This "Cloud Tax" will make cloud-based services like Microsoft 365, Salesforce, ChatGPT, Amazon Web Services, and Zoom more expensive, with the added costs likely passed on to consumers. The tax hike is projected to generate $333 million and is seen as a short-sighted solution to the city's financial challenges, failing to address underlying issues like rising pension obligations.

title: Ripple News: Cyber Hornet Files S&P 500 + XRP Hybrid ETF

These hybrid ETFs, filed as 485APOS amendments for quicker SEC review, are notable for their inclusion of XRP in a U.S. ETF tied directly to the S&P 500 and their unique blend of traditional equities with direct crypto exposure. Approval of these ETFs could open the market to institutional investors and significantly boost confidence and trading activity for XRP and other cryptocurrencies.

The acquisition, projected to close in Salesforce's Q4 2026, aims to deliver custom agentic analytics, ROI forecasting, and continuous optimization for Agentforce users.

title: Salesforce Says Global Online Cyber Monday Sales Reached $17.3 Billion (Up 5.3% YoY)

U.S. online sales specifically hit $3.4 billion, up 2.6% YoY, while online orders declined by 1%. The company anticipates global online sales for Cyber Monday to ultimately reach $52.7 billion and U.S. online sales to grow to $13.3 billion.

The market values Salesforce's larger scale and agent strategy over Adobe's superior profitability, as shown by Salesforce's higher P/E ratio and faster EPS growth.

title: Salesforce’s AI Push Aims For Massive Growth By 2030

This strategic shift and increased sales force productivity are crucial for Salesforce to achieve its ambitious $60 billion revenue target and "Rule of 50" performance.

title: Salesforce adds Informatica to Data 360, MuleSoft fold

The move is expected to retain Informatica's distinct user base, similar to Salesforce's successful integration of Tableau.

title: Salesforce opts for seat-based AI licensing as customers demand predictability
summary: Salesforce has shifted to seat-based AI licensing after customers requested more predictable pricing models, moving away from consumption or per-conversation charges. This change, while offering stability, often includes caveats such as usage caps or secondary license metrics to ensure vendors retain control and prevent overuse. Analysts note this trend helps customers calculate ROI more easily but also ensures vendors recoup their AI investment costs without losing revenue to potential staff reductions caused by AI productivity gains.

title: California Public Employees Retirement System Sells 151,825 Shares of BWX Technologies, Inc. $BWXT

title: It’s time for great industrial e-commerce

The piece argues that industrial organizations must adapt their operating models and integrate various systems to provide a seamless digital commerce experience to meet evolving customer demands and survive in a competitive market.

title: After claiming to redeploy 4,000 employees and automating their work with AI agents, Salesforce executive
summary: Salesforce is reducing its reliance on large language models (LLMs) for its Agentforce product due to reliability concerns, shifting towards more predictable "deterministic" automation. This comes after the company claimed to have redeployed 4,000 employees by automating their work with AI agents. Executives now admit that their confidence in LLMs has declined over the past year, citing issues like missed instructions and AI "drift."

title: Salesforce makes revamped Slackbot generally available

title: Salesforce's acquisition of Cimulate to boost AI shopping
summary: Salesforce is acquiring Cimulate to enhance its Agentforce Commerce platform with advanced AI capabilities, particularly in intent-driven shopping experiences and AI-powered search. Cimulate's technology, including its CommerceGPT LLM-based operating system, aims to improve product recommendations and content optimization, addressing the shift from traditional website clicks to AI summaries in online shopping. This acquisition is expected to bolster Salesforce's offerings in an evolving e-commerce landscape, including the potential for autonomous shopping agents in B2B transactions.

title: AcuityMD Announces AcuityMD for Salesforce on Salesforce AppExchange
summary: AcuityMD has launched "AcuityMD for Salesforce" on the Salesforce AppExchange, enabling MedTech commercial teams to integrate AcuityMD's platform directly with Salesforce. This integration allows sales representatives to streamline their workflows, identify opportunities more efficiently, and keep data consistent across systems, ultimately helping them achieve sales goals faster. The partnership aims to enhance efficiency and visibility for MedTech companies by aligning targeting, account, and opportunity data within a single commercial workflow.

title: Salesforce.com (CRM) Earnings Expected to Grow: Should You Buy?
summary: Salesforce.com (CRM) is projected to report increased earnings and revenues for the quarter ended January 2026. While the Zacks Consensus Estimate for EPS is $3.03, the Earnings ESP is slightly negative at -0.05%, suggesting analysts are leaning bearish. Despite a strong Zacks Rank #2 and a history of beating past EPS estimates, the combination makes predicting an earnings beat for CRM difficult.

title: Salesforce Bets on Agentforce: Will It Power CRM's Next Growth Cycle?
summary: Salesforce is heavily investing in its new Agentforce platform to revive revenue growth, which has slowed to single digits. Agentforce, which integrates AI across various CRM functions, generated $540 million in recurring revenues in Q3 fiscal 2026, marking a 330% year-over-year increase. While competitors like Microsoft and ServiceNow are also advancing AI in enterprise solutions, Salesforce hopes Agentforce will drive sustained adoption and reaccelerate its growth trajectory, with analysts projecting revenue increases of 9.5% and 10.7% for fiscal 2026 and 2027, respectively.

title: GoDaddy ANS Integrates with Salesforce's MuleSoft Agent Fabric
summary: GoDaddy has announced an integration between its Agent Name Service (ANS) and Salesforce's MuleSoft Agent Fabric. This collaboration aims to provide a "digital passport" for AI agents, allowing organizations to discover and verify their identities, thereby reducing the risk of spoofed tools and enhancing security. By registering AI agents through ANS and publishing them to the public DNS, businesses can ensure that only trusted agents interact with their systems and sensitive data, enabling safer and more scalable AI adoption.

title: Mizuho Maintains an Outperform Rating on Salesforce (CRM)
summary: Mizuho Securities has maintained an Outperform rating on Salesforce (CRM) but lowered its price target from $340 to $280, still indicating a significant upside. This revision is part of broader adjustments across the enterprise software sector due to "AI disruption fears," yet Mizuho sees attractive opportunities for patient investors. Separately, TD Cowen highlighted a new agreement between Salesforce and the U.S. Army, which expands access to Department of Defense users and potentially increases Salesforce's total addressable market.

title: July 17th Options Now Available For Salesforce (CRM)
summary: New options for Salesforce Inc. (CRM) with a July 17th expiration are now trading, offering opportunities for investors. The article details specific put and call contracts, highlighting the potential premiums and annualized returns for sellers, and includes analyses of strike prices relative to CRM's trading history and implied volatility.

title: Salesforce Inc. (NYSE:CRM): A Value Investing Case Study
summary: This article presents a value investing case study for Salesforce Inc. (NYSE:CRM), highlighting its attractive valuation metrics compared to its industry and the S&P 500. The analysis points to Salesforce's strong profitability, efficient capital use, and solid historical growth as indicators of a high-caliber business, distinguishing it from a "value trap." Despite some liquidity notes, the company's robust financial health and debt coverage reinforce its appeal for value-focused investors.

title: Invisory Announces Partner Success Tracker on Salesforce AppExchange, the World's Leading Enterprise Cloud Marketplace
summary: Invisory has launched its Partner Success Tracker on Salesforce AppExchange, designed to help Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) better understand and maximize the impact of their partner relationships on pipeline and revenue. This tool allows companies to track individual partner performance, identify opportunities, and address gaps, moving beyond a general partner-level view. It aims to increase partner-driven pipeline, save alliance teams time, and provide executive-level insights through dashboards and reports.

title: Why India has the perfect conditions to make the most of digital technology
summary: India is poised for significant economic growth driven by digital transformation, thanks to its large talent pool, digitally-motivated population, supportive government policies, and lower costs of doing business. The country's digital economy is projected to reach $1 trillion in two years, with widespread adoption of technology across various sectors, from education to payments. This digital push, fueled by collaboration between public and private sectors, is seen as crucial for addressing societal challenges and maintaining India's competitive edge in the global landscape.

title: Salesforce supercharges its bandwidth with Prisma-SD-WAN
summary: Salesforce adopted Palo Alto Networks' Prisma SD-WAN solution to overcome limitations with its legacy MPLS-based WAN, which struggled with scalability, cloud application support, and direct internet connectivity at branch offices. This move allowed Salesforce to dramatically increase bandwidth, enhance security through zone-based firewalls, streamline network management with centralized control, and improve application awareness, ultimately supporting its global, cloud-centric operations. The transition has resulted in significant operational improvements and an average 500% increase in bandwidth without added WAN costs.

title: Salesforce Inc (CRM) Expands AI Capabilities With Momentum Acquisition
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) has acquired Momentum, a conversational insights and revenue orchestration platform, to enhance its AI capabilities in Agentforce 360 and Slackbot. This acquisition aims to better ingest and analyze unstructured data from third-party voice and video channels, thereby accelerating the company's efforts to leverage conversational data. Despite a recent price target cut by UBS, feedback on Agentforce has improved, and customers are not switching to AI alternatives, although backlog and revenue growth rates show no significant increase.

title: Salesforce Inc (CRM) Expands AI Capabilities With Momentum Acquisition
summary: Salesforce Inc. (CRM) has announced the acquisition of Momentum, a conversational insights and revenue orchestration platform. This acquisition aims to enhance Agentforce 360 and Slackbot's ability to analyze unstructured data from third-party voice and video channels, accelerating Salesforce's roadmap for incorporating conversational data. Despite a recent price target cut by UBS, feedback on Agentforce has improved, and customers are not looking to replace Salesforce with AI alternatives.

title: Salesforce, Inc. (CRM) Surges 5.4% — Developing Story
summary: Salesforce, Inc. (CRM) shares experienced a significant surge, climbing 5.4% to $187.93 in today's trading. This sharp increase is drawing market attention, prompting traders to seek the underlying catalyst. A detailed analysis of the price action is expected to be released soon on AlphaStreet.

title: Salesforce Is Down Some 50% in 13 Months. Here's Its Chart. for NYSE:CRM by moomoo
summary: Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) stock has fallen by about 50% in the last 13 months, hitting a three-year low before its upcoming fiscal Q4 earnings report. Analysts have mixed opinions, but there are some potentially bullish technical indicators, such as the Relative Strength Index flirting with exiting oversold territory and the MACD showing signs of a potential positive crossover. An options strategy like a bull-call spread is suggested for risk-averse traders.

title: Salesforce report finds Korea pushes data overhaul to power AI gains - CHOSUNBIZ
summary: A Salesforce report indicates that Korea is actively pursuing a comprehensive data overhaul. This initiative is primarily aimed at strengthening the country's capabilities and leveraging data to drive advancements in artificial intelligence.

title: Jefferies names AI winners as software sell-off takes a breather
summary: Jefferies has identified Intuit (INTU) and Salesforce (CRM) as "AI-proof" winners amidst a recent software sell-off, viewing them as generational buying opportunities. Despite initial fears that AI would disrupt traditional software models, both companies are leveraging their vast data and platforms to integrate AI, enhancing their offerings and solidifying their market positions. Analysts argue their deep proprietary data and strategic pivot to AI agents make them resilient and poised for continued growth.
